original: nang gi bde ba de ltar skyes la ma 'gags pa ni /
analyzed: nang gi bde ba de ltar skyes la ma 'gags pa ni /
translated: The inner bliss that has arisen in that way and is not blocked is the single nature that performs a function.

original: don byed pa'i rang bzhin gcig nyid du rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad mas myong bas gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: don byed pa'i rang bzhin gcig nyid du rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad mas myong bas gcig pa nyid de /
translated: It is experienced by the valid experience of reflexive awareness as being one.

original: des na kun rdzob tu gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir zhes pa ma grub bo //üîΩgal te de lta na phyi'i don kyang don dam bar snang ba dang snang ba las gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu'ang med ces 'jog na ni /
analyzed: des na kun rdzob tu gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir zhes pa ma grub bo // gal te de lta na phyi'i don kyang don dam bar snang ba dang snang ba las gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu'ang med ces 'jog na ni /
translated: Therefore, the reason ‚Äúbecause it is free from one and many in the relative‚Äù is not established.üîΩIf that is so, and if external objects are also posited as not existing even in the relative because it is not tenable that they appear and are other than appearance,

original: gtan tshigs khyab par ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur la kun rdzob tu snang ba dang snang ba las gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes 'god na yang gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs khyab par ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur la kun rdzob tu snang ba dang snang ba las gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes 'god na yang gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
translated: then the reason is not established as a pervasion. If it is posited that ‚Äúit is not tenable that they are other than appearance in the relative,‚Äù the reason is not established.

original: kun rdzob tu ni tha snyad pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma la /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni tha snyad pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma la /
translated: In the relative, conventional direct valid experience,

original: gzugs la sogs par snang ba nyid phyi rol don byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par snang ba nyid phyi rol don byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: the appearance of forms and so on appears as the nature that performs an external function.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no error.

original: de lta na yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tsam du yang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa mi 'thad pa nyid du sngar bstan pa dang / yang kun rdzob tsam du shes pa las so so las rnam par 'byed ba pha rol po nyid kyis khas blangs pa mi 'thad par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa snga ma rnams spang dgos so //
analyzed: de lta na yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tsam du yang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa mi 'thad pa nyid du sngar bstan pa dang / yang kun rdzob tsam du shes pa las so so las rnam par 'byed ba pha rol po nyid kyis khas blangs pa mi 'thad par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa snga ma rnams spang dgos so //
translated: Even though that is so, the former errors must be refuted, such as the fact that the consciousnesses of the five sense doors are untenable even as mere correct conventionalities, as was previously explained, and the fact that it is untenable for the opponent to accept that the consciousnesses are distinguished from each other in terms of mere conventionality.

original: yang gal te de lta na gzugs dang sgra la sogs par snang ba ni kun rdzob tu du ma nyid yin na /
analyzed: yang gal te de lta na gzugs dang sgra la sogs par snang ba ni kun rdzob tu du ma nyid yin na /
translated: If that is so, then since the appearances as forms, sounds, and so on are multiple in terms of mere conventionality,

original: gcig pa nyid mi 'thad par 'gyur bas nyes pa mtshungs so zhe na ;
analyzed: gcig pa nyid mi 'thad par 'gyur bas nyes pa mtshungs so zhe na ;
translated: it is untenable that they are singular.

original: de ci gzugs sgra la sogs par snang ba gcig nyid du snang ba med pas kun rdzob tu yang gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de ci gzugs sgra la sogs par snang ba gcig nyid du snang ba med pas kun rdzob tu yang gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad la /
translated: Since the appearances as forms, sounds, and so on do not appear as singular, it is untenable that they are singular even in terms of mere conventionality.

original: thams cad du gcig med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du gcig med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not the case that they are all nonexistent as singular.

original: snga ma ltar nang gi bde ba da ltar bar myong ba cha sna tshogs su myong ba med cing don byed pa'i rang bzhin gcig nyid du myong bas kun rdzob tu gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma ltar nang gi bde ba da ltar bar myong ba cha sna tshogs su myong ba med cing don byed pa'i rang bzhin gcig nyid du myong bas kun rdzob tu gcig ces bya'o //
translated: If it is the former, then the internal bliss is not experienced in various aspects in the present, and since it is experienced as a single nature that functions, it is called ‚Äúone‚Äù in the conventional sense.

original: des na 'di ni mi mtshungs pa nyid du gsal rab tu snang ngo //
analyzed: des na 'di ni mi mtshungs pa nyid du gsal rab tu snang ngo //
translated: Therefore it is clear that this is not similar.

original: gal te de lta na gzugs la sogs pa snang ba ni myong ba'i rang bzhin spangs pa dang / dbyibs dang kha dog gi rang bzhin dang / yul dang phyogs kyis bsdus pa dang / shes pa @44b las chad pa'i rnam par snang zhing sems dang mi mthun pa'i phyi rol nyid du snang bas /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gzugs la sogs pa snang ba ni myong ba'i rang bzhin spangs pa dang / dbyibs dang kha dog gi rang bzhin dang / yul dang phyogs kyis bsdus pa dang / shes pa @44b las chad pa'i rnam par snang zhing sems dang mi mthun pa'i phyi rol nyid du snang bas /
translated: If it is the latter, then the appearance of form and so on is excluded from the nature of experience, and it appears as a shape and color, as an object and a location, as something cut off from consciousness, and as something external that is not the mind.

original: kun rdzob tu phyi rol nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu phyi rol nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore it is external in the conventional sense.

original: shes pa ni ma yin te shes pa'i bdag nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa ni ma yin te shes pa'i bdag nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not consciousness because it does not appear as the nature of consciousness.

original: de yang ji ltar gzugs sgra la sogs par snang ba snang tshod du mar snang bas gcig nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar gzugs sgra la sogs par snang ba snang tshod du mar snang bas gcig nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Moreover, just as the appearances as forms, sounds, and so on appear in many ways, they are not a single entity.

original: skyon med de gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni /
analyzed: skyon med de gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni /
translated: There is no fault, because the appearances as forms and so on

original: gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis myong ba'i rang bzhin spangs par snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis myong ba'i rang bzhin spangs par snang ba ma yin te /
translated: are not appearances that abandon the nature of experience through the clarity of appearance.

original: gsal ba dang myong ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba dang myong ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because clarity and experience are included in synonyms.

original: yang kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs par snang ba ni /
analyzed: yang kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs par snang ba ni /
translated: Moreover, the appearances as colors, shapes, and so on

original: rnam par shes ba'i khyad par sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par shes ba'i khyad par sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa nyid de /
translated: are the special features of consciousness, the five sense consciousnesses.

original: shes pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig ni dga' gdung la sogs par nang nyid du myong la /
analyzed: shes pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig ni dga' gdung la sogs par nang nyid du myong la /
translated: Some special features of consciousness are experienced internally as pleasure, pain, and so on,

original: 'ga' zhig ni yul la bkram pa lta bur phyi rol chad pa'i rnam par snang mod kyi /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni yul la bkram pa lta bur phyi rol chad pa'i rnam par snang mod kyi /
translated: and some appear externally as if spread out in the object.

original: sems dang mi mthun par snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems dang mi mthun par snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not appear in a way that is discordant with the mind.

original: sems kyi khyad par nang du myong ba 'ga' zhig dang mi mthun par snang mod kyi /
analyzed: sems kyi khyad par nang du myong ba 'ga' zhig dang mi mthun par snang mod kyi /
translated: The difference in the mind appears to be incompatible with some of the inner experiences.

original: de nang du myong ba'i sems su khas mi len pas skyon med do //
analyzed: de nang du myong ba'i sems su khas mi len pas skyon med do //
translated: But since we do not accept that the mind is an inner experience, there is no fault.

original: gzugs sgra la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba ni gcig gi rnam pa dang mi mthun zhing /
analyzed: gzugs sgra la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba ni gcig gi rnam pa dang mi mthun zhing /
translated: The appearance of the various aspects of form, sound, and so on is incompatible with the aspect of a single thing.

original: gcig nyid kyi khyad par du mi 'thad pa nyid du rab tu gsal lo ;
analyzed: gcig nyid kyi khyad par du mi 'thad pa nyid du rab tu gsal lo ;
translated: It is quite clear that it is not tenable as a difference of a single thing.

original: ;'dir gzugs la sogs pa sna tshogs su snang ba don dam par sems dang mi mthun par snang bas /
analyzed: ;'dir gzugs la sogs pa sna tshogs su snang ba don dam par sems dang mi mthun par snang bas /
translated: Here, the appearance of the various things such as form appear ultimately as incompatible with the mind.

original: sems kyi ngo bo don dam pa nyid du khas mi len pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo don dam pa nyid du khas mi len pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, we do not accept the nature of the mind as ultimately real.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tsam du yang phyi'i don mi 'thad pa nyid du bstan pa na /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tsam du yang phyi'i don mi 'thad pa nyid du bstan pa na /
translated: Thus, when it is shown that external objects are untenable even as mere correct conventionalities,

original: de ltar snang ba 'di ci yin snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba 'di ci yin snyam du sems na /
translated: if you think, ‚ÄúWhat is this appearance?‚Äù

original: kun rdzob tu snang ba sems tsam du sgrub ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu snang ba sems tsam du sgrub ste /
translated: we establish that the appearance as mere mind is the conventional.

original: de yang gtan tshigs rnam pa gnyis yin pa las /
analyzed: de yang gtan tshigs rnam pa gnyis yin pa las /
translated: Moreover, there are two types of reasons.

original: dang po rig pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas na /
analyzed: dang po rig pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas na /
translated: First, from the perspective of the reasoning of awareness,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don dgod pa dang / brtsad pa spangs pa'o //üîΩde'i dang po yang gzugs sgra la sogs par snang ba ni kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don dgod pa dang / brtsad pa spangs pa'o // de'i dang po yang gzugs sgra la sogs par snang ba ni kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin te /
translated: there is the presentation of the meaning of the reasoning and the refutation of objections.

original: gsal bar snang ba'i phyir dper na bde ba la sogs pa myong ba bzhin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba'i phyir dper na bde ba la sogs pa myong ba bzhin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The first of those is that what appears as forms, sounds, and so on is the mind itself in the relative because it appears as clarity, like, for example, the experience of bliss.

original: brtsad ba spang ba ni gzhan dag gtan tshigs 'di ni khyab pa ma grub pa yin te /üîΩde ltar gsal bar snang ba yang sems dang mi mthun pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brtsad ba spang ba ni gzhan dag gtan tshigs 'di ni khyab pa ma grub pa yin te / de ltar gsal bar snang ba yang sems dang mi mthun pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir /
translated: The refutation of objections is as follows: Others may say, ‚ÄúThis reasoning is not established because of the pervasion.

original: @45a * // sems nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: @45a * // sems nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even though it appears as clarity, it does not become the mind because it appears to be discordant with the mind.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: ‚Äù That is not so.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar kun rdzob tu sems dang mi mthun par snang ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar kun rdzob tu sems dang mi mthun par snang ba ma yin zhing /
translated: As previously explained, it is not the case that in the relative it appears to be discordant with the mind.

original: don dam par sems kyi chos nyid dang mi mthun par snang yang /
analyzed: don dam par sems kyi chos nyid dang mi mthun par snang yang /
translated: Even though in the ultimate it appears to be discordant with the dharmatƒÅ of the mind,

original: don dam par sems kyi ngo bor mi sgrub pa'i phyir skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par sems kyi ngo bor mi sgrub pa'i phyir skyon med pa'o //
translated: there is no fault because in the ultimate it is not established as the essence of the mind.

original: gzhan yang / gsal ba ni sems kyi mtshan nyid yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gsal ba ni sems kyi mtshan nyid yin pas /
translated: Moreover, since clarity is the characteristic of the mind,

original: mtshan nyid de dang ldan pas sems yin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dang ldan pas sems yin zhes pa ni /
translated: it is the mind because it possesses that characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid gtan tshigs su bkod pa tha snyad rab tu sgrub pa'i rtags skyon med pa yin te /üîΩlkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gtan tshigs su bkod pa tha snyad rab tu sgrub pa'i rtags skyon med pa yin te / lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is a faultless reason that proves the conventional because the characteristic is posited as the reason.

original: ba lang gi tha snyad du byar rung zhes pa dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: ba lang gi tha snyad du byar rung zhes pa dang mtshungs so //
translated: It is similar to saying, ‚ÄúIt is suitable to use the term ‚Äòox‚Äô because it possesses a dewlap and so on.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag gsal bar snang ba tsam ni sems kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gsal bar snang ba tsam ni sems kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Others say, ‚ÄúThe mere appearance of clarity is not the characteristic of the mind.

original: 'on kyang nang du yongs su gsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang nang du yongs su gsal ba'o //
translated: However, it is the complete clarity that is internal.

original: de ni gzugs la sogs pa snang ba la med pas /
analyzed: de ni gzugs la sogs pa snang ba la med pas /
translated: That does not exist in the appearance of form and so on,

original: de dag sems su bsgrub par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: de dag sems su bsgrub par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: so it is not possible to prove that those are the mind.‚Äù

original: ma yin te /üîΩde lta na sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs par snang ba la /
analyzed: ma yin te / de lta na sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs par snang ba la /
translated: That is not so.

original: sems kyi mtshan nyid med pas sems nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi mtshan nyid med pas sems nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the consciousnesses of the five sense doors that appear as form and so on would not be the mind because they would not have the characteristic of the mind.

original: de'i phyir gsal bar snang ba'i spyi ci tsam sems kyi mtshan nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal bar snang ba'i spyi ci tsam sems kyi mtshan nyid du rigs so //
translated: Therefore, to the extent that a universal appears clearly, it is reasonable to consider it to be a characteristic of mind.

original: yang gal te sems kyi mtshan nyid ni myong ba dang rig pa yin la /
analyzed: yang gal te sems kyi mtshan nyid ni myong ba dang rig pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, if the characteristic of mind is experience and awareness,

original: de ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba la med do zhe na /
analyzed: de ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba la med do zhe na /
translated: then it does not exist in the appearance of form and so on.

original: de lta na yang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa sems ma yin par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa so na 'dug go //
analyzed: de lta na yang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa sems ma yin par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa so na 'dug go //
translated: In that case, the fault remains that the consciousnesses of the five sense doors would not be mind.

original: de'i phyir myong ba 'am rig pa ni sems kyi mtshan nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir myong ba 'am rig pa ni sems kyi mtshan nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, indeed, experience or awareness is the characteristic of mind.

original: de ni gzugs la sogs pa gsal ba la yang mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni gzugs la sogs pa gsal ba la yang mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: But that is the same in the case of the clear appearance of form and so on.

original: myong ba spangs pa'i gsal ba ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: myong ba spangs pa'i gsal ba ni mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that clear appearance is devoid of experience.

original: bems po 'am dngos po med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: bems po 'am dngos po med kyang rung ste /
translated: For those that are not the nature of experience, whether they are matter or not,

original: myong ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa de dag ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyang min pas ji ltar gsal la zhes pa'o //
analyzed: myong ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa de dag ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyang min pas ji ltar gsal la zhes pa'o //
translated: are not the nature of clear appearance. Therefore, how can they be clear?

original: yang gal te de 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ces bstan pa gang yin pa de la med pas mtshan nyid ma khyab par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yang gal te de 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ces bstan pa gang yin pa de la med pas mtshan nyid ma khyab par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Again, if you say that since such characteristics do not exist in the so-called foundation consciousness and afflicted intellect, characteristics are not pervasive,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de lta na me'i mtshan nyid tsha zhing sreg pa yang /
analyzed: de lta na me'i mtshan nyid tsha zhing sreg pa yang /
translated: In that case, the characteristics of fire‚Äîhot and burning‚Äî

original: me'i rdul phra mo kun la med pas ma khyab pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: me'i rdul phra mo kun la med pas ma khyab pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: would not be pervasive because they do not exist in all the subtle particles of fire.

original: chu'i gsher ba nyid kyang chu'i rdul phra mo la med pas /
analyzed: chu'i gsher ba nyid kyang chu'i rdul phra mo la med pas /
translated: And the wetness of water would not be pervasive because it does not exist in the subtle particles of water.

original: ma khyab pa nyid du @45b 'gyur ro zhes ci ste mi brjod /
analyzed: ma khyab pa nyid du @45b 'gyur ro zhes ci ste mi brjod /
translated: Why do you not say this?

original: gal te der chu'i dkyil 'khor rgyas pa lta bu'i gsher zhing rlan pa med kyang /
analyzed: gal te der chu'i dkyil 'khor rgyas pa lta bu'i gsher zhing rlan pa med kyang /
translated: If you say that although there is no wetness or moisture there like the vast expanse of water,üîΩthere is merely wetness that is compatible with that subtle state of form,

original: gzugs kyi gnas skabs phra mo de dang rjes su mthun pa'i gsher ba tsam yod pas skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi gnas skabs phra mo de dang rjes su mthun pa'i gsher ba tsam yod pas skyon med do zhe na /
translated: then there is no error,

original: snga ma de bzhin te /
analyzed: snga ma de bzhin te /
translated: then it is just as before.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa rgya chad pa'i gsal bar snang ba lta bu med kyang /
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa rgya chad pa'i gsal bar snang ba lta bu med kyang /
translated: Although there is no appearance of the five sense consciousnesses and so on that is clear and limited in terms of object and aspect,

original: gnas skabs de dang rjes su mthun pa'i gsal ba 'am myong ba'i rang bzhin tsam yod pas so //
analyzed: gnas skabs de dang rjes su mthun pa'i gsal ba 'am myong ba'i rang bzhin tsam yod pas so //
translated: there is merely the nature of clarity or experience that is consistent with that state.

original: 'dir gsal ba'i phyir zhes pa'i gtan tshigs ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gsal ba'i phyir zhes pa'i gtan tshigs ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa'o //
translated: Here, the reason ‚Äúbecause of clarity‚Äù is established by reflexive-awareness direct perception.

original: gtan tshigs gnyis pa'i dbang du bya ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyis pa'i dbang du bya ste /
translated: The second reason is stated as follows.

original: yang gtan tshigs kyi don dgod pa ni /
analyzed: yang gtan tshigs kyi don dgod pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the reason is set forth as follows.

original: snga ma ltar gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin te /
analyzed: snga ma ltar gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin te /
translated: As before, the appearance as forms and so on is the mind itself conventionally,

original: sems dang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: because it is ascertained that it is observed together with the mind.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs kyi don ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba dmigs pa la /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs kyi don ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba dmigs pa la /
translated: Here, the meaning of the reason is as follows. The appearance that is the object of apprehension, such as a form, is observed.

original: de la 'dzin pa'i sems dmigs pa khyab cing /
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa'i sems dmigs pa khyab cing /
translated: The mind that apprehends it pervades the object.

original: der 'dzin pa'i shes pa dmigs pa la yang de 'dra ba'i gzung ba dmigs pa khyab pas dmigs pa phan tshun mi 'khrul ba nyid do //
analyzed: der 'dzin pa'i shes pa dmigs pa la yang de 'dra ba'i gzung ba dmigs pa khyab pas dmigs pa phan tshun mi 'khrul ba nyid do //
translated: And the consciousness apprehending that is also the object of that sort of apprehension, so the object is not confused with another object.

original: 'dir yang gzung 'dzin gnyis grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang gzung 'dzin gnyis grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Here also, the two, the object and the subject, are not established.

original: mi mkhas pa'i rtog pa'i don /
analyzed: mi mkhas pa'i rtog pa'i don /
translated: The meaning of the non-expert‚Äôs idea

original: nga'i mig rnam par shes pas sngon po mthong ngo zhes gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du rlom ste bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: nga'i mig rnam par shes pas sngon po mthong ngo zhes gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du rlom ste bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: is that the eye consciousness of mine sees blue, and it is imagined to be the object and the subject.

original: dmigs pa phan tshun mi 'khrul zhes bstan pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa phan tshun mi 'khrul zhes bstan pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Following the teaching, it is merely taught that the object is not confused with another object.

original: don ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs pa nyid /
analyzed: don ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs pa nyid /
translated: The meaning is that the mere apprehension of the aspect of form, etc.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dmigs pa yin la de 'dra ba'i shes pa dmigs pa yang don gyi rnam par dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dmigs pa yin la de 'dra ba'i shes pa dmigs pa yang don gyi rnam par dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: is the object of the eye consciousness, etc., and the mere consciousness of that sort is the mere apprehension of the aspect of the object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs bsgrub bya la mi 'khrul ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs bsgrub bya la mi 'khrul ba yang yin no //
translated: For that very reason, the reason is not confused with the probandum.

original: de la brtsad pa sprang ba ni /
analyzed: de la brtsad pa sprang ba ni /
translated: Here, the refutation of that is:

original: gzhan dag gtan tshigs 'di ni ma nges te /üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gtan tshigs 'di ni ma nges te / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la /
translated: Others say that this reason is not established.

original: 'gro ba tha mal pa'i sems rgyud snang pa na /
analyzed: 'gro ba tha mal pa'i sems rgyud snang pa na /
translated: When the mindstream of an ordinary being appears to the gnosis of omniscience,

original: dmigs par bya ba tha mal ba'i sems rgyud dmigs pa la /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba tha mal ba'i sems rgyud dmigs pa la /
translated: the object of observation of the mindstream of an ordinary being appears.

original: de ltar snang ba'i ye shes dmigs pas khyab pa /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba'i ye shes dmigs pas khyab pa /
translated: The gnosis that appears in that way is necessarily an object of observation.

original: ye shes dmigs pa la de'i gzung cha tha mal pa'i shes pa dmigs pas khyab pas /üîΩdmigs @46a * //
analyzed: ye shes dmigs pa la de'i gzung cha tha mal pa'i shes pa dmigs pas khyab pas / dmigs @46a * //
translated: The object of observation of gnosis is necessarily the aspect of the apprehender of the mindstream of an ordinary being.

original: pa phan tshun mi 'khrul ba'i gtan tshigs yod mod kyi /
analyzed: pa phan tshun mi 'khrul ba'i gtan tshigs yod mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, there is a reason that is not mistaken with regard to the mutual observation of the two.

original: tha mal pa'i sems rgyud thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin ma yin pas /
analyzed: tha mal pa'i sems rgyud thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin ma yin pas /
translated: However, since the mindstream of an ordinary being is not the nature of the gnosis of omniscience,

original: gtan tshigs 'di 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩskyon med de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhe na / skyon med de /
translated: this reason is mistaken.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la tha mal pa'i sems kyi rnam par snang ba ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la tha mal pa'i sems kyi rnam par snang ba ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: There is no error because the appearance of the aspect of the mind of an ordinary being to the gnosis of omniscience is the nature of gnosis.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is included in the concordant class.

original: gal te de 'dra ba lta na de 'dra ba'i rnam pa 'jog byed tha mal pa'i sems rgyud ye shes las tha dad pa kun rdzob tu yod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba lta na de 'dra ba'i rnam pa 'jog byed tha mal pa'i sems rgyud ye shes las tha dad pa kun rdzob tu yod pa bzhin du /
translated: If you say that it is like that, then just as the ordinary mind stream that is the basis for positing such aspects exists conventionally,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'jog par byed pa tha dad pa yod pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'jog par byed pa tha dad pa yod pas /
translated: so too the distinct basis for positing the aspects of form and so on would exist.

original: kun rdzob sems tsam du bsgrub par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob sems tsam du bsgrub par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: Thus you cannot prove that the conventional is mind only.

original: ma yin te /üîΩde 'dra ba'i rnam par snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol don dam pa ni sngar bkag la kun rdzob tu yod pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ma yin te / de 'dra ba'i rnam par snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol don dam pa ni sngar bkag la kun rdzob tu yod pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: This is not so.üîΩUltimate external objects that are not included in the appearance of such aspects have already been refuted.

original: ji ltar snang ba 'di kho na zhes pa la sogs pa kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid mi 'thad pa nyid du sngar bstan no //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba 'di kho na zhes pa la sogs pa kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid mi 'thad pa nyid du sngar bstan no //
translated: Nor is it tenable that they exist conventionally, because the definition of the conventional, ‚Äúwhatever is just this appearance‚Äù and so on, is untenable.

original: ye shes la rnam par 'jog pa'i tha mal pa'i rgyud ni rang rang gi rgyud la so sor snang zhing myong bas kun rdzob nyid du 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes la rnam par 'jog pa'i tha mal pa'i rgyud ni rang rang gi rgyud la so sor snang zhing myong bas kun rdzob nyid du 'thad pa'o //
translated: The ordinary mind stream that is the basis for positing consciousness is tenable as the conventional because it appears and is experienced in one‚Äôs own mind stream.

original: snang ba las gzhan du gyur ba'i bems po ni myong ba'i rang bzhin spangs pas /
analyzed: snang ba las gzhan du gyur ba'i bems po ni myong ba'i rang bzhin spangs pas /
translated: Since matter, which is different from appearance, is devoid of the nature of experience,

original: rang nyid rig cing myong ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rang nyid rig cing myong ba yang ma yin la /
translated: it is not itself aware and does not experience.

original: snang ba las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir blo gzhan la snang ba yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: snang ba las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir blo gzhan la snang ba yang ma yin pas /
translated: And since it is beyond appearance, it does not appear to the mind.

original: de dag mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not similar.

original: yang gal te gzugs la sogs par snang ba sems dang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pas sems nyid yin pa ltar /
analyzed: yang gal te gzugs la sogs par snang ba sems dang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pas sems nyid yin pa ltar /
translated: Moreover, just as the appearance of form and so on is ascertained as being observed simultaneously with the mind and is therefore the mind itself,

original: sems kyang gzugs la sogs par snang ba dang / lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir snang ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyang gzugs la sogs par snang ba dang / lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir snang ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: the mind is also ascertained as being observed simultaneously with the appearance of form and so on and therefore becomes the nature of appearance.

original: de'i don yang de dag lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa ni gnyis ka'i thun mong ba ste /üîΩsnang ba ni sems dang lhan cig dmigs pa nges la /
analyzed: de'i don yang de dag lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa ni gnyis ka'i thun mong ba ste / snang ba ni sems dang lhan cig dmigs pa nges la /
translated: The meaning of that is that the ascertainment of simultaneous observation of those two is common to both.üîΩAppearance is ascertained as being observed simultaneously with the mind,üîΩbut the mind is not ascertained as being observed simultaneously with appearance.

original: sems ni snang ba dang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa ma yin no zhes pa ni mi 'thad pa'o zhe na ;
analyzed: sems ni snang ba dang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa ma yin no zhes pa ni mi 'thad pa'o zhe na ;
translated: This is untenable.

original: sems kyang snang ba'i rang bzhin du 'dod pas skyon med pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyang snang ba'i rang bzhin du 'dod pas skyon med pa nyid do //
translated: Since the mind is also asserted to be the nature of appearances, there is no fault.

original: yang lhan cig gi sgra'i don ni gnyis nyid yin pas gtan tshigs 'di 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yang lhan cig gi sgra'i don ni gnyis nyid yin pas gtan tshigs 'di 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Again, since the meaning of the term ‚Äútogether‚Äù is ‚Äúboth,‚Äù this reason is contradictory.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: phyir rgol mi mkhas pa'i bsam pa dang sbyar nas lhan cig brjod du zad kyang /
analyzed: phyir rgol mi mkhas pa'i bsam pa dang sbyar nas lhan cig brjod du zad kyang /
translated: It is merely stated that they are together in consideration of the opponent‚Äôs lack of expertise.

original: don ni sngar bstan @46b pa ltar yin pas nyes pa med do //üîΩgal te 'dir zhib tu rnam par dpyad pa'i sgo nas gzugs la sogs pa snang ba /
analyzed: don ni sngar bstan @46b pa ltar yin pas nyes pa med do // gal te 'dir zhib tu rnam par dpyad pa'i sgo nas gzugs la sogs pa snang ba /
translated: Since the meaning is as previously explained, there is no fault.

original: phyi'i don yin pa 'gog pa na /
analyzed: phyi'i don yin pa 'gog pa na /
translated: If here, through the door of detailed analysis, the appearance of form and so on is refuted as being an external object,

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la yang mtshungs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la yang mtshungs par 'gyur la /
translated: then that will be the same for consciousness as well.

original: ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi dbang du byas na ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba phyi'i don nyid du byis pa yan chod kyi shes pa la rab tu grags pas /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi dbang du byas na ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba phyi'i don nyid du byis pa yan chod kyi shes pa la rab tu grags pas /
translated: If it is considered from the perspective of mere appearance, then the appearance of form and so on is well known to the consciousnesses of everyone from children on up as being external objects.

original: mtshungs pa ma yin nam snyam du sems na /
analyzed: mtshungs pa ma yin nam snyam du sems na /
translated: So is it not the case that the reason is not established?

original: bden mod kyi ji ltar lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan par snang ba'i gong bu ni /
analyzed: bden mod kyi ji ltar lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan par snang ba'i gong bu ni /
translated: True, but just as the entity that appears to possess a dewlap and so on,

original: de kho na nyid du rnam par dpyad na ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'gar yang ma grub mod kyi /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du rnam par dpyad na ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'gar yang ma grub mod kyi /
translated: when analyzed in terms of reality, is not established as having the nature of a cow or a horse,

original: rnam par gzhag pa tsam du ba lang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan par snang bas /üîΩba lang nyid du rnam par 'jog pa ltar gzugs la sogs par snang ba yang kun rdzob tsam du sems kyi mtshan nyid dang 'brel par snang bas /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa tsam du ba lang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan par snang bas / ba lang nyid du rnam par 'jog pa ltar gzugs la sogs par snang ba yang kun rdzob tsam du sems kyi mtshan nyid dang 'brel par snang bas /
translated: it is still posited as a cow because it appears to possess the characteristics of a cow.

original: sems nyid du rnam par gzhag go ;
analyzed: sems nyid du rnam par gzhag go ;
translated: Likewise, the appearances of form and so on are posited as mind itself because they appear to be related to the characteristics of mind as mere conventionalities.

original: / gal te 'dir thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni /
analyzed: / gal te 'dir thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni /
translated: If you say that the fact that it possesses obstruction

original: sems las gzhan bems po'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: sems las gzhan bems po'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: is the characteristic of matter that is other than mind,

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang de dang 'brel bar snang bas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang de dang 'brel bar snang bas /
translated: and since form and so on appear to be related to that,

original: phyi'i don bems po nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyi'i don bems po nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: outer objects would become matter,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa ni bdag nyid kyi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa yin la /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa ni bdag nyid kyi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa yin la /
translated: That which is obstructive is that which impedes the arising of another in its own place.

original: gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But the appearance of form and so on is not like that.

original: ji ltar dung dkar po'i rnam par snang ba'i go skabs de nyid du gzhan dag la ser po'i rnam par snang ba nyid du 'gyur zhing /üîΩde las gzhan ro dang kha dog la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la yang 'dod bya'i rnam par snang ba'i go skabs de nyid du /
analyzed: ji ltar dung dkar po'i rnam par snang ba'i go skabs de nyid du gzhan dag la ser po'i rnam par snang ba nyid du 'gyur zhing / de las gzhan ro dang kha dog la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la yang 'dod bya'i rnam par snang ba'i go skabs de nyid du /
translated: Just as the opportunity for the appearance of the white color of a conch is the very opportunity for the appearance of yellow color to others,

original: gzhan la de dang 'gal ba'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la de dang 'gal ba'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and just as the opportunity for the appearance of the desirable color, taste, and so on of food is the very opportunity for the appearance of something incompatible to others,üîΩsuch as pus.üîΩMoreover, in the chapter that teaches the inconceivable qualities of a buddha in the noble King of SamƒÅdhis S≈´tra,

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab par bstan pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab par bstan pa'i le'u las /
translated: it says:

original: skra gcig khyon la sangs rgyas mang po ni //
analyzed: skra gcig khyon la sangs rgyas mang po ni //
translated: Many buddhas on the tip of a single hair

original: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed yod ;
analyzed: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed yod ;
translated: equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River,

original: / rgyal ba de dag zhing yang de snyed de //
analyzed: / rgyal ba de dag zhing yang de snyed de //
translated: and those victors have as many buddhafields.

original: de dag mtshan nyid mi 'dra skal mi mnyam //
analyzed: de dag mtshan nyid mi 'dra skal mi mnyam //
translated: They have different characteristics and are not of the same kind.

original: skra yi khyon la 'gro ba lnga rnams te //
analyzed: skra yi khyon la 'gro ba lnga rnams te //
translated: The five types of beings live on the tip of a hair.

original: sems can dmyal dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba dang // gshin rje'i 'jig rten lha dang mi rnams bzhugs //
analyzed: sems can dmyal dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba dang // gshin rje'i 'jig rten lha dang mi rnams bzhugs //
translated: The beings of the hells, animals, the world of Yama, gods, and humans live there.

original: 'dres pa med cing gnod par 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: 'dres pa med cing gnod par 'gyur ba med //
translated: They do not mix and do not harm each other.

original: @47a * // de yi gnas su mtsho dang rgya mtshor bcas //
analyzed: @47a * // de yi gnas su mtsho dang rgya mtshor bcas //
translated: In their abodes are oceans and seas,

original: chu klung de bzhin mtshe'u dang lteng ka rnams //
analyzed: chu klung de bzhin mtshe'u dang lteng ka rnams //
translated: rivers, ponds, and pools.

original: 'dres pa med cing gnod par 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: 'dres pa med cing gnod par 'gyur ba med //
translated: They do not mix and do not harm each other.

original: ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: yang don de nyid 'phags pa thogs med kyis /
analyzed: yang don de nyid 'phags pa thogs med kyis /
translated: The noble Asanga also teaches this meaning:üîΩHungry ghosts, animals, humans, and gods,

original: yi dags dud 'gro mi rnams dang // lha rnams ji ltar rigs rigs bzhin //
analyzed: yi dags dud 'gro mi rnams dang // lha rnams ji ltar rigs rigs bzhin //
translated: according to their type,

original: dngos gcig yid ni tha dad phyir //
analyzed: dngos gcig yid ni tha dad phyir //
translated: see one thing in different ways.

original: don ma grub par 'dod pa yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //üîΩgzhan yang sna tshogs sems kyi bdag nyid yin par ni /
analyzed: don ma grub par 'dod pa yin // zhes gsungs so // gzhan yang sna tshogs sems kyi bdag nyid yin par ni /
translated: Therefore, objects are not established.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba dang / sa bcu pa las kyang /
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba dang / sa bcu pa las kyang /
translated: Moreover, that the various appearances are of the nature of mind is taught in the Samdhinirmocana Sutra and the Dashabhumika Sutra.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo sde 'di nyid du rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas bstan pas /üîΩgzhan dag / yid ches lung dang mi ldan par //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo sde 'di nyid du rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas bstan pas / gzhan dag / yid ches lung dang mi ldan par //
translated: And in this very sutra, the teaching is given in many ways.üîΩTherefore, do not doubt that there is no scriptural authority for the teaching of mind only, as stated in the Dense Array Scripture:

original: chos rnams ston par byed pa ni //
analyzed: chos rnams ston par byed pa ni //
translated: Those who teach the Dharma

original: mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa yis //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa yis //
translated: without confidence and without scripture

original: bdag nyid chud zos gzhan chud gson //
analyzed: bdag nyid chud zos gzhan chud gson //
translated: are themselves lost and cause others to lose

original: zhes 'phags pa stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las gsungs pa bzhin du 'dir sems tsam du ston pa la yid ches pa'i lung med do snyam du dogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes 'phags pa stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las gsungs pa bzhin du 'dir sems tsam du ston pa la yid ches pa'i lung med do snyam du dogs par mi bya'o //
translated: the way through their conceptual characteristics.

original: gal te phyi'i don kun rdzob tsam du yang med na /
analyzed: gal te phyi'i don kun rdzob tsam du yang med na /
translated: If external objects do not exist even conventionally,

original: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba mi 'thad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba mi 'thad par 'gyur te /
translated: the relationship between action and effect is untenable.

original: 'di ltar re zhig lus dang ngag gi ngo bo nyid kyang med na /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig lus dang ngag gi ngo bo nyid kyang med na /
translated: Thus, if the body and speech do not exist even conventionally,

original: de dag gi las dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa ji ltar 'thad cing /
analyzed: de dag gi las dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa ji ltar 'thad cing /
translated: how can their virtuous and nonvirtuous actions be tenable?

original: de'i rnam par smin pa lha dang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas dang lus la sogs pa tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'brel bar snang ba nyid mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa lha dang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas dang lus la sogs pa tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'brel bar snang ba nyid mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: It is untenable that the maturation of karma would appear as the places of gods and hell-beings, bodies, and so on that are related to the feelings of pleasure and pain.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: kun rdzob tu thams cad sems kyi snang ba nyid la 'jog ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu thams cad sems kyi snang ba nyid la 'jog ste /
translated: Everything is posited as the appearance of mind conventionally.

original: 'di ltar bdag cag rnams kyi lus dang ngag tu snang ba'i rnam rig / gzhan lha sbyin la sogs pa'i lus su snang ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag cag rnams kyi lus dang ngag tu snang ba'i rnam rig / gzhan lha sbyin la sogs pa'i lus su snang ba la /
translated: Thus the appearance of our own body and speech as consciousness and the appearance of the body of another, Devadatta, and so on,

original: mtshon cha la sogs pa bsnun pa snang ba dang / de dag la yang de ltar snang bas sems rgyud sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang 'brel bar myong zhing /
analyzed: mtshon cha la sogs pa bsnun pa snang ba dang / de dag la yang de ltar snang bas sems rgyud sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang 'brel bar myong zhing /
translated: the appearance of the stabbing of a weapon, and so on, and the experience of the continuum of consciousness as related to the feeling of pain in that body

original: srid pa nying mtshams 'brel bar myong ba na /
analyzed: srid pa nying mtshams 'brel bar myong ba na /
translated: and the experience of the connection to the next birth

original: srog gcod pa zhes rab tu grags pa'i lus kyi las mi dge ba nyid du 'jog ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa zhes rab tu grags pa'i lus kyi las mi dge ba nyid du 'jog ste /
translated: are posited as the nonvirtuous karma of the body known as killing.

original: des ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid lus su snang ba la lus kyi las nyid du 'jog gi /
analyzed: des ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid lus su snang ba la lus kyi las nyid du 'jog gi /
translated: Thus consciousness only is posited as the karma of the body in the appearance as a body.

original: phyi rol bems po'i bdag nyid du @47b gyur ba'i lus kyi las ni khas mi len pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol bems po'i bdag nyid du @47b gyur ba'i lus kyi las ni khas mi len pa nyid do //
translated: The body‚Äôs action, which is of the nature of external matter, is not accepted.

original: ma byin par len pa la sogs pa lus ngag gi las mi dge ba dang dge ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa la sogs pa lus ngag gi las mi dge ba dang dge ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The other distinctions of nonvirtuous and virtuous actions of body and speech, such as taking what is not given, should be understood in the same way.

original: las de rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yang de 'dra ba'i las su snang zhing myong ba las /
analyzed: las de rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yang de 'dra ba'i las su snang zhing myong ba las /
translated: The maturation of those actions is the appearance of such actions and the experience of them.

original: dus gzhan du de'i sems rgyud sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang 'brel bar myong ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dus gzhan du de'i sems rgyud sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang 'brel bar myong ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: At another time, the continuum of their mind experiences the connection with the feeling of suffering.

original: ji ltar sems can dmyal ba'i lcags kyi khang pa 'bar bar snang zhing rang gi lus su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa nyid mes bsregs par myong ba la sogs pa dang / lha rnams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan la sogs pa dang 'brel bar nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can dmyal ba'i lcags kyi khang pa 'bar bar snang zhing rang gi lus su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa nyid mes bsregs par myong ba la sogs pa dang / lha rnams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan la sogs pa dang 'brel bar nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the appearance of the iron house of hell appears and the consciousness that appears as one‚Äôs own body experiences being burned by fire and so on, and just as the gods experience the connection with the sense objects of desire and so on.

original: gal te 'dir las dang 'bras bu'i bye brag de nyid sgrub pa la tshad ma ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir las dang 'bras bu'i bye brag de nyid sgrub pa la tshad ma ci yod ce na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the valid knowledge that establishes the specific relationship between actions and results here?‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung las bshad pa 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung las bshad pa 'am /
translated: It is explained in the scriptures of the TathƒÅgata.

original: yang na dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad ma yang yod de /
analyzed: yang na dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad ma yang yod de /
translated: Or, there is valid knowledge that engages by the power of the thing itself.

original: ji ltar mtho ris kyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i mi rnams kyi phung po'i rgyun 'ga' zhig gi dang po mi nyid du grub cing tha snyad mtho ris kyi bde ba dang 'brel ba ni chos can nyid yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar mtho ris kyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i mi rnams kyi phung po'i rgyun 'ga' zhig gi dang po mi nyid du grub cing tha snyad mtho ris kyi bde ba dang 'brel ba ni chos can nyid yin la /
translated: In the case of humans who are included in the continuum of the higher realms, the continuum of aggregates that is established as human in the beginning and is related to the conventions of the bliss of the higher realms is the subject.

original: de nyid dge ba'i sems ba sngon du song ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid dge ba'i sems ba sngon du song ba yin te /
translated: That is preceded by virtuous intention.

original: de las gzhan pa rgyur mi 'thad pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rgyur mi 'thad pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is a thing that is not tenable as another cause.

original: dper na zhing stengs kyi myu gu'i khyad par bzhin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dper na zhing stengs kyi myu gu'i khyad par bzhin zhes pa ste /
translated: For example, it is like the particular sprouts in a field.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
translated: This is a reason of nature.

original: gal te 'dir khyab pa'i don la brtsad pa med mod kyi gtan tshigs nyid mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gal te 'dir khyab pa'i don la brtsad pa med mod kyi gtan tshigs nyid mi 'thad de /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúAlthough there is no dispute about the meaning of the pervasion here, the reason itself is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar lung du ma bstan pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems pa dang / des kun nas slong ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams de 'dra ba'i phung po mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba srid do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di ltar lung du ma bstan pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems pa dang / des kun nas slong ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams de 'dra ba'i phung po mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba srid do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that it is possible that neutral and nonvirtuous intention and the afflictions such as attachment that motivate it are the cause of establishing such a type of aggregate,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: dud 'gro la sogs pa 'gro ba'i khyad par de dang der snang ba rnams ni phal cher srog gcod pa la sogs pa nyes par spyod pa'i lus dang ngag gi rig byed dang 'brel bar snang ba na /
analyzed: dud 'gro la sogs pa 'gro ba'i khyad par de dang der snang ba rnams ni phal cher srog gcod pa la sogs pa nyes par spyod pa'i lus dang ngag gi rig byed dang 'brel bar snang ba na /
translated: The specific appearances of the realms of animals and so on are mostly related to the indicative form of body and speech of negative action such as killing.

original: de dag kun nas slong ba'i mi dge ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa dang / rjes su 'brel par dpag par nus shing /üîΩgzhan yang lung du ma bstan pa'i lus ngag gi rig byed du snang ba las kyang /
analyzed: de dag kun nas slong ba'i mi dge ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa dang / rjes su 'brel par dpag par nus shing / gzhan yang lung du ma bstan pa'i lus ngag gi rig byed du snang ba las kyang /
translated: It is possible to infer that they are related to nonvirtuous karma and affliction that motivates them.

original: de dag kun nas slong ba'i lung du ma bstan pa'i sems pa nyid dpag par nus te /
analyzed: de dag kun nas slong ba'i lung du ma bstan pa'i sems pa nyid dpag par nus te /
translated: Moreover, it is possible to infer that neutral intention that motivates them from the appearance of neutral indicative form of body and speech.

original: ji ltar @48a * //
analyzed: ji ltar @48a * //
translated: How is that?

original: bdag cag rnams kyi rgyud la de 'dra ba'i lus ngag gi rig byed du snang ba ni /
analyzed: bdag cag rnams kyi rgyud la de 'dra ba'i lus ngag gi rig byed du snang ba ni /
translated: The appearance of such indicative form of body and speech in our mindstreams

original: de 'dra ba'i sems pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sems pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du grub pa bzhin no //
translated: is established as preceded by such intention and so on.

original: de lta na 'gro ba'i khyad par de rnams su snang ba ni shin tu ches cher mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems pa la sogs pa dang ldan par grub mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta na 'gro ba'i khyad par de rnams su snang ba ni shin tu ches cher mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems pa la sogs pa dang ldan par grub mod kyi /
translated: Thus it is established that the appearance of these different beings is endowed with very unvirtuous and neutral intention and so on.

original: mtho ris kyi phung po ni de'i drung na shin tu nyung zad tsam du dmigs pas //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi phung po ni de'i drung na shin tu nyung zad tsam du dmigs pas //
translated: But the aggregates of higher rebirth are observed to be very few in comparison with those of lower rebirth.

original: de rnams 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su mi byed ces pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su mi byed ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore they do not follow the increase and decrease of those.

original: gal te 'dir rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na skyes bu'i khyad par 'ga' zhig snang ba dang sgyu ma'i skyes bu la de 'dra ba'i lus ngag gi rig byed du snang ba dmigs kyang /
analyzed: gal te 'dir rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na skyes bu'i khyad par 'ga' zhig snang ba dang sgyu ma'i skyes bu la de 'dra ba'i lus ngag gi rig byed du snang ba dmigs kyang /
translated: If you say that in dream states some beings appear and the indicative form of their body and speech appears to an illusory being,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa de dag sngon du song ba ma yin pas de 'dra ba'i rtags 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa de dag sngon du song ba ma yin pas de 'dra ba'i rtags 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But since karma and affliction do not precede them, such signs would be deceptive.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: Reply: They are not,

original: de dag ni skye bo thams cad la mthun par snang ba dang / rjes su 'brel bar yun ring du snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni skye bo thams cad la mthun par snang ba dang / rjes su 'brel bar yun ring du snang ba ma yin te /
translated: because they do not appear to all beings in a similar way, nor do they appear to be related to each other for a long time.

original: gnyid kyis bslad pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig la skyes bu'i khyab par gzhan zhig srog gcod pa la sogs pa nyes par spyod pa'i rig byed dang 'brel par snang zhing /
analyzed: gnyid kyis bslad pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig la skyes bu'i khyab par gzhan zhig srog gcod pa la sogs pa nyes par spyod pa'i rig byed dang 'brel par snang zhing /
translated: For example, some people who are affected by sleep may perceive the performance of evil actions, such as killing, related to other people.

original: de yang 'chol pa'am mi gsal pa la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'o //
analyzed: de yang 'chol pa'am mi gsal pa la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'o //
translated: Moreover, they appear in a confused or unclear way.

original: gzhan yang sgyu ma'i skyes bu yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgyu ma'i skyes bu yang /
translated: Moreover, even illusory peopleüîΩare not perceived

original: mig ma bslad pa rnams kyis ni //üîΩde ltar de dag ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: mig ma bslad pa rnams kyis ni // de ltar de dag ma mthong phyir //
translated: by those whose eyes are unaffected.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i tshul du mthun par snang ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i tshul du mthun par snang ba ma yin zhing /
translated: In the same way, they do not appear in a similar way to all.

original: de 'dra ba'i nyes par spyod pa'i las dang rjes su 'brel bar rgyun ring du snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i nyes par spyod pa'i las dang rjes su 'brel bar rgyun ring du snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the case that such an action of faulty conduct is seen to be related to a long continuum.

original: sngar bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ni skye bo thams cad la mthun par snang ba dang / rjes su 'brel bar rgyun ring du snang ba nyid kyi khyad par du byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ni skye bo thams cad la mthun par snang ba dang / rjes su 'brel bar rgyun ring du snang ba nyid kyi khyad par du byas pa yin pas /
translated: The meaning of the reason stated above is that it is qualified by being seen in common by all people and by being seen to be related to a long continuum.

original: 'khrul par 'gyur ba'i skyon med ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul par 'gyur ba'i skyon med ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of error.

original: gzhan dag sems tsam pa la rgyud gzhan grub pa mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: gzhan dag sems tsam pa la rgyud gzhan grub pa mi 'thad pas /
translated: Others argue that since it is not tenable that CittamƒÅtra establishes other continua,üîΩit is not tenable that they generate the supreme mind of awakening preceded by love and compassion for the sake of those sentient beings and engage in the bodhisattva deeds such as generosity.

original: de dag gi don du byams pa dang snying rje sngon du 'gro ba can gyi byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa dang / srin pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mi 'thad do zhes rgol ba'i lan du yang 'di nyid sbyor bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi don du byams pa dang snying rje sngon du 'gro ba can gyi byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa dang / srin pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mi 'thad do zhes rgol ba'i lan du yang 'di nyid sbyor bar bya ste /
translated: This very verse should be applied in response to that.

original: ji skad du /üîΩrang lus blo sngon 'gro ba yis //
analyzed: ji skad du / rang lus blo sngon 'gro ba yis //
translated: As it has been said:üîΩSeeing that actions are done

original: bya ba mthong nas gzhan la de //
analyzed: bya ba mthong nas gzhan la de //
translated: by the mind that precedes them,

original: 'dzin phyir gal te blo shes 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dzin phyir gal te blo shes 'gyur //
translated: If the mind were known through grasping,

original: sems tsam @48b la yang tshul 'di mtshungs //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems tsam @48b la yang tshul 'di mtshungs // zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The same would be true of mind-only.

original: 'dir phyi'i don du smra ba rnams rang gi rgyud la 'gro ba dang / smra bar bya'o snyam pa'i blo sngon du 'gro ba can gyis lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed 'ga' zhig mthong nas /üîΩgzhan lha sbyin la sogs pa la yang de 'dra ba'i lus ngag gi bya ba mthong ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: 'dir phyi'i don du smra ba rnams rang gi rgyud la 'gro ba dang / smra bar bya'o snyam pa'i blo sngon du 'gro ba can gyis lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed 'ga' zhig mthong nas / gzhan lha sbyin la sogs pa la yang de 'dra ba'i lus ngag gi bya ba mthong ba'i sgo nas /
translated: Here, those who advocate external objects see that some physical and verbal expressions are preceded by the mind that thinks, ‚ÄúI will go‚Äù or ‚ÄúI will speak.‚Äù

original: kun nas slong ba'i blo rjes su dpog pa ltar /
analyzed: kun nas slong ba'i blo rjes su dpog pa ltar /
translated: And they infer the mind that motivates them by seeing similar physical and verbal actions in others, such as Devadatta.

original: sems tsam gyi lus la yang de 'dra ba'i lus ngag gi rig byed du snang ba las /
analyzed: sems tsam gyi lus la yang de 'dra ba'i lus ngag gi rig byed du snang ba las /
translated: Similarly, in the CittamƒÅtra system, from the appearance of the body that is similar to the appearance of the physical and verbal expressions,

original: de dang 'brel bar snang ba'i chos can 'ga' zhig de 'dra ba'i kun nas slong ba'i blo sngon du song ba nyid du dpog par byed de /
analyzed: de dang 'brel bar snang ba'i chos can 'ga' zhig de 'dra ba'i kun nas slong ba'i blo sngon du song ba nyid du dpog par byed de /
translated: they infer that some phenomena that appear to be related to that body are preceded by a mind that motivates them in that way.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in accordance with the explanation above.

original: gal te 'dir sngar gyi rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs nyid ma grub ste /
analyzed: gal te 'dir sngar gyi rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs nyid ma grub ste /
translated: If you say that the original reason is not established here,

original: mtho ris kyi phung po de 'dra ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ni pha dang ma la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i rdzas yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mtho ris kyi phung po de 'dra ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ni pha dang ma la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i rdzas yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the cause that produces the aggregates of the higher realms is the substance of the elements of the father and mother, and so on,

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: then there is no error.

original: 'dir rdzus te skyes pa'i 'gro ba'i khyad par 'ba' zhig ma gtogs pa gzhan ni 'byung bas kyang mngon par 'grub pa'i rkyen byed mod kyi /üîΩgtan tshigs kyi don ni dge ba'i sems pa dang / de kun nas slong ba ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par /
analyzed: 'dir rdzus te skyes pa'i 'gro ba'i khyad par 'ba' zhig ma gtogs pa gzhan ni 'byung bas kyang mngon par 'grub pa'i rkyen byed mod kyi / gtan tshigs kyi don ni dge ba'i sems pa dang / de kun nas slong ba ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par /
translated: Here, the condition of the elements does indeed produce the special rebirth of beings born supernaturally, but not the other rebirths.

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig rgyur mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig rgyur mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the reason is that it is not tenable that anything other than virtuous intention and the root of virtue of nonattachment that motivates it is a cause.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na 'dir sems las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba nyid sngar bkag pas skyon med pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na 'dir sems las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba nyid sngar bkag pas skyon med pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: In reality, here the elements themselves are not other than the mind, and since they were previously refuted, there is no error.

original: gal te yang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems pa la sogs pa dang / mtho ris kyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i phung po 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su byed mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems pa la sogs pa dang / mtho ris kyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i phung po 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su byed mod kyi /
translated: Even though nonvirtuous and neutral intentions and so on and the increase and decrease of the aggregates subsumed by the higher realms are not seen,üîΩthey are not objects of our vision.

original: de 'dra ba'i 'bras bu bdag cag rnams kyis mthong ba'i yul du ma gyur pa snod kyi 'jig rten gzhan du skyes pas /üîΩma dmigs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i 'bras bu bdag cag rnams kyis mthong ba'i yul du ma gyur pa snod kyi 'jig rten gzhan du skyes pas / ma dmigs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhe na /
translated: They are merely not observed because they are born in other worlds.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: snga ma ltar phyi'i don mi 'thad pas sems kyi snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i snod kyi 'jig rten nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma ltar phyi'i don mi 'thad pas sems kyi snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i snod kyi 'jig rten nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since external objects are untenable as previously explained, the world as environment is untenable apart from being appearances of mind.

original: lung las kyang /
analyzed: lung las kyang /
translated: Also, a scripture says:

original: skra tsam khyon la 'gro ba lnga rnams te //
analyzed: skra tsam khyon la 'gro ba lnga rnams te //
translated: Beings of the five types exist in the space of a single hair.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don sngar bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don sngar bstan to //
translated: The meaning of this and other such passages has been explained above.

original: yang gal te phyi'i don yod du zin kyang 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang gal te phyi'i don yod du zin kyang 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if external objects do exist, this is not logical.

original: phung po 'grub pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig snod kyi 'jig rten @49a * //
analyzed: phung po 'grub pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig snod kyi 'jig rten @49a * //
translated: Some special feature of the formation of the aggregates is the world as environment.

original: gzhan du skye bar srid kyang /üîΩthams cad dam /
analyzed: gzhan du skye bar srid kyang / thams cad dam /
translated: It is possible that some will be born in other places,üîΩbut there is no reason why all or

original: phal cher ni de ltar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan med de /
analyzed: phal cher ni de ltar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan med de /
translated: most will be born there.

original: de ltar na snod kyi 'jig rten 'dir mtho ris kyi phung po skye ba'i mthun rkyen ma tshang ba 'am /
analyzed: de ltar na snod kyi 'jig rten 'dir mtho ris kyi phung po skye ba'i mthun rkyen ma tshang ba 'am /
translated: In that case, it would be because the conditions for the arising of the aggregates of the higher realms in this world system are incomplete or

original: 'gal rkyen nye bar gnas ba las yin grang na /
analyzed: 'gal rkyen nye bar gnas ba las yin grang na /
translated: because adverse conditions are present.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is illogical,

original: da ltar mngon du gyur pa'i mtho ris kyi phung po 'di rnams kyang med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar mngon du gyur pa'i mtho ris kyi phung po 'di rnams kyang med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aggregates of the higher realms that are manifest now would not exist.üîΩTherefore,üîΩThe one who accumulates karma and

original: de'i phyir / las rnams sogs par byed pa dang // de yi 'bras bu longs spyod pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / las rnams sogs par byed pa dang // de yi 'bras bu longs spyod pa //
translated: experiences its effects

original: snod kyi 'jig rten tha dad na //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten tha dad na //
translated: If the world systems were different,

original: 'ga' zhig de ltar srid mod kyi //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig de ltar srid mod kyi //
translated: it is possible that some would be like that.

original: thams cad de ltar nges pa'i rgyu ni 'thad pa ma yin te /üîΩbyed po'i yul ni spyod 'gyur ba //
analyzed: thams cad de ltar nges pa'i rgyu ni 'thad pa ma yin te / byed po'i yul ni spyod 'gyur ba //
translated: But it is not logical that all are definitely like that.üîΩThe object of the agent is not

original: byed po'i rgyun du 'gal ba med //
analyzed: byed po'i rgyun du 'gal ba med //
translated: contradictory in the continuum of the agent.

original: ces pa'o // gal te sems las gzhan pa'i snod kyi 'jig rten yod dam med kyang sla ste /
analyzed: ces pa'o // gal te sems las gzhan pa'i snod kyi 'jig rten yod dam med kyang sla ste /
translated: Whether or not there is a physical world other than mind,

original: de 'dra ba'i las kyis bskyed pa'i phung po thams cad khyed kyis mthong ba'i yul du 'gyur ba'i nges pa med do zhe na ;
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i las kyis bskyed pa'i phung po thams cad khyed kyis mthong ba'i yul du 'gyur ba'i nges pa med do zhe na ;
translated: it is not certain that all the aggregates generated by such karma will be objects seen by you.

original: ma yin te /üîΩde 'dra ba'i las mthun par bsags pa'i 'gro ba rnams ni las kyi dbang gis byung pa'i snod kyi 'jig rten thun mong bar snang ba dang / lus dang longs spyod thun mong bar snang ba 'ba' zhig la spyod par rigs te /
analyzed: ma yin te / de 'dra ba'i las mthun par bsags pa'i 'gro ba rnams ni las kyi dbang gis byung pa'i snod kyi 'jig rten thun mong bar snang ba dang / lus dang longs spyod thun mong bar snang ba 'ba' zhig la spyod par rigs te /
translated: That is not so,üîΩbecause it is reasonable that those reincarnating beings who have accumulated karma in agreement experience only the shared physical world that arises from the power of karma and the shared physical world and resources that appear to them.

original: ji ltar las mtshungs pa las byung ba'i mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa 'di rnams nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar las mtshungs pa las byung ba'i mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa 'di rnams nyid bzhin no //
translated: This is just like the shared physical world and resources that appear to humans who belong to the same realm and who have arisen from similar karma.

original: gzhan du na tha snyad pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad 'tshol ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na tha snyad pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad 'tshol ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, all conventional causes and effects would be sought.

original: ji ltar sa dang sa bon la sogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu yang du ma nyid yin no zhes ci ste mi brjod do //
analyzed: ji ltar sa dang sa bon la sogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu yang du ma nyid yin no zhes ci ste mi brjod do //
translated: Why don‚Äôt you say that the effects of such things as the earth and seeds are also multiple?

original: der yang sa bon gyi dngos po du ma yin pa bzhin du de'i 'bras bu yang du ma nyid skyes mod kyi /
analyzed: der yang sa bon gyi dngos po du ma yin pa bzhin du de'i 'bras bu yang du ma nyid skyes mod kyi /
translated: In that case, just as the entity of the seed is multiple, its effect is also multiple.

original: 'o skol rnams kyis mthong ba'i yul du ma gyur pas /
analyzed: 'o skol rnams kyis mthong ba'i yul du ma gyur pas /
translated: But we do not see this,

original: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su byed pa dgag par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su byed pa dgag par mi nus so //
translated: so we cannot deny that the effect increases and decreases.

original: de la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par thams cad rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur bas 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par thams cad rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur bas 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not tenable to posit any distinction between cause and effect, this is not a reasonable explanation.

original: de bzhin du ngan song gi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i phung po sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang 'brel ba gsar du skyes pa rnams kyang mi dge ba'i sems pa dang de kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa sngon du song ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngan song gi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i phung po sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang 'brel ba gsar du skyes pa rnams kyang mi dge ba'i sems pa dang de kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa sngon du song ba yin te /
translated: In the same way, the newly arisen aggregates that are included in the continuum of an unfortunate realm and that are associated with the feeling of pain are preceded by nonvirtuous volition and the afflictions that motivate it.

original: de las ma rtogs pa rgyu gzhan mi 'thad pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir zhes pa @49b ste sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de las ma rtogs pa rgyu gzhan mi 'thad pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir zhes pa @49b ste sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Since it is not tenable that there is another cause for noncomprehension, it is a thing.

original: gzhan yang da ltar gyi dus na sems can gyi phung pos bsdus pa'i dad pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa dang / chags pa dang sdang ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gsal bar myong ba ni rang gi rigs goms pa dge mi dge'i sems pa kun nas slong bar byed pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du rang rang gi rgyud la grub pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang da ltar gyi dus na sems can gyi phung pos bsdus pa'i dad pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa dang / chags pa dang sdang ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gsal bar myong ba ni rang gi rigs goms pa dge mi dge'i sems pa kun nas slong bar byed pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du rang rang gi rgyud la grub pa na /
translated: Moreover, in the present, the experience of the aspects of affliction such as attachment and aversion and of faith, wisdom, and so on, subsumed by the aggregates of sentient beings is established in the continuum of each being as that which precedes the motivation of virtuous and nonvirtuous intention that is familiar with its own type.

original: gzhan dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa phal che ba gsar du skyes pa rnams la yang sngar bstan pa bzhin du lus dang ngag gi nyes par spyod pa'i las dang 'brel bar snang ba las /
analyzed: gzhan dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa phal che ba gsar du skyes pa rnams la yang sngar bstan pa bzhin du lus dang ngag gi nyes par spyod pa'i las dang 'brel bar snang ba las /
translated: In other realms, even in the majority of newly born animals, as previously explained, there is the appearance of the connection with the karma of the misdeeds of body and speech.

original: chags pa dang sdang ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi dge ba'i sems pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang 'brel ba nyid du rtogs shing /
analyzed: chags pa dang sdang ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi dge ba'i sems pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang 'brel ba nyid du rtogs shing /
translated: It is understood that they are related to the motivation of nonvirtuous thoughts such as attachment and hostility.

original: de yang de 'dra ba'i rigs mthun goms pa snga ma sngon du song ba nyid du grub la /
analyzed: de yang de 'dra ba'i rigs mthun goms pa snga ma sngon du song ba nyid du grub la /
translated: Moreover, it is established that they are preceded by the familiarization with such a type.

original: de ltar goms pa yang skye ba der gtogs pa'i rten la ma rdzogs pas skye ba snga ma gzhan gcig la yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten snga ma nyid kyang dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad mas grub cing /
analyzed: de ltar goms pa yang skye ba der gtogs pa'i rten la ma rdzogs pas skye ba snga ma gzhan gcig la yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten snga ma nyid kyang dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad mas grub cing /
translated: Since such familiarization is not completed in the present life, it must be from a previous life. Thus the previous world is established by valid knowledge that engages through the power of the thing.

original: de la ltos te da ltar pa 'di nyid phyi ma yin pas /
analyzed: de la ltos te da ltar pa 'di nyid phyi ma yin pas /
translated: In dependence on that, the present life is the later life.

original: 'jig rten phyi ma yang de bzhin du grub po //
analyzed: 'jig rten phyi ma yang de bzhin du grub po //
translated: Thus the later world is also established in the same way.

original: yang de nyid kyis ngan song gi phung por gtogs pa de 'dra ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du grub pa'i sgo nas kyang /
analyzed: yang de nyid kyis ngan song gi phung por gtogs pa de 'dra ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du grub pa'i sgo nas kyang /
translated: Moreover, that which is included in the mass of lower rebirths is established as preceded by karma and affliction.

original: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du tshad mas kyang 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du tshad mas kyang 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: Just as the Bhagavat has taught the relationship between karma and its effects, it is also established by valid knowledge.

original: de bzhin du mtho ris kyi phung po gsar du skyes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyud la yang legs par spyod pa'i lus dag gi rig byed dang 'brel bar snang ba la brten nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtho ris kyi phung po gsar du skyes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyud la yang legs par spyod pa'i lus dag gi rig byed dang 'brel bar snang ba la brten nas /
translated: In the same way, in the continuum of those newly born in the aggregate of the higher realms, the non-manifest karma related to the body of good conduct is observed.

original: dad pa dang ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i sems pa kun nas slong bar byed pa sngon du song ba nyid du grub cing /
analyzed: dad pa dang ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i sems pa kun nas slong bar byed pa sngon du song ba nyid du grub cing /
translated: Based on that, it is established that they were previously motivated by virtuous intentions such as faith and non-attachment.

original: de yang rang gi rigs goms pa snga ma sngon du song ba nyid du grub pas /
analyzed: de yang rang gi rigs goms pa snga ma sngon du song ba nyid du grub pas /
translated: And that is established as preceded by the prior habituation to their own type.

original: yang 'jig rten snga phyi dang las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa'i khyad par ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du grub ces pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'jig rten snga phyi dang las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa'i khyad par ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du grub ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the specific relationship between past and future worlds and karma and its effects is established just as it is taught.

original: 'di ni khyad par du yang rgyu mthun pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par du yang rgyu mthun pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the presentation of the cause and effect of natural outflow in particular.

original: gal te 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su mi byed pas rgyu dang 'bras bur mi 'thad pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su mi byed pas rgyu dang 'bras bur mi 'thad pa de ltar na /
