translated: If it is untenable that they are cause and effect because they do not follow increase and decrease,üîΩthen it would be a mistake to say that the aggregates of higher rebirth

original: rab tu grags pa'i 'gro ba rnams la mtho ris @50a * //üîΩkyi phung po 'grub pa la sogs pa ni /üîΩches shin tu nyung zhing /
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i 'gro ba rnams la mtho ris @50a * // kyi phung po 'grub pa la sogs pa ni / ches shin tu nyung zhing /
translated: are established in the world,üîΩbecause the aggregates of higher rebirth are much more numerous

original: mtho ris kyi phung po ni debs  mang ba'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: mtho ris kyi phung po ni debs  mang ba'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: than the aggregates of lower rebirth.

original: ngan song gi rten de dag las de 'dra ba 'grub par byed pa'i sngon gyi las ni 'bras bu phyung bas zad cing las sar pa gzhan dag kyang ma bsags la /
analyzed: ngan song gi rten de dag las de 'dra ba 'grub par byed pa'i sngon gyi las ni 'bras bu phyung bas zad cing las sar pa gzhan dag kyang ma bsags la /
translated: That is not so, because karma that produces such aggregates of lower rebirth from those lower rebirths is exhausted by the effect arising and other new karma is not accumulated.

original: yang sngon gyi dge ba'i las kyi sa bon 'ba' zhig sad pa na rten de las 'phos nas mtho ris dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang sngon gyi dge ba'i las kyi sa bon 'ba' zhig sad pa na rten de las 'phos nas mtho ris dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When the seeds of former virtuous karma are awakened, one is reborn in higher rebirth after transmigrating from that basis.

original: rigs pa 'di rnams kyi don ni tshad ma rnam par gtan la dbab pa las /
analyzed: rigs pa 'di rnams kyi don ni tshad ma rnam par gtan la dbab pa las /
translated: The meaning of these reasonings is explained in Ascertaining Valid Knowledge.

original: sbyin pa dang 'tshe ba spang ba'i sems pa ni mngon par mtho ba'i 'bras bu 'byung ba la tshad ma ci yod ce na zhes brtsad pa'i lan du /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang 'tshe ba spang ba'i sems pa ni mngon par mtho ba'i 'bras bu 'byung ba la tshad ma ci yod ce na zhes brtsad pa'i lan du /
translated: In response to this, it is said that

original: de nyid kyi phyir the tshom za ba'am /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir the tshom za ba'am /
translated: because of that, there is doubt,üîΩor else, since valid knowledge is possible, one does not abandon it.

original: yang na tshad ma srid pas mi spong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i don de nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang na tshad ma srid pas mi spong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i don de nyid yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of that statement.

original: gzhan yang mang du thos pa'i slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos mdo sde 'di nyid kyi 'grel par gsungs pas the tshom mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mang du thos pa'i slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos mdo sde 'di nyid kyi 'grel par gsungs pas the tshom mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since this is stated in the commentary on this s≈´tra by the master of vast learning J√±ƒÅna≈õrƒ´bhadra, one should not doubt it.

original: yang khyad par du sbyin pa'i sems pa la brten nas longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa thob pa dang / tshul khrims kyis bde 'gror 'gyur ba la sogs pa yang rigs pa 'di nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs la yid ches par bya'o //
analyzed: yang khyad par du sbyin pa'i sems pa la brten nas longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa thob pa dang / tshul khrims kyis bde 'gror 'gyur ba la sogs pa yang rigs pa 'di nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs la yid ches par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should have confidence in the attainment of abundant resources based on the thought of generosity and in the attainment of high status based on ethics by following this very reasoning.

original: gal te phyi'i don med kyang lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed du snang ba la brten nas de ltar las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba 'jog na /
analyzed: gal te phyi'i don med kyang lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed du snang ba la brten nas de ltar las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba 'jog na /
translated: Even though external objects do not exist, one can posit the relationship between karma and its effects in dependence on the appearance of the body and speech as the perceptible form of the object.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na srog gcod pa la sogs pa snang ba las kyang /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na srog gcod pa la sogs pa snang ba las kyang /
translated: Even though the appearance of killing and so on occurs in dreams and so forth,

original: las sog cing rnam par smin pa 'byin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: las sog cing rnam par smin pa 'byin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: karma is accumulated and its fruitional effects are produced.

original: gnas skabs der yang chags sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas bslangs nas gzhan lha spyin lta bu 'ga' zhig gsad par bya'o snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: gnas skabs der yang chags sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas bslangs nas gzhan lha spyin lta bu 'ga' zhig gsad par bya'o snyam du sems shing /
translated: Even in that state, one is motivated by afflictions such as attachment and hostility and thinks, I will kill someone else, such as Devadatta.

original: de la brten nas bdag gis mtshon bsnun par snang zhing de nyid shi ba lta bur yang snang ba las /
analyzed: de la brten nas bdag gis mtshon bsnun par snang zhing de nyid shi ba lta bur yang snang ba las /
translated: In dependence on that, one appears to wield a weapon and strike and one appears to kill him.

original: gnyid sad pa na rjes kyi shes pas kyi ma legs par byas so zhes sngar gyi sems pa'i sa bon gsos pa na /
analyzed: gnyid sad pa na rjes kyi shes pas kyi ma legs par byas so zhes sngar gyi sems pa'i sa bon gsos pa na /
translated: When one awakens, the subsequent consciousness revives the seed of the previous intention and thinks, I have done something bad.

original: las cung zad sog pa ni 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: las cung zad sog pa ni 'dod pa yin la /
translated: It is asserted that a little karma is accumulated.

original: 'on kyang sad pa'i gnas skabs dang mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang sad pa'i gnas skabs dang mi 'dra ste /
translated: However, it is not the same as the waking state.

original: kun nas slong ba'i bsam pa khyad med kyang /
analyzed: kun nas slong ba'i bsam pa khyad med kyang /
translated: Although the intention that motivates it is not different,

original: dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs na gzhan gyi sems rgyud sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba @50b dang 'brel par byas pa la sogs pa med pa dang / gnyid kyis bslad pa'i gnas skabs yin pas so //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs na gzhan gyi sems rgyud sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba @50b dang 'brel par byas pa la sogs pa med pa dang / gnyid kyis bslad pa'i gnas skabs yin pas so //
translated: in the actual state, there is no connection of the mental continuum of another with the feeling of suffering, and it is a state affected by sleep.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: rmi lam sems ni gnyid kyis nyams //
analyzed: rmi lam sems ni gnyid kyis nyams //
translated: The mind in a dream is affected by sleep.

original: des na 'bras bu 'dra ma yin //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu 'dra ma yin //
translated: Therefore, the result is not the same.

original: zhes sa bcu'i mgon pos gsungs shing /
analyzed: zhes sa bcu'i mgon pos gsungs shing /
translated: Thus the lords of the tenth stage have said,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las kyang don de nyid rgya cher gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsgyu ma'i skyes bu gsad sogs la //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las kyang don de nyid rgya cher gsungs pa'i phyir ro // sgyu ma'i skyes bu gsad sogs la //
translated: and the Perfection of Wisdom s≈´tras also extensively teach this point.üîΩThere is no sin in killing an illusory person,

original: sems med phyir na sdig med de //
analyzed: sems med phyir na sdig med de //
translated: because he has no mind.

original: zhes sdig pa gtan med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes sdig pa gtan med par bstan pa ni /
translated: This shows that there is no sin at all.

original: de nyid sgyu ma nyid du shes shing kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / gsod pa'i sems pa yang med la /
analyzed: de nyid sgyu ma nyid du shes shing kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / gsod pa'i sems pa yang med la /
translated: This is because there is no motivating affliction and no intention to kill, and because one knows that it is an illusion.

original: rjes kyi gnas skabs na yang de la mngon par dga' ba med de /
analyzed: rjes kyi gnas skabs na yang de la mngon par dga' ba med de /
translated: And in the subsequent state, there is no delight in that.

original: de ltar snang ba tsam nyid du shes pas nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba tsam nyid du shes pas nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is no fault, since one understands that it is mere appearance.

original: gal te de ltar na gzhan rig pa'i cha'i shes pa thams cad kyi yul 'gog par khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na gzhan rig pa'i cha'i shes pa thams cad kyi yul 'gog par khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, since there is no difference in the negation of the object of all consciousnesses that are parts of the cognition of other,

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na gzugs la sogs par snang ba dang / smig rgyu la chur snang ba ni tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na gzugs la sogs par snang ba dang / smig rgyu la chur snang ba ni tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: then the appearance as form and so on in the context of dreams and so forth and the appearance of water in a mirage are not valid cognitions,

original: chu klung dang lteng ka la sogs pa chur snang ba ni tshad ma yin no zhes tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: chu klung dang lteng ka la sogs pa chur snang ba ni tshad ma yin no zhes tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: and the appearance of water in a river, a pond, and so on is a valid cognition. Thus it is untenable to make a distinction between valid and nonvalid cognitions.

original: de ltar yang bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar yang bden mod kyi /
translated: That is also true.

original: 'dir smig rgyu la chur snang ba las chu don du gnyer pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig zhugs pa na /
analyzed: 'dir smig rgyu la chur snang ba las chu don du gnyer pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig zhugs pa na /
translated: However, here, when a person who desires water enters a mirage in which water appears,

original: 'khrul pa'i bag chags mi brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i bag chags mi brten pa'i phyir /
translated: because the latent tendency of error is not stable,

original: chu dang phrad cing btung ngoms su snang ba ma byung bas /
analyzed: chu dang phrad cing btung ngoms su snang ba ma byung bas /
translated: Since the water is not actually encountered and drunk,

original: 'jig rten tha snyad la yid mi rton cing blo de 'dra ba 'khrul pa nyid du 'jog ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten tha snyad la yid mi rton cing blo de 'dra ba 'khrul pa nyid du 'jog ste /
translated: one should not rely on mundane conventions, and one should posit that mind as a mere error.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not a valid cognition.

original: gzhan chu klung la sogs pa chur snang ba na don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu zhugs pas 'khrul pa'i bag chags brtan pa'i phyir phrad par snang ba la sogs pa byung bas tshad ma nyid du rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: gzhan chu klung la sogs pa chur snang ba na don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu zhugs pas 'khrul pa'i bag chags brtan pa'i phyir phrad par snang ba la sogs pa byung bas tshad ma nyid du rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: However, when a person who desires water enters a mirage that appears as water, since the latent potentialities of error are stabilized, the appearance of encountering and drinking water occurs, and therefore it is posited as a valid cognition.

original: de ltar na tha snyad tsam du gzhan rig pa'i cha'i tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i dbye ba ni de dag tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de ltar na tha snyad tsam du gzhan rig pa'i cha'i tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i dbye ba ni de dag tsam du zad do //
translated: Thus the division of valid and nonvalid cognitions that are consciousnesses of other states is merely that.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig kyang de dang mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig kyang de dang mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: Some special cases, such as dreams, are similar to that.

original: yang rmi lam gyi gnas skabs 'ga' zhig na glu dbyangs la sogs pa'i sgra'am rol mo la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang ba dang / chu la sogs par snang ba las /üîΩdon du gnyer ba'i @51a * //
analyzed: yang rmi lam gyi gnas skabs 'ga' zhig na glu dbyangs la sogs pa'i sgra'am rol mo la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang ba dang / chu la sogs par snang ba las / don du gnyer ba'i @51a * //
translated: Moreover, in some dream situations, there are appearances of sound, such as singing, or of form, such as musical instruments, or of water, and so on.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs shing /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs shing /
translated: In these cases, the desires of the person who is in pursuit of the object are completely fulfilled,üîΩand there are appearances of drinking, being satisfied, and so on.

original: btung ngoms la sogs par snang ba na sad pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
analyzed: btung ngoms la sogs par snang ba na sad pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
translated: There is no difference at all from the waking state.

original: de ltar na yul la mngon par zhen pa ci'i phyir mi ldog snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de ltar na yul la mngon par zhen pa ci'i phyir mi ldog snyam du sems so //
translated: Thus, why should the attachment to objects not be reversed?

original: gzhan yang phyi'i don kun rdzob tsam du yang med na /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi'i don kun rdzob tsam du yang med na /
translated: Moreover, if external objects do not exist even as mere convention,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs ni gzhig cing gzhom du rung ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes pa la sogs pa gzugs kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid dang / phyi dang nang gi skye mched gzugs can bems po nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs ni gzhig cing gzhom du rung ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes pa la sogs pa gzugs kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid dang / phyi dang nang gi skye mched gzugs can bems po nyid du gsungs te /
translated: then why did the Transcendent Conqueror say that the defining characteristic of the aggregate of form is that it can be destroyed and overcome, and so on, and that the inner and outer physical sense bases are inanimate?

original: ji skad du 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
translated: As the King of SamƒÅdhi says:

original: mig dang rna ba sna yang tshad ma min //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba sna yang tshad ma min //
translated: The eye, ear, and nose are not valid cognitions.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa dang / gal te dbang po 'di dag tshad yin na //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa dang / gal te dbang po 'di dag tshad yin na //
translated: If these sense faculties were valid cognitions,

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyis su la ci zhig bya //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis su la ci zhig bya //
translated: what would be the point of the noble path?

original: de phyir ngo bo nyid kyis bems po lung ma bstan //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de phyir ngo bo nyid kyis bems po lung ma bstan // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, matter is neutral by nature.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa sa bcu pa las kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa sa bcu pa las kyang /
translated: Moreover, the Ten Grounds Sutra states:

original: sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul phra rab thams cad shes par gsungs pas /
analyzed: sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul phra rab thams cad shes par gsungs pas /
translated: The bodhisattva on the tenth ground knows all the atoms in the world systems.

original: phyi'i don med na de ltar shes pa 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi'i don med na de ltar shes pa 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If external objects do not exist, such knowledge would be mistaken,

original: lung dang 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung dang 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: and that would contradict scripture.

original: gzhan yang 'gro ba rnams kyi snod kyi 'jig rten gyi tshad dang / rnam pa'i khyad par rnams gsungs pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gro ba rnams kyi snod kyi 'jig rten gyi tshad dang / rnam pa'i khyad par rnams gsungs pas /
translated: Moreover, the Buddha taught the size and specific features of the world systems of transmigrating beings.

original: phyi'i don kun rdzob tu med na de ltar gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: phyi'i don kun rdzob tu med na de ltar gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If external objects do not exist conventionally, such statements would be contradicted.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: gsung rab dag las de ltar yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs gnyis ka gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: gsung rab dag las de ltar yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs gnyis ka gsungs mod kyi /
translated: In the scriptures, both the position of existence and the position of non-existence are taught.üîΩHowever, the method of the scriptures is to be determined by means of the four intentions and the four indirect intentions.

original: gsung rab kyi tshul ni dgongs pa rnam pa bzhi dang ldem por dgongs pa bzhi'i sgo nas gtan la dbab par bya'o zhes mgon po byams pas gsungs pa dang / de rnams kyang bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gsung rab kyi tshul ni dgongs pa rnam pa bzhi dang ldem por dgongs pa bzhi'i sgo nas gtan la dbab par bya'o zhes mgon po byams pas gsungs pa dang / de rnams kyang bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The protector Maitreya has said that these can be summarized in two:

original: drang ba'i don dang / des  pa'i don no //
analyzed: drang ba'i don dang / des  pa'i don no //
translated: the interpretable meaning and the definitive meaning.

original: de la des  pa'i don ni tshad mas grub pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa ston pa ste /üîΩji ltar mdo nas bstan pa'i don de kho na ltar nges kyi /
analyzed: de la des  pa'i don ni tshad mas grub pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa ston pa ste / ji ltar mdo nas bstan pa'i don de kho na ltar nges kyi /
translated: The definitive meaning is the teaching of the ultimate truth, which is established by validating cognition.

original: de las gzhan du gzhag par mi nus pas nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan du gzhag par mi nus pas nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the definitive meaning because the meaning taught in the sutra is just as it is ascertained, and it cannot be otherwise.

original: drang ba'i don ni dgongs pa can zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: drang ba'i don ni dgongs pa can zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The interpretable meaning is also called intentional.

original: mtshan nyid snga ma las bzlog pa ji ltar dngos su bstan pa las de kho na nyid kyi don gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid snga ma las bzlog pa ji ltar dngos su bstan pa las de kho na nyid kyi don gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the opposite of the former characteristic, and its meaning is otherwise than the way it is explicitly taught.

original: de skad du yang 'phags pa blo gros mi @51b zad pas bstan pa las /üîΩde la nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'phags pa blo gros mi @51b zad pas bstan pa las / de la nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang /
translated: The Ak·π£ayamatis≈´tra says:üîΩ‚ÄúWhat is a s≈´tra of definitive meaning?

analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang zhe na / mdo sde gang dag don dam pa'i bden pa ston pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya la /
translated: What is a s≈´tra of provisional meaning?‚ÄùüîΩS≈´tras that teach ultimate truth are called definitive.

analyzed: mdo sde gang dag kun rdzob kyi bden pa ston pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs so //

original: des na gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i don yod par bstan pa'i don la /
analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i don yod par bstan pa'i don la /
translated: Thus, with regard to the meaning of the teaching that external objects such as form exist,

analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir tshad ma ma grub pa'i don dam pa ston pa ma yin pas /

analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi mdo ma yin zhing drang ba'i don zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore it is not a s≈´tra of definitive meaning but is called provisional.

original: de yang rang rang gi sems kyi rnam pa de ltar snang ba la dgongs nas phyi'i don la mngon par zhen pa'i byis pa rnams skrag pa spong zhing rim gyis sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la gzud par bya ba'i don du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang rang rang gi sems kyi rnam pa de ltar snang ba la dgongs nas phyi'i don la mngon par zhen pa'i byis pa rnams skrag pa spong zhing rim gyis sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la gzud par bya ba'i don du gsungs pa ste /
translated: The Buddha taught this in consideration of the fact that the aspects of one‚Äôs own mind appear in that way, in order to eliminate the fear of childish beings who are attached to external objects and to gradually introduce them to the vehicle of the Buddha.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: gzugs sogs skye mched yod par ni //
analyzed: gzugs sogs skye mched yod par ni //
translated: The existence of the sense bases of form and so on

original: des 'dul ba yi skye bo la ;
analyzed: des 'dul ba yi skye bo la ;
translated: is taught by the Buddha for the sake of those who are to be trained

original: / dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa ste //
analyzed: / dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa ste //
translated: through the power of his intention,

analyzed: brdzus te byung ba'i sems can bzhin //

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //

original: gzhan yang chu bo dga' skyed kyi 'gram du gang zag gi bdag tu lta ba'i kun tu rgyu lnga brgya sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la gzud par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dgongs
analyzed: gzhan yang chu bo dga' skyed kyi 'gram du gang zag gi bdag tu lta ba'i kun tu rgyu lnga brgya sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la gzud par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dgongs
translated: Furthermore, on the banks of the Joyful River, in order to introduce five hundred tƒ´rthikas who had the view of a self of persons to the vehicle of the Buddha, the Bhagavat taught the essence of the tathƒÅgata, the all-base consciousness,

original: te / nga ni sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang / bdag gi ngo bor gyur pa la sogs pa yod par 'dod do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: te / nga ni sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang / bdag gi ngo bor gyur pa la sogs pa yod par 'dod do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //

original: de bzhin du gsung rab kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig las /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung rab kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig las /
translated: Similarly, in some scriptures

analyzed: dge slong dag las dang las kyi khur khyer ba'i gang zag dag yod do zhes kyang gsungs so //

original: gzhan yang 'gro ba rnams kyi snod kyi khyad par bstan pa yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gro ba rnams kyi snod kyi khyad par bstan pa yang /
translated: Moreover, the scriptures teach that the world is a container,

analyzed: las mthun par bsags pa'i sems can rnams la las kyi dbang gis gnas kyi khyad par mthun par snang ba na /

analyzed: de rnams kyi snang ba thun mong ba la dgongs nas /

analyzed: yang de dag dang las mi mthun par bsags pa rnams la /
translated: However, those who accumulate dissimilar karma

analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi @52a * //
translated: see a dissimilar world as a container.

analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du snang bas snga ma las gzhan du bshad de /
translated: Since it appears in another aspect, it is explained as being different from the former.

original: ji ltar chos mngon pa'i mdo sde 'ga' zhig dang / theg pa chen po'i gsung rab dag las phan tshun mi mthun par bshad pa dang / rig pa 'dzin pa'i sde snod sh'i k'a la tsa kra las kyang gzhan du bshad de ;
analyzed: ji ltar chos mngon pa'i mdo sde 'ga' zhig dang / theg pa chen po'i gsung rab dag las phan tshun mi mthun par bshad pa dang / rig pa 'dzin pa'i sde snod sh'i k'a la tsa kra las kyang gzhan du bshad de ;
translated: In some Abhidharma sutras and in the scriptures of the Mahayana, there are explanations that are inconsistent with each other, and the vidyadhara pi·π≠aka explains them differently in the Kalacakra.

analyzed: des na phyi'i don yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yod na de rnams 'gal ba nyid du gyur to //
translated: Therefore, if external objects exist as real conventionalities, they would be contradictory.

original: rang rang gi sems kyi snang ba yin pa la ni sngar bshad pa ltar nyes pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi sems kyi snang ba yin pa la ni sngar bshad pa ltar nyes pa med pa kho na'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir k'a la tsa kra las chos mngon pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i brtsad pa bkod nas /

original: lan du de rnams phyi rol gyi dngos por grub pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lan du de rnams phyi rol gyi dngos por grub pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The reply is that they are not established as external things.

original: sems can rnams kyi rang rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam yin la /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rang rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam yin la /
translated: They are merely the appearances of the individual minds of sentient beings.

original: de'i snang ba phyogs re la dgongs te gsungs pa yin pas nyes pa med do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i snang ba phyogs re la dgongs te gsungs pa yin pas nyes pa med do zhes bshad do //
translated: Since the Buddha spoke with an intention directed toward a particular appearance, there is no fault.

original: gzhan du sems can dmyal ba'i lcags sregs kyi sa gzhi la sogs pa phyi rol gyi ngo bor grub na /
analyzed: gzhan du sems can dmyal ba'i lcags sregs kyi sa gzhi la sogs pa phyi rol gyi ngo bor grub na /
translated: If, on the other hand, the iron ground of the hells and so on are established as external entities,

original: mthu dang thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ci'i phyir de dag 'joms shing rdul du rlog par mi byed ces bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: mthu dang thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ci'i phyir de dag 'joms shing rdul du rlog par mi byed ces bsam par bya'o //
translated: then why do the buddhas and bodhisattvas, who are endowed with power and compassion, not destroy them and reduce them to dust?

original: de'i phyir gzhom par bya ba'i rgyu'i phyi rol gyi ngo bo grub pa med cing rang gi sems kyi nyes pa yin par sngar bstan pa'i skyon med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhom par bya ba'i rgyu'i phyi rol gyi ngo bo grub pa med cing rang gi sems kyi nyes pa yin par sngar bstan pa'i skyon med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no external entity that is established as a cause to be destroyed, and it has been shown that it is a fault of one‚Äôs own mind.

original: ji ltar byis pa dag smyo bas yid 'khrugs pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa dag smyo bas yid 'khrugs pa na /
translated: Just as when children, due to a fever,

original: rang gi mdun du sdig pa dang sprul gyi rnam pa snang bas skrag cing du bar gyur la /
analyzed: rang gi mdun du sdig pa dang sprul gyi rnam pa snang bas skrag cing du bar gyur la /
translated: see in front of themselves the forms of snakes and scorpions and become frightened and cry,

original: de'i pha stobs dang ldan pa zhig gis sprul la sogs pa phyi rol na yod na gzhom par nus mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i pha stobs dang ldan pa zhig gis sprul la sogs pa phyi rol na yod na gzhom par nus mod kyi /
translated: The father, who is powerful, can conquer the external enemies such as the nƒÅgas, but

original: de ltar grub pa med cing byis pa'i rang gi sems kyi nyes pa yin pas cir yang byar med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar grub pa med cing byis pa'i rang gi sems kyi nyes pa yin pas cir yang byar med pa bzhin no //
translated: since they are not established in that way, they are faults of the child‚Äôs own mind. Therefore, there is nothing to do at all.

original: gal te der yang pha mas byis pa'i sems kyi nyes pa 'chos pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te der yang pha mas byis pa'i sems kyi nyes pa 'chos pa bzhin du /
translated: If it is said that just as the parents correct the faults of the child‚Äôs mind,üîΩwhy do they not pulverize the faults of the minds of sentient beings?

original: sems can de rnams kyi sems kyi nyes pa ci'i phyir rdul du rlog par mi byed ces dpyad pa mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: sems can de rnams kyi sems kyi nyes pa ci'i phyir rdul du rlog par mi byed ces dpyad pa mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: The analysis is the same.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi nyes pa rgyu dang rkyen nges pa med pa khams dang bag la nyal sna tshogs pa rnams ni tshad med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi nyes pa rgyu dang rkyen nges pa med pa khams dang bag la nyal sna tshogs pa rnams ni tshad med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The faults of the minds of sentient beings are immeasurable because the causes and conditions are indefinite and the various dispositions and latent tendencies are various.

original: cig car gzhom par mi nus pas /
analyzed: cig car gzhom par mi nus pas /
translated: Therefore, they cannot be conquered all at once.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas lha dang tshangs pa'i theg pa la sogs pa sna tshogs bstan pa'i sgo nas rim gyis @52b 'joms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas lha dang tshangs pa'i theg pa la sogs pa sna tshogs bstan pa'i sgo nas rim gyis @52b 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: The tathƒÅgatas conquer them gradually through the various teachings of the vehicles of gods, BrahmƒÅ, and so on.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten ni sems can du ma'i thun mong pa'i gnas cig yin pas /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten ni sems can du ma'i thun mong pa'i gnas cig yin pas /
translated: The physical cosmos is a place shared by many sentient beings.

original: de yod na cig car nyid du ci'i phyir 'joms par mi byed ces pa ste /
analyzed: de yod na cig car nyid du ci'i phyir 'joms par mi byed ces pa ste /
translated: If it exists, why does it not destroy them all at once?

original: de ni gzhom par sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhom par sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is easy to destroy.üîΩThis point is also made in the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning, where it says:

original: don 'di nyid kyang 'bags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams longs spyod mi zad pa yod cing snying rje can lags na /
analyzed: don 'di nyid kyang 'bags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams longs spyod mi zad pa yod cing snying rje can lags na /
translated: Bhagavan, if Bodhisattvas have inexhaustible resources and are compassionate,

original: ci'i slad du 'jig rten na dbul po gda' lags zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
analyzed: ci'i slad du 'jig rten na dbul po gda' lags zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
translated: why are there poor people in the world?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de ni sems can rnams kyi rang gi las kyi nyes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de ni sems can rnams kyi rang gi las kyi nyes pa kho na yin te /
translated: The Bhagavan replied: Avalokite≈õvara, it is the fault of sentient beings themselves.

original: dper na yi dags lus skom pas gdungs ba rnams kyis rgya mtsho'i chu skams par mthong ba de ni rgya mtsho'i nyes pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na yi dags lus skom pas gdungs ba rnams kyis rgya mtsho'i chu skams par mthong ba de ni rgya mtsho'i nyes pa ma yin gyi /
translated: For example, hungry ghosts tormented by thirst see the water of the ocean as dried up. This is not the ocean's fault.

original: yi dags de nyid kyi rang gi las kyi 'bras bu'i nyes pa yin no //üîΩde bzhin du 'bras bu med par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: yi dags de nyid kyi rang gi las kyi 'bras bu'i nyes pa yin no // de bzhin du 'bras bu med par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: This is the fault of the hungry ghost's own karma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa dag gi rgya mtsho lta bur gyur pa rnams kyi nyes pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa dag gi rgya mtsho lta bur gyur pa rnams kyi nyes pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, the fact that there is no result is not a fault of the bodhisattva's generosity, which is like an ocean.

original: sems can rang gis nyes pa byas pa yi dags lta bu rnams kyi las kyi nyes pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rang gis nyes pa byas pa yi dags lta bu rnams kyi las kyi nyes pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is the fault of the hungry ghost-like sentient beings who have committed the fault of their own karma.

original: de ltar phyi'i don dgag pa dang / snang ba sems tsam nyid du sgrub pa dang / de la brtsad pa spang ba rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i don dgag pa dang / snang ba sems tsam nyid du sgrub pa dang / de la brtsad pa spang ba rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having extensively taught the refutation of external objects and the proof that appearances are mind only, and the refutation of objections to that,

original: don dam par sems nyid rang bzhin med par gtan la dbab par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par sems nyid rang bzhin med par gtan la dbab par bya ste /
translated: the nature of mind itself is to be ascertained ultimately to be essenceless.

original: de yang gzhan phyi rol pa gzung 'dzin gnyis med par smra ba kha cig don dam par sems nyid rig pa rtag pa'i ngo bo yin zhing /
analyzed: de yang gzhan phyi rol pa gzung 'dzin gnyis med par smra ba kha cig don dam par sems nyid rig pa rtag pa'i ngo bo yin zhing /
translated: In this regard, some non-Buddhists who advocate the nonduality of object and subject say that ultimately mind itself is the essence of permanent awareness.

original: de las gzhan phyi'i don grub pa med de /
analyzed: de las gzhan phyi'i don grub pa med de /
translated: Apart from that, external objects do not exist.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rnam rig tsam ni rtag tu rnam par dag //
analyzed: rnam rig tsam ni rtag tu rnam par dag //
translated: Mere awareness is always pure.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas rtag tu grol ba nyid //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas rtag tu grol ba nyid //
translated: Thus, the Buddha is always liberated.

original: blang dang dor bya med ces rab bstan pa //
analyzed: blang dang dor bya med ces rab bstan pa //
translated: It is taught that there is nothing to adopt or reject.

original: tshangs pa mya ngan med ces rtag gnas byos //
analyzed: tshangs pa mya ngan med ces rtag gnas byos //
translated: BrahmƒÅ, abide always in the state of deathless peace.

original: zhes pa'o // gzhan yang zhi ba pa rnams kyi 'dod pa lha chen pos smras pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gzhan yang zhi ba pa rnams kyi 'dod pa lha chen pos smras pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the assertions of the peace-loving ones are spoken of by the great god:

original: ji ltar shing la me yod dang // sa yi nang du chu yod pa //üîΩde ltar thams cad lus gnas su //
analyzed: ji ltar shing la me yod dang // sa yi nang du chu yod pa // de ltar thams cad lus gnas su //
translated: Just as fire exists in wood and water in the earth,üîΩso, too, peace and purity

original: zhi ba dag pa rnam par gnas //
analyzed: zhi ba dag pa rnam par gnas //
translated: dwell in the body of all.

original: thams cad 'di ni zhi bdag ste //
analyzed: thams cad 'di ni zhi bdag ste //
translated: All this is peaceful,

original: zhi ba las ni rab tu 'byung //
analyzed: zhi ba las ni rab tu 'byung //
translated: and from peace it arises.

original: 'byung po kun la zhi ba yod //
analyzed: 'byung po kun la zhi ba yod //
translated: Peace exists in all beings,

original: zhi ba gang yin de nga nyid //üîΩbrtan zhing byin 'gro de bzhin du //
analyzed: zhi ba gang yin de nga nyid // brtan zhing byin 'gro de bzhin du //
translated: and I am that peace.üîΩJust as the earth exists in a stable way

original: cung zad gang ni sa la yod //
analyzed: cung zad gang ni sa la yod //
translated: and in a moving way in water,

original: de kun mchog @53a * //üîΩgi dbang po yis //
analyzed: de kun mchog @53a * // gi dbang po yis //
translated: so, too, the supreme lord

original: bdag nyid khyab ste rab tu gnas //
analyzed: bdag nyid khyab ste rab tu gnas //
translated: pervades and abides in all.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: de'i don yang dbang phyug gi rang bzhin bdag shes pa rig pa gnyis su med pa'i don de nyid zhi ba ste /
analyzed: de'i don yang dbang phyug gi rang bzhin bdag shes pa rig pa gnyis su med pa'i don de nyid zhi ba ste /
translated: The meaning of that is that the nature of the self, which is the nondual meaning of the self that is the essence of ƒ™≈õvara, is peace.

original: thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin zhes pa'o //
translated: It is the nature of all.

original: 'di ni mi 'thad de /üîΩde ltar rtag par snang ba chos can dngos po la med de /
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'thad de / de ltar rtag par snang ba chos can dngos po la med de /
translated: This is not tenable.üîΩThe subject, a permanent appearance, does not exist among things because it is empty of the ability to perform a function either gradually or instantaneously.

original: rim dang cig car gyis don byed pa'i nus pas stong pa'i phyir zhes khyab byed mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis rtag pa nyid spyir bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim dang cig car gyis don byed pa'i nus pas stong pa'i phyir zhes khyab byed mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis rtag pa nyid spyir bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the reason of the nonobservation of a pervader refutes permanence in general.

original: 'di'i spros pa zhib tu ni rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i spros pa zhib tu ni rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las shes par bya'o //
translated: The elaborations of this should be understood from the treatises on reasoning.

original: yang rang gi sde pa rnam rig tsam du smra ba kha cig phyi'i don ni kun rdzob tu yang med la /
analyzed: yang rang gi sde pa rnam rig tsam du smra ba kha cig phyi'i don ni kun rdzob tu yang med la /
translated: Again, some of our own schools who are Proponents of Mere Consciousness say that external objects do not exist even conventionally.

original: des na khams gsum pa ni sems nyid rig pa skad cig ma'i ngo bo snga ma rnams la rag las te /
analyzed: des na khams gsum pa ni sems nyid rig pa skad cig ma'i ngo bo snga ma rnams la rag las te /
translated: Therefore the three realms are dependent on the former moments of the essence of the mind itself, which is consciousness.

original: phyi ma rnams 'byung ba gzhan gyi dbang dang / de nyid gzung 'dzin la sogs pa'i ngo bor brtags pas dben pa ni /
analyzed: phyi ma rnams 'byung ba gzhan gyi dbang dang / de nyid gzung 'dzin la sogs pa'i ngo bor brtags pas dben pa ni /
translated: The latter are the dependent nature, and the emptiness of that dependent nature with respect to the imagined nature of subject and object, etc.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo ste don dam pa'i dngos por 'dod do //üîΩde ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs par /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo ste don dam pa'i dngos por 'dod do // de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs par /
translated: is the consummate nature, which is asserted to be the ultimate truth.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa gzod ma nas zhi ba rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa gzod ma nas zhi ba rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: Thus, it is contradictory to the statements in the Transcendent Wisdom scriptures and so forth by the Transcendent Conqueror that all phenomena are natureless, unborn, unceasing, primordially peaceful, and naturally passed beyond sorrow.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault,üîΩbecause the Transcendent Wisdom scriptures and so forth are intentional.

original: de ni dgongs pa can yin par 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni dgongs pa can yin par 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
translated: The noble Definitive Commentary on Enlightened Intent explains:

original: dgongs pa'i don yang kun brtags mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang // gzhan dbang skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa dang / yongs su grub pa don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i don yang kun brtags mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang // gzhan dbang skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa dang / yongs su grub pa don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the intention is that the imagined is the identity-unreality of character, the relative is the identity-unreality of production, and the perfect is the ultimate identity-unreality.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus:

original: don dam yang dag 'phags de la chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags de la chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhe na /
translated: ParamƒÅrthasamudgata, what is the identity-unreality of phenomena?

original: kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: It is the imagined identity.

original: de ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: It is the identity established by name and symbol,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin pas /
translated: but not the identity established by intrinsic identity.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the identity-unreality.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags de la chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags de la chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhe na /
translated: ParamƒÅrthasamudgata, what is the production-unreality of phenomena?

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: It is the relative identity.

original: de ni rgyu @53b rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis skye'i /
analyzed: de ni rgyu @53b rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis skye'i /
translated: It is produced by the power of other conditions,üîΩbut not by itself.

original: bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin pas de'i phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin pas de'i phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is not produced by itself, therefore it is said to be ‚Äúunproduced by own nature.‚Äù

original: de la sogs pa dpe dang bcas te rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: de la sogs pa dpe dang bcas te rgyas par bstan to //
translated: This is taught in detail with examples such as this.

original: de ltar byas na sems nyid rig pa'i gzhan dbang dang yongs su grub pa rgyu rkyen gzhan las skyes pa nyid du bstan bas 'di ni med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar byas na sems nyid rig pa'i gzhan dbang dang yongs su grub pa rgyu rkyen gzhan las skyes pa nyid du bstan bas 'di ni med pa ma yin la /
translated: If this is so, then since the mind itself is taught to be produced from other causes and conditions, it is not nonexistent.

original: med pa dang ma skyes pa la sogs par bstan pa'i dgongs don ni sngar bstan pa bzhin du med pa rnam pa gsum yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: med pa dang ma skyes pa la sogs par bstan pa'i dgongs don ni sngar bstan pa bzhin du med pa rnam pa gsum yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning of the teaching of nonexistence, nonproduction, and so on is that, as was previously explained, there are three types of nonexistence.

original: 'di ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'thad de /
translated: This is not tenable.

original: mdo sde de nyid las sgyu ma byas pa ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: mdo sde de nyid las sgyu ma byas pa ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas /
translated: In that very s≈´tra it says, ‚ÄúThe lack of production by own nature should be viewed as being like an illusion.‚Äù

original: sgyu ma bzhin kun rdzob tu rgyu rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis skye'i bdag nyid las skye ba ma yin la /
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin kun rdzob tu rgyu rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis skye'i bdag nyid las skye ba ma yin la /
translated: Like an illusion, it is produced by other causes and conditions on the conventional level, but it is not produced by itself.

original: don dam par ni rang ngam gzhan gang las kyang skye ba mi 'thad pas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyang med par bstan to //
analyzed: don dam par ni rang ngam gzhan gang las kyang skye ba mi 'thad pas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyang med par bstan to //
translated: Ultimately, since arising from self or other is untenable, the dependent nature is also shown to be nonexistent.

original: gzhan yang ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa'i dgongs don de ltar bshad pa rang yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa'i dgongs don de ltar bshad pa rang yang /
translated: Moreover, the meaning of the intention of the teachings on the lack of nature and so on is as explained above.

original: dgongs pa can gyi mdo yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa can gyi mdo yin te /
translated: Those teachings are s≈´tras of provisional meaning.

original: sngar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs par bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa ma byas par ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa bstan pa la /
analyzed: sngar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs par bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa ma byas par ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa bstan pa la /
translated: Previously, in the Perfection of Wisdom s≈´tras and so on, without making a division of the two truths and so on, the Buddha taught the lack of nature and so on.

original: dmigs pa can gyi skye bo skrag par 'gyar bas de dag gi skrag pa bsal ba'i don du'o //üîΩde ltar yin pa'i rgyu mtshan yang sems kyi ngo bo don dam pa'i dngos por yod pa la /
analyzed: dmigs pa can gyi skye bo skrag par 'gyar bas de dag gi skrag pa bsal ba'i don du'o // de ltar yin pa'i rgyu mtshan yang sems kyi ngo bo don dam pa'i dngos por yod pa la /
translated: Since those who possess objects of observation are frightened by that, for the purpose of dispelling their fear,

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma du ma mdo sde 'di nyid du ston par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma du ma mdo sde 'di nyid du ston par 'gyur zhing /
translated: the reason for that being so is that in the s≈´tra itself many valid knowledges that harm the existence of the nature of the mind as an ultimate entity are taught.

original: bstan bcos dag las kyang bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos dag las kyang bshad de /
translated: They are also explained in the treatises.

original: skabs su bab pa na bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa na bstan par bya'o //
translated: I will explain this when the time comes.

original: gal te de rnam pa bden par smra ba dag gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de rnam pa bden par smra ba dag gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang ba ni /
translated: Now, if the Proponents of Real Images argue that the various images of forms, sounds, and so forth that appear to the mind are

original: don dam par sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: don dam par sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: ultimately the mind‚Äôs own nature,

original: sems dang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir zhes sngar bstan pa ltar /
analyzed: sems dang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir zhes sngar bstan pa ltar /
translated: because they are ascertained as being observed simultaneously with the mind, as was explained above,

original: gtan tshigs nyid du sbyor bar byed cing /
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid du sbyor bar byed cing /
translated: and if they apply this very reasoning

original: gzhan yang gsal bar snang ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsal bar snang ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: and say that because they appear as clear images,

original: snang ba sems kyi ngo bo nyid du grub po zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba sems kyi ngo bo nyid du grub po zhe na /
translated: the appearances are established as being the mind‚Äôs own nature,

original: mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mi 'thad de /
translated: this is not tenable.

original: don dam par sems kyi ngo bor sgrub pa la ltos te /
analyzed: don dam par sems kyi ngo bor sgrub pa la ltos te /
translated: In relation to the establishment of the mind‚Äôs nature as ultimate,

original: 'di dag gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di dag gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: these are not tenable as reasons.

original: de la dang po'i dbang du byas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la /
analyzed: de la dang po'i dbang du byas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la /
translated: In the first case, when the wisdom of omniscience

original: tha mal pa'i sems kyi rnam @54a * //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i sems kyi rnam @54a * //
translated: appears in the form of an ordinary mind,

original: par snang ba'i tshe /
analyzed: par snang ba'i tshe /
translated: at that time,

original: de ltar snang ba'i rnam pa ye shes kyi ngo bo don dam pa pa yin yang /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba'i rnam pa ye shes kyi ngo bo don dam pa pa yin yang /
translated: even though the images that appear are the ultimate nature of wisdom,

original: de la rnam pa 'jog par byed pa'i tha mal pa'i sems rgyud tha dad pa dgag bar mi nus ba bzhin du gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba 'jog par byed pa'i phyi rol tha dad don dam pa'i dngos por yod pa dgag bar mi
analyzed: de la rnam pa 'jog par byed pa'i tha mal pa'i sems rgyud tha dad pa dgag bar mi nus ba bzhin du gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba 'jog par byed pa'i phyi rol tha dad don dam pa'i dngos por yod pa dgag bar mi
translated: Just as it is impossible to refute the different ordinary mind-streams that posit the aspects, in the same way, it is impossible to refute the external things that are different and that exist as ultimate entities and that posit the appearances as forms, sounds, and so forth.

original: nus pas / thams cad sems tsam nyid du gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: nus pas / thams cad sems tsam nyid du gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible to posit everything as mind only.

original: gal te de 'dra ba'i phyi rol sngar bstan pa ltar gcig dang du ma dang bral ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'gog go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba'i phyi rol sngar bstan pa ltar gcig dang du ma dang bral ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'gog go zhe na /
translated: If you say that such external things are refuted by arguments such as the absence of one and many, as was demonstrated earlier,

original: de ni sems la yang mtshungs pas de don dam pa'i dngos por 'jog pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni sems la yang mtshungs pas de don dam pa'i dngos por 'jog pa mi 'thad do //
translated: then the same applies to the mind, and so it is not tenable to posit it as an ultimate entity.

original: kun rdzob sems su sgrub pa la ni de 'dra ba'i dpyad pa mi mtshungs te /
analyzed: kun rdzob sems su sgrub pa la ni de 'dra ba'i dpyad pa mi mtshungs te /
translated: In establishing the conventional as mind, such an analysis is not the same.

original: sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: It is as was demonstrated earlier.

original: gtan tshigs gnyis pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyis pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: The second reason is also untenable.

original: gsal ba tsam gtan tshigs su 'god na ni sems nyid don dam pa'i dngos por sgrub pa la 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gsal ba tsam gtan tshigs su 'god na ni sems nyid don dam pa'i dngos por sgrub pa la 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: If mere clarity is posited as the reason, then it would be a mistake to prove that mind itself is an ultimate entity.

original: don dam pa'i dngos por gsal pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su 'god na yang ma grub par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos por gsal pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su 'god na yang ma grub par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And if ‚Äúbecause of being clear as an ultimate entity‚Äù is posited as the reason, then it is not established.

original: yang khyad par du rnam pa brdzun pa rnams kyi dbang du byas na gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa sems las gzhan pa bkag pa'i med par dgag pa nyid bsgrub byar 'dod la /
analyzed: yang khyad par du rnam pa brdzun pa rnams kyi dbang du byas na gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa sems las gzhan pa bkag pa'i med par dgag pa nyid bsgrub byar 'dod la /
translated: Moreover, in particular, with respect to false aspects, the mere negation that refutes the aspects of form and so on as being different from the mind is asserted as the predicate.

original: de lta na lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa ni ji ltar gzung ba'i rnam pa sems dang lhan cig dmigs pa 'ang nges pa bzhin du sems kyang gzung ba'i rnam pa dang lhan cig dmigs pa nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa ni ji ltar gzung ba'i rnam pa sems dang lhan cig dmigs pa 'ang nges pa bzhin du sems kyang gzung ba'i rnam pa dang lhan cig dmigs pa nges par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, just as the ascertainment of simultaneous observation is that the aspects of the object apprehended are ascertained as observed simultaneously with the mind, so the mind would also be ascertained as observed simultaneously with the aspects of the object apprehended.

original: sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is as was previously explained.

original: de'i phyir sems kyang gzung ba'i rnam pa las gzhan bkag pa tsam gyi med par dgag pa nyid du 'gyur pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyang gzung ba'i rnam pa las gzhan bkag pa tsam gyi med par dgag pa nyid du 'gyur pas /
translated: Therefore the mind would also be a mere negation that is the negation of being different from the aspects of the object apprehended.

original: sems tsam dngos por mi 'thad do //
analyzed: sems tsam dngos por mi 'thad do //
translated: Mind Only is not tenable as a thing.

original: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur bar shin tu gsal rab pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur bar shin tu gsal rab pa nyid do //
translated: Otherwise, it is very clear that this reason is not established.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa sems las gzhan yin pa khegs kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa sems las gzhan yin pa khegs kyang /
translated: Moreover, although the aspect is refuted as being different from the mind,

original: de las ma gtogs pa phyi rol gyi ngo bo yod pa mi khegs te /
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa phyi rol gyi ngo bo yod pa mi khegs te /
translated: the existence of an external nature that is not included in that is not refuted.

original: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la tha mal pa'i sems kyi rnam pa snang ba na de 'dra ba'i rnam pa ye shes las gzhan ma yin yang /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la tha mal pa'i sems kyi rnam pa snang ba na de 'dra ba'i rnam pa ye shes las gzhan ma yin yang /
translated: Just as when the aspect of an ordinary mind appears to the wisdom of omniscience, such an aspect is not different from the wisdom,

original: tha mal pa'i sems rgyud ye shes las tha dad pa dgag pa mi nus pa @54b bzhin no //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i sems rgyud ye shes las tha dad pa dgag pa mi nus pa @54b bzhin no //
translated: but it is impossible to refute that the ordinary mindstream is different from the wisdom.

original: gal te shes pa ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid kyis grub la /
analyzed: gal te shes pa ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid kyis grub la /
translated: If it is said that consciousness is established by reflexive awareness itself,

original: sems rgyud tha dad pa yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni gzhan rig pa'i chas mngon sum gyis grub cing /
analyzed: sems rgyud tha dad pa yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni gzhan rig pa'i chas mngon sum gyis grub cing /
translated: and that different mindstreams are established by the yogi‚Äôs direct perception that knows others‚Äô minds,

original: phal pa rnams kyis kyang rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas grub po zhe na /
analyzed: phal pa rnams kyis kyang rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas grub po zhe na /
translated: and that ordinary beings establish it through inference,

original: kun rdzob tu de ltar yin mod kyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de ltar yin mod kyi /
translated: This is indeed the case on the relative level.

original: don dam par rang rig pa nyid mi 'thad de /
analyzed: don dam par rang rig pa nyid mi 'thad de /
translated: But on the ultimate level, reflexive awareness is untenable.

original: skabs su bab pa na bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa na bstan par bya'o //
translated: This will be shown when the time comes.

original: de ltar sgrub byed med cing gnod byed yod pas sems nyid rig pa don dam pa'i dngos por mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub byed med cing gnod byed yod pas sems nyid rig pa don dam pa'i dngos por mi 'thad do //
translated: Since there is no proof for it and there are arguments against it, it is untenable that mind-itself is reflexively aware in an ultimate sense.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'phags pa dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su 'dzin pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su 'dzin pa las /
translated: In the Noble Holy DhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of the Roots of Virtue:

original: yang dag tu na rnam par shes //
analyzed: yang dag tu na rnam par shes //
translated: In reality, consciousness

original: lus kyi nang na mi gnas te //
analyzed: lus kyi nang na mi gnas te //
translated: Does not dwell within the body,

original: lus kyi phyi rol dag na yang //
analyzed: lus kyi phyi rol dag na yang //
translated: And outside the body

original: rnam par shes pa mi srid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi srid do //
translated: Consciousness is impossible.

original: chos rnams kun la rnam kun du //
analyzed: chos rnams kun la rnam kun du //
translated: In all phenomena, in every way,

original: rnam par shes pa mi srid de //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi srid de //
translated: Consciousness is impossible.üîΩIts location and non-location

original: 'di yi gnas dang gnas med dang // 'pho ba yang ni mi shes so //
analyzed: 'di yi gnas dang gnas med dang // 'pho ba yang ni mi shes so //
translated: And its transference are unknown.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: And so on, it is taught extensively.

original: 'phags pa stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las kyang sems tsam du bstan pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: 'phags pa stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las kyang sems tsam du bstan pa'i rjes la /
translated: In the Noble Dense Ornamentation, after teaching mind only,

original: sems med tsam po'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: sems med tsam po'ang yod ma yin //
translated: It also does not exist as mere non-mind.

original: tshad dang gzhal dang gnyis ka med //
analyzed: tshad dang gzhal dang gnyis ka med //
translated: Measure, measurability, and both do not exist.

original: ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'phags pa zung gi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa zung gi mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the noble Scripture of the Joined Pair:

original: lha'i bu de la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra bar shes she na /
analyzed: lha'i bu de la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra bar shes she na /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of the gods, how do the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas know all things to be like space?

original: lha'i bu khams gsum pa ni sems tsam du zad la /
analyzed: lha'i bu khams gsum pa ni sems tsam du zad la /
translated: Son of the gods, the three worlds are just mind.

original: sems de yang gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
analyzed: sems de yang gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
translated: And that mind is formless, invisible,

original: thogs pa med pa rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin pa sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin pa sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: unobstructed, not a knower, like an illusion.

original: sems de yang sems kyi chos nyid kyis yongs su btsal kyang mi rnyed do //
analyzed: sems de yang sems kyi chos nyid kyis yongs su btsal kyang mi rnyed do //
translated: And that mind, even though it is sought in the reality of mind, is not found.

original: sems gang gis sems yongs su chol ba'i sems de yang mi rnyed do //
analyzed: sems gang gis sems yongs su chol ba'i sems de yang mi rnyed do //
translated: And that mind by which the mind is sought is also not found.üîΩAnd he, not apprehending mind, does not apprehend any thing.‚Äù

original: de sems mi dmigs pas chos thams cad mi dmigs so zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so ;
analyzed: de sems mi dmigs pas chos thams cad mi dmigs so zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so ;
translated: And so on extensively.

original: / de bzhin du khungs kyi mdo ni du ma nyid snang mod kyi gzhung mangs kyis dogs pas mi bri'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du khungs kyi mdo ni du ma nyid snang mod kyi gzhung mangs kyis dogs pas mi bri'o //
translated: And so, although there are many scriptures, I will not write more for fear of being long-winded.

original: gal te de lta na sngar bstan pa ltar khams gsum sems tsam du bstan pa dang / mdo gzhan dag las kyang /
analyzed: gal te de lta na sngar bstan pa ltar khams gsum sems tsam du bstan pa dang / mdo gzhan dag las kyang /
translated: If that is so, then it contradicts the teaching that the three realms are mind only, as explained above, and also the teachings in other s≈´tras:

original: 'jig rten sems kyis bris pa ste //
analyzed: 'jig rten sems kyis bris pa ste //
translated: The world is written by mind.

original: sems kyis sems ni mi @55a * //
analyzed: sems kyis sems ni mi @55a * //
translated: Mind does not see mind.

original: mthong ngo // dge ba 'am 'on te mi dge ba'i //
analyzed: mthong ngo // dge ba 'am 'on te mi dge ba'i //
translated: Virtuous or nonvirtuous karma

original: las ni sems kyis bsags pa yin //
analyzed: las ni sems kyis bsags pa yin //
translated: is accumulated by mind.

original: sems ni mgal me bzhin du 'khor //
analyzed: sems ni mgal me bzhin du 'khor //
translated: Mind circles like a firebrand.

original: sems ni rta ltar 'khyams pa ste //
analyzed: sems ni rta ltar 'khyams pa ste //
translated: Mind roams like a horse.

original: sems ni nags kyi me bzhin sreg //
analyzed: sems ni nags kyi me bzhin sreg //
translated: Mind burns like a forest fire.

original: sems ni chu chen bzhin du skyed //
analyzed: sems ni chu chen bzhin du skyed //
translated: Mind grows like a great river.

original: ces pa la sogs pa bstan pa dang / mdo sde 'di nyid las kyang /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa bstan pa dang / mdo sde 'di nyid las kyang /
translated: And also this s≈´tra itself teaches:

original: sems tsam dngos po nyid du bstan pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /üîΩskyon med de /
analyzed: sems tsam dngos po nyid du bstan pa dang 'gal lo zhe na / skyon med de /
translated: ‚ÄúMind only is taught as an entity.‚Äù

original: de dag ni kun rdzob pa la dgongs te bstan pas so //
analyzed: de dag ni kun rdzob pa la dgongs te bstan pas so //
translated: There is no error because those teachings were given with the intention of the conventional.

original: de skad du yang mdo sde de dag nyid las /
analyzed: de skad du yang mdo sde de dag nyid las /
translated: And those s≈´tras themselves say:

original: sems kyis sems ni mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems kyis sems ni mi mthong ngo //
translated: Mind does not see mind.

original: zhes gsungs pa dag sngar bstan pa ltar stug po bkod pa'i rgyan la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dag sngar bstan pa ltar stug po bkod pa'i rgyan la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: As previously explained, you should understand this in accordance with the Ornament of the Universal Vehicle Sutras and so forth.

original: mdo 'di nyid las bstan pa'i don ni skabs su bab pa na bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las bstan pa'i don ni skabs su bab pa na bshad par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this very sutra will be explained when the appropriate time arrives.

original: des na 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, the condensed meaning here is this.

original: phyi'i don ni kun rdzob tsam du yang med cing snang ba thams cad sems tsam nyid yin la /
analyzed: phyi'i don ni kun rdzob tsam du yang med cing snang ba thams cad sems tsam nyid yin la /
translated: External objects do not exist even as mere convention, and all appearances are mind only.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of mind?

original: kun rdzob tu ni myong zhing rig pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni myong zhing rig pa tsam yin te /
translated: It is mere experience and awareness conventionally.

original: sems thams cad la rjes su 'brang zhing gzhan la med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems thams cad la rjes su 'brang zhing gzhan la med pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the nature of mind because it pervades all minds and does not exist elsewhere.

original: me la tsha ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: me la tsha ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: It is like heat in fire.

original: dad pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni res 'ga' ba nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir sems kyi gnas skabs glo bur ba yin te /
analyzed: dad pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni res 'ga' ba nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir sems kyi gnas skabs glo bur ba yin te /
translated: Faith, attachment and so on are observed to be intermittent, they are adventitious states of mind.

original: ji ltar chu'i rnyog ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar chu'i rnyog ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like the turbidity of water and so on.

original: de skad du yang 'phags pa snang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa las khye'us gsol pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'phags pa snang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa las khye'us gsol pa /
translated: In the same way, the noble Inconceivable Rapture says, ‚ÄúThe boy said:

original: rnam rtog mang po ci 'tshal te //
analyzed: rnam rtog mang po ci 'tshal te //
translated: What is the use of many thoughts?

original: sems ni rang bzhin 'od gsal zhing //üîΩde la nyon mongs mi 'byung ste //
analyzed: sems ni rang bzhin 'od gsal zhing // de la nyon mongs mi 'byung ste //
translated: The mind is luminous by nature.üîΩAfflictions do not arise in it.

original: nams kyang nyon mongs de mi 'gyur //
analyzed: nams kyang nyon mongs de mi 'gyur //
translated: They never will arise in it.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said,

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is just as you have said.

original: sems ni rtag tu 'od gsal kyang //üîΩglo bur nye ba'i nyon mongs kyis //üîΩso so'i skye bo nyon mongs 'gyur /
analyzed: sems ni rtag tu 'od gsal kyang // glo bur nye ba'i nyon mongs kyis // so so'i skye bo nyon mongs 'gyur /
translated: The mind is always luminous,üîΩBut ordinary beings are afflicted by afflictions

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Due to adventitious, nearby afflictions.‚Äù

original: mdo 'di nyid las kyang /
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las kyang /
translated: This s≈´tra also says,

original: sems ni rang bzhin dang ba ste //
analyzed: sems ni rang bzhin dang ba ste //
translated: The mind is pure by nature.

original: rnyog par byed pa yid yin no //
analyzed: rnyog par byed pa yid yin no //
translated: The mental factors are what disturb it.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: don dam par ni sems kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni sems kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, the nature of the mind is emptiness.

original: de ltar rig pa dang stong pa yang phan tshun khyab pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar rig pa dang stong pa yang phan tshun khyab pa ste /
translated: In this way, awareness and emptiness are mutually pervasive.

original: de'i phyir rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa rnam rig sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa rnam rig sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, the union of awareness and emptiness is the illusion-like awareness of the mind.

original: de skad du yang 'phags @55b pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'phags @55b pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
translated: As it says in the Sublime Pile of Jewels:

original: rnam shes de ni sgyu ma mtshungs //
analyzed: rnam shes de ni sgyu ma mtshungs //
translated: Consciousness is like an illusion.

original: zhes pa dang / 'phags pa zung gi mdo dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang sems nyid sgyu ma lta bur gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / 'phags pa zung gi mdo dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang sems nyid sgyu ma lta bur gsungs pas so //
translated: And in the Sublime Couple Discourse and the Transcendent Knowledge how-to, the mind itself is said to be like an illusion.

original: 'dir rigs pa'i stobs kyis kyang grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa'i stobs kyis kyang grub pa nyid de /
translated: Here, it is established by the power of reasoning.

original: chos can dang dgag bya la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: chos can dang dgag bya la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The subject, the object of refutation, and so forth, are to be understood by following the previous explanations.

original: gtan tshigs sbyor ba'i tshul yang /
analyzed: gtan tshigs sbyor ba'i tshul yang /
translated: The way to apply the reasoning is as follows.

original: gang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i ngo bo de ni sgyu ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i ngo bo de ni sgyu ma nyid yin te /
translated: Whatever has an essence free from one and many is an illusion,

original: dper na sgyu ma'i rta glang nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i rta glang nyid bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, an illusory horse or elephant.

original: ji ltar snang zhing myong ba'i sems kyang //
analyzed: ji ltar snang zhing myong ba'i sems kyang //
translated: And the mind that appears and is experienced

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: has an essence free from one and many.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa 'am /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa 'am /
translated: It is either a non-observation of a pervader

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
translated: or a reason of nature.

original: sngar gzugs la sogs par snang ba sgyu ma nyid du bsgrubs pas kyang /
analyzed: sngar gzugs la sogs par snang ba sgyu ma nyid du bsgrubs pas kyang /
translated: Also, by previously establishing the appearance as form, etc. as illusion,

original: sems nyid sgyu ma lta bur bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: sems nyid sgyu ma lta bur bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: the mind itself is established as illusion-like,

original: snang ba tsam gyi chos can sems nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dir gzhan dag phyi rol lam /
analyzed: snang ba tsam gyi chos can sems nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // 'dir gzhan dag phyi rol lam /
translated: because the subject, the mere appearance, is the mind itself.üîΩHere, others say that whether it is external or

original: sems gang yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: sems gang yin yang rung ste /
translated: the mind,

original: sgyu ma nyid du rigs pas grub cing mi gnod na /
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid du rigs pas grub cing mi gnod na /
translated: if it is established by reasoning as illusion and is not harmed,

original: de nyid yang dag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid yang dag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: it becomes reality,

original: rigs pas grub lugs de bzhin du bden pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pas grub lugs de bzhin du bden pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by reasoning in that way and is true.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar snang zhing myong ba sgyu mar rigs pas grub cing mi gnod pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar snang zhing myong ba sgyu mar rigs pas grub cing mi gnod pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if it is established by reasoning that what appears and is experienced is illusion and is not harmed,

original: de nyid yang dag nyid du yod ces kyang ci'i phyir na khas mi blang ste /
analyzed: de nyid yang dag nyid du yod ces kyang ci'i phyir na khas mi blang ste /
translated: why would one not accept that it exists as reality?

original: rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the reason is the same.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: ji ltar rigs pas grub pa'i tshul de ltar yang dag nyid du 'gyur ba ni 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pas grub pa'i tshul de ltar yang dag nyid du 'gyur ba ni 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: We agree that whatever is established by reasoning is indeed real.

original: de lta na dgag bya nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na dgag bya nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But then it would be an object of refutation.

original: yang dag yin pa tsam gyis dgag byar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag yin pa tsam gyis dgag byar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: It is not the case that just because something is real it becomes an object of refutation.

original: khyab pa nyid ma grub ste /
analyzed: khyab pa nyid ma grub ste /
translated: The pervasion is not established.

original: dgag bya ni yang dag gi dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag bya ni yang dag gi dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of refutation is a real thing.

original: gal te rigs pas grub cing mi gnod pa'i phyir yang dag gi dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rigs pas grub cing mi gnod pa'i phyir yang dag gi dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that something becomes a real thing because it is established by reasoning and is not undermined,

original: de yang khyab pa ma thub ste //
analyzed: de yang khyab pa ma thub ste //
translated: that too is not a valid pervasion.

original: bden pa'i dngos min myong ba tsam //
analyzed: bden pa'i dngos min myong ba tsam //
translated: The mere experience of what is not a real thing

original: rig stong dbyer med ngo bo gang //
analyzed: rig stong dbyer med ngo bo gang //
translated: Is the essence of the inseparability of awareness and emptiness.

original: rnam rig dbu ma'i tshul lugs la //
analyzed: rnam rig dbu ma'i tshul lugs la //
translated: In the system of the Middle Way of cognition,

original: de bzhin rigs pas rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin rigs pas rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: It is realized in the same way through reasoning.

original: bden pa'i dngos por 'gyur na ni //üîΩtshad ma dngos po'i byed pa ru //
analyzed: bden pa'i dngos por 'gyur na ni // tshad ma dngos po'i byed pa ru //
translated: If it were a real thing,

original: ci'i phyir na mi @56a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na mi @56a * //
translated: Why would it not beüîΩA valid cognition that engages with things?üîΩTell me!

original: 'gyur smros // gal te de ltar 'dod ce na //
analyzed: 'gyur smros // gal te de ltar 'dod ce na //
translated: If you accept that,

original: shes pa'i byed pa zhugs pa na //
analyzed: shes pa'i byed pa zhugs pa na //
translated: Then when the activity of cognition engages,

original: shes bya gzhan du 'gyur ba dang // byed pa ma skyes sngon rol na //
analyzed: shes bya gzhan du 'gyur ba dang // byed pa ma skyes sngon rol na //
translated: And prior to the arising of the agent,

original: tshad mar tha snyad gdags pa yi //
analyzed: tshad mar tha snyad gdags pa yi //
translated: The basis for the conventionalüîΩDesignation of valid knowledge would not exist.

original: rten med phyir na tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: rten med phyir na tshad ma nyid //
translated: Therefore valid knowledge would not exist.

original: thams cad du ni med par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad du ni med par 'gyur //
translated: Everything would be nonexistent.

original: gal te sgyu ma dang yang dag pa nyid ni 'gal te /
analyzed: gal te sgyu ma dang yang dag pa nyid ni 'gal te /
translated: You might say, ‚ÄúIllusion and reality are mutually exclusive.

original: sgyu ma'i don ni gsob nyid dang / gsog nyid snying po med pa yin la /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i don ni gsob nyid dang / gsog nyid snying po med pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of illusion is falsity, voidness, and essencelessness.

original: yang dag pa ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Reality is the opposite of that.‚Äù

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no error.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma ma yin pa la sgyu mar btags pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma ma yin pa la sgyu mar btags pa ni /
translated: The imputation of illusion to that which is not an illusion

original: sgyu ma yang dag pa ma yin gyi /üîΩsgyu ma nyid la sgyu mar rnam par gzhag pa ni /
