analyzed: sgyu ma yang dag pa ma yin gyi / sgyu ma nyid la sgyu mar rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: is not the reality of illusion.üîΩHowever, the presentation of illusion as illusionüîΩis the reality of illusion.

original: de ltar bden pas sgyu ma yang dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bden pas sgyu ma yang dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore illusion is called reality.

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
translated: The Heap of Jewels says:

original: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan bzang pos /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan bzang pos /
translated: A good magician

original: sprul pa'i sgyu ma ni sgyu ma yang dag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sgyu ma ni sgyu ma yang dag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: conjures an illusion that is not the reality of illusion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur gsungs pa'i sgyu ma na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur gsungs pa'i sgyu ma na /
translated: The Tathagata has said that all phenomena are like illusions.

original: sgyu ma yang dag pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma yang dag pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He has said that illusions are real.

original: brtsad pa gnyis pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: brtsad pa gnyis pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: The second objection is also untenable.

original: snang zhing myong ba yang dag pa'i dngos por yod pa la /
analyzed: snang zhing myong ba yang dag pa'i dngos por yod pa la /
translated: That which appears and is experienced exists as a real entity.

original: yang dag gi gcig dang du mas khyab pa las /
analyzed: yang dag gi gcig dang du mas khyab pa las /
translated: The real is necessarily either one or many.

original: de 'dra ba'i khyab byed mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i khyab byed mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But such a pervasion is untenable.

original: 'dir sgyu mar rigs pas grub cing mi gnod pa la ni /
analyzed: 'dir sgyu mar rigs pas grub cing mi gnod pa la ni /
translated: Here, in the case of an illusion that is established by reasoning and is not undermined,

original: de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: it is not the case that it is like that.

original: sngar bstan pa tshad ma dngos po 'chos par byed pa'i byed pa po ma yin pas /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa tshad ma dngos po 'chos par byed pa'i byed pa po ma yin pas /
translated: The previously explained valid cognition is not a creator that fabricates real entities.

original: bden pa'i dngos por ma grub pa'i sgyu ma la /
analyzed: bden pa'i dngos por ma grub pa'i sgyu ma la /
translated: Therefore, in an illusion that is not established as a real entity,

original: de ltar tshad mas rtogs kyang yang dag gi dngos por mi 'gyur bas yang dag gi gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i dpyad pa mi 'jug ces pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshad mas rtogs kyang yang dag gi dngos por mi 'gyur bas yang dag gi gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i dpyad pa mi 'jug ces pa'o //
translated: even though it is cognized by valid cognition in that way, it does not become a real entity. Therefore, the analysis of the real, such as whether it is one or many, does not apply.

original: yang gzhan dag ji ltar snang zhing myong ba sgyu ma nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ji ltar snang zhing myong ba sgyu ma nyid yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, others assert that what appears and is experienced is itself an illusion.

original: de yang don dam pa'i bden par khas len na /
analyzed: de yang don dam pa'i bden par khas len na /
translated: And if that is accepted as ultimate truth,

original: sngon gyi slob dpon dag gis bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i kun rdzob dang khyad par med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon dag gis bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i kun rdzob dang khyad par med par 'gyur te /
translated: it is no different from the correct conventionalities explained by the masters of the past.

original: ji skad du /üîΩbrtags pa'i don gyis dben 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: ji skad du / brtags pa'i don gyis dben 'gyur zhing //
translated: As it has been said:üîΩThe mere thing that arises in dependence

original: dngos tsam brten nas gang skyes pa //
analyzed: dngos tsam brten nas gang skyes pa //
translated: on an object that is devoid of the imputed meaning

original: yang dag kun rdzob shes par bya //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag kun rdzob shes par bya // zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: should be known as the correct conventionality.

original: de'i don kyang yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba 'di nyid /
analyzed: de'i don kyang yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba 'di nyid /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows. The correct conventionality is this very appearance as forms and so on,

original: don dam par skye'o 'gag go zhes pa @56b  sogs par brtags pa'i don gyis dben pa dang / dngos po tsam du grub pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skyes pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par skye'o 'gag go zhes pa @56b  sogs par brtags pa'i don gyis dben pa dang / dngos po tsam du grub pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skyes pa'o //
translated: which is devoid of the imputed meaning, such as ‚ÄúIt arises ultimately‚Äù or ‚ÄúIt ceases,‚Äù and is established as a mere thing and arises in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: de ni ji ltar khyed kyis 'dod pa'i rnam rig sgyu ma tsam la yang mtshungs pa nyid du snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar khyed kyis 'dod pa'i rnam rig sgyu ma tsam la yang mtshungs pa nyid du snang ngo zhe na /
translated: That is also similar to the mere illusion of consciousness that you assert.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no error.

original: 'dir sgyu ma lta bu'i don ni dngos po tsam dang / rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skye bar snang yang /
analyzed: 'dir sgyu ma lta bu'i don ni dngos po tsam dang / rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skye bar snang yang /
translated: Here, the meaning of ‚Äúillusion-like‚Äù is that although things merely appear to arise in dependence on causes and conditions,

original: skye ba don dam pa'i dngos po la sogs pas /
analyzed: skye ba don dam pa'i dngos po la sogs pas /
translated: they are empty of ultimate arising and so forth.

original: stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The nature of the union of appearance and emptiness is the correct relative.

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ni de lta bus khyad par du ma byas pa'i dngos po tsam la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ni de lta bus khyad par du ma byas pa'i dngos po tsam la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The correct relative is merely things and so forth that are not qualified by that.

original: brtags pa'i don gyis dben zhes pa ni /
analyzed: brtags pa'i don gyis dben zhes pa ni /
translated: The line ‚Äúfree from the object of investigation‚Äù

original: de ltar rtog pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa la bya'i /
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa la bya'i /
translated: means that it is not the object of such a conception.

original: de ltar brtags pa'i zhen yul skye ba la sogs pa'i dngos pos stong pa ni 'dir ched che ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar brtags pa'i zhen yul skye ba la sogs pa'i dngos pos stong pa ni 'dir ched che ba ma yin no //
translated: The emptiness of the object of such a conception, such as arising, is not the chief point here.

original: gal te yang dag pa'i kun rdzob gzugs la sogs par snang ba 'di'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid ni /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa'i kun rdzob gzugs la sogs par snang ba 'di'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid ni /
translated: If you say that the nature of this appearance of correct relative form and so forth is the same as that,

original: de lta bu'i skye ba la sogs pas stong pa'i phyir mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i skye ba la sogs pas stong pa'i phyir mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: because it is empty of such arising and so forth,üîΩthen that is not the case.

original: de ci'i phyir kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid don dam pa dang khyad med par 'gyur ba ni 'dod pa nyid do /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid don dam pa dang khyad med par 'gyur ba ni 'dod pa nyid do /
translated: Why? Because it is accepted that the nature of the conventional is not different from the ultimate, thatness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it was said:üîΩThe thatness of the conventional is the ultimate thatness.

original: kun rdzob kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid do zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid do zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is as it was explained above.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i sko nas kyang brtsad pa spang bar nus mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i sko nas kyang brtsad pa spang bar nus mod kyi /
translated: Even though the objection can be refuted on the basis of this explanation,

original: 'on kyang 'di ni rnam pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni rnam pa gzhan yin te /
translated: there is another way to do it.

original: ji skad du /üîΩdngos rnams skye ba kun rdzob tu //
analyzed: ji skad du / dngos rnams skye ba kun rdzob tu //
translated: As it will be taught below:üîΩThings arise conventionally.

original: dam pa'i don du rang bzhin med //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du rang bzhin med //
translated: Ultimately, they are essenceless.

original: rang bzhin med la 'khrul pa gang //
analyzed: rang bzhin med la 'khrul pa gang //
translated: The confusion of essencelessness

original: de ni kun rdzob bden pa yin //üîΩzhes 'og nas ston par 'gyur la /üîΩde'i don yang shes bya ji ltar snang zhing myong ba 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid ni /
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob bden pa yin // zhes 'og nas ston par 'gyur la / de'i don yang shes bya ji ltar snang zhing myong ba 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid ni /
translated: is the conventional truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa yin la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The nature of these objects of knowledge, as they appear and are experienced, is ultimate truth.

original: de las phyin ci log tu 'khrul pa'am 'khrul pa'i snang ba ni /
analyzed: de las phyin ci log tu 'khrul pa'am 'khrul pa'i snang ba ni /
translated: The opposite of this is delusion or deluded appearance.üîΩ

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that, the mistaken or the appearance of the mistaken, is the conventional truth.

original: 'dir rnam rig sgyu ma lta bu'i tshul ni de lta ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir rnam rig sgyu ma lta bu'i tshul ni de lta ma yin pas /
translated: Here, the mode of the illusion-like consciousness is not like that,

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: so it is not the correct conventional.

original: gal te yang sgyu ma ni dngos po'i cha byad 'dzin pas /
analyzed: gal te yang sgyu ma ni dngos po'i cha byad 'dzin pas /
translated: If you think that since an illusion takes on the appearance of an entity,

original: de ltar rigs pa'i stobs kyis grub cing mi gnod na /
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa'i stobs kyis grub cing mi gnod na /
translated: it is established by the power of reasoning and is not harmed,

original: bden pa'i dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: bden pa'i dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: then it would become a real entity.

original: blo gros 'di ni log pa ste /üîΩstong pa spangs pa'i dngos po 'ba' zhig gi ldog @57a * //
analyzed: blo gros 'di ni log pa ste / stong pa spangs pa'i dngos po 'ba' zhig gi ldog @57a * //
translated: This idea is mistaken.

original: pa nas / rigs pas grub pa nyid du su yang khas mi len la /
analyzed: pa nas / rigs pas grub pa nyid du su yang khas mi len la /
translated: No one accepts that the mere opposite of emptiness, an entity that is devoid of emptiness,üîΩis established by reasoning.

original: dngos po tsam dang bden pa'i dngos pos stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i don rigs pas grub pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: dngos po tsam dang bden pa'i dngos pos stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i don rigs pas grub pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: We assert that the meaning of the union of mere entity and emptiness of true entity is established by reasoning.

original: de la ni sngar bstan pa ltar nyes pas gos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni sngar bstan pa ltar nyes pas gos pa ma yin no //
translated: As explained above, it is not tainted by faults.

original: yang gzhan dag gal te don dam par stong pa nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag gal te don dam par stong pa nyid du khas len na /
translated: Moreover, others say that if one accepts emptiness in the ultimate,

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: then the noble Perfection of Wisdom would be contradicted, for it says:

original: phung 'di stong zhes rtog na'ang byang chub sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: phung 'di stong zhes rtog na'ang byang chub sems dpa' ni //
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúThese aggregates are empty,‚Äù

original: mtshan ma la spyod skye med gnas la dad ma yin //
analyzed: mtshan ma la spyod skye med gnas la dad ma yin //
translated: the bodhisattva is engaging with signs, not having faith in the abode of non-arising.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / skabs kyi don chos dang chos min pa ni shes rab kyis spang bar bya bar gsungs pa dang / 'og nas kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / skabs kyi don chos dang chos min pa ni shes rab kyis spang bar bya bar gsungs pa dang / 'og nas kyang /
translated: And it says that the object of this context is that Dharma and non-Dharma are to be abandoned by wisdom, and later it says:

original: de bas yod par mi brtag cing //
analyzed: de bas yod par mi brtag cing //
translated: Therefore do not conceive of existence,

original: med pa nyid du'ang brtag mi bya //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / yang 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las kyang /
analyzed: med pa nyid du'ang brtag mi bya // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / yang 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las kyang /
translated: and do not conceive of nonexistence.üîΩAnd the noble Jewel Mound Sutra also says:

original: 'od srungs gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam ni bla'i /
analyzed: 'od srungs gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam ni bla'i /
translated: ‚ÄúKƒÅ≈õyapa, it is better to have the view of the person that is as big as Mount Meru

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can stong pa nyid du lta ba ni /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can stong pa nyid du lta ba ni /
translated: than to have the pride of emptiness of those who are arrogant.

original: de lta ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is not the same.‚Äù

original: de la sogs pa mdo sde du ma dang 'gal bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la sogs pa mdo sde du ma dang 'gal bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: This and other such statements contradict many s≈´tras.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang /üîΩrgyal bas stong nyid lta ba kun //
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang / rgyal bas stong nyid lta ba kun //
translated: The noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna also says:üîΩThe Victorious One taught that emptiness,üîΩwhich is the view of all views,

original: lta kun nges par 'joms par gsungs //
analyzed: lta kun nges par 'joms par gsungs //
translated: destroys all views.

original: gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
translated: Those who view emptiness

original: 'di ni gso ru med par gsungs //
analyzed: 'di ni gso ru med par gsungs //
translated: are said to be incurable.

original: zhes bstan pa dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur la /üîΩyang / dgag bya yod pa ma yin pas //üîΩyang dag tu na bkag med gsal //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur la / yang / dgag bya yod pa ma yin pas // yang dag tu na bkag med gsal //
translated: And this would contradict the teaching.

original: zhes bstan pa'i rigs pa'i stobs kyis kyang gnod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i rigs pa'i stobs kyis kyang gnod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: And it would also be undermined by the force of the reasoning that teaches:

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: Since the object of negation does not exist,üîΩin reality there is no negation and no clarity.üîΩIf you think this, there is no fault.

original: 'dir stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig ni khas len pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig ni khas len pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, we do not accept mere emptiness.

original: kun rdzob tu ni thams cad yod cing 'og nas ston pas snga ma ltar rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa sgyu ma lta bu'i don nyid /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni thams cad yod cing 'og nas ston pas snga ma ltar rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa sgyu ma lta bu'i don nyid /
translated: Since everything exists conventionally, as will be taught below, the meaning of the union of appearance and emptiness, like an illusion, is as follows.

original: snang zhing myong ba'i chos can la brten nas de kho na nyid spyod pa'i skabs su khas len pa'o //
analyzed: snang zhing myong ba'i chos can la brten nas de kho na nyid spyod pa'i skabs su khas len pa'o //
translated: When engaging in the way things really are, based on the phenomena that appear and are experienced, it is accepted.

original: de lta na yang don dam par stong zhing med pa yin mod kyi /üîΩmdo sde dag gi don ni dngos po sngon du song ba'am /
analyzed: de lta na yang don dam par stong zhing med pa yin mod kyi / mdo sde dag gi don ni dngos po sngon du song ba'am /
translated: Nevertheless, ultimately, it is empty and nonexistent.üîΩThe meaning of the s≈´tras is that emptiness or nonexistence is imputed by the mental process in dependence on an entity that has gone before or on the counterpart of an entity.

original: dngos po'i zla'o la ltos nas blo'i byed pas sgro btags pa'i stong pa 'am med pa de 'dra ba dang / der sgro 'dogs kyi blo dgag par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i zla'o la ltos nas blo'i byed pas sgro btags pa'i stong pa 'am med pa de 'dra ba dang / der sgro 'dogs kyi blo dgag par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: It is taught in order to refute the mind that imputes that.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i don rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni theg pa chen po'i mdo @57b sde thams cad kyi snying po'i don yin zhing /
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i don rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni theg pa chen po'i mdo @57b sde thams cad kyi snying po'i don yin zhing /
translated: The meaning of unity, natural emptiness, is the essential meaning of all the s≈´tras of the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: de ltar ston pa'i gzhung yang du ma yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ston pa'i gzhung yang du ma yod mod kyi /
translated: There are many texts that teach that.

original: 'dir khungs nyid du mi bri ste shes par zad do //
analyzed: 'dir khungs nyid du mi bri ste shes par zad do //
translated: Here, I will not write about them as sources, but I have understood them.

original: des na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i blo'i spros pa'i mtha' thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes brtags shing yul du byas kyang /
analyzed: des na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i blo'i spros pa'i mtha' thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes brtags shing yul du byas kyang /
translated: Therefore, even though it is analyzed and taken as an object with the thought, ‚ÄúIt is free from all extremes of conceptual mental proliferation,‚Äù

original: de ni spros pa dang bral pa zab mo'i don kho na nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni spros pa dang bral pa zab mo'i don kho na nyid ma yin te /
translated: that is not the profound meaning of the way things really are, which is free from proliferation.

original: blo de ni brjod pa dang 'dre rung ba'i don sgro btags pa phyi'i rnam pa nyid yul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo de ni brjod pa dang 'dre rung ba'i don sgro btags pa phyi'i rnam pa nyid yul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the mind makes an object of the mere external aspect that is the superimposition of a meaning that is suitable to be expressed.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba /
translated: Therefore, when the valid knowledge of inference is measuring the reality of the mind, which is free from elaborations and clear light,

original: rig pa dang stong ba zung du 'jug pa'i don la 'jal ba na /
analyzed: rig pa dang stong ba zung du 'jug pa'i don la 'jal ba na /
translated: the meaning of the union of awareness and emptiness,

original: de nyid kyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis sems kyi chos nyid rtogs par rlom yang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis sems kyi chos nyid rtogs par rlom yang /
translated: it is conceited with the pride of that and presumes to realize the reality of the mind.

original: de'i chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not the realization of the reality of the mind just as it is.

original: de lta na yang dngos po la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa'i spros pa phyogs re gcod pas /
analyzed: de lta na yang dngos po la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa'i spros pa phyogs re gcod pas /
translated: Nevertheless, since it eliminates some of the elaborations that superimpose entities and so on,

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis btsal zhing gtan la dbab par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis btsal zhing gtan la dbab par bya ba nyid do //
translated: it is something to be sought and ascertained by those who have realization.

original: gal te de lta na de nyid gang gi yul du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na de nyid gang gi yul du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what is the object of that?

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis rig par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis rig par bya ba nyid do //
translated: It is the object of the nonconceptual wisdom of the ƒÅryas.

original: yang gal te dgag bya'i dngos po med pas de bkag pa'i med pa'am /
analyzed: yang gal te dgag bya'i dngos po med pas de bkag pa'i med pa'am /
translated: Moreover, if you say that the negation of an existent object is not tenable,

original: stong pa nyid mi 'thad ces pa yang dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid mi 'thad ces pa yang dpyad par bya ste /
translated: then you should analyze the negation of an existent object.

original: 'dir dgag bya'i dngos po med de /
analyzed: 'dir dgag bya'i dngos po med de /
translated: Here, the negation of an existent object is not tenable.

original: dngos por snang ba ma 'gags pa tsam gyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid chos rnams kyi chos nyid du khas len te /
analyzed: dngos por snang ba ma 'gags pa tsam gyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid chos rnams kyi chos nyid du khas len te /
translated: We accept the emptiness of the nature of things, which is the mere noncessation of the appearance of things.

original: de ni ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not unestablished,

original: gzhan du na pha rol pho nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyang ma grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩyang dngos po sngon du song ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan du na pha rol pho nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyang ma grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // yang dngos po sngon du song ba'am /
translated: otherwise, the reason of the otherness of the opponent would also be unestablished.

original: de la ltos nas brtags pa'i bkag pa ni khas mi len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la ltos nas brtags pa'i bkag pa ni khas mi len pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, we do not accept a negation that is imputed in dependence on an existent object.

original: 'di ni gyi na tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'di ni gyi na tsam du zad do //
translated: Therefore, this is just nonsense.

original: des na dbu ma par smra ba kha cig gsung rab kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig gam /
analyzed: des na dbu ma par smra ba kha cig gsung rab kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig gam /
translated: Some proponents of Madhyamaka say that some scriptures teach that

original: 'dir ni yod nyid 'gog nyid kyi //
analyzed: 'dir ni yod nyid 'gog nyid kyi //
translated: Here, we refute existence,

original: med nyid sgrub par byed pa min //
analyzed: med nyid sgrub par byed pa min //
translated: but we do not affirm nonexistence.

original: zhes pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / gzhan yang /
translated: And also:

original: yod dang med dang yod med ces //
analyzed: yod dang med dang yod med ces //
translated: Existence, nonexistence, and existence

original: khas mi len pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: khas mi len pa gang yin pa //
translated: And what is not accepted,

original: de la nan tan ldan pas kyang //
analyzed: de la nan tan ldan pas kyang //
translated: Even if one were to insist on it,

original: cir yang klan ka bya mi nus //
analyzed: cir yang klan ka bya mi nus //
translated: One cannot be faulted in any way.

original: zhes slob dpon klu sgrub la sogs pas bshad pa'i gzhung la brten nas /
analyzed: zhes slob dpon klu sgrub la sogs pas bshad pa'i gzhung la brten nas /
translated: Thus, based on the scriptures explained by the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna and so on,

original: ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi chos can la /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi chos can la /
translated: with regard to a subject that is merely apparent,

original: de kho na nyid du yod med dpyod pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du yod med dpyod pa'i skabs su /
translated: when analyzing whether it exists in reality or not,

original: dgag par bya ba @58a * //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba @58a * //
translated: the object of negation

original: ni gang zhig rigs pas grub cing mi gnod pa yin la /
analyzed: ni gang zhig rigs pas grub cing mi gnod pa yin la /
translated: is that which is established by reasoning and is not undermined.

original: dgag bya rnam par bkag pa las gzhan bsgrub par bya ba ni khas mi len te /
analyzed: dgag bya rnam par bkag pa las gzhan bsgrub par bya ba ni khas mi len te /
translated: Other than the negation of the object of negation, nothing else is established.

original: des na de kho na nyid du yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' thams cad dang bral zhing /
analyzed: des na de kho na nyid du yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' thams cad dang bral zhing /
translated: Therefore, free from all extremes of existence, nonexistence, and so on in reality,

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba ni cung zad tsam yang med de /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba ni cung zad tsam yang med de /
translated: there is not even the slightest thing to establish that is actually desired.

original: khas len thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khas len thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: It is free from all assertions.

original: 'di ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'thad de /
translated: This is not tenable.

original: bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa don dam pa'i dngos por ni dbu ma ba su yang khas mi len bas /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa don dam pa'i dngos por ni dbu ma ba su yang khas mi len bas /
translated: No one who is a Madhyamika accepts that the probandum and so on are ultimate entities.

original: 'di ni kun rdzob rnam par gzhag pa tsam du yang med par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni kun rdzob rnam par gzhag pa tsam du yang med par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, this is the assertion that it does not exist even as a mere conventional positing.

original: de lta na bsgrub bya shes par 'dod pa med pas /
analyzed: de lta na bsgrub bya shes par 'dod pa med pas /
translated: In that case, since there is no desire to know the probandum,

original: shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i chos can ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i chos can ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: the subject that has the particularity of being desired to be known is not established.

original: de la brten pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid tshul dang po kun rdzob tsam du yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid tshul dang po kun rdzob tsam du yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the first mode of the definition of a reason, which is based on that, does not exist even as a mere convention.

original: de'i phyir rang gi rgyud kyi gtan tshigs khas len pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rgyud kyi gtan tshigs khas len pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to accept a reason based on one's own mind.

original: gal te rang la 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya med kyang gzhan gyi phyogs dgag par 'dod pa kun rdzob tsam du yod cing /
analyzed: gal te rang la 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya med kyang gzhan gyi phyogs dgag par 'dod pa kun rdzob tsam du yod cing /
translated: One may say: 'Although one does not have a probandum that is desired by oneself, one has a mere convention that is desired to refute the position of others,

original: de'i rten de nyid shes 'dod kyi chos can yin pas skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rten de nyid shes 'dod kyi chos can yin pas skyon med do zhe na /
translated: and since the basis of that is the subject that is desired to be known, there is no fault.'

original: de lta na de nyid bsgrub byar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na de nyid bsgrub byar 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, that would be the probandum.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs dgag par 'dod pa ni rgol ba de nyid kyi mngon par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs dgag par 'dod pa ni rgol ba de nyid kyi mngon par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The opponent himself desires to refute the position of the other.

original: gzhan du mkha' la 'phyo ba lta bu gang zag gi rgyud dang ma 'brel ba gcig ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan du mkha' la 'phyo ba lta bu gang zag gi rgyud dang ma 'brel ba gcig ni mi 'thad do //
translated: Otherwise, it would be untenable for him to be unrelated to the continuum of a person, like one who flies in the sky.

original: de nyid kyi phyir kho bo cag la 'dod pa med ces pa yang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kho bo cag la 'dod pa med ces pa yang /
translated: Therefore, when he says, ‚ÄúWe have no thesis,‚Äù

original: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba la kun du spyod par snang ngo //
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba la kun du spyod par snang ngo //
translated: he appears to be engaging in contradiction of his own words.

original: de ltar bsgrub bya'i mtshan nyid rgol ba bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa dang yang ldan zhing /
analyzed: de ltar bsgrub bya'i mtshan nyid rgol ba bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa dang yang ldan zhing /
translated: Thus, the definition of the probandum is possessed by the proponent himself, and

original: 'dod pa'i don de nyid phyir rgol ba gzhan la yang grub na ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don de nyid phyir rgol ba gzhan la yang grub na ni /
translated: if that desired object is established for the opponent as well,

original: rtags 'god ba la sogs pa'i byed pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtags 'god ba la sogs pa'i byed pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: then the activity of positing reasons and so on would be pointless.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i don de nyid phyir rgol ba la ma grub cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i don de nyid phyir rgol ba la ma grub cing /
translated: Therefore, that desired object is not established for the opponent,

original: yang mngon par 'dod pa'i don la mngon sum la sogs pa'i bsal ba la 'jug par gyur na ni /
analyzed: yang mngon par 'dod pa'i don la mngon sum la sogs pa'i bsal ba la 'jug par gyur na ni /
translated: and if the manifest object of desire is engaged by means of direct perception and so on,

original: gzhan gyi phyogs dgag par mi nus pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs dgag par mi nus pas /
translated: then the position of the other cannot be refuted.

original: de'i phyir ma bsal ba nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma bsal ba nyid kyang yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also not to be eliminated.

original: de lta na bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni rigs mi mthun par sel bar byed la /
analyzed: de lta na bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni rigs mi mthun par sel bar byed la /
translated: Thus, the definition of the probandum is that which eliminates what is dissimilar.üîΩIt is also asserted to be the nature of the probandum, and it is also the third, that which is not to be eliminated.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang / bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa dang / ma bsal ba dang rnam pa gsum gyis mtshon par nus shing /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang / bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa dang / ma bsal ba dang rnam pa gsum gyis mtshon par nus shing /
translated: It is also the collection of these three.

original: @58b tshogs pa nyid du rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las bshad pas /
analyzed: @58b tshogs pa nyid du rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las bshad pas /
translated: This is explained in the treatises on logic.

original: 'dir gzhan gyi phyogs dgag par 'dod pa'i don de nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyi phyogs dgag par 'dod pa'i don de nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in this context, the meaning of the desire to refute the position of the other becomes the probandum.

original: gal te 'dir gzhan gyi phyogs 'gegs kyi /
analyzed: gal te 'dir gzhan gyi phyogs 'gegs kyi /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIn this context, the other‚Äôs position is refuted,

original: bsgrub pa nyid du khas mi len pas /
analyzed: bsgrub pa nyid du khas mi len pas /
translated: but it is not accepted as the probandum,

original: de 'dra ba grub pa dang ma grub pa nyid du brtags nas sun 'byin pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dra ba grub pa dang ma grub pa nyid du brtags nas sun 'byin pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: then it is not tenable to investigate whether such a thing is established or not established and then refute it,‚Äù

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: there is no error.

original: 'di ltar dgag par bya ba gzhan gyi phyogs de nyid yod dam med ces brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dgag par bya ba gzhan gyi phyogs de nyid yod dam med ces brtag par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should investigate whether the other‚Äôs position, which is to be refuted, exists or not.

original: de la dang po ltar na dgag par mi nus la /
analyzed: de la dang po ltar na dgag par mi nus la /
translated: If it is the first case, it cannot be refuted.

original: gnyis pa ltar na dgag mi dgos so zhes bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ltar na dgag mi dgos so zhes bstan par bya'o //
translated: In the second case, it is not necessary to refute it.

original: gal te dgag par bya ba med pa nyid du gzhan gyis ma rtogs pas /
analyzed: gal te dgag par bya ba med pa nyid du gzhan gyis ma rtogs pas /
translated: If you say that the other party has not understood that the object of refutation does not exist,

original: de ltar shes par byed pa nyid dgag pa'i don yin pas skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar shes par byed pa nyid dgag pa'i don yin pas skyon med do zhe na /
translated: and that the purpose of the refutation is to make them understand this, and that therefore there is no fault,

original: mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mi 'thad de /
translated: that is not tenable.

original: ma shes pa dang ma grub ces pa ni rnam grangs nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma shes pa dang ma grub ces pa ni rnam grangs nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because ‚Äúnot understood‚Äù and ‚Äúnot established‚Äù are synonyms.

original: dam bca' ba'i mtshan nyid rang gi ngo bo dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i mtshan nyid rang gi ngo bo dang ldan zhing /
translated: The definition of a thesis is that it is something that one‚Äôs own mind ascribes to itself.

original: de ltar shes par 'dod pa nyid rgol bas bsgrub byar 'dod pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ltar shes par 'dod pa nyid rgol bas bsgrub byar 'dod pa yang yin la /
translated: And the opponent‚Äôs desire to understand it in that way is the desire to prove it.

original: 'dod pa'i don la ma bsal ba yang yin pas nyes pa snga ma nyid son 'dug go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don la ma bsal ba yang yin pas nyes pa snga ma nyid son 'dug go //
translated: And the object of that desire is not eliminated. Therefore the previous fault still applies.

original: gzhan yang rang gi rgyud kyi gtan tshigs ni bsgrub par bya ba la ltos te 'jog pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi rgyud kyi gtan tshigs ni bsgrub par bya ba la ltos te 'jog pas /
translated: Moreover, since an autonomous reason is posited in dependence on the probandum,

original: de kun rdzob tu med na de la ltos pa'i gtan tshigs kyang kun rdzob tsam du yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kun rdzob tu med na de la ltos pa'i gtan tshigs kyang kun rdzob tsam du yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: if the probandum does not exist conventionally, the reason that depends on it also would not exist even conventionally.

original: gzhan yang gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba nyid rtags las rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gzhal bya yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba nyid rtags las rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gzhal bya yin pas /
translated: Moreover, the probandum itself is understood from the reason.

original: de med na rjes dpag gzhal bya dang mi ldan pas tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na rjes dpag gzhal bya dang mi ldan pas tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not exist, since inference would not have an object of comprehension, it would not be a valid cognition.

original: gal te 'dir slob dpon zla ba'i grags pa rjes 'brang dang bcas pa rnams rang gi rgyud kyi gtan tshigs dang tshad ma khas mi len pas de ltar 'dod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'dir slob dpon zla ba'i grags pa rjes 'brang dang bcas pa rnams rang gi rgyud kyi gtan tshigs dang tshad ma khas mi len pas de ltar 'dod pa nyid yin la /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúHere, since the master Candrakƒ´rti and his followers do not assert autonomous reasons and valid cognitions, they assert this.

original: 'on kyang gzhan gyi phyogs na thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs kyi sgo nas 'gog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gyi phyogs na thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs kyi sgo nas 'gog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: However, they refute the positions of others by way of consequences,‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: bsgrub bya khas blangs pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni snga ma dang mtshungs la /
analyzed: bsgrub bya khas blangs pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni snga ma dang mtshungs la /
translated: The point would be the same as before: the probandum would be accepted.

original: gzhan yang 'dir dgag par bya ba gzhan gyi phyogs de nyid yod pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir dgag par bya ba gzhan gyi phyogs de nyid yod pa 'am /
translated: Moreover, here, is the object of negation, the position of others, existent,

original: 'on te med pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: 'on te med pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: or is it nonexistent,

original: the tshom gyi gnas nyid du khas len zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom gyi gnas nyid du khas len zhe na /
translated: or is it accepted as a basis of uncertainty?

original: rnam pa gsum du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du brtag par bya'o //
translated: It should be analyzed in three ways.

original: de la dang po dang tha ma'i phyogs ltar na dgag pa mi 'thad de don go bar @59a * //
analyzed: de la dang po dang tha ma'i phyogs ltar na dgag pa mi 'thad de don go bar @59a * //
translated: If it is like the first or the last position, then the refutation is not tenable, and the meaning is exhausted.

original: zad do // bar pa ltar na yang gzhan gyi phyogs med pa nyid du tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa'i blo gang gis rtogs zhes brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: zad do // bar pa ltar na yang gzhan gyi phyogs med pa nyid du tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa'i blo gang gis rtogs zhes brtag par bya'o //
translated: If it is like the middle, then it should be analyzed: ‚ÄúBy what cognition, valid or invalid, is the nonexistence of the opponent‚Äôs position realized?‚Äù

original: de la tshad ma ma yin pa ni don la sgro 'dogs gcod pa'i byed pa dang mi ldan pas rtogs byed kyi yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: de la tshad ma ma yin pa ni don la sgro 'dogs gcod pa'i byed pa dang mi ldan pas rtogs byed kyi yan lag ma yin no //
translated: An invalid cognition is not a part of the process of realization because it does not have the function of eliminating superimpositions onto objects.

original: tshad mas rtogs na yang skabs kyi don nyams par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tshad mas rtogs na yang skabs kyi don nyams par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If it is realized by a valid cognition, then the point of the context is lost.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi chos can 'di nyid de kho na nyid du yod pa 'am med pas dben pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi chos can 'di nyid de kho na nyid du yod pa 'am med pas dben pa ni /
translated: Moreover, this very subject, which is merely what appears, is empty of existence or nonexistence in reality.

original: tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyi mngon sum gyi tshad mas ni rtogs par mi nus pas /
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyi mngon sum gyi tshad mas ni rtogs par mi nus pas /
translated: This cannot be realized by the valid cognition of direct perception of those who see only what is near.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma nyid khas len dgos la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma nyid khas len dgos la /
translated: Therefore it is necessary to accept the valid cognition of inference.

original: de'i phyir de'i rgyu mtshan rang gi rgyud kyi gtan tshigs kyang ci'i phyir khas mi len snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rgyu mtshan rang gi rgyud kyi gtan tshigs kyang ci'i phyir khas mi len snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, why would you not accept the reason of your own continuum?

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas thob par byed pa'i lam gyi gtso bo ni sngar bstan pa ltar /
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas thob par byed pa'i lam gyi gtso bo ni sngar bstan pa ltar /
translated: Moreover, the principal path for attaining buddhahood is, as previously explained,

original: de kho na nyid shes pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid shes pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin la /
translated: the perfection of wisdom that is the knowledge of suchness.

original: de yang tshad ma 'am tshad ma'i rgyun rgyud 'ga' zhig yin pas de khas mi len na lam la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de yang tshad ma 'am tshad ma'i rgyun rgyud 'ga' zhig yin pas de khas mi len na lam la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Since that is a valid cognition or a continuum of valid cognition, if you do not accept it, you deprecate the path.

original: de nyid kyi 'bras bu la yang skur pa 'debs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'bras bu la yang skur pa 'debs par 'gyur ro //
translated: You also deprecate its result.

original: gzhan yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum tshad ma mthar thug pa nyid yin pas de nyid kyang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum tshad ma mthar thug pa nyid yin pas de nyid kyang med par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, since the gnosis of omniscience is the ultimate valid cognition of yogic direct perception, it too would not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni phyin ci log gis gang ba'i rgya mtshor 'jug pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni phyin ci log gis gang ba'i rgya mtshor 'jug pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Therefore this is merely an entry into an ocean filled with error.

original: yang gzhan dag skabs 'dir dgag bya ni rigs pas dpyad pa'i ngo na rnyed pa'i shes bya'am dngos po nyid yin la /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag skabs 'dir dgag bya ni rigs pas dpyad pa'i ngo na rnyed pa'i shes bya'am dngos po nyid yin la /
translated: Still others say that the object of refutation here is an object of knowledge or entity that is found when one analyzes with reasoning.

original: de 'dra ba'i dngos po rnam par bkag pa tsam gyi med par dgag pa ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i dngos po rnam par bkag pa tsam gyi med par dgag pa ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: The mere negation that is the negation of such an entity is what is to be affirmed.

original: des na nyes pa snga ma rnams las grol lo zhe na /
analyzed: des na nyes pa snga ma rnams las grol lo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, they say, they are free from the previous faults.

original: 'di ni snga ma la ltos na ches bzang mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni snga ma la ltos na ches bzang mod kyi /
translated: This is much better than the previous interpretations.

original: 'on kyang rnam par gcad pa tsam gyi med dgag ni nyams su myong ba'i chos can yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yod pa 'di'i chos ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par gcad pa tsam gyi med dgag ni nyams su myong ba'i chos can yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yod pa 'di'i chos ma yin te /
translated: However, a mere elimination, a nonimplicative negation, is not the correct relative that is experienced.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa dang med pa ni 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa dang med pa ni 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, to exist and not exist in the relative would be contradictory.

original: don 'di yang rgyas par ni tshad ma rnam 'grel las bstan to //
analyzed: don 'di yang rgyas par ni tshad ma rnam 'grel las bstan to //
translated: This point is taught extensively in the Thorough Exposition of Valid Cognition.

original: gzhan yang de ltar na gtan tshigs kyang gcig dang du ma la sogs pa rnam par bkag pa tsam gyi med dgag yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang de ltar na gtan tshigs kyang gcig dang du ma la sogs pa rnam par bkag pa tsam gyi med dgag yin la /
translated: Moreover, in that case, the reason would be a nonimplicative negation that is the mere elimination of being one or many.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar ri bong gi rva med pa dang / mo gsham gyi bu med pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar ri bong gi rva med pa dang / mo gsham gyi bu med pa las /
translated: Therefore, if there were any difference between the nonexistence of the rabbit‚Äôs horns and the nonexistence of the barren woman‚Äôs son,

original: @59b med pa 'di dag la khyad par 'ga' zhig yod na ni khyad par dngos po'i chos yin pas dgag tu mi 'thad la /
analyzed: @59b med pa 'di dag la khyad par 'ga' zhig yod na ni khyad par dngos po'i chos yin pas dgag tu mi 'thad la /
translated: since the difference would be a phenomenon of an entity, it would be untenable to refute it.

original: khyad par med na yang /
analyzed: khyad par med na yang /
translated: If there is no difference,

original: ri bong gi rva med pa dang / mo gsham gyi bu med pa la /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva med pa dang / mo gsham gyi bu med pa la /
translated: then just as the nonexistence of the rabbit‚Äôs horns and the nonexistence of the barren woman‚Äôs son

original: gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya mi 'thad pa bzhin du 'dir yang ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya mi 'thad pa bzhin du 'dir yang ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: are untenable as the reason and the predicate of the probandum, why would it not be the same here?

original: gal te bkag pa tsam gyi rang bzhin la khyad par med mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te bkag pa tsam gyi rang bzhin la khyad par med mod kyi /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúAlthough there is no difference in the nature of mere negation,

original: de las bzlog pa'i skabs su ri bong gi rva dang mo gsham gyi bu la 'brel pa med pas /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i skabs su ri bong gi rva dang mo gsham gyi bu la 'brel pa med pas /
translated: in the context of the opposite of that, since there is no relation between the rabbit‚Äôs horns and the barren woman‚Äôs son,

original: ma 'brel pa gzhan bkag pa ni /
analyzed: ma 'brel pa gzhan bkag pa ni /
translated: the negation of another that is not related

original: cig shos gzhan bkag pa la 'khrul par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: cig shos gzhan bkag pa la 'khrul par 'gyur bas /
translated: would be confused with the negation of the other.

original: gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya mi 'thad la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya mi 'thad la /
translated: Therefore the reason and the predicate of the probandum are untenable.‚Äù

original: 'dir ni dngos po'i ngo bo yod pa la gcig dang du ma la sogs pas khyab pas /
analyzed: 'dir ni dngos po'i ngo bo yod pa la gcig dang du ma la sogs pas khyab pas /
translated: Here, the essence of an entity is pervaded by one and many.

original: khyab byed bkag pa khyab bya bkag pa la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir /üîΩgtan tshigs dang bsgrub byar 'thad do zhe na yang /
analyzed: khyab byed bkag pa khyab bya bkag pa la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir / gtan tshigs dang bsgrub byar 'thad do zhe na yang /
translated: This is because the negation of the pervader is not confused with the negation of the pervaded.üîΩEven though you say that the reason and the predicate of the probandum are tenable,

original: 'dir yang rnam par dpyad na mi 'thad pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam par dpyad na mi 'thad pa nyid de /
translated: when analyzed, this is not tenable.

original: de ltar bzlog pa'i 'brel pa'i khyad par gyis /
analyzed: de ltar bzlog pa'i 'brel pa'i khyad par gyis /
translated: The special relationship of the reversal

original: rnal ma gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya la med pa /
analyzed: rnal ma gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya la med pa /
translated: does not exist in the reason and the predicate of the probandum.

original: gzhan de dag las khyad par cung zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: gzhan de dag las khyad par cung zhig yod na ni /
translated: If there were even the slightest difference between them,

original: nyes pa snga ma nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyes pa snga ma nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: the previous error would apply.

original: khyab par med na yang gang la gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya 'jog pa'i rnal ma'i don de nyid snga ma dang mtshungs pas nyes pa snga ma nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khyab par med na yang gang la gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya 'jog pa'i rnal ma'i don de nyid snga ma dang mtshungs pas nyes pa snga ma nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If there is no pervasion, then the meaning of the natural state, in which the reason and the predicate of the probandum are posited, is the same as the previous one, and so the previous error would apply.

original: gzhan yang 'dir snang zhing myong ba'i chos can la brten nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir snang zhing myong ba'i chos can la brten nas /
translated: Moreover, in this context, based on the phenomena of appearances and experience,

original: 'di nyid de kho na nyid du yod dam med ces dpyod pa'i skabs su dngos po med pa min na yod pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di nyid de kho na nyid du yod dam med ces dpyod pa'i skabs su dngos po med pa min na yod pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: if one analyzes whether they exist or do not exist in reality, if they are not nonexistent, why would they not be existent?

original: yod pa dang med pa ni rnam gcod yongs gcod kyi 'gal ba yin pas /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa ni rnam gcod yongs gcod kyi 'gal ba yin pas /
translated: Existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive in the sense that one is the negation of the other.

original: gcig bkag pa gzhan sgrub pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig bkag pa gzhan sgrub pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the negation of one is the affirmation of the other.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it has been said:

original: dgag pa bkag bsgrub pa yin //üîΩdngos yod med la yod yin la //
analyzed: dgag pa bkag bsgrub pa yin // dngos yod med la yod yin la //
translated: The negation of a negation is an affirmation.üîΩExistence is the negation of nonexistence.

original: dngos po med pa yod min zhes //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yod min zhes //
translated: The existence of nonexistence is not possible.

original: blun po yi ni spyod la ltos //
analyzed: blun po yi ni spyod la ltos //
translated: Look at the behavior of the fools!

original: zhes mkhas pa rnams kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes mkhas pa rnams kyis gsungs so //
translated: This is what the wise ones have said.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi chos can ni khas len dgos la /üîΩde kho na nyid du yod pa'am med pa'i phyogs gang yang ma yin na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi chos can ni khas len dgos la / de kho na nyid du yod pa'am med pa'i phyogs gang yang ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, one must accept the mere subject that appears.üîΩIf it is neither the position that it exists in reality nor the position that it does not exist in reality,

original: de dag rnam gcod yongs gcod kyi 'gal ba nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag rnam gcod yongs gcod kyi 'gal ba nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then existence and nonexistence are not mutually exclusive in the sense that one is the negation of the other.

original: gnyis ka ma yin pa'i phung bo gsum pa byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te yang don dam pa'i bden pa gtan la 'bebs pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: gnyis ka ma yin pa'i phung bo gsum pa byung ba'i phyir ro // gal te yang don dam pa'i bden pa gtan la 'bebs pa'i skabs su /
translated: This is because a third alternative, which is neither of the two, would be possible.

original: yod med gnyis ka ma yin @60a * //
analyzed: yod med gnyis ka ma yin @60a * //
translated: If one were to say that the ultimate truth is neither existence nor nonexistence,

original: pa'i snang ba tsam byung ba'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su 'god na ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: pa'i snang ba tsam byung ba'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su 'god na ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: If you posit the mere appearance of an object as the reason, then it is not established.

original: der ni snang ba nyid kyang khas mi len no //
analyzed: der ni snang ba nyid kyang khas mi len no //
translated: For in that context, you do not accept even the appearance itself.

original: yang kun rdzob gtan la 'bebs pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: yang kun rdzob gtan la 'bebs pa'i skabs su /
translated: Moreover, in the context of determining the conventional,

original: gnyis ka ma yin pa'i snang ba tsam byung ba'i phyir zhes nye bar 'god na /
analyzed: gnyis ka ma yin pa'i snang ba tsam byung ba'i phyir zhes nye bar 'god na /
translated: if you posit the mere appearance of an object that is neither of those two as the reason,

original: de yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: de yang ma grub ste /
translated: then that is also not established.

original: skabs der ni snang ba tsam gyi chos can yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes khas mi len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: skabs der ni snang ba tsam gyi chos can yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes khas mi len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: For in that context, you do not accept that the mere appearance of the subject is free from all positions of existence and nonexistence.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no error.

original: snang zhing myong ba'i chos can la brten nas /
analyzed: snang zhing myong ba'i chos can la brten nas /
translated: In dependence on the subject that appears and is experienced,

original: rtog ge tha mal pa rnams de kho na nyid du yod pa dang med par dpyod pa'i skabs 'di nyid /
analyzed: rtog ge tha mal pa rnams de kho na nyid du yod pa dang med par dpyod pa'i skabs 'di nyid /
translated: in this context of ordinary logicians analyzing whether it exists or does not exist in reality,

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob gtan la 'bebs pa'i skabs gang yin kyang bla ste /
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob gtan la 'bebs pa'i skabs gang yin kyang bla ste /
translated: it is fine whether you are determining the ultimate or the conventional.

original: gnas skabs der snang ba tsam gyi chos can khas blangs nas /
analyzed: gnas skabs der snang ba tsam gyi chos can khas blangs nas /
translated: In that context, having accepted the mere appearance of the subject,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs gang yang med ces zer na ni nyes pa snga ma nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs gang yang med ces zer na ni nyes pa snga ma nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: If one says that there is neither the position of existence nor the position of nonexistence, one falls into the former error.

original: de lta ma yin te phyogs 'ga' zhig 'jog na yang dngos po yod pa'i phyogs ni tshad ma snga ma rnams kyi gnod pas /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te phyogs 'ga' zhig 'jog na yang dngos po yod pa'i phyogs ni tshad ma snga ma rnams kyi gnod pas /
translated: If one does not do that, but posits some position, then the position of the existence of things is undermined by the previous arguments.

original: don dam pa'i dngos por med cing snang ba tsam ni ma bkag pas zung du 'jug pa'i don sgyu ma lta bu nyid rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos por med cing snang ba tsam ni ma bkag pas zung du 'jug pa'i don sgyu ma lta bu nyid rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: Since the mere appearance of what does not exist as an ultimate thing is not refuted, the meaning of the union of appearance and emptiness, which is like an illusion, is established.

original: yang de 'dra ba'i phyogs gzhan dag khas len pa la gnod byed kyi tshad ma med pas /
analyzed: yang de 'dra ba'i phyogs gzhan dag khas len pa la gnod byed kyi tshad ma med pas /
translated: Moreover, since there is no valid cognition that undermines the acceptance of such a position,

original: gzhan gyi khas len 'gog ces pa yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi khas len 'gog ces pa yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not tenable to say that one refutes the assertions of others.

original: don 'di yang 'phags pa dad pa cher 'byung gi mdo las /
analyzed: don 'di yang 'phags pa dad pa cher 'byung gi mdo las /
translated: This point is also made in the noble S≈´tra of the Play of Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba nyi shu rtsa brgyad bshad pa'i nang nas /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba nyi shu rtsa brgyad bshad pa'i nang nas /
translated: Among the explanations of the twenty-eight non-highest views,

original: lta ba khas mi len pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba 'di nyid yin te /üîΩde skad du yang /
analyzed: lta ba khas mi len pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba 'di nyid yin te / de skad du yang /
translated: this is the view called ‚Äúnot accepting a view.‚Äù

original: mdo de nyid las /
analyzed: mdo de nyid las /
translated: As it says in that s≈´tra:

original: de la khas mi len par lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la khas mi len par lta ba ni /
translated: The view of non-acceptance is as follows.

original: gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' da 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' da 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The bodhisattva who views the sign of non-existence thinks as follows:

original: chos thams cad med pa nyid 'di la /
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa nyid 'di la /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this non-existence of all phenomena,

original: gzhan dang rtsod par gyur pa na /
analyzed: gzhan dang rtsod par gyur pa na /
translated: when there is a dispute with others,

original: bdag gis phyogs gang yang khas mi blang ste /
analyzed: bdag gis phyogs gang yang khas mi blang ste /
translated: I will not accept any position at all,

original: bdag gis mi gzung ba 'ba' zhig tu bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis mi gzung ba 'ba' zhig tu bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I will only hold nothing.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir khas mi len par lta ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir khas mi len par lta ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of non-acceptance.

original: sgrub min bsgrub bya'i mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: sgrub min bsgrub bya'i mtshan nyid can //
translated: Having the characteristic of a thesis that is not established,

original: 'dod med 'dod pa'i lcags kyus gzung //
analyzed: 'dod med 'dod pa'i lcags kyus gzung //
translated: without desire, the hook of desire grasps,

original: khas len med par khas len pa'i //
analyzed: khas len med par khas len pa'i //
translated: without acceptance, acceptance

original: kun slong sgyu ma'i zhags pas bcings //üîΩzhes pa'o // de ltar sems nyid don dam pa bden pa'i dngos @60b bo bkag cing myong ba tsam du grub pa spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba de nyid /
analyzed: kun slong sgyu ma'i zhags pas bcings // zhes pa'o // de ltar sems nyid don dam pa bden pa'i dngos @60b bo bkag cing myong ba tsam du grub pa spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba de nyid /
translated: is bound by the illusory noose of motivation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por ston cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por ston cing /
translated: Thus, the ultimate truth of mind itself is negated as a real entity, and that very [mind] which is established as mere experience, free from conceptual elaborations and luminous, is taught to be the essence of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: de sbyong bar byed pa lam gyi rim pa la sogs pa ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sbyong bar byed pa lam gyi rim pa la sogs pa ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The stages of the path which purify that will be taught below.

original: 'dir shes par bya ba'i don bsdus te bstan pa ni de dag tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'dir shes par bya ba'i don bsdus te bstan pa ni de dag tsam du zad do //
translated: Here, the meaning to be understood is taught in just that way.

original: da ni gzhung nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gzhung nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Now, we will enter into the text itself.

original: de la chos med pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos med pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the non-existent phenomena?

original: gang de dag bdag nyid du ma red pa yin te zhes pa'i don ni rgyu dang yon tan la sogs par snang ba de dag dngos po'i bdag nyid du ma red pa ste /
analyzed: gang de dag bdag nyid du ma red pa yin te zhes pa'i don ni rgyu dang yon tan la sogs par snang ba de dag dngos po'i bdag nyid du ma red pa ste /
translated: Those which are not established as their own nature. The meaning of that is: those which appear as causes, qualities, etc. are not established as the nature of things.

original: de 'dra ba'i dngos po ma yin zhing med do zhes dgag pa'i rnam pa can du rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo'i mdun na gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i dngos po ma yin zhing med do zhes dgag pa'i rnam pa can du rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo'i mdun na gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those which are not such things, which are non-existent, are the ones which stand before the mind which has the aspect of negation, which has the form ‚ÄúThey do not exist.‚Äù

original: gal te chos dang chos med pa de rnams dgag pa'i rten gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chos dang chos med pa de rnams dgag pa'i rten gang yin zhe na /
translated: If phenomena and non-phenomena are the bases of negation, what are they?

original: mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba med pa'i chos don gyi rgyu las byung ba de dag ces pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba med pa'i chos don gyi rgyu las byung ba de dag ces pa ste /
translated: They are those which arise from the cause of the object, the non-movement of the conceptual thought of characteristics.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang so so rang gis rig pa rnams so /üîΩde la yang dag pa ste chos kyi dngos po bden pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang so so rang gis rig pa rnams so / de la yang dag pa ste chos kyi dngos po bden pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The dependent, which is like an illusion, is perceived by oneself.

original: chos med par blos brtags shing rtog pa 'jug pa med par mthong nas /
analyzed: chos med par blos brtags shing rtog pa 'jug pa med par mthong nas /
translated: Here, the real, i.e., the true entity of a thing, and the unreal, i.e., the non-entity of a thing, are seen as not being the domain of conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir chos med par rnam par rtog pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos med par rnam par rtog pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the conceptualization of the non-entity of a thing is abandoned.

original: 'dir chos smos pa ni zhar la byung ba tsam du zad do //üîΩmtshan nyid ni gzhig cing //
analyzed: 'dir chos smos pa ni zhar la byung ba tsam du zad do // mtshan nyid ni gzhig cing //
translated: Here, the mention of the entity of a thing is merely a digression.

original: gzhom du rung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhom du rung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristic is that it can be destroyed and overcome, etc.

original: yang dag nyid du me red pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos med pa'i rnam grangs gzhan ston te /
analyzed: yang dag nyid du me red pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos med pa'i rnam grangs gzhan ston te /
translated: The real, etc. shows another synonym for the non-entity of a thing.

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tsam du yang med pa nyid du grags pa ri bong gi rva la sogs par brtags pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tsam du yang med pa nyid du grags pa ri bong gi rva la sogs par brtags pa'o //
translated: It is imagined in the non-existent itself, which is known as non-existent even in the mere correct convention, such as the horn of a rabbit, etc.

original: dpyod pa'i don ni blo'i snang ba tsam mo //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i don ni blo'i snang ba tsam mo //
translated: The meaning of analysis is merely the appearance of the mind.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ltar mngon par chags pas ni ma yin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ltar mngon par chags pas ni ma yin zhes pa ni /
translated: It is not like a pot, etc., by attachment.

original: de dag 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu don byed par snang pas /
analyzed: de dag 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu don byed par snang pas /
translated: Since they appear to function in the world's relative,üîΩthey are posited as existent.

original: yod par 'jog pa ltar ri bong gi rva la sogs par snang ba ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yod par 'jog pa ltar ri bong gi rva la sogs par snang ba ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: They are not like the appearance of a rabbit's horns and so forth.

original: gal te chos dang chos med pa rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin zhing spang bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur ba de lta na /
analyzed: gal te chos dang chos med pa rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin zhing spang bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur ba de lta na /
translated: If phenomena and non-phenomena are the objects of conceptualization and are to be abandoned,

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid yod cing spang bar bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid yod cing spang bar bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: then is not conceptualization itself existent and to be abandoned?

original: ji ltar de dag ces pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag ces pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the lines beginning with Just like those...

original: chos dang chos med pa de dag ma 'khrul pa'i shes pas gzung du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos dang chos med pa de dag ma 'khrul pa'i shes pas gzung du med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since those phenomena and non-phenomena are not apprehended by non-mistaken consciousness,

original: spang bar bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: they are to be abandoned.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po @61a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po @61a * //
translated: Likewise, the entities of conceptualization

original: rnams kyang spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rnams kyang spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: are also to be abandoned.

original: de ni brtag bya la ltos nas 'jog pa dang / chos dang chos med pa nyid du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni brtag bya la ltos nas 'jog pa dang / chos dang chos med pa nyid du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is posited in dependence on the object of investigation and is included within phenomena and non-phenomena.

original: de'i phyir zhes pa la sogs bas ni don bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes pa la sogs bas ni don bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: The summary of the meaning is taught in the lines beginning with Therefore...

original: gang yang lang ka'i bdag po zhes pa la sogs pas 'bod 'grogs la tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas gdams pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang lang ka'i bdag po zhes pa la sogs pas 'bod 'grogs la tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas gdams pa'o //
translated: The phrase O lord of Lanka and so forth is an address and instruction through another method.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis kyi sgo nas ston pa las /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis kyi sgo nas ston pa las /
translated: Moreover, it is taught through two aspects.

original: dang por sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la gdams pa ste /
analyzed: dang por sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la gdams pa ste /
translated: First, there is the instruction on the nature of the buddhas.

original: de la sngon zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i tshig bla dags te zhes pa'i don ni 'das pa'i don gyi spyi'i rnam par rtog pas brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de la sngon zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i tshig bla dags te zhes pa'i don ni 'das pa'i don gyi spyi'i rnam par rtog pas brtags pa ste /
translated: In that regard, before is a term imputed by thought. The meaning of imputed is a general imputation by thought of the meaning of the past.

original: de yang sngar bstan pa ltar rtog pa nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pas rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de yang sngar bstan pa ltar rtog pa nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pas rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Moreover, since it is the nature of thought, as previously explained, it is thought.

original: de 'dra ba ston byed kyi tshig glo bur du brdar gdags pas bla dags zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ston byed kyi tshig glo bur du brdar gdags pas bla dags zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is a term that suddenly designates a conventional term that reveals such a thought, it is called imputed.

original: 'das pa zhes pa la sogs pas rtog pa de nyid kyi rnam grangs ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa zhes pa la sogs pas rtog pa de nyid kyi rnam grangs ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase the past and so on teaches the synonyms of that thought.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: The phrase the tathƒÅgatas and so on teaches the nature of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang / khyod kyis 'das pa la sogs par rnam par brtags pa'i mi mthun pa nyid du ston te //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang / khyod kyis 'das pa la sogs par rnam par brtags pa'i mi mthun pa nyid du ston te //
translated: The nature of the Tathagata is shown to be the very opposite of what you imagine it to be in the past, etc.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni dbyings dang ye shes dbyer med pa'i chos nyid yin pas rtog pa dang / brtag par bya ba'i spros pa las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni dbyings dang ye shes dbyer med pa'i chos nyid yin pas rtog pa dang / brtag par bya ba'i spros pa las 'das pa ste /
translated: Its nature is the reality of the realm of Dharma and wisdom inseparable, and so it is beyond the conceptual and the conceptualized.

original: ji ltar byis pa'i skye bo'i gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhes brtags shing rtog pa lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa'i skye bo'i gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo la 'di dang 'di lta bu zhes brtags shing rtog pa lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not like the way childish beings imagine the nature of form, etc.

original: de las gzhan du so so rang rig pa'i ye shes mngon du mdzad pa /
analyzed: de las gzhan du so so rang rig pa'i ye shes mngon du mdzad pa /
translated: It is otherwise, being the direct realization of the wisdom of individual self-awareness.

original: zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i don du zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i don du zhes pa ste /
translated: It is for the sake of undefiled bliss.

original: de 'dra ba'i don la mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par bsgom pa ni mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i don la mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par bsgom pa ni mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: The meditation of the wisdom that is the practice of signlessness with regard to such an object is the abiding in the manner of non-movement.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin de ltar yin pa de'i phyir de ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid ye shes kyi sku ste brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin de ltar yin pa de'i phyir de ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid ye shes kyi sku ste brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: Because the nature of the Tathagata is such, it is the body of wisdom, the nature of wisdom, and should not be imagined.

original: gang gis mi brtag ce na /
analyzed: gang gis mi brtag ce na /
translated: By whom should it not be imagined?

original: yid kyis te /
analyzed: yid kyis te /
translated: By the mind.

original: de nyid rgyas par ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par ston pa ni /
translated: This is being taught in detail.

original: yul gyi don gyi rgyu las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi don gyi rgyu las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The mind consciousness that arises from the cause of the object.

original: de yang tha snyad tsam du don du snang ba dang / dngos sam brgyud pa'i sgo nas 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de yang tha snyad tsam du don du snang ba dang / dngos sam brgyud pa'i sgo nas 'brel pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is merely a convention, the appearance of an object, and is related to it either directly or indirectly.üîΩIn what way should it not be imagined?

original: ji ltar mi brtag ce na zhes pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ji ltar mi brtag ce na zhes pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The meaning of this is twofold.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gang zag gi bdag tu mi brtag pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gang zag gi bdag tu mi brtag pa ni /
translated: The Tathagata should not be imagined as a self of persons.

original: bdag dang srog dang gang @61b zag tu mi brtag go zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang srog dang gang @61b zag tu mi brtag go zhes pa'o //
translated: He should not be imagined as a self, a life-force, or a person.

original: de la nga rgyal srung ba'i don gyis na bdag ste de las nga rgyal bskyed cing srung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nga rgyal srung ba'i don gyis na bdag ste de las nga rgyal bskyed cing srung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, a self is that which protects the sense of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù It is so called because pride is generated from it and it protects it.

original: srog gi dbang po'i stobs kyis rigs mthun pa'i skal ba yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du gnas par byed pas na srog go //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po'i stobs kyis rigs mthun pa'i skal ba yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du gnas par byed pas na srog go //
translated: Life is that which causes one to remain for as long as one‚Äôs life force is strong, until the complete exhaustion of one‚Äôs share of life.

original: dge mi dge la sogs pa'i las la brten cing khams gsum du zag par byed pas gang zag ces pa ste /
analyzed: dge mi dge la sogs pa'i las la brten cing khams gsum du zag par byed pas gang zag ces pa ste /
translated: The person is so called because it is based on virtuous and nonvirtuous actions and it flows into the three realms.

original: thams cad gang zag gi rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad gang zag gi rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: All of these are included in the categories of the person.

original: ji ltar gzugs kyi zhes pa la sogs pas de la chos kyi bdag tu mi brtag pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs kyi zhes pa la sogs pas de la chos kyi bdag tu mi brtag pa ste /
translated: The nonconceptuality of the self of phenomena is taught by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe form skandha is not to be viewed as the self, etc.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzhig cing gzhom du rung ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzhig cing gzhom du rung ba ste /
translated: The defining characteristic of form is that it can be destroyed and defeated.

original: de la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung po zhes pa la sogs pa dang / dbyibs te sku ni n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab ces pa la sogs pa dang kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam par mi brtag ces pa ste /
analyzed: de la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung po zhes pa la sogs pa dang / dbyibs te sku ni n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab ces pa la sogs pa dang kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam par mi brtag ces pa ste /
translated: One should not view it as the self, as in the case of the statement ‚ÄúDrawing blood with an evil mind, etc.,‚Äù or as the body, as in the case of the statement ‚ÄúThe body is like a banyan tree in height and spread,‚Äù or as color, etc.

original: don 'di nyid mdo sde gzhan las kyang gsungs te sngar bstan par zad do //
analyzed: don 'di nyid mdo sde gzhan las kyang gsungs te sngar bstan par zad do //
translated: This very point is taught in other s≈´tras, as has been previously indicated.

original: de bas na zhes pa la sogs pas skabs kyi don bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes pa la sogs pas skabs kyi don bsdus pa'o //
translated: Thus, etc. summarizes the topic.

original: lang ka'i bdag po zhes pa la sogs pas 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po zhes pa la sogs pas 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin la gdams pa'o //
translated: The statement Lord of Lanka, etc. is the instruction on the nature of mundane phenomena.

original: sems can gyi spyod pa ni sems kyi snang ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: sems can gyi spyod pa ni sems kyi snang ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The conduct of sentient beings are the phenomena of the appearances of the mind.

original: de rnams ni rtsig pa'i ri mo'i gzugs la mthon dman med kyang mthon dman du snang ba dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni rtsig pa'i ri mo'i gzugs la mthon dman med kyang mthon dman du snang ba dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Those are like the forms of a mural, which do not have high and low, but appear as high and low.

original: 'jig rten gnas zhes pa ni phung po lngas bsdus pa'i 'jig rten kun rdzob tu gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gnas zhes pa ni phung po lngas bsdus pa'i 'jig rten kun rdzob tu gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: The statement the world abides is this conventional world subsumed by the five aggregates.

original: de kho na nyid du sems ba'i g-yo ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du sems ba'i g-yo ba med pa ste /
translated: It is without the movement of the mind that thinks in terms of reality.
