original: de nyid kyi phyir des kun nas bslang ba'i lus ngag gi las dang byed pas te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir des kun nas bslang ba'i lus ngag gi las dang byed pas te /
translated: Therefore, it is the karma of body and speech that is motivated by that, and the activity.

original: phyi rol pas brtags pa'i sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: phyi rol pas brtags pa'i sgrub par byed pa /
translated: It is the proof that is imagined by the non-Buddhists.

original: byed pa po'i gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ba dang / rang nyid bya ba dang ldan pa dang gtsor gyur pa'i bsgrub bya la nye bar sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: byed pa po'i gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ba dang / rang nyid bya ba dang ldan pa dang gtsor gyur pa'i bsgrub bya la nye bar sbyor ba ste /
translated: It is the other-dependent in terms of the agent, it is the one that is endowed with the action, and it is the one that is applied to the principal object to be accomplished.

original: ji ltar sta res shing gcod pa'i bya ba byed pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar sta res shing gcod pa'i bya ba byed pa na /
translated: For example, when an axe performs the action of cutting a tree,

original: byed pa po skyes bu gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa dang / rang nyid gyen du lding ba dang thur du 'bab pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa dang gtsor gyur pa'i bsgrub bya shing dum bur byed pa la sbyor ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: byed pa po skyes bu gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa dang / rang nyid gyen du lding ba dang thur du 'bab pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa dang gtsor gyur pa'i bsgrub bya shing dum bur byed pa la sbyor ba lta bu'o //
translated: the agent, the person, is other-dependent, it is endowed with the action of rising up and falling down, and it is applied to the principal object to be accomplished, the cutting of the tree.

original: yang sangs rgyas rnams ni de 'dra ba'i byed ba dang bral mod kyi gang gi mjug thogs su gang skye bar nges pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don dam par 'dod de de 'dra ba'i byed pa dang yang bral ba'o //üîΩ'di la zhes pa la @62a * //
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas rnams ni de 'dra ba'i byed ba dang bral mod kyi gang gi mjug thogs su gang skye bar nges pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don dam par 'dod de de 'dra ba'i byed pa dang yang bral ba'o // 'di la zhes pa la @62a * //
translated: Although the buddhas are free from such action, they are asserted to be ultimate dependent origination, in that they are the dependent origination in which whatever arises definitely arises in immediate succession to something else, and they are free from such action.

original: sogs pas de nyid kyi phyogs gcig pa'i dpe ston te /
analyzed: sogs pas de nyid kyi phyogs gcig pa'i dpe ston te /
translated: The example of one part of that is taught by ‚ÄúThis‚Äù and so on.

original: de bzhin du lta ba 'am blta bar bya ba la sogs pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lta ba 'am blta bar bya ba la sogs pa med ces pa'o //
translated: Likewise, there is no seeing or the seen, etc.

original: gal te de lta na de dag tshad ma la snang ba mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na de dag tshad ma la snang ba mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If it is like that, then it is not tenable that they appear in valid cognition.

original: 'jig rten gnas pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste shes par zad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gnas pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste shes par zad do //
translated: The world abides, etc.

original: lang ka'i bdag po zhes pa la sogs pas gdams pa'i don rtogs pa'i phan yon ston te /
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po zhes pa la sogs pas gdams pa'i don rtogs pa'i phan yon ston te /
translated: The benefit of realizing the meaning of the instruction is shown by the passage beginning ‚ÄúLord of Lanka,‚Äù etc.

original: mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang 'ga' yang mthong ba med pa ni de kho na nyid mthong ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang 'ga' yang mthong ba med pa ni de kho na nyid mthong ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: In other sutras also it is said that ‚Äúno one sees anything is seeing reality.‚Äù

original: de las gzhan du mthong ba phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de las gzhan du mthong ba phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa la spyod cing /
translated: Seeing otherwise is engaging in the conceptualization of error.

original: de nyid kyis gzung 'dzin gnyis su yang rtog ste ;
analyzed: de nyid kyis gzung 'dzin gnyis su yang rtog ste ;
translated: By that very fact, one also conceives of the duality of subject and object.

original: ji ltar gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang / de 'jog par byed pa gzugs kyi dngos po gnyis med pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang / de 'jog par byed pa gzugs kyi dngos po gnyis med pa la /
translated: Just as in a reflection, etc., there are not two things, the reflection and the thing reflected.

original: de lta bur rtog pa dang mtshungs par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la bdag gi rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba rab tu gzung zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bur rtog pa dang mtshungs par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la bdag gi rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba rab tu gzung zhes pa ste /
translated: In the same way, all phenomena such as form are apprehended as the object of the conception of self.

original: de phyin ci log gi snang ba nyid du ma shes par phyi rol tha dad pa'i ngo bor gzung ste /
analyzed: de phyin ci log gi snang ba nyid du ma shes par phyi rol tha dad pa'i ngo bor gzung ste /
translated: Not knowing that this is an erroneous appearance, they are apprehended as having the nature of external, separate things.

original: chos dang chos min par rnam par rtog ces pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos min par rnam par rtog ces pa'o //
translated: They are conceptualized as being virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: bdag gi lus kyi grib ma zhes pa ni 'od kyi khyad par de dag la lus kyi grib ma snang ba ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyis stong yang byis pa dag de lta bur rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus kyi grib ma zhes pa ni 'od kyi khyad par de dag la lus kyi grib ma snang ba ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyis stong yang byis pa dag de lta bur rtog pa'o //
translated: The shadow of the body is the appearance of the special light of those [objects] as the shadow of the body. Even though it is empty of the obstructed body, fools conceive of it in that way.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa ni de rnams dang mtshungs pa'i don gzhan yang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa ni de rnams dang mtshungs pa'i don gzhan yang zhes pa'o //
translated: Moreover means another object similar to those.

original: spong ba la mi spyod ces pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar lhag mthong gi shes rab kyis de rnams stong pa nyid du rtogs shing sgom par mi byed ces pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba la mi spyod ces pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar lhag mthong gi shes rab kyis de rnams stong pa nyid du rtogs shing sgom par mi byed ces pa'o //
translated: Not engaging in abandonment means, as previously explained, not realizing and meditating on those as emptiness through the wisdom of vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

original: spyod do zhes pa la sogs pas ni de las bzlog pa'i mtshan ma la spyod ces pa ste /
analyzed: spyod do zhes pa la sogs pas ni de las bzlog pa'i mtshan ma la spyod ces pa ste /
translated: The phrase one engages in the signs that are the opposite of those refers to the opposite of those.

original: gcig gis gcig bshad ba 'am rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gis gcig bshad ba 'am rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: One explains the other or they belong to a category.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i ye shes brnyes pas don gcig rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas ston mkhyen te /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i ye shes brnyes pas don gcig rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas ston mkhyen te /
translated: Moreover, since the Tathagata has attained the wisdom of the analytical knowledge of phenomena, he knows how to teach the same topic through many synonyms.

original: de'i dgos pa yang de'i tshe nye bar gyur pa'i gdul bya rnams la 'ga' zhig ni dbang po rtul zhing rnam par g-yengs pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i dgos pa yang de'i tshe nye bar gyur pa'i gdul bya rnams la 'ga' zhig ni dbang po rtul zhing rnam par g-yengs pa yin la /
translated: The purpose of that is that at that time, some disciples are of dull faculties and distracted,

original: 'ga' zhig ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: while others are the opposite.

original: de la don gcig ming gi rnam grangs mi 'dra ba'i sgo nas bstan pas /
analyzed: de la don gcig ming gi rnam grangs mi 'dra ba'i sgo nas bstan pas /
translated: Thus, by teaching the same topic through different synonyms,

original: dbang po rtul zhing g-yengs pa rnams kyis kyang tshig gang yang rung ba cig zin pas don gyi bya ba byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dbang po rtul zhing g-yengs pa rnams kyis kyang tshig gang yang rung ba cig zin pas don gyi bya ba byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: even those of dull faculties and distracted minds will accomplish the purpose of the teaching by understanding any one of the words.

original: dbang po @62b rno zhing ma g-yengs pa rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa la mnga' brnyes pa nyid du rtogs pas gus pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po @62b rno zhing ma g-yengs pa rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa la mnga' brnyes pa nyid du rtogs pas gus pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those of sharp faculties and undistracted minds will also come to respect it, realizing that the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs word is authoritative.

original: de las gzhan du tshig gcig tsam gsungs na ni 'ga' zhig gis gzung bar mi nus shing /
analyzed: de las gzhan du tshig gcig tsam gsungs na ni 'ga' zhig gis gzung bar mi nus shing /
translated: If he had taught only a single word, some would be unable to grasp it.

original: tshig mthun pa du ma bstan na yang gzhan dag ma gus par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshig mthun pa du ma bstan na yang gzhan dag ma gus par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And even if he had taught many words, others would become disrespectful.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i rang bzhin can gyi gzhung 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba rnams kyang 'di bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i rang bzhin can gyi gzhung 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba rnams kyang 'di bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The texts that have this kind of nature will be taught later on. They should be understood in the same way.

original: rab tu zhi ba ni phyin ci log spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba ni phyin ci log spangs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPeace‚Äù means the abandonment of error.

original: de ltar ston pa'i gzhung 'di tshig rtse gcig pa ste nges pa don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: de ltar ston pa'i gzhung 'di tshig rtse gcig pa ste nges pa don gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: Thus, this text that teaches in this way is of definitive meaning, a s≈´tra of definitive meaning.

original: de la brten nas thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la 'jug ces pa ste shes par zad do //
analyzed: de la brten nas thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la 'jug ces pa ste shes par zad do //
translated: Based on it, one enters into the TathƒÅgata essence through the stages of the knowledge that comes from hearing and reflection.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i 'grel pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i rgyan las 'bod 'grogs kyis gsol ba btab pa'i le'u ste dang po'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i 'grel pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i rgyan las 'bod 'grogs kyis gsol ba btab pa'i le'u ste dang po'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the first chapter of the commentary on the Ornament of the TathƒÅgata Essence, the Entry into the Bodhisattva‚Äôs Way of Life, called ‚ÄúThe Supplication of the One Who Is Called.‚Äù

original: // / de ltar gdul bya'i gtso bos zhus pa'i lan du brjod bya'i don bsdus te bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar gdul bya'i gtso bos zhus pa'i lan du brjod bya'i don bsdus te bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the summarized meaning of the subject matter in response to the request of the principal disciple,

original: gdul bya rnams kyi the tshom so sor bsal ba'i don du le'u lhag ma rnams kyis don de nyid rgyas par ston pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi the tshom so sor bsal ba'i don du le'u lhag ma rnams kyis don de nyid rgyas par ston pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: in order to clear away the individual doubts of the disciples, the remaining chapters extensively teach that very meaning in two parts:

original: zhus pa dang lan no //
analyzed: zhus pa dang lan no //
translated: the question and the answer.

original: de la zhu ba ni rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la zhu ba ni rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas shes par bya ste /
translated: The question should be understood in terms of four aspects:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bstod pa dang / dri ba'i tshig mdor bsdus te bstan pa dang / bshad bar skabs dbye ba dang / dri ba'i tshig rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bstod pa dang / dri ba'i tshig mdor bsdus te bstan pa dang / bshad bar skabs dbye ba dang / dri ba'i tshig rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: the praise of the TathƒÅgata, the concise teaching of the words of the question, the request to explain, and the extensive teaching of the words of the question.

original: de la dang po ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de la dang po ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pas ston te /
translated: The first is taught by ‚ÄúThen, the Bodhisattva MahƒÅmati‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: zhing thams cad du rgyu ba ni /
analyzed: zhing thams cad du rgyu ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúMoving in all realms‚Äù means

original: mtha' yas 'jig rten khams rnams su //
analyzed: mtha' yas 'jig rten khams rnams su //
translated: In infinite world systems,

original: mkhas pa gang phyir rgyu bar byed //
analyzed: mkhas pa gang phyir rgyu bar byed //
translated: the wise one moves about.

original: ces pa la sogs pa gleng gzhi'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa gleng gzhi'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand this as it is taught in the Introduction Chapter.

original: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa ni 'phags pa sdong pos brgyan pa las nor bzangs kyis 'jam dpal la bstod pa /
analyzed: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa ni 'phags pa sdong pos brgyan pa las nor bzangs kyis 'jam dpal la bstod pa /
translated: Again, ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati‚Äù is said to be ƒÄrya Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, because in the ƒÄrya-sƒÅrdha-≈õma-≈õƒÅna-ala·πÖkƒÅra-nƒÅma-dhƒÅra·πáƒ´, Sudhana praises Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´:

original: blo gros chen po mtha' yas spyod yul can //
analyzed: blo gros chen po mtha' yas spyod yul can //
translated: MahƒÅmati, with infinite range of activity,

original: zhes gsungs pas 'phags pa 'jam dpal yin zhes kyang grag go //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas 'phags pa 'jam dpal yin zhes kyang grag go //
translated: Thus, it is said that he is ƒÄrya Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.

original: ga la ba de logs su zhes pa ni gang na bzhugs pa'i phyogs der ro //
analyzed: ga la ba de logs su zhes pa ni gang na bzhugs pa'i phyogs der ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTo that place‚Äù means to the direction where he resides.

original: 'dir bstod pa'i tshig nye bar 'god pa la /üîΩmtshan ma med pas rtag tu dag / ces pa'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa la spangs @63a * //
analyzed: 'dir bstod pa'i tshig nye bar 'god pa la / mtshan ma med pas rtag tu dag / ces pa'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa la spangs @63a * //
translated: Here, in the arrangement of the words of praise,

original: pa dang ye shes kyi cha nas bstod pa yin la /
analyzed: pa dang ye shes kyi cha nas bstod pa yin la /
translated: up to ‚Äúalways pure by being without signs‚Äù is a praise of the TathƒÅgata from the point of view of abandonment and wisdom.

original: de man chad kyis ni dbyings kyi cha la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de man chad kyis ni dbyings kyi cha la bstod pa'o //
translated: From there on is a praise of the aspect of the dhƒÅtu.

original: de ltar skye 'jig spangs pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas ni yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin rtog pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: de ltar skye 'jig spangs pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas ni yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin rtog pa'i phan yon no //
translated: Thus, the benefits of understanding the Buddha-nature which has such qualities are as follows.

original: de las dang po'i don bshad pa la /
analyzed: de las dang po'i don bshad pa la /
translated: The meaning of the first line is as follows.

original: 'jig rten skye 'jig ma mchis te //
analyzed: 'jig rten skye 'jig ma mchis te //
translated: The world is not subject to origination and destruction,

original: nam mkha'i me tog rab tu 'dra //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog rab tu 'dra //
translated: Just like a sky-flower.

original: zhes pa'i don ni phung po lngas bsdus pa'i 'jig rten skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du byis pas brtags pa rnams ni nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra zhes pa ste //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don ni phung po lngas bsdus pa'i 'jig rten skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du byis pas brtags pa rnams ni nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra zhes pa ste //
translated: The world, which is included in the five aggregates, is imagined by the childish to be subject to origination and destruction.

original: ye shes kyi yul bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi yul bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the object of wisdom.

original: gal te ye shes kyis de ltar mkhyen na med pa'i mthar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ye shes kyis de ltar mkhyen na med pa'i mthar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If wisdom knows in this way, it will become the extreme of non-existence.

original: khyod kyi shes rab thugs rje yis //
analyzed: khyod kyi shes rab thugs rje yis //
translated: Your wisdom and compassion

original: khyod kyis yod dam med ma dmigs //
analyzed: khyod kyis yod dam med ma dmigs //
translated: Do not apprehend existence or non-existence.

original: zhes pa ste sngar bstan pa ltar /
analyzed: zhes pa ste sngar bstan pa ltar /
translated: As was previously explained,

original: rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i don dam pa shes pa'i shes rab kyi yul des bsdus pa'i 'jig rten de kho na nyid du yod par mi dmigs shing snang ba tsam du med par mi dmigs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i don dam pa shes pa'i shes rab kyi yul des bsdus pa'i 'jig rten de kho na nyid du yod par mi dmigs shing snang ba tsam du med par mi dmigs zhes pa'o //
translated: The world included in the object of the wisdom which knows the ultimate, the union of awareness and emptiness, does not exist in reality, and does not not exist as mere appearance.

original: gzhan yang dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rjes kyang de bzhin du yod pa dang med par ma dmigs zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rjes kyang de bzhin du yod pa dang med par ma dmigs zhes pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the world included in the object of nonreferential compassion does not exist in reality, and does not not exist as mere appearance.

original: bden pa gnyis la ltos nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la ltos nas bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught in terms of the two realities.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na shes rab kyis ni 'jig rten yod par ma dmigs la thugs rjes med par ma dmigs zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na shes rab kyis ni 'jig rten yod par ma dmigs la thugs rjes med par ma dmigs zhes pa ste /
translated: In another way, the world is not found to exist by wisdom, and is not found not to exist by compassion.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtha' mngon du mi byed par kun rdzob tu 'jig rten blos dmigs shing sdug bsngal las grol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtha' mngon du mi byed par kun rdzob tu 'jig rten blos dmigs shing sdug bsngal las grol bar byed pa'o //
translated: Without realizing the extreme of emptiness, the world is mentally found in the relative and is freed from suffering.

original: yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi mtha' dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi mtha' dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of being free from the extremes of existence and nonexistence,

original: chos rnams thams cad sgyu ma bzhin //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad sgyu ma bzhin //
translated: all phenomena are like illusions.

original: sems dang rnam par shes pa spangs //
analyzed: sems dang rnam par shes pa spangs //
translated: They are free from mind and consciousness.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: chos thams cad sems kyi rnam phar 'khrul pa yin pas sems nyid yin la /
analyzed: chos thams cad sems kyi rnam phar 'khrul pa yin pas sems nyid yin la /
translated: All phenomena are the manifestations of the mind, and therefore they are the mind itself.

original: de yang sgyu ma lta bu ste sngar rgyas par bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang sgyu ma lta bu ste sngar rgyas par bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, they are like an illusion, as has been extensively taught above.

original: de la sems dang rnam par shes pa ni go rims bzhin du kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o /
analyzed: de la sems dang rnam par shes pa ni go rims bzhin du kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o /
translated: In this regard, mind and consciousness are the fundamental consciousness and the operative consciousnesses, respectively.

original: yang na rnam grangs nyid du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam grangs nyid du gtogs pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, they are included in the enumeration of the eight collections of consciousness.

original: spangs zhes ba ni bden pa'i dngos por ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: spangs zhes ba ni bden pa'i dngos por ma grub pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Abandoned‚Äù means that they are not established as real things.

original: yang na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad sems las byung ba dang bcas pa rnams bag chags dang bcas te gnas gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad sems las byung ba dang bcas pa rnams bag chags dang bcas te gnas gyur pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the eight collections of consciousness together with the mental factors are transformed together with their habitual tendencies.

original: de ltar khyad par du sgro 'dogs pa'i rten sems kyi ngo bo nyid dang / @63b der rtogs pa spangs pas khyad par du sgro 'dogs pa med cing de nyid kyis skur pa'i mtha' las kyang grol bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar khyad par du sgro 'dogs pa'i rten sems kyi ngo bo nyid dang / @63b der rtogs pa spangs pas khyad par du sgro 'dogs pa med cing de nyid kyis skur pa'i mtha' las kyang grol bar ston pa ni /
translated: Thus, the essence of the mind, which is the basis for the superimposition of the distinction, is realized. By abandoning the distinction, the superimposition is removed, and by that very fact, the extreme of denial is also overcome. This is taught by the following:

original: khyod kyi shes rab thugs rje yis //
analyzed: khyod kyi shes rab thugs rje yis //
translated: Through your wisdom and compassion,

original: khyod kyis yod dang med ma dmigs //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis yod dang med ma dmigs // zhes pa ste /
translated: You do not observe existence and nonexistence.

original: snga ma nyid rjes su brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: snga ma nyid rjes su brjod pa yin la /
translated: This is the same as the previous verse.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'jig rten rtag dang chad pa spangs /
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag dang chad pa spangs /
translated: The world is free from permanence and annihilation.

original: khor zug rmi lam 'dra ba ste //üîΩzhes pa la /
analyzed: khor zug rmi lam 'dra ba ste // zhes pa la /
translated: It is like a dream that is always occurring.

original: dngos yod rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos yod rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur //
translated: If things existed, they would be permanent or impermanent.

original: zhes gsungs pa 'am /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa 'am /
translated: This is what is taught.üîΩüîΩ

original: yang / gal te rang bzhin gyis yod na //
analyzed: yang / gal te rang bzhin gyis yod na //
translated: If they existed essentially,

original: de ni med pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni med pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: They could not become nonexistent.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i tshul du 'jig rten yod par dmigs na rtag pa'i mthar 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i tshul du 'jig rten yod par dmigs na rtag pa'i mthar 'gyur la /
translated: If the world were observed to exist, it would be a case of the extreme of permanence.

original: med par dmigs na yang med pa yod par 'gyur ba mi 'thad pas rtag tu med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir chad pa'i mthar 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: med par dmigs na yang med pa yod par 'gyur ba mi 'thad pas rtag tu med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir chad pa'i mthar 'gyur ba las /
translated: If it were observed to be nonexistent, it would be a case of the extreme of annihilation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yod med kyi mtha' dang bral bar rtogs pas de ltar ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yod med kyi mtha' dang bral bar rtogs pas de ltar ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata, free from the extremes of existence and nonexistence, understands things in a way that is different from that.

original: khor zug ces pa ni lo la sogs pas bsdus pa'i dus khor mor te /
analyzed: khor zug ces pa ni lo la sogs pas bsdus pa'i dus khor mor te /
translated: ‚ÄúAlways occurring‚Äù means that it is included in the time that is measured in years and so forth.

original: rtag tu rmi lam dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu rmi lam dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Always like a dream.

original: de ltar mthar 'dzin pa spangs shing 'jig rten thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra bar sems kyi snang ba tsam du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mthar 'dzin pa spangs shing 'jig rten thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra bar sems kyi snang ba tsam du rtogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, having abandoned the extremes, one realizes that all worlds are like dreams, mere appearances of the mind.üîΩMoreover, through wisdom and compassion, one does not objectify the extremes of existence and nonexistence, and so one realizes the two kinds of no self.

original: yang shes rab dang thugs rjes yod med kyi mthar dmigs pa med pas bdag med pa gnyis rtogs shing de nyid kyis nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: yang shes rab dang thugs rjes yod med kyi mthar dmigs pa med pas bdag med pa gnyis rtogs shing de nyid kyis nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: And by that very fact, one eliminates the obscurations of afflictions and of the knowable, which are the seeds of the two kinds of grasping at self existence.

original: sems ma zhi ba'i ngo bor 'dug pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa shes rab dang thugs rjes mthar thug cing /
analyzed: sems ma zhi ba'i ngo bor 'dug pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa shes rab dang thugs rjes mthar thug cing /
translated: The obscurations of the afflictions are the seeds of the afflictions such as attachment, which are present as the essence of an unsettled mind. The obscurations of the knowable are the seeds of the nonafflicted ignorance, which is the conceptualization of subject and object.

original: de nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa'i ye shes thugs su chud pas sa bon dang bcas te spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa'i ye shes thugs su chud pas sa bon dang bcas te spangs pa'o //
translated: Through wisdom and compassion, one eliminates these two obscurations, together with their seeds, and one realizes the wisdom of signlessness.

original: yang na 'di rnams kyi don ni rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas shes par bya ste //
analyzed: yang na 'di rnams kyi don ni rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas shes par bya ste //
translated: Alternatively, the meaning of these verses can be understood in terms of three aspects.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs par brtags pa'i kun brtags mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med par thugs su chung pa ste /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs par brtags pa'i kun brtags mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med par thugs su chung pa ste /
translated: The first verse shows his understanding of the imagined reality, imagined in terms of production, cessation, etc., as identity-unreality.

original: de yang dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de yang dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: And the Samdhinirmocana says,

original: nam mkha'i me tog ji lta ba de ltar ni /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ji lta ba de ltar ni /
translated: Just as there is no sky-flower,

original: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid pa lta bar bya'o zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid pa lta bar bya'o zhes gsungs te //
translated: so should one view identity-unreality.

original: de ltar rkang pa dang po gnyis kyis ni yul bstan la /
analyzed: de ltar rkang pa dang po gnyis kyis ni yul bstan la /
translated: Thus, the first two lines show the object,

original: 'og ma gnyis kyis ni yul can ye shes so //
analyzed: 'og ma gnyis kyis ni yul can ye shes so //
translated: and the last two lines show the subject, the intuition.

original: de nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni gzhan dbang skye ba ngo bo nyid med par thugs su chud par ston te /
analyzed: de nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni gzhan dbang skye ba ngo bo nyid med par thugs su chud par ston te /
translated: Then, the next two verses show his understanding of the relative reality as production-unreality.

original: de la tshig rkang pa @64a * //
analyzed: de la tshig rkang pa @64a * //
translated: There, the first two lines

original: dang po gnyis kyis sems dang sems las byung ba'i gzhan dbang sgyu ma lta bur ston te /
analyzed: dang po gnyis kyis sems dang sems las byung ba'i gzhan dbang sgyu ma lta bur ston te /
translated: show the relative mind and mental functions as illusion-like.

original: ji skad du sgyu ma byas pa ji lta ba de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: ji skad du sgyu ma byas pa ji lta ba de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe dependent nature should be seen as like a magical creation.‚Äù

original: de nas rkang ba gnyis kyis de ltar rtogs pa'i ye shes ston to //
analyzed: de nas rkang ba gnyis kyis de ltar rtogs pa'i ye shes ston to //
translated: The next two lines show the gnosis that realizes that.

original: yang de nas rkang pa gnyis kyis gzhan dbang gi 'jig rten rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba rtag tu rmi lam dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: yang de nas rkang pa gnyis kyis gzhan dbang gi 'jig rten rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba rtag tu rmi lam dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: The next two lines show that the dependent world is free from the extremes of eternalism and nihilism and is always like a dream.

original: sems snang ba tsam zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems snang ba tsam zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mind is mere appearance.

original: de nas rkang pa gnyis kyis de ltar thugs su chud pa'i ye shes ston to //
analyzed: de nas rkang pa gnyis kyis de ltar thugs su chud pa'i ye shes ston to //
translated: The next two lines show the gnosis that understands that.

original: de nas tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis yongs grub don dam pa ngo bo nyid med par thugs su chud cing /
analyzed: de nas tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis yongs grub don dam pa ngo bo nyid med par thugs su chud cing /
translated: The next verse shows that the perfectly established nature is understood to be ultimate and essenceless.

original: ye shes de rnams kyis sgrib pa gnyis spangs par ston to //
analyzed: ye shes de rnams kyis sgrib pa gnyis spangs par ston to //
translated: And it shows that through those gnoses the two obscurations are abandoned.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said,

original: don dam yang dag 'phags /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags /
translated: ParamƒÅrthasamudgata,

original: chos rnams kyi chos bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That absence of self in phenomena of phenomena is called their lack of nature.

original: de ni don dam pa yin la don dam pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pas de'i phyir don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: de ni don dam pa yin la don dam pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pas de'i phyir don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: That is the ultimate, and the ultimate is distinguished by the lack of nature of all phenomena. Therefore, it is called the ultimate lack of nature.

original: de la 'dir /
analyzed: de la 'dir /
translated: Here,üîΩthe selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of persons

original: chos dang gang zag bdag med dang // zhes pa ni shes rab dang thugs rje'i yul yin la /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag bdag med dang // zhes pa ni shes rab dang thugs rje'i yul yin la /
translated: are the objects of wisdom and compassion.

original: de ltar rtogs pas sgrib pa gnyis spang zhes pa ste shes par zad do //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pas sgrib pa gnyis spang zhes pa ste shes par zad do //
translated: By realizing them in that way, the two obscurations are abandoned.

original: dbyings kyi cha la bstod pa yang rkang pa dang po gnyis kyis brtsad pa dgod pa ste /
analyzed: dbyings kyi cha la bstod pa yang rkang pa dang po gnyis kyis brtsad pa dgod pa ste /
translated: The praise of the aspect of the dhƒÅtu also sets forth the challenge in the first two lines.

original: sgyu ma rmi lam rang bzhin gyi chos kyi sku spros pa thams cad dang bral ba la bstod pa mi 'thad de //
analyzed: sgyu ma rmi lam rang bzhin gyi chos kyi sku spros pa thams cad dang bral ba la bstod pa mi 'thad de //
translated: It is not tenable to praise the dharmakƒÅya, which is the nature of illusion and dream, free from all elaborations.

original: bstod pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par brjod pa yin pa las 'dir de 'dra ba'i khyad par grub pa med pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bstod pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par brjod pa yin pa las 'dir de 'dra ba'i khyad par grub pa med pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: Praise is the expression of special qualities, but here there is no such special quality to be established.

original: dngos po'i zhes pa la sogs pas de'i lan ston te /
analyzed: dngos po'i zhes pa la sogs pas de'i lan ston te /
translated: The reply to that is taught by ‚ÄúThe nature of things‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin skye ba la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba la de ltar mi rtog cing spros pa dang bral ba nyid de la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin skye ba la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba la de ltar mi rtog cing spros pa dang bral ba nyid de la bstod pa'o //
translated: The nature of things is free from the elaborations of arising and so forth. Not conceptualizing it in that way, the freedom from elaborations itself is the praise.

original: de ltar na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang mtshungs pas bstod par mi 'gyur ro zhen /
analyzed: de ltar na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang mtshungs pas bstod par mi 'gyur ro zhen /
translated: In that case, since it is similar to the horns of a rabbit and so forth, it will not be praise.üîΩThe reply to that is taught by ‚ÄúFree from the objects of the senses‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: dbang po don dang rnam bral zhing //üîΩsnang med de yi gzigs pa bas //
analyzed: dbang po don dang rnam bral zhing // snang med de yi gzigs pa bas //
translated: Free from the objects of the senses,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: The vision of the nonappearance of that is praised.

original: gzung 'dzin gnyis su snang ba dang bral zhing snang ba med pa'i ye shes so so rang rig gi tshul du mngon du byas pas spros pa dang bral ba med dgag tsam ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin gnyis su snang ba dang bral zhing snang ba med pa'i ye shes so so rang rig gi tshul du mngon du byas pas spros pa dang bral ba med dgag tsam ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Free from the appearance of the duality of percept and perceiver, the nonappearance of that is the wisdom that is realized in the manner of reflexive awareness. It is not a mere nonimplicative negation that is free from elaborations.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ye shes de nyid sgra dang blo'i @64b yul las 'das par ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ye shes de nyid sgra dang blo'i @64b yul las 'das par ston pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that that very intuition is beyond the range of word and thought:

original: gal te bstod dam smad kyang rung //
analyzed: gal te bstod dam smad kyang rung //
translated: Whether praised or disparaged,

original: thub pa de la ji skad brjod //üîΩces pa ste /
analyzed: thub pa de la ji skad brjod // ces pa ste /
translated: what can be said of that Sage?

original: skyon dang yon tan brjod pa'i sgo nas bstod pa dang smad pa ni byis pa rnams kyis rnam par rtog pas brtags pa yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la de 'dra ba med ces pa'o //üîΩmya ngan mi 'da' 'da' la min //
analyzed: skyon dang yon tan brjod pa'i sgo nas bstod pa dang smad pa ni byis pa rnams kyis rnam par rtog pas brtags pa yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la de 'dra ba med ces pa'o // mya ngan mi 'da' 'da' la min //
translated: By the process of expressing faults and virtues, the childish imagine praise and disparagement, but such does not exist in the nature of the Buddha.

original: khyod la mya ngan 'da' mi gnas //
analyzed: khyod la mya ngan 'da' mi gnas //
translated: He does not abide in nirvana, nor does he not abide in nirvana.üîΩHe does not abide in nirvana, nor does he not abide in nirvana.

original: zhes pas ni snying rjes zhi ba la mi gnas pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: zhes pas ni snying rjes zhi ba la mi gnas pa nyid du ston te /
translated: This shows that he does not abide in peace due to compassion.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtha' mngon du byas nas sems can gyi don rgyun mi gcod pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtha' mngon du byas nas sems can gyi don rgyun mi gcod pa'o //
translated: Having realized the limit of emptiness, he does not interrupt the benefit of sentient beings.

original: sprul pa'i sku mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshul ston pa ni /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshul ston pa ni /
translated: The way of manifesting the nirvana of the emanation body is as follows:

original: gdul bya rnams kyis rtag par 'dzin pa spang pa'i don du yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la ni de 'dra ba med do //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyis rtag par 'dzin pa spang pa'i don du yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la ni de 'dra ba med do //
translated: It is for the sake of disciples to abandon their grasping at permanence. But the Buddha-nature is not like that.

original: de ltar yang mdo 'di nyid las //
analyzed: de ltar yang mdo 'di nyid las //
translated: Thus, this very s≈´tra says:

original: mtshan nyid dang ni bya ba dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da' //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni bya ba dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da' //
translated: I do not pass into nirvƒÅ·πáa in terms of characteristics, activities, and entities.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ston to //
translated: This is taught by such passages as this.

original: mdo sde gzhan las kyang //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las kyang //
translated: Also, in other s≈´tras it is said:

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan yod mi 'da' //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan yod mi 'da' //
translated: The Buddha does not pass into nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: This is taught by such passages as this.

original: 'da' la min zhes pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'da' la min zhes pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot in nirvƒÅ·πáa‚Äù means not actualizing the extreme of nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: khyod la mya ngan 'da' mi gnas //
analyzed: khyod la mya ngan 'da' mi gnas //
translated: ‚ÄúYou do not abide in nirvƒÅ·πáa‚Äù

original: zhes pas de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pas de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'o //
translated: This passage clarifies that.

original: blo dang rig pa bgyi dang bral //
analyzed: blo dang rig pa bgyi dang bral //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from the activities of mind and cognition‚Äù

original: yod dang med pa'i phyogs kyang spangs //
analyzed: yod dang med pa'i phyogs kyang spangs //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso abandoned the positions of existence and nonexistence‚Äù

original: zhes pas shes bas srid pa la mi gnas pa'am /
analyzed: zhes pas shes bas srid pa la mi gnas pa'am /
translated: This shows that the mind does not abide in existence.

original: yang de'i rang bzhin shes pa'i yul las 'das shing /
analyzed: yang de'i rang bzhin shes pa'i yul las 'das shing /
translated: Or, the nature of that is beyond the domain of cognition

original: mtha' thams cad dang bral ba nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: mtha' thams cad dang bral ba nyid du bstan te /
translated: and is taught to be free from all extremes.

original: rgyas bar ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas bar ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The extensive explanation will be shown below.

original: de ltar rtogs pa'i phan yon bstan pa ni phal cher shes par zad do //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i phan yon bstan pa ni phal cher shes par zad do //
translated: Thus, the benefits of realizing this have been taught for the most part.

original: chags med nyer len ma mchis pa //
analyzed: chags med nyer len ma mchis pa //
translated: Without attachment, without appropriation,

original: zhes pa ni sred pa dang ma rig pa la sogs pa med pas phung po nyid mtshams 'brel par byed pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sred pa dang ma rig pa la sogs pa med pas phung po nyid mtshams 'brel par byed pa med ces pa'o //
translated: Since craving, ignorance, and so on are absent, the aggregates are not connected.

original: dri ba'i tshig mdor bstan pa ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: dri ba'i tshig mdor bstan pa ni shes par zad do //
translated: The brief explanation of the words of the question is understood.

original: bshad par skabs dbye ba la /
analyzed: bshad par skabs dbye ba la /
translated: The explanation of the opportunity:

original: thams cad 'khor la rnam gzigs nas //
analyzed: thams cad 'khor la rnam gzigs nas //
translated: Having seen the entire retinue,

original: zhes pa ni 'khor rnams 'dul ba'i dus la bab pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'khor rnams 'dul ba'i dus la bab pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is understood that the time has come to tame the retinue.

original: gzhan ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni shes par zad do //
translated: The rest is understood.

original: dri ba'i tshig rgyas par bstan pa la dang por rtog ge'i tshul 'dri ba ni /üîΩji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dri ba'i tshig rgyas par bstan pa la dang por rtog ge'i tshul 'dri ba ni / ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: In the extensive explanation of the words of the question, first, the method of inquiry is asked:üîΩHow is it that the mind is not seen?

original: ji skad du phyi'i don ni kun rdzob tsam du yang med cing snang ba sems kyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: ji skad du phyi'i don ni kun rdzob tsam du yang med cing snang ba sems kyi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: As it is said, external objects do not exist even as mere convention, and appearances are the nature of the mind.

original: don dam par sems kyang med na de bzhin @65a * //
analyzed: don dam par sems kyang med na de bzhin @65a * //
translated: If ultimately mind does not exist,üîΩ

original: gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'tshang rgya ba'i tshul ma bstan pa'i sngon rol lam /
analyzed: gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'tshang rgya ba'i tshul ma bstan pa'i sngon rol lam /
translated: If ultimately there is no mind, then prior to the demonstration of the way of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs enlightenment in the world,

original: sangs rgyas nas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nas kyang rung ste /
translated: or even after the Buddha‚Äôs enlightenment,

original: chos kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba med par rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig la brten nas shes bya rnams la dpyod cing 'jal ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba med par rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig la brten nas shes bya rnams la dpyod cing 'jal ba ni /
translated: without seeing the nature of phenomena as it is, the analysis and evaluation of objects of knowledge based on some reason is

original: rtog ge zhes pa ste tha snyad pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yin la /
analyzed: rtog ge zhes pa ste tha snyad pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yin la /
translated: called ‚Äúlogic,‚Äù which is conventional direct perception and inference.

original: de nyid rnam par dag pa ni de kho na nyid gzigs pa'i lung la brten nas mngon sum la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dag pa ni de kho na nyid gzigs pa'i lung la brten nas mngon sum la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa /
translated: The pure form of that is the presentation of the characteristics of direct perception and so on based on the scriptures that see suchness.

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi gtsug lag ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi gtsug lag ste /
translated: That is the sacred teaching of the Buddhists.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gzugs shes pa'i shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gzugs shes pa'i shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: As the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMonks, there are two types of consciousness that perceive form.

original: mig dang de'i rjes su byung ba'i yod do zhes pa la sogs pas mngon sum gyi rnam par dbye ba dang / gzhan yang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pas de'i mtshan nyid rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa yang gsungs te /
analyzed: mig dang de'i rjes su byung ba'i yod do zhes pa la sogs pas mngon sum gyi rnam par dbye ba dang / gzhan yang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pas de'i mtshan nyid rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa yang gsungs te /
translated: The passage eye consciousness and so on and the passage it exists and so on indicate the classification of direct perception. The passage one knows blue through possessing eye consciousness but does not think 'This is blue' and so on indicates that its definition is free from thought and nonerroneous.

original: de la brten nas mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang / de'i yul gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rdul phra rab la sogs pa du ma bsdus pa'i rang bzhin gyi phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: de la brten nas mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang / de'i yul gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rdul phra rab la sogs pa du ma bsdus pa'i rang bzhin gyi phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang /
translated: Based on that, he speaks of the valid knowledge of direct perception and its objects, such as form and so on, which are the aggregates, sense bases, and so forth that are the nature of many minute particles and so forth.üîΩHe also says:

original: du ba las ni mer shes te /
analyzed: du ba las ni mer shes te /
translated: Fire is known from smoke

original: chu skyar las ni chu yin no //
analyzed: chu skyar las ni chu yin no //
translated: and water from a white crane.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas 'bras bu'i rtags las rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang / de'i yul me la sogs pa rdul phra rab 'dus pa rdzas gcig gi bdag nyid kyis dben pa la sogs pa gsungs shing /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas 'bras bu'i rtags las rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang / de'i yul me la sogs pa rdul phra rab 'dus pa rdzas gcig gi bdag nyid kyis dben pa la sogs pa gsungs shing /
translated: Thus, he taught the valid knowledge of inference that is the realization from the sign of the effect and the object of that, fire and so on, is devoid of the nature of the single substance of the aggregation of subtle particles and so on.

original: yang dge slong dag kun 'byung ba'i chos can gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa'i chos can zhes bya ba'i rtags la brten nas 'du byed skad cig ma nyid du rtogs pa rang bzhin gyi rtags las 'byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa dang / des gzhal bar bya ba nyid gsungs shing /
analyzed: yang dge slong dag kun 'byung ba'i chos can gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa'i chos can zhes bya ba'i rtags la brten nas 'du byed skad cig ma nyid du rtogs pa rang bzhin gyi rtags las 'byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa dang / des gzhal bar bya ba nyid gsungs shing /
translated: Again, he taught the inference that arises from the sign of nature that realizes that compounded phenomena are momentary based on the sign that whatever has the attribute of origination has the attribute of cessation and the object of that is said to be just that.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly, he said:

original: dge slong dag gang zag gis gang zag la chod gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang zag gis gang zag la chod gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: Monks, one person should not hold another person in esteem.

original: gang zag gis gang zag la tshod 'dzin pa ni nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag gis gang zag la tshod 'dzin pa ni nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Holding another person in esteem is a downfall.

original: de ltar 'dzin na nga 'am nga 'dra ba yod pa des gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ni dgag pa go bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin na nga 'am nga 'dra ba yod pa des gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ni dgag pa go bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, non-appearance is not a non-apprehension that causes understanding of a negation.

original: rgyu dang khyab byed la sogs pa bkag pas 'bras bu dang khyab bya la sogs par 'gog pa snang ba @65b mi dmigs pa nyid dgag pa go bar byed pa nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab byed la sogs pa bkag pas 'bras bu dang khyab bya la sogs par 'gog pa snang ba @65b mi dmigs pa nyid dgag pa go bar byed pa nyid du gsungs te /
translated: However, it is said that the negation of an effect, a pervaded, etc., by the negation of a cause, a pervader, etc., is a non-apprehension of appearance that causes understanding of a negation.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi chos can yang dag pa'i dngos por yod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi chos can yang dag pa'i dngos por yod na /
translated: Therefore, if the mere appearance of a subject exists as a real thing,

original: de la yang dag gi gcig dang du mas khyab pas de 'dra ba'i khyab byed log pa na khyab bya'i dngos po med par rtogs shing /
analyzed: de la yang dag gi gcig dang du mas khyab pas de 'dra ba'i khyab byed log pa na khyab bya'i dngos po med par rtogs shing /
translated: then since it is pervaded by real singularity and plurality, when such a pervader is negated, one realizes that the thing that is pervaded does not exist.üîΩBy becoming accustomed to that, the gnosis of individual intuitive awareness of the ƒÅryas, which has an ultimate object, will arise.

original: de ltar goms pas 'phags pa rnams kyi so so rang rig pa'i ye shes don dam pa'i yul can skye bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang tshad ma snga ma rnams la brten nas kyang /
analyzed: de ltar goms pas 'phags pa rnams kyi so so rang rig pa'i ye shes don dam pa'i yul can skye bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang tshad ma snga ma rnams la brten nas kyang /
translated: Moreover, based on the former valid knowledges,

original: ji ltar skad cig mtha' yod ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar skad cig mtha' yod ltar //
translated: just as there is an end of the instants,

original: thog ma dbus kyang brtag par gyis //
analyzed: thog ma dbus kyang brtag par gyis //
translated: Examine its beginning and end.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa dang // gzugs ni rdul phran gzhig pa na //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa dang // gzugs ni rdul phran gzhig pa na //
translated: And: When form is destroyed by atoms,

original: rdul phran cha ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni yod ma yin //
translated: The atom has no parts.

original: zhes pa la sogs par rtogs pa'i rim gyis de kho na nyid 'jal ba'i tshad ma skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs par rtogs pa'i rim gyis de kho na nyid 'jal ba'i tshad ma skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, through the process of reasoning, the valid cognition that perceives reality arises.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi rtog ge'i tshul ni de kho na nyid gzigs pa'i lung la brten cing brgyud nas de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag yin pas rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi rtog ge'i tshul ni de kho na nyid gzigs pa'i lung la brten cing brgyud nas de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag yin pas rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Buddhist method of reasoning is pure, because it is based on and indirectly understands the scriptures that perceive reality.

original: phyi rol pa rnams kyi ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol pa rnams kyi ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The non-Buddhist method is the opposite of that.

original: nor ba nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nor ba nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as mistaken.

original: de yang kha cig gis ni ngo shes kyi blo mngon sum gyi tshad mar 'dod cing /üîΩde nyid kyis sngon gyi lha sbyin gang yin pa de ni 'di'o zhes rtag pa'am /
analyzed: de yang kha cig gis ni ngo shes kyi blo mngon sum gyi tshad mar 'dod cing / de nyid kyis sngon gyi lha sbyin gang yin pa de ni 'di'o zhes rtag pa'am /
translated: Some assert that the cognition that recognizes is a valid perception.

original: spyi'i dngos por gyur ba mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub par 'dod la /
analyzed: spyi'i dngos por gyur ba mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub par 'dod la /
translated: And by that very [cognition], they assert that the valid perception establishes that the very same Devadatta from before is permanent or a universal entity.

original: yang bye brag pa rnams bdag ni thams cad na khyab pa ste /
analyzed: yang bye brag pa rnams bdag ni thams cad na khyab pa ste /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas assert that the self pervades everything,

original: bdag gi yon tan bde sdug yul kun na dmigs pa'i phyir zhes ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs su 'dod cing de las bdag grub par 'dod do //
analyzed: bdag gi yon tan bde sdug yul kun na dmigs pa'i phyir zhes ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs su 'dod cing de las bdag grub par 'dod do //
translated: because the qualities of the self, such as pleasure, pain, and so on, are observed everywhere. They assert that this unestablished reason is a correct reason and that the self is established from that.

original: de la sogs pa tshad ma dang gzhal bya phyin ci log tu rnam par gzhag pa de rnams ni de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag tu mi 'gyur bas log pa'i rtog ge zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la sogs pa tshad ma dang gzhal bya phyin ci log tu rnam par gzhag pa de rnams ni de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag tu mi 'gyur bas log pa'i rtog ge zhes bya ste /
translated: Such presentations of valid knowledge and objects of comprehension are incorrect because they do not become limbs for realizing suchness. Therefore they are called ‚Äúwrong reasoning.‚Äù

original: thams cad ngo bo nyid med na 'di rnams thams cad mi 'thad ces brtsad pa'i tshul du 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad ngo bo nyid med na 'di rnams thams cad mi 'thad ces brtsad pa'i tshul du 'dri ba ste /
translated: They ask, ‚ÄúIf everything is essenceless, then all of this is untenable,‚Äù in the manner of a debate.

original: des kyang gdul bya rnams kyi log par rtogs pa sel bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des kyang gdul bya rnams kyi log par rtogs pa sel bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This also removes the wrong thoughts of those to be tamed.

original: yang na nor ba zhes pa ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyi shes pa phal cher de kho na nyid kyi don la log par zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang na nor ba zhes pa ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyi shes pa phal cher de kho na nyid kyi don la log par zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: Or, ‚Äúmistaken‚Äù refers to the consciousnesses of most ordinary beings that are engaged in the error of the meaning of suchness.

original: 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba'i dri ba thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan yang phal cher 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba'i dri ba thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan yang phal cher 'di nyid yin te /
translated: The reason for all the questions that will be taught below is for the most part just this.

original: kun rdzob tu sems yin zhing don dam par sems kyang ngo bo nyid @66a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sems yin zhing don dam par sems kyang ngo bo nyid @66a * //
translated: The mind is conventional, and ultimately the mind also lacks entityness.

original: med na 'di dang 'di lta bu'i bye brag rnams mi 'thad ces sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: med na 'di dang 'di lta bu'i bye brag rnams mi 'thad ces sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: If that is so, then these and those distinctions are not tenable.

original: ji lta bu zhes pa ni shes par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhes pa ni shes par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: How is it?

original: ci'i slad du zhes pa ni nor ba skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ci'i slad du zhes pa ni nor ba skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Why is it?

original: de rnams ni dri ba'i ngag gcig nyid de rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni dri ba'i ngag gcig nyid de rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those are one question, because they are related.üîΩWhy is it?

original: ci'i slad du zhes pa la sogs pa phal cher rnam byung gi phyogs la brten pa'i dri ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i slad du zhes pa la sogs pa phal cher rnam byung gi phyogs la brten pa'i dri ba ste /
translated: and so forth are for the most part questions based on the side of arising.

original: zhing sna tshogs su sprul ba'i sku sna tshogs ston pa dang / sngar snang ba med pa las  lha chen po dang gtogs 'dod la sogs pa mu stegs kyi ston pa rnams kyi gzugs dang / de'i 'og tu khyod nyid mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i sku ru snang ba'i go rims mi 'thad ces brtsad pa dang /
analyzed: zhing sna tshogs su sprul ba'i sku sna tshogs ston pa dang / sngar snang ba med pa las  lha chen po dang gtogs 'dod la sogs pa mu stegs kyi ston pa rnams kyi gzugs dang / de'i 'og tu khyod nyid mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i sku ru snang ba'i go rims mi 'thad ces brtsad pa dang /
translated: The order in which you first appeared as the forms of the tirthika teachers such as Mahesvara and Visnu, who were not previously manifest, and then later as a body adorned with the thirty two marks is untenable.üîΩFrom what karma or cause of yours did the Bodhisattva arise?

original: khyod kyi rgyal sras las sam rgyu gang las byung zhes pa dang / 'khor ba'i gnas su sred pa'i srad bu la sogs pas bcings pa las thabs gang gis grol zhing grol ba'i gnas kyi khyad par gang zhig tu 'gro bar 'gyur zhes pa ste /üîΩphyi rol pa la sogs pas 'dod pa ltar 'jig rten thams cad kyi steng na /
analyzed: khyod kyi rgyal sras las sam rgyu gang las byung zhes pa dang / 'khor ba'i gnas su sred pa'i srad bu la sogs pas bcings pa las thabs gang gis grol zhing grol ba'i gnas kyi khyad par gang zhig tu 'gro bar 'gyur zhes pa ste / phyi rol pa la sogs pas 'dod pa ltar 'jig rten thams cad kyi steng na /
translated: By what means are beings liberated from the bonds of craving and so forth in the abodes of cyclic existence and to what special place of liberation do they go?

original: dpag tshad bye ba'i khyon tsam gyi thar ba'i gnas yod cing grol ba rnams der 'gro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad bye ba'i khyon tsam gyi thar ba'i gnas yod cing grol ba rnams der 'gro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: According to the beliefs of the non Buddhists, there is a place of liberation above all worlds, which is as vast as ten million leagues and liberated beings go there.

original: byis pa nyer spyod kyi bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / lam dang 'bras bu'i theg pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa dang / lam gyis spang bar bya ba las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba srid pa'i yan lag rgyu dang 'bras bus bsdus pa rnams dang /
analyzed: byis pa nyer spyod kyi bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / lam dang 'bras bu'i theg pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa dang / lam gyis spang bar bya ba las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba srid pa'i yan lag rgyu dang 'bras bus bsdus pa rnams dang /
translated: the presentation of the three vehicles of the path and the result, the branches of existence that are produced by the conditions of karma and affliction and so on that are to be abandoned by the path and are included in cause and effect,

original: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa rnam gcod yongs gcod kyi 'gal ba yin pas gcig bkag pa gzhan sgrub pa la rag las pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba cig tu bden pas gnyis ka yang phyin ci log g-yang sa'i gnas kyi mtha' nyid du mi rigs
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa rnam gcod yongs gcod kyi 'gal ba yin pas gcig bkag pa gzhan sgrub pa la rag las pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba cig tu bden pas gnyis ka yang phyin ci log g-yang sa'i gnas kyi mtha' nyid du mi rigs
translated: and existence and nonexistence and so on are mutually exclusive in the sense of elimination and determination. Therefore, since one is truly existent, the other must be established. It is illogical that either is an extreme of error that is a precipice.

original: zhes pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang thun mong ba gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ba'i tshogs bdun la sogs pa 'gog pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang thun mong ba gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ba'i tshogs bdun la sogs pa 'gog pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation of discriminations and feelings of bodhisattvas.

original: tshig gsum dang rim pa bzhin sbyor ro //
analyzed: tshig gsum dang rim pa bzhin sbyor ro //
translated: These three phrases are to be applied in order.

original: yang na tshig tha ma ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med @66b pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na tshig tha ma ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med @66b pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Or the last phrase refers to the meditative attainment of nondiscrimination and the meditative attainment of nondiscernment.üîΩFrom those meditative attainments, one awakens and, having awakened, one takes up the bodies of the five or six types of reincarnating beings and links with them.

original: snyoms 'jug de rnams las sad pa dang / de las sad nas ris lnga 'am drug gi 'gro ba'i lus 'dzin cing nying mtshams 'brel bar byed pa'i bya ba dang / yang rjes kyi gnas skabs na ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin la tshul ji ltar sgom pa dang /
analyzed: snyoms 'jug de rnams las sad pa dang / de las sad nas ris lnga 'am drug gi 'gro ba'i lus 'dzin cing nying mtshams 'brel bar byed pa'i bya ba dang / yang rjes kyi gnas skabs na ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin la tshul ji ltar sgom pa dang /
translated: In the subsequent period, one meditates on the nature of mere appearance.

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis dkar po rnam par mthong ba la sogs pa'i sa la ji ltar 'jug pa dang / de'i dbang gis mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na srid pa gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spangs shing gnas sam lus kyi khyad par ji lta ba 'dzin pa dang //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis dkar po rnam par mthong ba la sogs pa'i sa la ji ltar 'jug pa dang / de'i dbang gis mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na srid pa gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spangs shing gnas sam lus kyi khyad par ji lta ba 'dzin pa dang //
translated: By the power of that, how do they eliminate the defilements related to the three worlds and take on special states or bodies in the state of no more learning?üîΩHow do they become bodhisattvas, heirs of the victorious ones, who, having given rise to the supreme bodhicitta through the buddhas' blessings and so forth, take birth in certain special places and situations and work for the benefit of sentient beings?

original: de las sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs la sogs pas byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed nas gnas dang 'gro ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig tu skye ba blangs shing sems can gyi don byed pa'i rgyal ba'i sras su ji ltar 'gyur ba dang / der yang rim gyis dbang bcu la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de las sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs la sogs pas byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed nas gnas dang 'gro ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig tu skye ba blangs shing sems can gyi don byed pa'i rgyal ba'i sras su ji ltar 'gyur ba dang / der yang rim gyis dbang bcu la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: And how do they gradually attain the ten masteries and so forth?

original: khyad par du byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la sogs par sems chos nyid la mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par du byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la sogs par sems chos nyid la mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: In particular, how do they rest in the evenness of the nature of phenomena on the eighth bodhisattva level and above?

original: de ltar dri ba nyi shu dang po'i don dang nyi shu rtsa gcig po de rnams /
analyzed: de ltar dri ba nyi shu dang po'i don dang nyi shu rtsa gcig po de rnams /
translated: These are the topics of the first twenty questions.

original: rgyal ba khyu mchog bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: rgyal ba khyu mchog bdag la gsungs //
translated: Victor, bull of men, please explain!

original: zhes pa ste 'khor gyi nang na khyu mchog lta bur 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste 'khor gyi nang na khyu mchog lta bur 'dug pa'o //
translated: Here, he is like a bull in the midst of the herd.

original: 'dir slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos snang med rim pa zhes pa'i don ni thog mar phung po la sogs pa bstan zhing /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos snang med rim pa zhes pa'i don ni thog mar phung po la sogs pa bstan zhing /
translated: Here, the master J√±ƒÅna≈õrƒ´bhadra explains that the meaning of the stage of nonappearance is the stage of first teaching the aggregates and so on,

original: de nas sems tsam nyid du ston pa'i rim pa 'am /
analyzed: de nas sems tsam nyid du ston pa'i rim pa 'am /
translated: and then teaching only mind,

original: yang snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa'o zhes kyang 'chad do //
analyzed: yang snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa'o zhes kyang 'chad do //
translated: or else the stage of the samƒÅdhi with appearance and the samƒÅdhi without appearance.

original: 'gro ba dang ni zhes pa'i don yang 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma yin pas yul gang na gnas pa ni de nyid du 'gag pas yul gzhan du 'gro ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ni zhes pa'i don yang 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma yin pas yul gang na gnas pa ni de nyid du 'gag pas yul gzhan du 'gro ba mi 'thad de /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúgoing‚Äù is that since all formations are momentary, whatever place they abide in, they cease right there, so it is not tenable that they go to another place.

original: des na 'gro ba'i bya ba mi 'thad de zhes 'dri ba'i tshig tu sbyar ro //
analyzed: des na 'gro ba'i bya ba mi 'thad de zhes 'dri ba'i tshig tu sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the action of going is untenable.

original: yid dang shes pa la sogs pas gtso bor kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i dri ba ston te /
analyzed: yid dang shes pa la sogs pas gtso bor kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i dri ba ston te /
translated: The questions that follow are primarily about the side of affliction based on the mind, consciousness, and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad dam yang na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ma gtogs pa bdun po rnams ji ltar tha dad du snang ba'i yul la 'jug ces pa dang / ji ltar de las ldog pa dang / sems can rnams la thar ba'i rigs yod pa 'am med par ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa ste /üîΩdri ba gsum mo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad dam yang na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ma gtogs pa bdun po rnams ji ltar tha dad du snang ba'i yul la 'jug ces pa dang / ji ltar de las ldog pa dang / sems can rnams la thar ba'i rigs yod pa 'am med par ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa ste / dri ba gsum mo //
translated: The three questions are: How do the eight collections of consciousness, or the seven collections of consciousness excluding the afflicted mentality, engage in objects that appear as different? How do they turn away from those objects? How is it that sentient beings either have the potential for liberation or do not?

original: @67a * // sems tsam zhes pa la sogs pas grub pa'i mtha' la brten pa'i dri ba ston te /
analyzed: @67a * // sems tsam zhes pa la sogs pas grub pa'i mtha' la brten pa'i dri ba ston te /
translated: The three questions based on the philosophical tenet systems are indicated by the passage beginning ‚ÄúIf one asserts mind only‚Äù and so on.

original: mdo sde'i phyogs gzhan nam 'di nyid las kyang sngar sems tsam du bstan pa dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid so sor 'god cing bdag gam sems can med par ston pa 'gal zhes pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi rnam par dbye ba bshad pa dang /
analyzed: mdo sde'i phyogs gzhan nam 'di nyid las kyang sngar sems tsam du bstan pa dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid so sor 'god cing bdag gam sems can med par ston pa 'gal zhes pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi rnam par dbye ba bshad pa dang /
translated: They are: The contradiction between the teaching of mind only in other sutras of the sutra collection or in this very sutra and the presentation of the individual characteristics of phenomena and the teaching of the nonexistence of a self or sentient being, The explanation of the classification of form and so on as correct conventionalities,

original: de 'dra ba'i dbye ba yod na /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i dbye ba yod na /
translated: And if there were such a classification,

original: dngos yod rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos yod rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur //
translated: Things would be both permanent and impermanent.

original: zhes pa'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid du rtag chad kyi lta ba ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes pa dang chos kyi mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba khas len pas de kho na nyid du mu stegs rnams dang ji ste 'gal bar mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid du rtag chad kyi lta ba ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes pa dang chos kyi mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba khas len pas de kho na nyid du mu stegs rnams dang ji ste 'gal bar mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: In this way, how could one not fall into the views of eternalism and nihilism with respect to reality? And, since you accept different characteristics of phenomena, how could you not contradict the tƒ´rthikas with respect to reality?

original: 'dir de kho na nyid smos pa ni tha snyad tsam du mtha' gnyis su lta zhing 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ba 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir de kho na nyid smos pa ni tha snyad tsam du mtha' gnyis su lta zhing 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ba 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the mention of reality is because you assert that there would be a contradiction in the two extremes being viewed as mere conventions.

original: yang grub mtha' mi 'dra ba'i sgo nas khyed nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu sde pa bzhi la sogs pa 'byung ba dang / stong ba nyid rnam par dbye ba dang / 'du byed skad cig tu skye zhing 'jig pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ji ltar 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: yang grub mtha' mi 'dra ba'i sgo nas khyed nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu sde pa bzhi la sogs pa 'byung ba dang / stong ba nyid rnam par dbye ba dang / 'du byed skad cig tu skye zhing 'jig pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ji ltar 'byung ba dang /
translated: Moreover, from the perspective of different philosophical systems, you assert that after your nirvƒÅ·πáa four schools and so on will arise, emptiness will be divided into different types, conditioned phenomena will arise and disintegrate in an instant, and the essence of the tathƒÅgata will arise.

original: 'jig rten phyi rol pa dang rang gi sde pas brtags pa'i byed pa med pa dang / 'jig rten rmi lam la sogs pa 'dra ba dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la sogs te byang chub kyi phyogs rnams rgyu ci las byung ba dang /üîΩyang phyi rol ba rnams dang lta ba la rtsod cing 'khrug pa 'am kla klo 'i rjes la mtshon gyis 'khrug ces pa ste /

original: yul dang mi rnams phan tshun 'khrug cing sal sogs pa'i 'byung ba ji ltar lta bar 'gyur zhes pa dang / kun brtags pa'i chos rnams mi skye mi 'gag cing nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten thugs su chud par 'gal ba dang /

analyzed: chos thams cad tshig dang yi ge med par gzhan la yang sgra'i sgo nas ston pa 'gal ba dang / thabs gang gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ba dang / ye shes spros pa dang bral bas nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang /
translated: Since wisdom is free from conceptual elaborations, it is like space.üîΩThe number of categories of suchness, the number of the mind and perfections,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba'i grangs dang / sems dang pha rol tu phyin pa du zhes pa ste kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i grangs dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i grangs 'dri ba ste /

original: don tha dad kyang 'dri ba'i tshig @67b gcig tu sbyar ro //
analyzed: don tha dad kyang 'dri ba'i tshig @67b gcig tu sbyar ro //
translated: Although the topics are different, they are combined into a single question.üîΩFor what reasons do the stages of the bodhisattva levels such as the Joyous arise?üîΩHow does one engage in the stream of nonconceptual wisdom?

original: yang rgyu mtshan gang gis rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rim par 'gyur ba dang / snang ba med pa'i ye shes rgyun gyis 'jug pa dang / chos dang gang zag la ji ltar bdag med par 'gyur ba dang /

translated: How does one understand the selflessness of phenomena and of persons?

original: de ltar rtogs shing goms pas shes bya'i sgrib pa ji ltar 'dag pa dang / ji lta ba dang ji snyed mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa dang / yang dag pa 'am log pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / sems can gyi 'byung gnas su gyur ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i las dge mi dge la sogs pa'i bye brag du yin zhes pa ste /

translated: What are the distinctions of right or wrong discipline and ritual, and of virtuous and nonvirtuous contaminated actions that are the source of sentient beings?

analyzed: de gsum don tha dad kyang dri ba'i ngag gcig tu sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Although these three are distinct topics, they are to be applied in a single question.

original: de ltar na grub pa'i mtha' la brten pa'i dri ba nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: de ltar na grub pa'i mtha' la brten pa'i dri ba nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: Thus there are twenty-five questions based on philosophical tenets.

original: nor bu mu tig ces pa la sogs pas zab pa dang bcas pa'i bsod nams kyi snang ba la brten pa'i dri ba ste /
analyzed: nor bu mu tig ces pa la sogs pas zab pa dang bcas pa'i bsod nams kyi snang ba la brten pa'i dri ba ste /
