translated: ‚ÄúBhagavat Vairocana‚Äôs right and left cheeks are the world systems of the sidelong world systems.

original: ko sko'i 'og na spyi gtsug gi 'jig rten gyi khams zhes pa kha thur du bltas pa yod ces pa dang / gzhan yang sngar sprul pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i @69b skabs su bstan pa bzhin mig 'phrul ltar phral la sprul pa'i zhing khams rnams ji lta bu zhes pa ste dri ba gcig go //
analyzed: ko sko'i 'og na spyi gtsug gi 'jig rten gyi khams zhes pa kha thur du bltas pa yod ces pa dang / gzhan yang sngar sprul pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i @69b skabs su bstan pa bzhin mig 'phrul ltar phral la sprul pa'i zhing khams rnams ji lta bu zhes pa ste dri ba gcig go //
translated: And furthermore, just as it was explained in the section on blessing the emanations, What are the emanated world systems like, which appear suddenly like a magical illusion?

original: slob dpon ye shes dpal gyis ni steng dang 'og tu bkod pa dag ces gzhung 'don par byed pa ste de ltar tshig gi don sla bar zad do //
analyzed: slob dpon ye shes dpal gyis ni steng dang 'og tu bkod pa dag ces gzhung 'don par byed pa ste de ltar tshig gi don sla bar zad do //
translated: Master Jnanapada reads the text as those arranged above and below, and so the meaning of the words is easy to understand.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i zhing gi bkod pa lta bu gser ram beed'urya las grub pa rnams ji ltar byung zhes pa dang / pi wang dang rnga'i dbyibs 'dra ba dang / 'bras bu me tog sna tshogs 'dra ba ste de ltar ljon shing gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa'i me tog dang 'bras bu g-yas g-yon dang steng 'og la sogs par sna tshogs su gnas pa ltar stong gsum gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa'i gling gi bye brag rnams
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i zhing gi bkod pa lta bu gser ram beed'urya las grub pa rnams ji ltar byung zhes pa dang / pi wang dang rnga'i dbyibs 'dra ba dang / 'bras bu me tog sna tshogs 'dra ba ste de ltar ljon shing gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa'i me tog dang 'bras bu g-yas g-yon dang steng 'og la sogs par sna tshogs su gnas pa ltar stong gsum gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa'i gling gi bye brag rnams
translated: And, ‚ÄúLike the shape of a lute or a drum, and like the fruit of various flowers,‚Äù that is, just as the flowers and fruits belonging to a single tree are situated in various ways to the right, left, above, below, and so on, so the various continents belonging to a single trichiliocosm

original: sna tshogs su snang ba'o //üîΩnyi zla dag dang rnam bral ba //
analyzed: sna tshogs su snang ba'o // nyi zla dag dang rnam bral ba //
translated: appear in various ways.

original: zhes pa ni de dag gi 'od med kyang sems can gyi lus kyi 'od kyis bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de dag gi 'od med kyang sems can gyi lus kyi 'od kyis bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from sun and moon‚Äù means that although they do not have the light of those [luminaries], the light of the bodies of the sentient beings there performs a function.

original: de 'dra ba'i bye brag ci'i slad du 'byung zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i bye brag ci'i slad du 'byung zhes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhy do such distinctions come about?‚Äù

original: dri ba'i ngag gcig go ;
analyzed: dri ba'i ngag gcig go ;
translated: This is a single question.

original: / yang ; la lar sprul pa'i sangs rgyas dang // sangs rgyas la la rnam smin 'byung //
analyzed: / yang ; la lar sprul pa'i sangs rgyas dang // sangs rgyas la la rnam smin 'byung //
translated: some are buddhas arisen from evolution.

original: yang dag ye shes sangs rgyas rnams //üîΩci slad ji ltar bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes sangs rgyas rnams // ci slad ji ltar bdag la gsungs //
translated: The buddhas of perfect pristine consciousness,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: why and how are they explained to me?

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyi rnam par snang ba ni sngon bla ma skyel ba la sogs pa las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba ste ji skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rgyas par bstan pa bzhin no
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyi rnam par snang ba ni sngon bla ma skyel ba la sogs pa las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba ste ji skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rgyas par bstan pa bzhin no
translated: The appearance in the form of the signs and exemplary marks of the sambhogakƒÅya arises from the evolution of karma, such as previously serving the guru, and so on, as extensively taught in the Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ.

original: // yang dag ye shes sangs rgyas zhes pa ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: // yang dag ye shes sangs rgyas zhes pa ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The buddhas of perfect pristine consciousness is the dharmakƒÅya.

original: de rnams kyang dri ba'i ngag gcig tu sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang dri ba'i ngag gcig tu sbyar ro //
translated: Those are also applied to the single question.

original: gzhan yang de 'dra ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'dod pa'i khams su 'tshang mi rgya bar 'og min gyi gnas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khrod du sangs rgyas pa'i tshul ston pa ci'i phyir zhes pa dang / sprul pa'i sku mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshul bstan nas de'i 'og tu bstan pa su zhig gis gnas par byed pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang de 'dra ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'dod pa'i khams su 'tshang mi rgya bar 'og min gyi gnas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khrod du sangs rgyas pa'i tshul ston pa ci'i phyir zhes pa dang / sprul pa'i sku mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshul bstan nas de'i 'og tu bstan pa su zhig gis gnas par byed pa dang /
translated: After the nirmanakaya demonstrates the way of passing into nirvana, who will then remain to uphold the teachings?

original: ston pa lo'i grangs ji srid kyi bar du bzhugs pa dang / chos bstan pa'i tshul ji srid kyi bar du gnas pa dang / khyod nyid kyis gdul bya'i bsam pa la ltos te grub pa'i mtha' dang lta ba rnam pa du ru bstan zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ston pa lo'i grangs ji srid kyi bar du bzhugs pa dang / chos bstan pa'i tshul ji srid kyi bar du gnas pa dang / khyod nyid kyis gdul bya'i bsam pa la ltos te grub pa'i mtha' dang lta ba rnam pa du ru bstan zhes pa ste /
translated: For how long will the teacher remain? For how long will the way of teaching the Dharma remain? And in accordance with the dispositions of those to be tamed, how many different philosophical tenets and views will you yourself teach?

original: de la grub pa'i mtha' ni kun rdzob tsam du gdul bya rnams kyi blang bar bya ba dang / dor bya dang btang snyoms su bya ba ni 'di dang 'di lta bu @70a * //
analyzed: de la grub pa'i mtha' ni kun rdzob tsam du gdul bya rnams kyi blang bar bya ba dang / dor bya dang btang snyoms su bya ba ni 'di dang 'di lta bu @70a * //
translated: In this regard, philosophical tenets are merely relative, and those to be tamed should adopt, reject, or remain indifferent to them.

original: zhes rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: zhes rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is established.

original: lta ba ni shes par bya ba'i de kho na nyid 'di lta bu zhes dbang po'i bye brag dang bstun nas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni shes par bya ba'i de kho na nyid 'di lta bu zhes dbang po'i bye brag dang bstun nas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: View is established in accordance with the differences of faculties, such as, This is the reality to be known.

original: de dag kyang dri ba gcig tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang dri ba gcig tu sbyor ro //
translated: Those are also applied in one question.

original: dge slong dngos dang 'dul ba yang //
analyzed: dge slong dngos dang 'dul ba yang //
translated: What is a monk? What is the Vinaya?

original: ci slad ji ltar bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: ci slad ji ltar bdag la gsungs //
translated: Why? How? Please explain to me.

original: zhes pa ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par gyur pa la sogs pa dang / so sor thar pa'i ris bdun nam brgyad kyis bsdus pa'i 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par gyur pa la sogs pa dang / so sor thar pa'i ris bdun nam brgyad kyis bsdus pa'i 'dul ba ste /
translated: This is the full ordination, etc. by the four-part rite of proposal, and the Vinaya comprised of the seven or eight classes of Pratimoksa.

original: ltung ba sde lnga gzhi gang las ji ltar bcas pa dang / tshul ji ltar 'byung ba dang byung ba las ldang ba'i thabs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ltung ba sde lnga gzhi gang las ji ltar bcas pa dang / tshul ji ltar 'byung ba dang byung ba las ldang ba'i thabs bstan pa ste /
translated: The five classes of downfalls are taught, from what basis, how they are established, how they occur, and the method of rising from what has occurred.

original: dri ba gcig tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dri ba gcig tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: They are applied in one question.

original: rang rgyal rgyal sras nyan thos kyi //
analyzed: rang rgyal rgyal sras nyan thos kyi //
translated: What is a Pratyekabuddha? What is a Bodhisattva? What is a Sravaka?

original: ci slad 'gyur ba brgya po dang // snang ba med pa brgya po yang //
analyzed: ci slad 'gyur ba brgya po dang // snang ba med pa brgya po yang //
translated: Why are there one hundred changes? Why are there one hundred non-appearances?

original: ci'i slad du bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: ci'i slad du bdag la gsungs //
translated: Please explain to me.

original: zhes des dri ba'i ngag gcig tu sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes des dri ba'i ngag gcig tu sbyar te /
translated: This is the speech of the questioner.

original: 'gyur ba brgya ni 'phags pa rnams kyi mthong bas sdang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par 'gyur ba gsal bar nyams su myong ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'gyur ba brgya ni 'phags pa rnams kyi mthong bas sdang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par 'gyur ba gsal bar nyams su myong ba rnams so //
translated: The one hundred changes are the changes of the aryas that are clearly experienced.

original: de'i don yang mthong ba'i lam ni bden pa bzhi 'am de'i chos nyid sngar ma mthong ba mthong ba yin la des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa yang bden pa la log par zhugs pa yin pas bden pa bzhi la brten te rnam par 'byed pa na
analyzed: de'i don yang mthong ba'i lam ni bden pa bzhi 'am de'i chos nyid sngar ma mthong ba mthong ba yin la des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa yang bden pa la log par zhugs pa yin pas bden pa bzhi la brten te rnam par 'byed pa na
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: The path of seeing is the seeing of the four truths or their reality dharmata that was not seen before. Also, the afflictions to be abandoned by that are wrongly engaged with the four truths.üîΩTherefore, based on the four truths, they are distinguished.

original: re zhig 'dod pa'i khams na bden pa re re la ltos te /
analyzed: re zhig 'dod pa'i khams na bden pa re re la ltos te /
translated: In the desire realm, in dependence on each truth, there are four types of abandonment.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste rnam pa bcu ru 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste rnam pa bcu ru 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Desire, anger, pride, ignorance, doubt, the afflicted view of the self, the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, wrong view, the esteeming of views, and the esteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: de la 'dir ma rig pa ni khams gsum gyi mi shes pa'o zhes 'byung bas rnam par 'gyur ba gsal bar myong ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir ma rig pa ni khams gsum gyi mi shes pa'o zhes 'byung bas rnam par 'gyur ba gsal bar myong ba med pa ste /
translated: Here, ignorance is the non-understanding of the three realms.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs par ma gtogs pa tsam mo //
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs par ma gtogs pa tsam mo //
translated: It is the mere non-apprehension of impermanence, suffering, etc., as they are in the truth of suffering.

original: 'dir don la log par 'dzin pa rnam par 'gyur ba gsal bar myong ba rnams de'i 'bras bur gyur pa lta ba'i bye brag rnams su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir don la log par 'dzin pa rnam par 'gyur ba gsal bar myong ba rnams de'i 'bras bur gyur pa lta ba'i bye brag rnams su gtogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the various forms of grasping the meaning wrongly are included among the views, which are the results of ignorance.

original: de ltar nam  rig pa ma gtogs pa bden pa re re la rnam pa dgu dgu ste sum cu rtsa drug yin la /
analyzed: de ltar nam  rig pa ma gtogs pa bden pa re re la rnam pa dgu dgu ste sum cu rtsa drug yin la /
translated: Thus, except for the summit of existence, each truth has nine aspects, making thirty six.

original: khams gong ma gnyis na khong khro yang med pas bden pa re re la rnam pa brgyad brgyad de @70b de ltar na sum cu rtsa gnyis pa phrag gnyis su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khams gong ma gnyis na khong khro yang med pas bden pa re re la rnam pa brgyad brgyad de @70b de ltar na sum cu rtsa gnyis pa phrag gnyis su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since anger does not exist in the two higher realms, each truth has eight aspects, making thirty two.

original: de ltar thams cad bsdoms pas brgya nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad bsdoms pas brgya nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, adding all these together, there are one hundred.

original: 'dir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni shes bya la log par zhugs pa yin las bden pa la brten pa'i rnam par dbye ba mi byed cing /
analyzed: 'dir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni shes bya la log par zhugs pa yin las bden pa la brten pa'i rnam par dbye ba mi byed cing /
translated: Here the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation are wrongly engaged with respect to objects of knowledge, but they are not classified in terms of the four truths.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rigs su gtogs pa rnam pa bcu drug yin no zhes chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las 'byung ste /
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rigs su gtogs pa rnam pa bcu drug yin no zhes chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las 'byung ste /
translated: The Abhidharmako≈õa states that the innate class of afflictions has sixteen aspects.

original: de rnams las nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes dang 'gal bas de nyid kyis spang bar bya ba'i rigs su 'dus la /
analyzed: de rnams las nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes dang 'gal bas de nyid kyis spang bar bya ba'i rigs su 'dus la /
translated: From among those, the manifest afflictions are to be abandoned by the very same path of seeing, because they are included in the class of objects to be abandoned by the transcendent wisdom of equipoise of the path of seeing.

original: bag la nyal ba ni rnam 'gyur gsal bar nyams su myong ba med pas 'dir ma smos so //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba ni rnam 'gyur gsal bar nyams su myong ba med pas 'dir ma smos so //
translated: The latent states are not mentioned here, because they do not clearly experience the manifestation of the afflictions.üîΩMoreover, the nonafflicted ignorance, the conception of apprehendeds and apprehenders, and so on, is not to be abandoned by the paths of Hearers and Solitary Realizers. Therefore it is not mentioned here.

original: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyis spang bar bya ba ma yin pas de yang 'dir ma smos te des na snga ma de dag
analyzed: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyis spang bar bya ba ma yin pas de yang 'dir ma smos te des na snga ma de dag
translated: Thus the former ones

original: tsam du zad do ;
analyzed: tsam du zad do ;
translated: are just that.

original: /'di rnams kyi don zhib tu ni lan 'debs pa'i skabs su bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: /'di rnams kyi don zhib tu ni lan 'debs pa'i skabs su bstan par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of these will be taught in detail in the section on the answers.

original: snang ba med pa brgya zhes pa ni de rnams kyi gnyen po mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes de bzhin nyid yul du byed pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa brgya zhes pa ni de rnams kyi gnyen po mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes de bzhin nyid yul du byed pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúhundred nonappearances‚Äù are the transcendent wisdom of meditative equipoise, the antidote to those, which takes suchness as its object.

original: de yang spang bya la ltos nas rnam pa brgya'o zhes bzhag ste /
analyzed: de yang spang bya la ltos nas rnam pa brgya'o zhes bzhag ste /
translated: Moreover, it is posited that there are one hundred aspects in terms of the objects of abandonment.

original: ji ltar lha sbyin nam sna tshogs bshes gnyen gang 'ong yang rung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar lha sbyin nam sna tshogs bshes gnyen gang 'ong yang rung ste /
translated: Just as it is said, ‚ÄúWhether Devadatta or Vi≈õvƒÅmitra comes,

original: do zla'i gyad ni nga'am nga'o zhes zla'o la ltos na bdag nyid rnam pa gnyis su 'jog pa lta bu'o //üîΩde las gzhan du snang ba med pa'i chos nyid dam /
analyzed: do zla'i gyad ni nga'am nga'o zhes zla'o la ltos na bdag nyid rnam pa gnyis su 'jog pa lta bu'o // de las gzhan du snang ba med pa'i chos nyid dam /
translated: I am the champion, ‚Äù and in terms of the opponent, the self is posited in two aspects.üîΩHow could it be tenable that the reality that does not appear otherwise

original: de ltar rtogs pa'i ye shes la tha dad pa'i dbye ba ji ltar 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i ye shes la tha dad pa'i dbye ba ji ltar 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: or the gnosis that realizes it in that way has different divisions?

original: don de nyid slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos 'chad pa na /
analyzed: don de nyid slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos 'chad pa na /
translated: When the master J√±ƒÅna≈õrƒ´bhadra explains that very point,

original: 'khrul pa gnas 'pho ba brgya ni gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa'i rigs pas spang ngo //
analyzed: 'khrul pa gnas 'pho ba brgya ni gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa'i rigs pas spang ngo //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe one hundred abodes of delusion are abandoned by the reasoning of nondual ultimate truth.üîΩThe one hundred are to be examined because they are limitless.

original: brgya ni mtha' med pas nye bar brtag par byed pa ste grangs mtshon pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: brgya ni mtha' med pas nye bar brtag par byed pa ste grangs mtshon pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: They are merely an illustration of a number.

analyzed: de nyid du brgya chad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not severed in reality.

original: ji skad du chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong zhes bstan pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: ji skad du chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong zhes bstan pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'o zhes so //
translated: It is similar to the teaching that there are eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi mngon par shes pa lnga po sngon gyi las sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi mngon par shes pa lnga po sngon gyi las sam /
translated: Moreover, the five mundane higher perceptions arise from previous karmaüîΩor from present effort.

original: 'phral gyi 'du byed pa gang gis byung zhing de rnams kyi steng du zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa dang drug ste /
analyzed: 'phral gyi 'du byed pa gang gis byung zhing de rnams kyi steng du zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa dang drug ste /
translated: In addition to those, there is the higher perception of the extinction of defilements.

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon par shes pa yang ji @71a * //
translated: How do the supramundane higher perceptions arise?

original: ltar byung zhes pa ste dri ba gcig tu sbyar ro //
analyzed: ltar byung zhes pa ste dri ba gcig tu sbyar ro //
translated: This is one question.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gnas ma gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun po rnams ji ltar byung zhes pa dang / yang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gnas ma gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun po rnams ji ltar byung zhes pa dang / yang /
translated: How do the seven bodhisattva stages arise, which are the collection of consciousness that has not been transformed?

original: khyod kyi dge 'dun rnam pa du //
analyzed: khyod kyi dge 'dun rnam pa du //
translated: How many kinds of sa·πÖgha do you have?

original: ji ltar dge 'dun dbyen du 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar dge 'dun dbyen du 'gyur //
translated: How does the sa·πÖgha become divided?

original: zhes dri ba'i ngag gcig tu sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes dri ba'i ngag gcig tu sbyar te /
translated: This is one question.

original: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyi rnam par dbye ba dur 'gyur zhing de rnams grub pa'i mtha' dang / longs spyod la sogs pa'i sgo nas phan tshun 'byed par byed pa'i dbyen dang / de las gzhan mtshams med pa'i las rnams su ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyi rnam par dbye ba dur 'gyur zhing de rnams grub pa'i mtha' dang / longs spyod la sogs pa'i sgo nas phan tshun 'byed par byed pa'i dbyen dang / de las gzhan mtshams med pa'i las rnams su ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: How do the divisions of the Sa·πÖgha of Hearers and Bodhisattvas come about? How do schisms in the Sa·πÖgha come about, which divide them from each other in terms of tenets, enjoyments, and so forth? And how do the actions of immediate retribution come about?üîΩAlso, are the sciences those that heal the physical, verbal, and mental illnesses of sentient beings?

original: gzhan yang sems can rnams kyi lus ngag yid gsum gyi nad gso bar byed pa'i gtsug lag rnams yin nam ji ltar yin zhes pa dang // 'od srungs log par dad sel dang // gser thub kyang ni nga yin zhes //

translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, I am also Vipa≈õyin,

original: rgyal ba'i sras la gsungs pa de //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras la gsungs pa de //
translated: and also Kanakamuni, I have said to the heirs of the victors.

original: thub pa chen po ci slad gsungs //
analyzed: thub pa chen po ci slad gsungs //

original: zhes dri ba'i ngag gcig tu sbyar te don ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: zhes dri ba'i ngag gcig tu sbyar te don ni shes par zad do //

original: yang las sam las kyi khur khyer ba'i bdag gam sems can de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis kyang gsungs shing /
analyzed: yang las sam las kyi khur khyer ba'i bdag gam sems can de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis kyang gsungs shing /
translated: The TathƒÅgata himself has also said that the self or sentient being who takes up or carries the burden of karma

original: tshad mas kyang grub bzhin du med ces ci'i phyir brjod ces pa dang / de bzhin nyid rtag pa dang 'jig par bshad pa'i gtam ji ltar mi 'gal zhes pa dang ; nyams su myong ba'i tshad mas grub pas sems nyid rig pa don dam pa'i dngos por mdo sde thams cad du ci'i phyir na mi bshad ces pa ste /
analyzed: tshad mas kyang grub bzhin du med ces ci'i phyir brjod ces pa dang / de bzhin nyid rtag pa dang 'jig par bshad pa'i gtam ji ltar mi 'gal zhes pa dang ; nyams su myong ba'i tshad mas grub pas sems nyid rig pa don dam pa'i dngos por mdo sde thams cad du ci'i phyir na mi bshad ces pa ste /
translated: Since it is established by the valid knowledge of experience, why is the mind itself, awareness, not explained as the ultimate reality in all s≈´tras?

original: de ltar na dri ba nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dri ba nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, there are twenty-four questions.

original: ci slad ces pa la sogs pas khyad par du yang phyi'i don med ces pa la brtsad pa'i tshul gyis 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: ci slad ces pa la sogs pas khyad par du yang phyi'i don med ces pa la brtsad pa'i tshul gyis 'dri ba ste /
translated: The questions beginning with ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù are inquiries into the way that external objects do not exist, even conventionally.

original: kun rdzob tsam du yang phyi'i don med na /üîΩskyes bu rnams kha deg dang reg bya la sogs pa'i khyad par las bde bar 'gyur zhing de la mngon par 'dod pa dang / aa ru ra dang skyu ru'i tshal /üîΩke las dang khor yug ri //
analyzed: kun rdzob tsam du yang phyi'i don med na / skyes bu rnams kha deg dang reg bya la sogs pa'i khyad par las bde bar 'gyur zhing de la mngon par 'dod pa dang / aa ru ra dang skyu ru'i tshal / ke las dang khor yug ri //
translated: If external objects do not exist even conventionally,üîΩwhy are beings happy due to the distinctions of taste, touch, and so on, and why do they desire them?üîΩWhy are there myrobalan trees, jujube trees,

original: rdo rje sra ba 'ang ji lta bu //
analyzed: rdo rje sra ba 'ang ji lta bu //

original: zhes pa dri ba'i ngag gcig ste /
analyzed: zhes pa dri ba'i ngag gcig ste /

original: don ni skye dgu rnams kyi lus la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i sman gyi tshal dang / ke la sa ste ti se'i byang ngos kyi ri'i khyad par ro zhes glegs bam las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: don ni skye dgu rnams kyi lus la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i sman gyi tshal dang / ke la sa ste ti se'i byang ngos kyi ri'i khyad par ro zhes glegs bam las 'byung ngo //

original: khor yug gi ri ni gling bzhi dang rgya mtsho'i phyi rol du gyur pa'i rin po che'i ris bskor ba'o //
analyzed: khor yug gi ri ni gling bzhi dang rgya mtsho'i phyi rol du gyur pa'i rin po che'i ris bskor ba'o //
translated: The mountain of the outer ring is the precious mountain that surrounds the four continents and the outer ocean.

original: de nyid rdo rje'i ri zhes kyang dus kyi 'khor lo las @71b bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje'i ri zhes kyang dus kyi 'khor lo las @71b bshad do //
translated: That very thing is explained in the KƒÅlacakra Tantra as the vajra mountain.

original: de'i nang nas zhes pa la sogs pa 'ang dri ba'i ngag gcig ste khor yug gi nang na man d'a ra ba dang / gser gyi ri la sogs pas brgyan cing /
analyzed: de'i nang nas zhes pa la sogs pa 'ang dri ba'i ngag gcig ste khor yug gi nang na man d'a ra ba dang / gser gyi ri la sogs pas brgyan cing /
translated: The phrase within that and so on is also one question. The inner ring is adorned with the Mandara and golden mountains, and so forth.

original: drang srong dri zas kun bkang ba //
analyzed: drang srong dri zas kun bkang ba //
translated: It is filled with gandharva ·πõ·π£is.

original: ji ltar ci slad ces pa ste mi 'thad par brtsad pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ci slad ces pa ste mi 'thad par brtsad pa'o //

original: de ltar thams cad bsdoms nas dri ba brgya rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad bsdoms nas dri ba brgya rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ba'o //

original: theg pa che tshul zhes pa la sogs pas zhu ba po la bsngags pa brjod cing skabs dbye ba ste /
analyzed: theg pa che tshul zhes pa la sogs pas zhu ba po la bsngags pa brjod cing skabs dbye ba ste /

original: dri ba de rnams thams cad kyang theg pa chen po'i tshul gtan la 'bebs pa /
analyzed: dri ba de rnams thams cad kyang theg pa chen po'i tshul gtan la 'bebs pa /
translated: All of those questions are about the way to determine the Great Vehicle,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs la mnga' ba yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs la mnga' ba yin la /
translated: which is mastered by the buddhas.

original: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pas gsan pa dang zhes pa gdul bya'i don du tshul de ltar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pas gsan pa dang zhes pa gdul bya'i don du tshul de ltar bstan pa'o //
translated: The line the Tathagata has heard means that he has taught that way for the benefit of those to be tamed.

original: gzhan ni phal cher shes par zad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni phal cher shes par zad do //
translated: The rest is for the most part self-evident.

original: de ni rim gyis ngas bshad ces pa dri ba'i go rims dang bstun pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang gdul bya'i khyad par rnams la rim gyis ston par snang ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rim gyis ngas bshad ces pa dri ba'i go rims dang bstun pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang gdul bya'i khyad par rnams la rim gyis ston par snang ba'o //

original: skye dang skye ba med pa dang // zhes pa la sogs pas dri ba'i don de nyid khyad par du bshad pa dang bcas te rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: skye dang skye ba med pa dang // zhes pa la sogs pas dri ba'i don de nyid khyad par du bshad pa dang bcas te rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: The line arising and nonarising and so forth restate the meaning of the questions along with a special explanation.

original: de yang phal cher sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brang bas rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: de yang phal cher sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brang bas rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Moreover, since they mostly follow the earlier explanations, they are easy to understand.

original: 'pho ba dang zhes pa ni //
analyzed: 'pho ba dang zhes pa ni //
translated: ‚ÄúTransference‚Äù is connected with

original: ji ltar sa la 'jug par 'gyur //üîΩzhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sa la 'jug par 'gyur // zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHow does one enter the stages?‚Äù

original: nyan thos rgyal ba'i sras zhes pa de yang rim gyis byang chub sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rgyal ba'i sras zhes pa de yang rim gyis byang chub sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe sons of the Victor, the ≈õrƒÅvakas‚Äù also gradually become bodhisattvas.

original: lha ma yin ni sngar gyi 'gro ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: lha ma yin ni sngar gyi 'gro ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: The asuras are a previously mentioned special type of rebirth.

original: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad do //
translated: The ‚Äúeight liberations‚Äù are as follows.

original: de bzhin du stobs lnga dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ste byang chub kyi phyogs kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du stobs lnga dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ste byang chub kyi phyogs kyis bsdus pa'o //

analyzed: yang stobs rnam pa bcu ste byang chub sems dpa' la yang ldan par mdo sde dag las bshad do //
translated: Moreover, the ten types of powers are explained in the s≈´tras as being possessed by bodhisattvas.

original: tshogs kyi lam la sogs pa'i lam rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam la sogs pa'i lam rnams kyang de bzhin no //

analyzed: tshad med rnams dang bsam gtan zhes pa 'jig rten pa'i lam mo //

original: 'gro 'ong zhes pa ni grol ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur zhe 'am /
analyzed: 'gro 'ong zhes pa ni grol ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur zhe 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúComing and going‚Äù means that when one is liberated, where does one go?

original: 'gro ba gzhan nas 'ongs nas 'dir lus 'dzin cing 'di nas gzhan du 'gro ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan nas 'ongs nas 'dir lus 'dzin cing 'di nas gzhan du 'gro ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to the other transmigrations, since one comes from another transmigration and takes up a body here, and from here one goes to another transmigration.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The meditative attainment is the attainment of non-perception.

original: 'gog pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi'o //

original: yang na snyoms par 'jug pa nyid 'gog pa ste gcig tu bsdu'o //
analyzed: yang na snyoms par 'jug pa nyid 'gog pa ste gcig tu bsdu'o //
translated: Or else, the meditative attainment itself is the cessation, so they are combined into one.

original: chos lnga dang rang bzhin gsum ste sngar gyi mtshan @72a * //üîΩrnams rnam par 'god pa'am /
analyzed: chos lnga dang rang bzhin gsum ste sngar gyi mtshan @72a * // rnams rnam par 'god pa'am /
translated: The five dharmas and the three natures are the former characteristics.

original: rig pa'i gnas zhes pa de nyid du bsdu'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas zhes pa de nyid du bsdu'o //

original: rtog pa dang brtag par bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang dang kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang brtag par bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang dang kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin no //

original: lta ba gnyis ni rtag pa dang chad par ro //
analyzed: lta ba gnyis ni rtag pa dang chad par ro //

original: sangs rgyas gcig dang dkrugs ma zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu dang por mngon par byang chub pa dang / tha mar mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa sprul pa'i sku'i sangs rgyas dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni gcig yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gcig dang dkrugs ma zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu dang por mngon par byang chub pa dang / tha mar mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa sprul pa'i sku'i sangs rgyas dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni gcig yin la /
translated: The single buddha and the mixed are the single buddha body of perfect enjoyment and the emanation body of a buddha who first demonstrates manifest enlightenment and finally demonstrates nirvana in a single world system.

original: zhing gzhan nas glo bur du 'dus pa ni dkrugs ma ste du ma'o //
analyzed: zhing gzhan nas glo bur du 'dus pa ni dkrugs ma ste du ma'o //
translated: The mixed are the many buddhas who suddenly gather from other realms.

original: gzhan yang shes pa dang shes bya'i ngo bor red cing 'byung ba thob ces pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa dang shes bya'i ngo bor red cing 'byung ba thob ces pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the term ‚Äúthe essence of consciousness and objects of consciousness‚Äù means ‚Äúto be in contact and to arise.‚Äù

original: dpe dang rgyu rnams ldan zhes pa shes byed kyi rgyu gtan tshigs dang / de'i khyab pa sgrub byed kyi yan lag dpe dang bcas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dpe dang rgyu rnams ldan zhes pa shes byed kyi rgyu gtan tshigs dang / de'i khyab pa sgrub byed kyi yan lag dpe dang bcas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' zhes pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúendowed with examples and causes‚Äù means ‚Äúto be established by means of the cause of the object of consciousness, the reason, and the example, which is the branch that proves its pervasion.‚Äù

original: tshul ni rtog gi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: tshul ni rtog gi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúmethod‚Äù means ‚Äúpure thought.‚Äù

original: de ltar dri ba rjes su brjod nas sems tsam ni zhes pa de rnams thams cad sems kyi snang ba yin pas sems nyid la rnam par 'jog ces pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar dri ba rjes su brjod nas sems tsam ni zhes pa de rnams thams cad sems kyi snang ba yin pas sems nyid la rnam par 'jog ces pa ste /
translated: Having thus repeated the question, ‚ÄúMind Only‚Äù means that since all of those are appearances of mind, they are posited as mind only.

original: sngar sems tsam gyi tshul la rtsod pa spang ba'i skabs su rgyas par bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar sems tsam gyi tshul la rtsod pa spang ba'i skabs su rgyas par bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the extensive explanation above in the context of rejecting objections to the Mind Only system.

original: snang ba med ces pa dang // sa rnams la yang rim pa med //
analyzed: snang ba med ces pa dang // sa rnams la yang rim pa med //
translated: ‚ÄúNo appearances‚Äù and ‚Äúno stages on the grounds‚Äù

original: ces pa ni de kho na nyid sems kyi khyad par rang yang grub pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni de kho na nyid sems kyi khyad par rang yang grub pa med ces pa'o //
translated: means that the reality of mind itself is also not established.üîΩ‚ÄúJust so‚Äù means that the meaning of the question, ‚ÄúWhy did you teach me the one hundred Dharma topics?‚Äù

original: de bzhin te zhes pas chos kyi khyad par brgya po ci phyir bdag la gsungs zhes dris pa'i don dang gso ba'i gtsug lag la sogs pa de rnams kyang kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin zhing don dam par ngo bo nyid med ces sngar bstan pa de bzhinüîΩte shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin te zhes pas chos kyi khyad par brgya po ci phyir bdag la gsungs zhes dris pa'i don dang gso ba'i gtsug lag la sogs pa de rnams kyang kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin zhing don dam par ngo bo nyid med ces sngar bstan pa de bzhin te shes pa'o //
translated: and the meaning of the reply, ‚ÄúJust so, those topics of medicine and so on are mind only conventionally and ultimately have no nature,‚Äù are understood.

original: gal te kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: If they are mind only conventionally,

original: de rnams kyi bye brag ji ltar dris pa bzhin du bstan par rigs so zhe na ma yin te /üîΩnor bu mu tig gser 'byung ba //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bye brag ji ltar dris pa bzhin du bstan par rigs so zhe na ma yin te / nor bu mu tig gser 'byung ba //
translated: It is proper to teach them in accordance with the questions asked.üîΩThe questions about the origin of jewels, pearls, and gold are not proper questions, since they are not necessary for disciples at that time.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa dri ba'i don gdul bya la skabs su nye bar mkho ba med pa ni dri bar mi rigs shing de bzhin du lan yang gdab par mi 'os pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa dri ba'i don gdul bya la skabs su nye bar mkho ba med pa ni dri bar mi rigs shing de bzhin du lan yang gdab par mi 'os pa'o //
translated: Likewise, it is not appropriate to answer them.

original: gal te da ltar nye bar mkho ba ma yin kyang dus gzhan gdul bya la nye bar mkho ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te da ltar nye bar mkho ba ma yin kyang dus gzhan gdul bya la nye bar mkho ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that although they are not necessary at present, they will become necessary for disciples at another time,

original: dngos sam brgyud pas rang ngam gzhan gyi don du mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos sam brgyud pas rang ngam gzhan gyi don du mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because there is no thing whatsoever that does not become useful for oneself or others either directly or indirectly,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de ltar na //
analyzed: de ltar na //
translated: If that were so,

original: ri bo de bzhin ri rnams dang // sa'i tshad kyang @72b zhes pa la sogs pa'i don 'di rnams kyang dus gzhan du sems can la nye bar mkho bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: ri bo de bzhin ri rnams dang // sa'i tshad kyang @72b zhes pa la sogs pa'i don 'di rnams kyang dus gzhan du sems can la nye bar mkho bar 'gyur bas /
translated: then the meaning of the questions about the size of mountains, the size of Mount Meru, and the size of the earth would also become necessary for sentient beings at another time.

original: ci'i phyir na mi 'dri ste dri bar rigs pa nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na mi 'dri ste dri bar rigs pa nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Why not? It would be reasonable to ask.

original: tshig gi don ni phal cher shes par zad do //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni phal cher shes par zad do //
translated: The meaning of the words is mostly exhausted.

original: bdag la gsungs zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig 'di rnams kyi don ni 'dri ba pos bdag la gsungs zhes ci'i phyir mi 'dri ste 'dri bar 'os zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la gsungs zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig 'di rnams kyi don ni 'dri ba pos bdag la gsungs zhes ci'i phyir mi 'dri ste 'dri bar 'os zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of these words beginning with speak to me is: why does the questioner not ask, Speak to me? It is appropriate to ask.

original: rab dang 'bring ni lus che chung gi sgo nas rdul mang nyung du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rab dang 'bring ni lus che chung gi sgo nas rdul mang nyung du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The superior and middling are distinguished by the size of the body, with more particles.

original: 'bum dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni khal gcig la rdul phran 'bum phrag du yod ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bum dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni khal gcig la rdul phran 'bum phrag du yod ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: A hundred thousand and so on means how many hundred thousands of atoms are in one load, and so on.

original: dbang po gcig cing rdul phran du zhes pa la sogs pa ni gzugs can gyi dbang por grags pa re re la yang rdul phra rab kyi grangs du yod ces pa dang / sems can gyi lus la smin ma dang spu'i khung bu'i grangs du yod ces ci'i phyir mi 'dri zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po gcig cing rdul phran du zhes pa la sogs pa ni gzugs can gyi dbang por grags pa re re la yang rdul phra rab kyi grangs du yod ces pa dang / sems can gyi lus la smin ma dang spu'i khung bu'i grangs du yod ces ci'i phyir mi 'dri zhes pa'o //
translated: One sense faculty and so on means how many atoms are there in each of the well-known physical sense faculties, and how many eyebrows and pores are there in the bodies of sentient beings? Why not ask?

original: gal te skabs su nye bar mkho ba med na dus gzhan du nye bar mkho ba nyid du 'gyur yang de 'dra ba'i dngos po thams cad ni dri bar mi nus shing /
analyzed: gal te skabs su nye bar mkho ba med na dus gzhan du nye bar mkho ba nyid du 'gyur yang de 'dra ba'i dngos po thams cad ni dri bar mi nus shing /
translated: If something is not needed at a particular time, it may be needed at another time. But it is impossible to ask about all such things.

original: dris pa la dgos pa yang med de /
analyzed: dris pa la dgos pa yang med de /
translated: And there is no need to ask about them,

original: thams cad bsdus pa'i don sems kyi chos nyid stong pa nyid gtan la bab cing goms pa la brten nas chos kyi khyad par thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad bsdus pa'i don sems kyi chos nyid stong pa nyid gtan la bab cing goms pa la brten nas chos kyi khyad par thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because by ascertaining and becoming familiar with the emptiness that is the nature of the mind, which is the meaning that subsumes everything, one will understand all the specific features of the Dharma.

original: de skad du yang ;
analyzed: de skad du yang ;
translated: As said:

original: 'jig rten khams ni stong dag tu //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams ni stong dag tu //
translated: In the thousandfold world systems,

original: ngas ni mdo sde gang bshad pa //
analyzed: ngas ni mdo sde gang bshad pa //
translated: the sutras I have taught

original: tshig 'bru tha dad don gcig ste //
analyzed: tshig 'bru tha dad don gcig ste //
translated: have different words but the same meaning;

original: thams cad brjod par nus ma yin //
analyzed: thams cad brjod par nus ma yin //
translated: it is impossible to express them all.

original: tshig gcig rnam par bsgoms pa yis //
analyzed: tshig gcig rnam par bsgoms pa yis //
translated: By meditating on a single word,

original: de dag thams cad bsgom par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bsgom par 'gyur //
translated: one will meditate on them all.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa bzhin no snyam du gdul bya'i khyad par 'ga' zhig dgos na mi 'thad de /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa bzhin no snyam du gdul bya'i khyad par 'ga' zhig dgos na mi 'thad de /
translated: If one thinks that it is not tenable to teach the Dharma in that way to certain specific disciples,

original: de lta na sngar gyi dri ba rgyas pa rnams kyang dri bar mi 'os pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na sngar gyi dri ba rgyas pa rnams kyang dri bar mi 'os pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Thus, the previous extensive questions are not suitable to be asked.

original: phyug po'i mi rnams ci las 'gyur //
analyzed: phyug po'i mi rnams ci las 'gyur //
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúHow do the people of the rich become so?‚Äù

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: tshig gi don ni phal cher sngar gyi dri ba dang sbyar bas shes par zad do ;üîΩ/ gang du sprin rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni phal cher sngar gyi dri ba dang sbyar bas shes par zad do ; / gang du sprin rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: The meaning of the words is mostly understood by connecting them with the previous questions.

original: zhes pa la sogs ba ni yul lam sog la sogs pa'i dus gang du zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs ba ni yul lam sog la sogs pa'i dus gang du zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere do the clouds come from?‚Äù and so forth means ‚ÄúIn what place or time do they come from?‚Äù

original: dus kyi rnams zhes pa yang dus de nyid kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dus kyi rnams zhes pa yang dus de nyid kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe divisions of time‚Äù are the divisions of that very time.

original: rgyal ba'i sras kyis mdzes zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa la rgyal ba'i sras kyis bskor ba'o //üîΩbyed pa ci yi @73a * //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras kyis mdzes zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa la rgyal ba'i sras kyis bskor ba'o // byed pa ci yi @73a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Victor‚Äôs sons are beautiful‚Äù means the tathƒÅgatas are surrounded by the Victor‚Äôs sons.üîΩ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of their arising?‚Äù

original: 'byung zhes pa ni /üîΩ'gro ba dag dang lus 'dzin pa //
analyzed: 'byung zhes pa ni / 'gro ba dag dang lus 'dzin pa //
translated: means

original: ci yi slad du bya ba 'byung /
analyzed: ci yi slad du bya ba 'byung /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of the arising of the bodies of beings?‚Äù

original: zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of their arising?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúWhy do you speak to me?‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir bdag la gsungs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag la gsungs zhes pa ni /
translated: means

original: zhu ba po khyod bdag la gsungs /
analyzed: zhu ba po khyod bdag la gsungs /
translated: ‚ÄúYou, the one who asks, speak to me.‚Äù

original: zhes ci'i phyir 'dri ste /
analyzed: zhes ci'i phyir 'dri ste /
translated: Why ask that?

original: dri bar mi 'os zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dri bar mi 'os zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not proper to ask that.

original: gal te de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' dri ba'i ngag skyon dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ram zhe na /üîΩmi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' dri ba'i ngag skyon dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ram zhe na / mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then the bodhisattva‚Äôs speech would be faulty.

original: de lta bu'i brgal ba dang lan brgyud pa la brten nas skabs su nye bar mkho ba med pa'i don ni mkhas pa rnams kyis gtso bor gtan la dbab par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i brgal ba dang lan brgyud pa la brten nas skabs su nye bar mkho ba med pa'i don ni mkhas pa rnams kyis gtso bor gtan la dbab par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: No, it would not, because the learned do not primarily determine the meaning of what is not useful in a given context, based on a series of questions and answers.

original: gtso por gtan la dbab par bya ba'i don ni thams cad bsdus pa sems kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ba'i dgos pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: gtso por gtan la dbab par bya ba'i don ni thams cad bsdus pa sems kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ba'i dgos pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: The meaning that is primarily to be determined is the reality of the mind, suchness, which includes everything.

original: de la sngar gyi dri ba'i don yang phal cher de nyid gtan la 'bebs pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur bas 'og nas lan rgyas par bstan par bya zhing /
analyzed: de la sngar gyi dri ba'i don yang phal cher de nyid gtan la 'bebs pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur bas 'og nas lan rgyas par bstan par bya zhing /
translated: The meaning of the previous questions is for the most part a branch of the determination of suchness. Therefore, the answer will be explained extensively below.

original: 'ga' zhig ni lan gdab par bya ba ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni lan gdab par bya ba ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Some questions are not to be answered.

original: de rnams kyang byang chub sems dpas dris pa'i dgos pa ni snga ma ltar rtogs pa skyed pa nyid yin te des na dgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir skyon med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang byang chub sems dpas dris pa'i dgos pa ni snga ma ltar rtogs pa skyed pa nyid yin te des na dgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir skyon med ces pa'o //
translated: The purpose of the Bodhisattva's questions is, as before, to generate understanding, and therefore, since they have a purpose, they are faultless.

original: 'di dang gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas sngar dris pa dang / 'og nas 'dri bar 'gyur ba thams cad kyi don gyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa sems kyi chos nyid bshad par dam bca' zhing //
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas sngar dris pa dang / 'og nas 'dri bar 'gyur ba thams cad kyi don gyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa sems kyi chos nyid bshad par dam bca' zhing //
translated: With this and other and so forth, all that was previously asked and will be asked below is summarized in the meaning reality, and the promise to explain the nature of mind is given.

original: nyon cig par gdams pa'o //
analyzed: nyon cig par gdams pa'o //
translated: The instruction to listen is given.

original: re rer mtshan dang rab ldan zhing //
analyzed: re rer mtshan dang rab ldan zhing //
translated: Each one is endowed with a characteristic,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni dri ba'i don so sor re rer dngos po'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni dri ba'i don so sor re rer dngos po'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang ldan zhing /
translated: and so forth. The meaning of this is that each individual question is endowed with a different characteristic of an entity.

original: de lta bu'i dngos por 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i nyes pa rnams spangs te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dngos por 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i nyes pa rnams spangs te /
translated: Having abandoned the faults of the view that grasps to such entities,

original: thams cad sems kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid du phyogs gcig tu grub pa'i mtha' nga yis bstan par bya yis khyod cag nga la nyan par gyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad sems kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid du phyogs gcig tu grub pa'i mtha' nga yis bstan par bya yis khyod cag nga la nyan par gyis zhes pa'o //
translated: I will teach the conclusion that everything is of one taste in the suchness of the nature of mind. You should listen to me.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na dri ba rnams kyis gnas skabs su nye bar mkho ba'i don rnams kun rdzob tu so sor mtshan nyid ma 'dres pa lta ba phyin ci log gis brtags pa'i nyes pa spangs te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na dri ba rnams kyis gnas skabs su nye bar mkho ba'i don rnams kun rdzob tu so sor mtshan nyid ma 'dres pa lta ba phyin ci log gis brtags pa'i nyes pa spangs te /
translated: In one way, the questions are about the conventional, individual characteristics of the topics that are needed in the present moment, avoiding the faults of mistaken conceptions.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyogs kyi grub pa'i mtha' nga yis bshad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyogs kyi grub pa'i mtha' nga yis bshad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: I will explain the unmistaken conclusion.

original: tshig rnams bkod pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni dri ba la sogs pa de dag thams cad tshig tsam yin gyis don grub pa med par ston pa'i tshig @73b dgod ces pa la sogs pa ste shes par zad do //
analyzed: tshig rnams bkod pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni dri ba la sogs pa de dag thams cad tshig tsam yin gyis don grub pa med par ston pa'i tshig @73b dgod ces pa la sogs pa ste shes par zad do //
translated: The meaning of the words arrayed and so on is that all of those questions and so on are merely words, not establishing a meaning. The meaning of arrayed and so on is understood.

original: de ltar dri ba'i lan shin tu bsdus pa dang dri bar mi 'os pa la sogs pa'i tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas bsdus te bstan pa dang / yang de las tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas bshad par dam bcas shing nyan par gdams par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dri ba'i lan shin tu bsdus pa dang dri bar mi 'os pa la sogs pa'i tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas bsdus te bstan pa dang / yang de las tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas bshad par dam bcas shing nyan par gdams par bstan nas /
translated: having promised to explain by way of other modes, and having instructed to listen,

original: de nyid la dri ba'i tshig 'god pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la dri ba'i tshig 'god pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the setting forth of the words of the question is ‚ÄúThen, the Bodhisattva, the great being, Maitreya‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: gal te 'dir dri ba dang lan gyi tshig brgya rtsa brgyad nyid du ston par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gal te 'dir dri ba dang lan gyi tshig brgya rtsa brgyad nyid du ston par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ni mi 'thad de /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúThe reason for teaching the words of the question and answer in just one hundred and eight is not tenable.

original: dri ba la sogs pa'i don skabs su nye bar mkho ba 'am gzhan yang rung ste rdzogs par ston pa yin na ni ches shin tu nyung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dri ba la sogs pa'i don skabs su nye bar mkho ba 'am gzhan yang rung ste rdzogs par ston pa yin na ni ches shin tu nyung bar 'gyur la /
translated: If one teaches the meaning of the question and so forth in a complete way, that is necessary for the occasion or otherwise, it would be far too brief.

original: phyogs 'ga' zhig tsam ston pa yin na ni mangs par yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs 'ga' zhig tsam ston pa yin na ni mangs par yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one teaches just a few aspects, it would be too much.‚Äù

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: 'di ni gdul bya nye ba nyid kyi bsam pa la dgongs nas shes rab kyi dmigs pa'i yul gtso bor gtan la 'bebs pa ni 'di nyid tsam bstan pas gdul bya rnams rjes su 'dzin par 'gyur bas de ltar dri ba dang lan gyi tshig 'di dag tsam
analyzed: 'di ni gdul bya nye ba nyid kyi bsam pa la dgongs nas shes rab kyi dmigs pa'i yul gtso bor gtan la 'bebs pa ni 'di nyid tsam bstan pas gdul bya rnams rjes su 'dzin par 'gyur bas de ltar dri ba dang lan gyi tshig 'di dag tsam
translated: By teaching just this, trainees are taken care of, and so just these questions and answers are set forth.

original: bkod pa'o // 'di dag gi go rims nges pa'i rgyu mtshan yang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: bkod pa'o // 'di dag gi go rims nges pa'i rgyu mtshan yang de nyid yin te /
translated: This is also the reason for the definite order of these topics.

original: de las gzhan pa'i go rims nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i go rims nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest reason for any other definite order.

original: de la skye ba'i tshig ces pa la sogs pa dgag pa'i yul brjod pa thams cad ni sgrub pa'i rnam pa nyid du dngos su blo la snang ba 'am /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i tshig ces pa la sogs pa dgag pa'i yul brjod pa thams cad ni sgrub pa'i rnam pa nyid du dngos su blo la snang ba 'am /
translated: In this regard, all statements that express the object of negation, such as ‚Äúthe term arising‚Äù and so on, appear to the mind in the manner of an affirmation.

original: de la zhen nas rtogs par bya ba'i rang bzhin te le'u dang por chos zhes pa'i sgras bstan par bya ba'i don dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la zhen nas rtogs par bya ba'i rang bzhin te le'u dang por chos zhes pa'i sgras bstan par bya ba'i don dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Or, having ascertained that, the nature of the object to be understood is to be applied to the meaning that is indicated by the term ‚Äúphenomenon‚Äù in the first chapter.

original: don 'di rnams thams cad kyang sngar bstan pa'i rigs pa 'am /
analyzed: don 'di rnams thams cad kyang sngar bstan pa'i rigs pa 'am /
translated: All of these topics are to be applied to the reasonings taught above.

original: 'og nas kyang gtan tshigs du ma'i sgo nas 'gog pas bden pa'i don ni cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: 'og nas kyang gtan tshigs du ma'i sgo nas 'gog pas bden pa'i don ni cung zad kyang med de /
translated: Since it will be refuted later on through many lines of reasoning, there is not the slightest bit of true existence.

original: de ltar bstan pa ni tshig tsam nyid yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa ni tshig tsam nyid yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the teachings are mere words.

original: de'i phyir de la ltos nas gzhag pa'i bkag pa'i chos blo'i don snang ba thams cad kyang sngar gyi chos med pa zhes pa'i tshig gi don dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la ltos nas gzhag pa'i bkag pa'i chos blo'i don snang ba thams cad kyang sngar gyi chos med pa zhes pa'i tshig gi don dang sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, all the phenomena of negation that are posited in dependence on them appear as objects of the mind.

original: de yang ltos pa ma grub pa'i phyir de la ltos te gzhag pa rnams brdzus pa nyid kyi phyir don grub pa med pas tshig tsam yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ltos pa ma grub pa'i phyir de la ltos te gzhag pa rnams brdzus pa nyid kyi phyir don grub pa med pas tshig tsam yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Since they are also not established in dependence, those that are posited in dependence are false. Since they do not establish objects, they are mere words.

original: de skad du yang mdo sde gzhan dag las /
analyzed: de skad du yang mdo sde gzhan dag las /
translated: As it says in other s≈´tras:

original: 'di dag thams cad ming tsam ste //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ming tsam ste //
translated: All of these are mere names.

original: 'du shes tsam la rab tu gnas //üîΩrjod par byed las ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: 'du shes tsam la rab tu gnas // rjod par byed las ma gtogs pa //
translated: They are based on mere conceptions.üîΩApart from the one who expresses,

original: brjod par bya ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yod ma yin //
translated: The object of expression does not exist.

original: zhes @74a * //üîΩgsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes @74a * // gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ltar na brjod pa'i tshig yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na brjod pa'i tshig yod dam zhe na /
translated: If one says that there are words of expression,

original: ma yin te de yang don la ltos te brtags pa'i phyir ltos sam grub pas mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te de yang don la ltos te brtags pa'i phyir ltos sam grub pas mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: It is not tenable to say that it is established by itself.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: yod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
analyzed: yod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
translated: Nonexistence is drawn out by existence.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be shown below.

original: de ltar na tshig dang don du snang zhing bshad pa nyid mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na tshig dang don du snang zhing bshad pa nyid mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that the words and their meanings appear and are explained.

original: de ltar snang ba kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin gyi tha dad pa'i don grub pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin gyi tha dad pa'i don grub pa med do //
translated: In that way, all appearances are the mind itself in the relative, but a separate object is not established.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: chos 'chad pa dang nyan dang bshad bya gang yin pa //üîΩde kun sgyu ma lta bur de bzhin gshegs pas bstan //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa dang nyan dang bshad bya gang yin pa // de kun sgyu ma lta bur de bzhin gshegs pas bstan //
translated: The Dharma that is explained, heard, and taught

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: All of that is taught by the TathƒÅgata to be like an illusion.

original: tshig so so'i don ni sngar gyi dri ba dang / lan bsdus te bstan pa'i tshig dang sbyar bas rtogs par sla ba nyid du zad do //
analyzed: tshig so so'i don ni sngar gyi dri ba dang / lan bsdus te bstan pa'i tshig dang sbyar bas rtogs par sla ba nyid du zad do //
translated: The meaning of the individual words is easily understood by combining them with the words that summarize the previous questions and answers.

original: dgag pa'i tshig thams cad ni /
analyzed: dgag pa'i tshig thams cad ni /
translated: All words of negation

original: sems tsam de ni snang ba med //
analyzed: sems tsam de ni snang ba med //
translated: Are the nonappearance of mind only.

original: sa rnams la yang rim pa med //
analyzed: sa rnams la yang rim pa med //
translated: There is no sequence in the stages.

original: ces lan bsdus te bstan pa'i tshig dang sbyar bar bya zhing /
analyzed: ces lan bsdus te bstan pa'i tshig dang sbyar bar bya zhing /

analyzed: gzhan yang sngar gyi dgag pa ston pa'i tshig gi khyad par dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the words that teach the previous refutations should be applied.

original: mi skye ba dang mi rtag pa ni skye ba dang rtag pa bkag pa yin gyi yongs gcod kyi cha ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi skye ba dang mi rtag pa ni skye ba dang rtag pa bkag pa yin gyi yongs gcod kyi cha ston pa ni ma yin no //

original: mtshan nyid kyi tshig ni mtshan nyid rnam par dgod pa zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi tshig ni mtshan nyid rnam par dgod pa zhes pa dang sbyar ro //

original: gnas gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ji ltar sa la 'jug ces pa dang ngo ;
analyzed: gnas gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ji ltar sa la 'jug ces pa dang ngo ;
translated: The transformation of the basis should be applied to ‚Äúhow does one enter the stages?‚Äù

original: / rang bzhin yod pa ni chos lnga dang rang bzhin zhes pa dang ngo //
analyzed: / rang bzhin yod pa ni chos lnga dang rang bzhin zhes pa dang ngo //
translated: The existence of intrinsic nature should be applied to the words ‚Äúfive dharmas and intrinsic nature.‚Äù

analyzed: sems kyi tshig ni yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes pa la sogs pa dang ngo //
translated: The words of mind should be applied to ‚Äúmind and consciousness‚Äù and so on.

original: dbu ma'i tshig ni sems tsam ni snang ba med ces pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: dbu ma'i tshig ni sems tsam ni snang ba med ces pa dang sbyar te /
translated: The words of the middle way should be applied to ‚Äúmind only is without appearance,‚Äù

analyzed: yod med kyi mtha' dang bral ba rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbu ma'o //
translated: the middle way of mere awareness free from the extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: ther zug pa'i tshig ni snying po ji ltar 'byung zhes pa dang ste /
analyzed: ther zug pa'i tshig ni snying po ji ltar 'byung zhes pa dang ste /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po 'gyur ba med pa'o //

original: nyon mongs pa ni ci slad 'gyur ba brgya zhes pa dang ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni ci slad 'gyur ba brgya zhes pa dang ngo //
translated: The words of affliction are ‚ÄúWhy are there hundreds of changes?‚Äù

original: sred pa'i tshig ni ci slad skyes bu na chung sha 'tshal bar yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes dang ngo //
analyzed: sred pa'i tshig ni ci slad skyes bu na chung sha 'tshal bar yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes dang ngo //
translated: The words of craving are ‚ÄúWhy is a young man so fond of flesh?‚Äù

original: thabs kyi tshig ni mtshan dang de bzhin gzugs sna tshogs zhes pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: thabs kyi tshig ni mtshan dang de bzhin gzugs sna tshogs zhes pa dang sbyar te /
translated: The words of method are ‚ÄúSigns and various forms‚Äù and so on.

original: sems can 'dul ba'i thabs su ji ltar mos pa'i gzugs su ston pa'o //
analyzed: sems can 'dul ba'i thabs su ji ltar mos pa'i gzugs su ston pa'o //
translated: The method of training sentient beings is to show whatever form is desired.

original: mkhas pa'i tshig ni /üîΩgang gis ji ltar rab tu bshad //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i tshig ni / gang gis ji ltar rab tu bshad //
translated: The words of skill are

original: ces pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: ces pa dang sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúBy whom and how are they explained?‚Äù

original: mkhas pa gang gis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa gang gis zhes pa'o //
translated: The words of skill are ‚ÄúBy whom?‚Äù

original: smon pa'i tshig dang 'khor gsum gyi tshig dang mtshan ma'i tshig ni ting @74b nge 'dzin zhes pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: smon pa'i tshig dang 'khor gsum gyi tshig dang mtshan ma'i tshig ni ting @74b nge 'dzin zhes pa dang sbyar te /
translated: The words of aspiration, the words of the three spheres, and the words of signs are ‚ÄúSamadhi‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ting nge 'dzin gyi dgag bya khams gsum la smon pa la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ting nge 'dzin gyi dgag bya khams gsum la smon pa la sogs ba'o //
translated: The three doors of liberation are the three concentrations that are the objects of negation: the desire for the three realms and so on.

original: 'khor gsum ni bya ba thams cad la byed pa po dang / las dang bya ba gsum du btags pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum ni bya ba thams cad la byed pa po dang / las dang bya ba gsum du btags pa'o //
translated: The three spheres are the imputation of the three: the agent, the object, and the action, in all activities.

original: yod med kyi phyogs ni gnyis kyi mtha' brjod ces pa dang ste /
analyzed: yod med kyi phyogs ni gnyis kyi mtha' brjod ces pa dang ste /
translated: The extreme of existence and nonexistence is the expression of the two extremes.

original: gang yang rung ba cig gi mthar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba cig gi mthar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the apprehension of either extreme.

original: gnyi ga'i tshig ces pa ni de lta bu'i mtha' gnyis ka tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i tshig ces pa ni de lta bu'i mtha' gnyis ka tshogs pa'o //
translated: The expression of both is the combination of those two extremes.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde ba'i tshig ni /üîΩde dag 'di dang slad mar yang //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde ba'i tshig ni / de dag 'di dang slad mar yang //
translated: The expression of happiness in this life is

original: chags med nyer len ma mchis 'gyur //
analyzed: chags med nyer len ma mchis 'gyur //
translated: they will be free from attachment and appropriation

original: zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: in this life and in the next.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa la yang snga ma rnams kyis bshad do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa la yang snga ma rnams kyis bshad do //
translated: The former masters also explain the meditative attainment of cessation and so on.

original: chu'i tshig ni khams drug 'dzin pa dang zhes pa 'am chu'i zla ba 'dra ba zhes pa dang ngo //
analyzed: chu'i tshig ni khams drug 'dzin pa dang zhes pa 'am chu'i zla ba 'dra ba zhes pa dang ngo //
translated: The expression of water is the apprehension of the six elements or like the moon in the water.

original: rmongs pa'i tshig ni glang po ri dags rta blun zhes pa dang ngo //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i tshig ni glang po ri dags rta blun zhes pa dang ngo //
translated: The words of delusion are ‚Äúelephant, deer, and horse, fool.‚Äù

original: yang dag pa'i tshig ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tshig ni /
translated: The words of reality are

original: ci phyir sems tsam yang dag nyid //
analyzed: ci phyir sems tsam yang dag nyid //
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is mind-only the reality?‚Äù

original: zhes pa la sogs pa dang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa dang ngo //
translated: and so forth.

original: skyo ba'i tshig ni bcings pa su lags zhes pa 'am /
analyzed: skyo ba'i tshig ni bcings pa su lags zhes pa 'am /
translated: The words of weariness are ‚ÄúWho is bound?‚Äù

original: bsam gtan pa'i yul dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa'i yul dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: or they are applied to the object of meditation.

original: stug po'i tshig ni shing gi 'khri shing zhes pa dang ngo //
analyzed: stug po'i tshig ni shing gi 'khri shing zhes pa dang ngo //
translated: The words of density are ‚Äúthe vines of the trees.‚Äù

original: sgyu rtsal dang rig pa dang bzo'i tshig ni tshig gsum du dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu rtsal dang rig pa dang bzo'i tshig ni tshig gsum du dbye bar bya'o //
translated: The words of art, science, and craft are divided into three.

original: sems kyi tshig ni sems dang pha rol phyin pa zhes pa 'am /
analyzed: sems kyi tshig ni sems dang pha rol phyin pa zhes pa 'am /
translated: The words of mind are ‚Äúmind and the perfections‚Äù

original: yang sems dang sa rnam bdun zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang sems dang sa rnam bdun zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: or ‚Äúmind and the seven stages.‚Äù

original: blo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: blo'i tshig ni /
translated: The words of intellect are

original: blo dang rig pa bgyi dang bral //üîΩzhes pa'i dgag bya ston pa'i tshig dang ngo //
analyzed: blo dang rig pa bgyi dang bral // zhes pa'i dgag bya ston pa'i tshig dang ngo //
translated: ‚Äúintellect and awareness are free from action.‚ÄùüîΩThis shows the words that teach the object of negation.

original: 'khor lo'i tshig ni sgyu ma'i dpe rnams ston pa'i skabs su mgal me'i 'khor lo don gyis bstan pa 'am /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i tshig ni sgyu ma'i dpe rnams ston pa'i skabs su mgal me'i 'khor lo don gyis bstan pa 'am /
translated: The words of the wheel are ‚Äúthe wheel of fire‚Äù in the context of teaching the examples of illusion.

original: yang na khor yug gi ri zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na khor yug gi ri zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Or it is applied to the mountains surrounding the environment.

original: nyi zla dang skar ma'i tshig kyang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ba'o //
analyzed: nyi zla dang skar ma'i tshig kyang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ba'o //
translated: The words sun, moon, and stars are also divided into two types.

original: bden pa'i tshig ni /
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig ni /
translated: The words of truth are

original: de bzhin nyid ni rnam pa du //üîΩzhes pa dang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni rnam pa du // zhes pa dang ngo //
translated: How many aspects does suchness have?

original: yan lag gi tshig ni byang chub yan lag ces pa dang ngo //
analyzed: yan lag gi tshig ni byang chub yan lag ces pa dang ngo //
translated: The words of the branches are the words of the branches of enlightenment.

original: sgyu rtsal rig pa ni yul can gyi shes pa yin pas snga ma dang zlos pa med do //
analyzed: sgyu rtsal rig pa ni yul can gyi shes pa yin pas snga ma dang zlos pa med do //
translated: The words of the arts and sciences are not repeated in the previous [words] because the consciousness that is the subject is the arts and sciences.

original: nor ba'i tshig ni ci'i slad du nor pa zhes pa dang ngo //
analyzed: nor ba'i tshig ni ci'i slad du nor pa zhes pa dang ngo //
translated: The words of error are why is it called error?

original: bsrung ba ni rgyal srid bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba ni rgyal srid bsrung ba'o //
translated: Protection is the protection of the kingdom.

original: rus kyi tshig ni sh'akya'i rigs zhes pa dang ngo //
analyzed: rus kyi tshig ni sh'akya'i rigs zhes pa dang ngo //
translated: The words of lineage are the Shakya lineage.

original: gzung ba'i tshig ni snang la ji ltar 'jug ces pa dang ngo //
analyzed: gzung ba'i tshig ni snang la ji ltar 'jug ces pa dang ngo //
translated: The words of grasping are how does one engage with appearances?

original: g-yo ba'i tshig ni 'gro ba dag dang zhes pa 'am rnam par shes pa yul la g-yo ba'o //üîΩ'og ma'i tshig @75a * //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i tshig ni 'gro ba dag dang zhes pa 'am rnam par shes pa yul la g-yo ba'o // 'og ma'i tshig @75a * //
translated: The words of movement are the movements of consciousness in objects.

original: ni khams 'og ma ste 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: ni khams 'og ma ste 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The words of the lower are the lower realms, the desire realm.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshig ni rnam pa gnyis su dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshig ni rnam pa gnyis su dbye ba'o //
translated: The words cause and effect are divided into two kinds.

original: bstan pa gzud pa ni //üîΩbshad pa dag kyang ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: bstan pa gzud pa ni // bshad pa dag kyang ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: The introduction to the teachingüîΩis the explanation of the teaching.

original: zhes pa dang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa dang ngo //
translated: How is it?

original: byin gyi rlabs ni ye shes dang thugs rje'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhing thams cad du mtshan dang gzugs sna tshogs ston zhes pa dang ngo //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs ni ye shes dang thugs rje'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhing thams cad du mtshan dang gzugs sna tshogs ston zhes pa dang ngo //
translated: The blessing is the display of various names and forms in all fields by the blessing of intuition and compassion.üîΩMoreover, it is connected with the statement, ‚ÄúBy the power of the Buddha, he rose from his seat.

original: yang sangs rgyas kyi mthus stan las langs zhes pa dang yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas kyi mthus stan las langs zhes pa dang yang sbyar ro //
translated: Also, ‚Äúthrough the Buddha‚Äôs power, he rose from his seat‚Äù is applied again.üîΩüîΩ

original: de ltar na tshig brgya rtsa brgyad po 'di rnams kyi don ni dngos su sngar gyi dri ba brgya rtsa brgyad dang sbyar zhing de nyid kyis de'i rigs su gyur pa gsung rab la sogs pa nas bstan pa'i tshig thams cad kyang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na tshig brgya rtsa brgyad po 'di rnams kyi don ni dngos su sngar gyi dri ba brgya rtsa brgyad dang sbyar zhing de nyid kyis de'i rigs su gyur pa gsung rab la sogs pa nas bstan pa'i tshig thams cad kyang shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of these one hundred and eight words is directly connected with the one hundred and eight previous questions, and by this very means, one should understand all the words taught in the scriptures and so forth that belong to this class.

original: tshig tsam nyid yin gyi sgrub pa 'am dgag pa'i don ni cung zad kyang med do zhes sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig tsam nyid yin gyi sgrub pa 'am dgag pa'i don ni cung zad kyang med do zhes sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: As was previously explained, they are mere words, and they do not have even the slightest meaning to be established or refuted.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis brjod ces pa ni de dag gis gsungs shing /
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis brjod ces pa ni de dag gis gsungs shing /
translated: The phrase spoken by the buddhas of the past means that they have spoken,

original: da ltar ngas kyang bstan zhes pa'o //üîΩde ltar dgongs pa can gyi tshig gzhan gyi sgo nas dris pa'i lan bsdus te bstan nas de nyid shin tu rgyas par 'chad pa ni de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar ngas kyang bstan zhes pa'o // de ltar dgongs pa can gyi tshig gzhan gyi sgo nas dris pa'i lan bsdus te bstan nas de nyid shin tu rgyas par 'chad pa ni de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and I also teach means that I teach at present.

original: de las dang po chos thams cad bsdus pa'i le'u la yang don rnam pa lnga'i sgo nas ston pa las //üîΩdang po shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin ston te /üîΩde yang don rnam pa bcu'i sgo nas ston pa las dang por gzhan gyi dbang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa'i tshul ston to //üîΩde las dang po'i dris lan gyi tshul gyis mdo tsam du bstan pa ni /üîΩde nas yang zhes pa nas mtshan nyid gnas pa'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: de las dang po chos thams cad bsdus pa'i le'u la yang don rnam pa lnga'i sgo nas ston pa las //üîΩdang po shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin ston te /üîΩde yang don rnam pa bcu'i sgo nas ston pa las dang por gzhan gyi dbang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa'i tshul ston to //üîΩde las dang po'i dris lan gyi tshul gyis mdo tsam du bstan pa ni /üîΩde nas yang zhes pa nas mtshan nyid gnas pa'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: Having thus summarized and taught the reply to the question by means of other words that are intentional, the very extensive explanation of that is from Then again... and so on.

original: de yang gzhan gyi dbang ni 'dus byas pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyi dbang ni 'dus byas pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the other-dependent is compounded.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa dang rnam pa gsum yin par 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas gsungs la /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa dang rnam pa gsum yin par 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas gsungs la /
translated: And the characteristics of the compounded are the three: arising, enduring, and ceasing, as stated by the noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las rnam pa bzhir bshad pa ni tshul lugs gzhan yin pas /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las rnam pa bzhir bshad pa ni tshul lugs gzhan yin pas /
translated: The explanation in the treatise Sa·πÉgraha that there are four characteristics is another system.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of contradiction with that.

original: de la rgyu ni rang rang gi rigs kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu du mar 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni rang rang gi rigs kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu du mar 'brel ba'o //
translated: Among those, the cause is the cause of each type that is related to many results.

original: mtshan nyid ni 'dir rnam par shes pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid sngar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni 'dir rnam par shes pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid sngar bstan pa ste /
translated: The characteristic is the characteristic of the consciousnesses that was previously explained.

original: mdor bsdu na rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: In brief, it is the nature of realization.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid dngos sam mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dngos po la yang mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid dngos sam mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dngos po la yang mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, the characteristic is either the actual characteristic or a thing that possesses the characteristic is also called the characteristic.

original: de ci'i @75b phyir rgyun kyang mtshan nyid kyis bsdus mod kyi de'i khyad par gyi ldog pa gzhan yin pas gnyis su phye ba'o //
analyzed: de ci'i @75b phyir rgyun kyang mtshan nyid kyis bsdus mod kyi de'i khyad par gyi ldog pa gzhan yin pas gnyis su phye ba'o //
translated: Why is that? Although the continuum is also included in the characteristic, it is divided into two because it has a different isolate.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ni dbye ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par ston te //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ni dbye ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par ston te //
translated: Great Intelligence and so on extensively teaches by way of the divisions and so forth.
