original: de las dang po'i dbye ba'i tshul ni rnam par shes pa rags pa 'am gsal bar 'jug pa dang / de'i gnas kyi dbang du byas te dbye na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de las dang po'i dbye ba'i tshul ni rnam par shes pa rags pa 'am gsal bar 'jug pa dang / de'i gnas kyi dbang du byas te dbye na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Among those, the mode of the first division is as follows: When divided from the perspective of the coarse or clear engagement of consciousness and its basis, there are three types.

original: 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang las kyi mtshan nyid dang / rigs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang las kyi mtshan nyid dang / rigs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of engagement, the characteristic of function, and the characteristic of type.

original: de la dang po ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa yul so so la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa yul so so la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The first is the five sense consciousnesses engaging their individual objects.

original: gnyis pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste de yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba dang / tshol ba pa dang nges pa'o zhes chos mngon pa las bshad pa las /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste de yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba dang / tshol ba pa dang nges pa'o zhes chos mngon pa las bshad pa las /
translated: The second is the mental consciousness, which is explained in the Abhidharma as the one that arises from the proximate, the one that searches, and the one that ascertains.

original: 'dir ni tshol ba dang nges pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni tshol ba dang nges pa gnyis yin te /
translated: Here, it is the two, the one that searches and the one that ascertains.

original: des kyang lus ngag tu snang ba'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa 'am /
analyzed: des kyang lus ngag tu snang ba'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa 'am /
translated: Also, it is the motivating force of all the actions that appear as body and speech.

original: kun gzhi la rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi bag chags 'jog par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: kun gzhi la rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi bag chags 'jog par byed pa 'am /
translated: Or, it is the one that deposits the habitual tendencies of all consciousnesses in the foundation consciousness.üîΩOr, it is the one that performs the function of determining that the meaning of an object is like this and not otherwise.

original: don 'di ltar yin gyi gzhan du ma yin zhes gtan la 'bebs pa'i bya ba byed pas las kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: don 'di ltar yin gyi gzhan du ma yin zhes gtan la 'bebs pa'i bya ba byed pas las kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Thus it is called the characteristic of action.

original: yang las kyi mtshan nyid ni de'i las su gyur pa kun gzhi la yod pa'i bag chags kyang yin no //
analyzed: yang las kyi mtshan nyid ni de'i las su gyur pa kun gzhi la yod pa'i bag chags kyang yin no //
translated: Also, the characteristic of action is the habitual tendencies that exist in the foundation consciousness and are its action.

original: gsum pa ni gnyis po de rnams kyi gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste de rnams kyi rigs mthun pa'i rgyu yin pas rigs kyi mtshan nyid ces so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gnyis po de rnams kyi gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste de rnams kyi rigs mthun pa'i rgyu yin pas rigs kyi mtshan nyid ces so //
translated: The third is the foundation consciousness, the basis of those two, because it is the homogeneous cause of those two.

original: gal te de ltar na theg pa chen po'i gsung rab las rnam par shes pa brgyad nyid du gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na theg pa chen po'i gsung rab las rnam par shes pa brgyad nyid du gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then why is it that the MahƒÅyƒÅna scriptures teach that there are eight consciousnesses?

original: de ltar yang srid tshad kyi dbang du byas nas rgyas par phye na /
analyzed: de ltar yang srid tshad kyi dbang du byas nas rgyas par phye na /
translated: It is possible to explain this in terms of the full-blown classification of consciousnesses.

original: de rnams kyi steng du yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang brgyad du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi steng du yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang brgyad du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In addition to those, there are eight when adding afflicted intellect.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi so so'i rang rang gi ngo bo la sogs pa cung zad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi so so'i rang rang gi ngo bo la sogs pa cung zad brjod par bya ste /
translated: The individual natures and so on of the consciousnesses will now be briefly described.

original: re zhig sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i rang rang gi ngo bo ni lung du ma bstan pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: re zhig sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i rang rang gi ngo bo ni lung du ma bstan pa nyid yin la /
translated: The individual natures of the five sense consciousnesses are neutral.

original: so so'i mtshan nyid las mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: so so'i mtshan nyid las mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: From their individual characteristics, the defining characteristic of eye consciousness is

original: bdag po'i rkyen mig gi dbang po la brten nas gzugs kyi rnam par gsal ba'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen mig gi dbang po la brten nas gzugs kyi rnam par gsal ba'o //
translated: that it is the clear appearance of form in dependence on the eye faculty as its dominant condition.

original: de lta na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba la khyab ches par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba la khyab ches par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it would be too broad because it would also apply to mental factors concomitant with it.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no error.

original: de nas sems las rdzas tha dad pa ma yin zhing de nyid kyi khyad par du gtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nas sems las rdzas tha dad pa ma yin zhing de nyid kyi khyad par du gtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not a different substance from the mind and it is included in its specific attributes.

original: ji ltar ba lang gi mtshan nyid @76a * //
analyzed: ji ltar ba lang gi mtshan nyid @76a * //
translated: For example, the defining characteristic of an ox is that it is a cow.

original: lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa ser zal la zhugs pa'i khyab ches par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa ser zal la zhugs pa'i khyab ches par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: It is not too broad, because it does not apply to the mere possession of a dewlap, etc.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rdzas tha dad med pa'i don 'di yang 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rdzas tha dad med pa'i don 'di yang 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: This point that mind and mental factors are not substantially different will be explained later.

original: gal te mig gi dbang po nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig gi dbang po nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the eye faculty?

original: 'dir gzugs can gyi dbang po zar ma'i me tog lta bu zhes pa la sogs pa ni sde pa rnams kyis brtags pa yin gyi don du grub pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'dir gzugs can gyi dbang po zar ma'i me tog lta bu zhes pa la sogs pa ni sde pa rnams kyis brtags pa yin gyi don du grub pa ni med do //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas imagine that the physical eye faculty is like a flower of the zar ma tree, but that is not established as the meaning.

original: 'on kyang mig gi dbang po zhes bya bar grags shing snang ba 'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang mig gi dbang po zhes bya bar grags shing snang ba 'am /
translated: However, the eye faculty is renowned and appears as such,

original: de la brten pa'i nus pa'i khyad par sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i nus pa'i khyad par sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa'o //
translated: or it is a special potency that is the basis of that, which becomes the nature of the mind.

original: de nyid ji ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: de nyid ji ltar grub ce na /
translated: How is that established?

original: mngon sum nyid gyis grub pa 'am /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid gyis grub pa 'am /
translated: It is established by direct perception.

original: yang na rkyen gsum tshang yang res 'ga' ma dmigs pa'i phyir zhes pa'i gtan tshigs la brten nas rkyen gsum las ma gtogs pa'i mig gi rnam shes skyed pa'i nus pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig mig tu grags pa'i phyogs 'di nyid na yod do zhes rtags las rtogsüîΩpar gyur pa ste ;
analyzed: yang na rkyen gsum tshang yang res 'ga' ma dmigs pa'i phyir zhes pa'i gtan tshigs la brten nas rkyen gsum las ma gtogs pa'i mig gi rnam shes skyed pa'i nus pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig mig tu grags pa'i phyogs 'di nyid na yod do zhes rtags las rtogs par gyur pa ste ;
translated: Or, based on the argument that although the three conditions are complete, sometimes the eye consciousness is not observed, one infers through reasoning that some special potency to generate an eye consciousness that is not included among the three conditions exists in this very position known as the eye.

original: ji ltar tshad ma rnam 'grel las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar tshad ma rnam 'grel las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is just as explained in the Pramanavarttika.

original: de nyid bdag po'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni rnam shes don du snang ba'i phyogs su 'phro zhing 'jug pa ni rkyen gzhan tshang ba'i gnas skabs na mig phye btsums kyi rjes su 'gro ldog byed pas des bskyed de /
analyzed: de nyid bdag po'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni rnam shes don du snang ba'i phyogs su 'phro zhing 'jug pa ni rkyen gzhan tshang ba'i gnas skabs na mig phye btsums kyi rjes su 'gro ldog byed pas des bskyed de /
translated: The eye is the dominant condition because the eye consciousness, which is the aspect that appears as the object, moves and engages in that direction. When the other conditions are complete, the eye consciousness moves and stops in accordance with the eye being open or closed, and thus it is generated by the eye.

original: ji ltar rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las /
translated: As the treatises on reasoning explain.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du skyed la dbang pos ni yul la 'dzin nus su skyed ces pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du skyed la dbang pos ni yul la 'dzin nus su skyed ces pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The immediately preceding condition generates the eye consciousness in the aspect of realization, and the sense faculty generates the eye consciousness in the aspect of apprehending its object.

original: 'dir yul ni da ltar ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skad cig ma yin zhes mngon pa'i bstan bcos las bshad pa ni nyan thos sde pa rnams kyi grub mtha' dang bstun pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir yul ni da ltar ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skad cig ma yin zhes mngon pa'i bstan bcos las bshad pa ni nyan thos sde pa rnams kyi grub mtha' dang bstun pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, the Abhidharmako≈õa explains that the object is the present moment of the intrinsic identity of form and so on. This is in accordance with the tenets of the ≈õrƒÅvaka schools.

original: de lta bu'i yul grub pa ni med de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yul grub pa ni med de /
translated: However, such an object does not exist.

original: 'on kyang gzugs kyi rnam par snang ba sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa nyid mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs kyi rnam par snang ba sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa nyid mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul zhes bya'o //
translated: Nevertheless, the appearance in the aspect of form that is the nature of mind itself is called the object of eye consciousness.

original: de skad du /üîΩrang gi sa bon gang las de'i ;
analyzed: de skad du / rang gi sa bon gang las de'i ;
translated: As it is said:üîΩWhatever appears to the consciousness

original: / rnam rig snang ba gang byung ba //üîΩde dag de yi skye mched ni //
analyzed: / rnam rig snang ba gang byung ba // de dag de yi skye mched ni //
translated: arises from its own seed.üîΩThe Subduer taught that

original: rnam pa gnyis su thub pas gsungs //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su thub pas gsungs //
translated: those are the two kinds of sense bases.

original: zhes pa'o // gzhan yang snga ma ltar na zla ba gnyis snang la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i shes pa rnams kyi yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pas ma khyab pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gzhan yang snga ma ltar na zla ba gnyis snang la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i shes pa rnams kyi yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pas ma khyab pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if it were as the opponent says, then the objects of mistaken consciousnesses such as the appearance of two moons would not be their specific characteristics, and so the definition would not be universally applicable.

original: rna @76b ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang yul yang 'di nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rna @76b ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang yul yang 'di nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics and objects of auditory consciousness and so on should be understood in the same way.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo ni dge mi dge la sogs pa ci rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo ni dge mi dge la sogs pa ci rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of mental consciousness can be virtuous, nonvirtuous, and so on, as appropriate.

original: mtshan nyid ni bdag po'i rkyen yid la brten nas yul gyi rnam par snang ba'o //üîΩyid kyang drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni bdag po'i rkyen yid la brten nas yul gyi rnam par snang ba'o // yid kyang drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: Its definition is that which appears in the aspect of an object in dependence on the dominant condition, the mental faculty.üîΩThe mental faculty is the consciousness that has just ceased.üîΩIt is said:

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
translated: Whatever is the consciousness that has just ceased is the mental faculty.

original: zhes pa'am / rang gi rigs kyi skad cig ma snga ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'am / rang gi rigs kyi skad cig ma snga ma'o //
translated: Or, it is the previous moment of its own type.

original: 'di'i yul ni dus gsum gyis bsdus pa'i chos 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i spyi yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i yul ni dus gsum gyis bsdus pa'i chos 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i spyi yin la /
translated: Its object is the general characteristics of phenomena, both conditioned and unconditioned, subsumed within the three times.

original: yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin no zhes kyang 'chad de /
analyzed: yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin no zhes kyang 'chad de /
translated: Also, it is explained that that which arises from the power of abiding observes the object's own characteristics.

original: tshad mas grub pa ni med do //
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa ni med do //
translated: But it is not established by valid knowledge.

original: gzhan yang yid goms pa'i stobs kyis rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don gsal bar snang ba yang phyi'i don gyi tshul khas len pa rnams 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang yid goms pa'i stobs kyis rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don gsal bar snang ba yang phyi'i don gyi tshul khas len pa rnams 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, although those who assert external objects assert that the power of mental familiarity causes the object's own characteristics to appear clearly,

original: yang dag par ni ma yin no zhes sngar bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag par ni ma yin no zhes sngar bstan to //
translated: this is not correct, as was previously explained.

original: 'di rnams kyi las dang mtshungs par ldan pa la sogs pa chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las bshad pa ni mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos dang bstun nas kun rdzob kyi tshul rnam par gzhag pa spros te bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi las dang mtshungs par ldan pa la sogs pa chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las bshad pa ni mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos dang bstun nas kun rdzob kyi tshul rnam par gzhag pa spros te bstan pa yin la /
translated: The topics of the Abhidharma, such as the actions and concomitant states of these consciousnesses, are taught in the Abhidharma treatises in order to extensively present the conventional nature of consciousness in accordance with the treatises of the SautrƒÅntikas and so on.

original: 'dir ni don la gzhol ba nges pa'i don nyid bstan pa yin pas mi spro'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni don la gzhol ba nges pa'i don nyid bstan pa yin pas mi spro'o //
translated: But here, since the definitive meaning that accords with the meaning is being taught, it is not elaborated.

original: yang kun gzhi la rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin la mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi sa bon du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yang kun gzhi la rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin la mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi sa bon du gyur pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the nature of consciousness in the foundation consciousness is unobscured and neutral, and its definition is that it is the seed of all consciousnesses.

original: ji skad du stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las /üîΩthams cad sa bon kun gzhi la //
analyzed: ji skad du stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las / thams cad sa bon kun gzhi la //
translated: As the Dense Array Scripture declares,üîΩAll seeds are in the foundation consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa kun kyang gnas //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kun kyang gnas //
translated: and all consciousnesses are present there.

original: rnam shes bdun po kun gzhi las //
analyzed: rnam shes bdun po kun gzhi las //
translated: The seven consciousnesses arise from the foundation consciousness,

original: rab tu 'byung ngo phan tshun gnas //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ngo phan tshun gnas // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and they are mutually present.

original: de'i don yang rnam par shes pa bdun po rnams 'gag pa na rang gi rigs mthun phyi ma skyed nus kyi bag chags kun gzhi la bsgos pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don yang rnam par shes pa bdun po rnams 'gag pa na rang gi rigs mthun phyi ma skyed nus kyi bag chags kun gzhi la bsgos pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: When the seven consciousnesses cease, they leave an imprint in the foundation consciousness, a potentiality to produce a subsequent consciousness of the same type.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags zhes kyang bya la /
translated: Therefore, it is also called the ‚Äúimprint of natural outcome‚Äù and

original: rnam shes sna tshogs su snang zhing spros pa'i bag chags zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: rnam shes sna tshogs su snang zhing spros pa'i bag chags zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: the ‚Äúimprint of the proliferation of the appearance of various consciousnesses.‚Äù

original: gzung 'dzin gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa'i bag chags dang ldan pas 'dzin pa gnyis kyi bag chags zhes pa la sogs pa rnam grangs du ma lung las bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa'i bag chags dang ldan pas 'dzin pa gnyis kyi bag chags zhes pa la sogs pa rnam grangs du ma lung las bshad pa'o //
translated: It is said in the scriptures that it is called the ‚Äúhabit energy of the two graspings‚Äù because it possesses the habit energies of the appearances of the two graspings, subject and object.

original: rnam shes bdun po rnams ni phan tshun nam rang rang gi bag chags bsgo ba'i rten du mi 'thad de //
analyzed: rnam shes bdun po rnams ni phan tshun nam rang rang gi bag chags bsgo ba'i rten du mi 'thad de //
translated: The seven consciousnesses are not tenable as the support for the impregnation of their own habit energies or of those of others.

original: rgyun mi brten pas sa bon chud zos par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rgyun mi brten pas sa bon chud zos par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Because they are not continuous, the seeds would be lost.

original: ji ltar rgyun mi brten @77a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyun mi brten @77a * //
translated: How are they not continuous?

original: pa'i skyes bu la nor bcol na chud zos par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: pa'i skyes bu la nor bcol na chud zos par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as when one entrusts property to a person who is not continuous, it is lost.

original: kun gzhi ni rgyun dang ldan pas de lta bu'i nyes pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi ni rgyun dang ldan pas de lta bu'i nyes pa las grol ba'o //
translated: The foundation consciousness is continuous and is thus free from such faults.

original: yang kun gzhi de nyid la rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: yang kun gzhi de nyid la rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: Also, that foundation consciousness is called the ‚Äúconsciousness that is the result of evolution.‚Äù

original: rnam par smin pa ni rgyu zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba las byung zhing /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni rgyu zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba las byung zhing /
translated: Evolution is that which arises from contaminated virtuous and nonvirtuous causes.

original: de yang rgyu dang dus gzhan gyis chod pa'i 'og tu byung ba dang / sems can gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa dang / rang gi ngo bo lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes bstan bcos dag las bshad do //üîΩgzhan yang de nyid la len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rgyu dang dus gzhan gyis chod pa'i 'og tu byung ba dang / sems can gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa dang / rang gi ngo bo lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes bstan bcos dag las bshad do // gzhan yang de nyid la len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it is taught in the treatises that it arises later, separated from its cause by another time, it is included within the mental continuum of sentient beings, and its nature is neutral.üîΩMoreover, it is called the appropriating consciousness because it appropriates and grasps this body.

original: 'di ltar des lus 'di gzung zhing blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las bshad pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar des lus 'di gzung zhing blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las bshad pas so //
translated: This is explained in the Definitive Commentary on the Intention.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes kyang mdo sde 'di nyid las ston par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes kyang mdo sde 'di nyid las ston par 'gyur zhing /
translated: It is also taught in this s≈´tra as the essence of the tathƒÅgata.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde gzhan las kyang gsungs te skabs su bab pa na bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde gzhan las kyang gsungs te skabs su bab pa na bshad par bya'o //
translated: It is also taught in other s≈´tras such as the NirvƒÅ·πáa S≈´tra, and I will explain it when the appropriate time comes.

original: 'di'i dmigs pa'i yul ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i dmigs pa'i yul ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Its object will be taught later.

original: ldog pa'i dus la rigs chad pa khas len pa rnams ni de 'dra ba'i gang zag la ltos te ldog pa'i dus med de /
analyzed: ldog pa'i dus la rigs chad pa khas len pa rnams ni de 'dra ba'i gang zag la ltos te ldog pa'i dus med de /
translated: Those who accept that there is a time when the lineage is severed say that there is no time when such a person is severed,

original: phyi ma'i mthar thug pa med pa'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mthar thug pa med pa'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: because there is no end to the future.

original: mi 'thad pa nyid du 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: mi 'thad pa nyid du 'og nas ston to //
translated: This is untenable, as will be explained below.

original: des na 'dir sa bon gyi cha dang rnam par smin pa'i cha las dang po sa bon la yang gnyis te zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon dang / zag pa med pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: des na 'dir sa bon gyi cha dang rnam par smin pa'i cha las dang po sa bon la yang gnyis te zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon dang / zag pa med pa'i sa bon no //
translated: Therefore, here the seed aspect and the fruitional aspect are twofold: the contaminated seed and the uncontaminated seed.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon kyang gnyis yin pa las /
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon kyang gnyis yin pa las /
translated: The contaminated seed is twofold.

original: dang po mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i dus na ldog la /
analyzed: dang po mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i dus na ldog la /
translated: First, the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing are severed at the time when the path of seeing arises.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang sgom pa mthar thug pa'i dus na ldog pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang sgom pa mthar thug pa'i dus na ldog pa'o //
translated: Those to be abandoned by the path of meditation are severed at the time when meditation is complete.

original: zag pa med pa'i sa bon ni ldog pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sa bon ni ldog pa mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that the uncontaminated seed is severed.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs na yang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi rten du gyur pa me long lta bu'i ye shes rgyun dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs na yang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi rten du gyur pa me long lta bu'i ye shes rgyun dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Even at the time of Buddhahood, it is the support of the uncontaminated dharmas, the continuity of the mirror-like pristine wisdom.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As is said:

original: me long ye shes mi g-yos te //
analyzed: me long ye shes mi g-yos te //
translated: The mirror-like pristine wisdom is unmoving,

original: ye shes gsum ni de la brten //
analyzed: ye shes gsum ni de la brten //
translated: and the three pristine wisdoms are based on it.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: gzhan yang sa bon de rnams kyi rten du gyur ba kun gzhi'i ngo bor gyur pa'i rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sa bon de rnams kyi rten du gyur ba kun gzhi'i ngo bor gyur pa'i rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the nature of the realization that is the essence of the foundation consciousness, which is the support of those seeds, is uninterrupted.

original: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ni de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu phyi ma phyi ma rnams skyed pa la /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ni de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu phyi ma phyi ma rnams skyed pa la /
translated: The nature of realization, in producing the subsequent effects that are such a nature,

original: rgyu mtshang ba med pa @77b nyid du da ltar nyams su myong bas grub la /
analyzed: rgyu mtshang ba med pa @77b nyid du da ltar nyams su myong bas grub la /
translated: is established by present experience as a cause that is not incomplete.üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / ma tshang med rgyu de la ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ma tshang med rgyu de la ni //
translated: In that cause that is not incomplete,

original: 'bras bu gang gis ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang gis ldog par 'gyur //
translated: what effect will be stopped?

original: zhes pa ste ldog pa nyid mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste ldog pa nyid mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: It is not tenable that it will be stopped.

original: rnam par smin pa'i cha ni me long lta bu'i ye shes thob pa'i dus na ldog ces bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i cha ni me long lta bu'i ye shes thob pa'i dus na ldog ces bshad pa'o //
translated: The aspect of karmic maturation is said to be eliminated when mirror-like wisdom is attained.

original: gal te de lta na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ye shes kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa ni rnam par smin pa'i sangs rgyas zhes 'og nas ston pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ye shes kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa ni rnam par smin pa'i sangs rgyas zhes 'og nas ston pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it would contradict the later statement that the enjoyment body, which is the nature of wisdom, is the fruitional buddha.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: sngon dge ba goms pa'i bag chags las brgyud nas skyes pas rnam par smin pa zhes btags su zad kyi /üîΩrnam par smin pa dngos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon dge ba goms pa'i bag chags las brgyud nas skyes pas rnam par smin pa zhes btags su zad kyi / rnam par smin pa dngos ni ma yin te /
translated: It is merely designated as fruitional because it is born in a continuum from the imprints of previously cultivated virtue.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyis ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyis ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not actual fruitional maturation because it is not established by contaminated karma.

original: 'di'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yang 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yang 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The valid knowledge that establishes this will be presented later.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi ngo bo ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi ngo bo ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: The nature of afflicted mind is obscured neutral.

original: ngar 'dzin pa phra mo dang ldan pa'i dus na de kho na nyid kyi ye shes 'char ba'i bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa phra mo dang ldan pa'i dus na de kho na nyid kyi ye shes 'char ba'i bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one possesses subtle grasping at ‚ÄúI,‚Äù it obstructs the arising of the gnosis of suchness.

original: mtshan nyid ni kun gzhi la nga yir 'dzin pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni kun gzhi la nga yir 'dzin pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Its definition is that which, in relation to the foundation consciousness, apprehends ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
analyzed: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
translated: The mind that thinks ‚ÄúI‚Äù is the mental consciousness.üîΩAnd:

original: zhes pa dang / yid ni bdag la bdag ces te /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / yid ni bdag la bdag ces te /
translated: The mental consciousness is the self of the self.

original: ngar 'dzin rab tu 'jug pa yin //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin rab tu 'jug pa yin // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the engagement of grasping ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: 'di'i dmigs pa'i yul ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i dmigs pa'i yul ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Its object is the foundation consciousness.

original: de yang sa bon gyi cha ni dge mi dges bsdus pas de la dmigs par mi nus la /
analyzed: de yang sa bon gyi cha ni dge mi dges bsdus pas de la dmigs par mi nus la /
translated: Moreover, since the aspect of seeds is included in virtue and nonvirtue, it cannot be its object.

original: 'on kyang rnam par smin pa'i cha las dmigs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par smin pa'i cha las dmigs pa yin zhing /
translated: However, it is an object of the aspect of its ripening.

original: de yang rnam par 'jog pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi 'khrul pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i sgo nas dmigs pa yin no zhes 'chad pa ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang rnam par 'jog pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi 'khrul pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i sgo nas dmigs pa yin no zhes 'chad pa ni mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable to explain that it is an object in the sense of being a basis of designation, but it is an object in the sense of being the basis of error.

original: kun gzhi ni lung ma bstan gyi sa bon kyang yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi ni lung ma bstan gyi sa bon kyang yin te /
translated: The foundation consciousness is also the seed of neutral states.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar /
translated: As was previously explained,

original: thams cad sa bon kun gzhi la //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad sa bon kun gzhi la // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: all are seeds in the foundation consciousness.

original: des na sa bon ni dge mi dges bsdus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sa bon ni dge mi dges bsdus pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus the seeds are not subsumed in either virtue or nonvirtue.

original: de ltar yin yang 'khrul pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i sgo nas dmigs pa'i yul yin pa la ni 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de ltar yin yang 'khrul pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i sgo nas dmigs pa'i yul yin pa la ni 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Even though this is so, there is not the slightest contradiction in their being objective referents that are the basis of error.

original: 'di'i ldog pa'i dus ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di'i ldog pa'i dus ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The time of their cessation is threefold:

original: 'jig rten 'das pa'i lam la med //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa'i lam la med //
translated: It does not exist on the supramundane path,

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug la med //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug la med //
translated: it does not exist in the meditative attainment of cessation,

original: dgra bcom nyid ni de ldog go //üîΩzhes gsungs so //üîΩde la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i @78a * //
analyzed: dgra bcom nyid ni de ldog go // zhes gsungs so // de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i @78a * //
translated: and it ceases in arhatship.üîΩIt does not exist on the path of seeing and so on that is supramundane,

original: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la med pa ni rang gi ngo bo grol ba ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la med pa ni rang gi ngo bo grol ba ste /
translated: and it does not exist in the meditative attainment of cessation, because they are liberated by their very nature.

original: re zhig mngon du rgyu pa log pa yin gyi sa bon spangs pa'i sgo nas gtan du log pa gang zag gi rgyud grol ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig mngon du rgyu pa log pa yin gyi sa bon spangs pa'i sgo nas gtan du log pa gang zag gi rgyud grol ba ni ma yin no //
translated: They are temporarily liberated by the cessation of manifest seeds, but they are not liberated in the continuum of the person by the abandonment of the seeds.

original: dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la ldog ba ni sa bon dang bcas te spangs pa gtan du ldog pa'o zhes chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la ldog ba ni sa bon dang bcas te spangs pa gtan du ldog pa'o zhes chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las bshad mod kyi /
translated: Although the Abhidharma treatise explains that the cessation in the continuum of an arhat is a permanent cessation that is abandoned along with its seed,

original: 'di yang mi 'thad pa nyid du 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang mi 'thad pa nyid du 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: this is not correct, as will be shown below.

original: de'i phyir sa bon dang bcas te gtan du ldog pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa yan chod dam yang na sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bon dang bcas te gtan du ldog pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa yan chod dam yang na sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: Therefore, the permanent cessation that is abandoned along with its seed is on the eighth bodhisattva ground or higher, or else it is the state of buddhahood.

original: 'di'i sgrub par byed pa ni yid ches pa'i lung las gzhan dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad ma ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di'i sgrub par byed pa ni yid ches pa'i lung las gzhan dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad ma ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: With regard to the proof of this, apart from authoritative statements of trustworthy beings, we do not see any valid cognition that engages this object by the power of the thing itself.

original: de ltar rgyas par phye na brgyad du gsungs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gsal bar ram rags bar 'jug pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyas par phye na brgyad du gsungs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gsal bar ram rags bar 'jug pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: When the consciousness that is said to be eightfold is explained in detail, it is from the perspective of the engagement of the clear or coarse consciousness.

original: mdor bsdus nas rnam par phye na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas rnam par phye na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: When it is summarized and explained in brief, it is twofold.

original: snang ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / dngos po so sor rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / dngos po so sor rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness of appearance and the consciousness that discriminates individual things.

original: de ltar dbye ba'i tshul bstan nas so so'i rang bzhin dang 'jug pa'i tshul la sogs pa ston pa ni blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dbye ba'i tshul bstan nas so so'i rang bzhin dang 'jug pa'i tshul la sogs pa ston pa ni blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having taught the mode of division in that way, the mode of teaching the individual natures, modes of engagement, and so on is ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the consciousness of appearance is the five sense consciousnesses.‚Äù

original: ji ltar me long la gzugs brnyan snang ba ni phyi rol rdzas su grub pa med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar me long la gzugs brnyan snang ba ni phyi rol rdzas su grub pa med pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the reflection of a form appears in a mirror, it is not an external substance that is established.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yang phyi rol rdzas su grub pa ni med de /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yang phyi rol rdzas su grub pa ni med de /
translated: Likewise, form, sound, and so on are not external substances that are established.

original: sems nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sems nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: They are the appearances of the mind itself.

original: de 'dra ba la 'dzin pa ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dra ba la 'dzin pa ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The apprehension of such is the five sense consciousnesses.

original: snang ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes gcig tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes gcig tu bstan pa'o //
translated: They are taught as one, the consciousness of appearance.

original: dngos po so sor rnam par rtog pa ni tshol ba dang nges pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po so sor rnam par rtog pa ni tshol ba dang nges pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that discriminates individual things is the seeking and ascertaining mental consciousness.

original: don 'di ni 'di ltar yin gyi gzhan du ma yin zhes nges pa'am /
analyzed: don 'di ni 'di ltar yin gyi gzhan du ma yin zhes nges pa'am /
translated: It is the ascertainment that ‚Äúthis object is like this and not otherwise.‚Äù

original: the tshom gyi rnam pa can gyi blo'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi rnam pa can gyi blo'o //
translated: It is a mind that has the aspect of doubt.

original: de gnyis kyang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid tha mi dad cing phan tshun gcig gi rgyu gcig yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid tha mi dad cing phan tshun gcig gi rgyu gcig yin te /
translated: Also, those two are not different in the general character of being realizers and they are mutually the cause of each other.

original: de'i don yang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun gyi thog ma ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas de ma thag pa'i rkyen byas nas skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i don yang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun gyi thog ma ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas de ma thag pa'i rkyen byas nas skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Also, the meaning of that is that the first moment of the continuum of the five sense consciousnesses arises, having been caused by the immediately preceding condition of mental consciousness.

original: yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa don gyi rnam par snang ba na des de ma thag pa'i rkyen byas nas de'i rjes thogs su ci don 'di 'di ltar yin nam gzhan @78b du yin zhes tshol ba la sogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes
analyzed: yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa don gyi rnam par snang ba na des de ma thag pa'i rkyen byas nas de'i rjes thogs su ci don 'di 'di ltar yin nam gzhan @78b du yin zhes tshol ba la sogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes
translated: Again, when the appearance of the object occurs in eye consciousness and so on, it arises, having been caused by the immediately preceding condition of that, and immediately after that, mental consciousness that investigates, such as ‚ÄúIs this object like this or is it otherwise?‚Äù

original: pa skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pa skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: arises.

original: yang rnam bar shes pa snga ma'i rgyu'i rkyen ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i rigs mthun pa la sogs pa'i bag chags nyan thos la sogs pa'i bsam pa'i yul las 'das pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: yang rnam bar shes pa snga ma'i rgyu'i rkyen ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i rigs mthun pa la sogs pa'i bag chags nyan thos la sogs pa'i bsam pa'i yul las 'das pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin la /
translated: Again, the causal condition of the prior consciousness is the inconceivable predispositions for the same type of consciousness that exist in the foundation consciousness, which is beyond the scope of thought of sravakas and so on.

original: de nyid yongs su smin cing sad pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid yongs su smin cing sad pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from the cause of the ripening and awakening of those predispositions.

original: des rgyu'i rkyen byas pa'i tshul gyis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: des rgyu'i rkyen byas pa'i tshul gyis bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is generated by the manner in which it acts as a causal condition.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni sngar bstan pa ltar ro //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni sngar bstan pa ltar ro //
translated: The dominant condition is as previously explained.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen sems las tha dad pa ni khas mi len te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen sems las tha dad pa ni khas mi len te /
translated: The objective condition is not asserted to be different from the mind.

original: don 'di yang sngar bstan pa bzhin no //üîΩrnam par shes pa gnyis pa'i da ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snga ma ltar snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yang yin la /
analyzed: don 'di yang sngar bstan pa bzhin no // rnam par shes pa gnyis pa'i da ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snga ma ltar snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yang yin la /
translated: This point is as previously explained.

original: yul la rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ste rang gi rigs snga ma las kyang byung ba'o //
analyzed: yul la rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ste rang gi rigs snga ma las kyang byung ba'o //
translated: The immediately preceding condition of the second consciousness is the consciousness that appears as the prior object and is the cause of the conception of the object, arising from its own prior type.

original: gzhan yang rgyu'i rkyen ni thog ma med pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu'i rkyen ni thog ma med pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the causal condition is the beginningless...

original: rigs mthun pa'i rgyu la thog ma med pa spros pa sna tshogs kyi bag chags kun gzhi la yod pa'o //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i rgyu la thog ma med pa spros pa sna tshogs kyi bag chags kun gzhi la yod pa'o //
translated: The homogeneous cause is the beginningless habitual propensities for the manifold conceptual elaborations that exist in the foundation consciousness.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni sngar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni sngar bstan pa'o //
translated: The dominant condition is as previously explained.

original: gal te de lta na bdag po'i rkyen dang de ma thag pa'i rkyen gnyis khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na bdag po'i rkyen dang de ma thag pa'i rkyen gnyis khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then there would be no difference between the dominant condition and the immediately preceding condition.

original: skyon med de /üîΩdngos po gcig nyid yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du bskyed pa'i cha nas ni //
analyzed: skyon med de / dngos po gcig nyid yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du bskyed pa'i cha nas ni //
translated: There is no error,

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya la /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya la /
translated: because the very same entity is called the immediately preceding condition from the perspective of generating the nature of the mental consciousness.

original: yul la 'dzin nus su bskyed pa'i cha nas bdag po'i rkyen zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: yul la 'dzin nus su bskyed pa'i cha nas bdag po'i rkyen zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: And it is called the dominant condition from the perspective of generating the ability to apprehend objects.

original: dngos po tha dad pa ni khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa ni khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we do not accept that they are different entities.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni snga ma dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni snga ma dang mtshungs so //
translated: The objective condition is the same as before.

original: de la blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de rnams kyi 'gag pa'i tshul ston te /
analyzed: de la blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de rnams kyi 'gag pa'i tshul ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúgreat intelligence‚Äù and so forth teaches the way in which they cease.

original: dbang po drug gi rnam par shes pa thams cad 'gag par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan ni kun gzhi la yod pa'i bag chags rgyu'i rkyen 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po drug gi rnam par shes pa thams cad 'gag par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan ni kun gzhi la yod pa'i bag chags rgyu'i rkyen 'gags pa ste /
translated: The reason that all the consciousnesses of the six sense faculties cease is that the causal condition, which is the latent propensities in the foundation consciousness, ceases.

original: de yang bag chags ni rnam shes skyed nus pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig yin la /
analyzed: de yang bag chags ni rnam shes skyed nus pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig yin la /
translated: Moreover, latent propensities are certain special features that have the ability to produce consciousnesses.

original: de yang nus pa can kun gzhi las tha dad pa ma yin pas 'dir kun gzhi dang bag chags gzhi mthun pa'i bsdu ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nus pa can kun gzhi las tha dad pa ma yin pas 'dir kun gzhi dang bag chags gzhi mthun pa'i bsdu ba byas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, they are not different from the foundation consciousness that has the potential for such propensities. Therefore, here the foundation consciousness and the latent propensities are included in the same basis.

original: gal te 'dir rtog pas dben pa snang ba'i bag chags kyang rnam par shes pa de rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'dir rtog pas dben pa snang ba'i bag chags kyang rnam par shes pa de rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen ma yin nam /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúIn this context, are not the latent propensities for appearances, which are devoid of conceptualization, the causal condition of those consciousnesses?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog ces de nyid 'ba' zhig ci ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog ces de nyid 'ba' zhig ci ste brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it that only that is said to be unreal imagination?‚ÄùüîΩThat is true.

original: bden mod kyi /üîΩrtogs @79a * //
analyzed: bden mod kyi /üîΩrtogs @79a * //
translated: However,

original: pa'i byed pas dben pa'i snang ba tsam gyis ni rang gi rigs mthun phyi ma skyed nus pa'i bag chags 'jog par mi nus zhes 'og nas ston pas bag chags 'jog pa la rtog pa'i byed pa 'jug pa'i phyir de skad smras pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i byed pas dben pa'i snang ba tsam gyis ni rang gi rigs mthun phyi ma skyed nus pa'i bag chags 'jog par mi nus zhes 'og nas ston pas bag chags 'jog pa la rtog pa'i byed pa 'jug pa'i phyir de skad smras pa'o //
translated: This will be shown later. Therefore, it is said that the activity of thought is engaged in the depositing of the latent potentialities.

original: de la mtshan nyid 'gag ces pa ni las kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid 'gag ces pa ni las kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: With regard to this, the characteristic ceases means the characteristic of the object.

original: bag chags sam de dang tha mi dad pa'i kun gzhi'i skad cig ma dang / gzhan yang rnam par shes pa de rnams kyi rgyun la yang mtshan nyid kyis khyab pas de rnams 'gag pa ni mtshan nyid 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags sam de dang tha mi dad pa'i kun gzhi'i skad cig ma dang / gzhan yang rnam par shes pa de rnams kyi rgyun la yang mtshan nyid kyis khyab pas de rnams 'gag pa ni mtshan nyid 'gag pa'o //
translated: The latent potentialities or the moments of the foundation consciousness that are not different from them and also the continua of those consciousnesses are pervaded by the characteristic. Therefore, their cessation is the cessation of the characteristic.

original: de la rgyun 'gag ces pa'i rgyun ni sngar bstan pa ltar rang rang gi rigs kyi 'bras bur gyur pa'i skad cig ma du ma gang las rgyun du 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la rgyun 'gag ces pa'i rgyun ni sngar bstan pa ltar rang rang gi rigs kyi 'bras bur gyur pa'i skad cig ma du ma gang las rgyun du 'byung ba yin te /
translated: With regard to this, the continuum ceases. The continuum is that from which many moments that are the effects of its own type arise, as was previously explained.

original: de la gang las zhes bya ba ni gang la gnas pa kun gzhi la yod pa'i bag chags rgyu'i rkyen dang / gang la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de la gang las zhes bya ba ni gang la gnas pa kun gzhi la yod pa'i bag chags rgyu'i rkyen dang / gang la dmigs pa ste /
translated: As for from which, it is the causal condition, the habitual propensities that exist in the foundation consciousness, the basis of the other seven consciousnesses.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa nyid du sngar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa nyid du sngar bstan pa'o //
translated: As for on which, it is the objective condition, the form and so on that is the object of consciousness, as was previously explained.

original: gal te 'dir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / de'i gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig gam tha dad ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / de'i gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig gam tha dad ce na /
translated: If the consciousnesses that engage objects and the foundation consciousness that is their basis are one, then they are not different. If they are different, then the foundation consciousness is not the basis of the other consciousnesses.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond, Mahamati, the foundation consciousness and the consciousnesses that engage objects are neither the same nor different.

original: tshig gi don ni phal cher shes par zad do //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni phal cher shes par zad do //
translated: The meaning of the words is mostly understood.

original: de dag las brtsams pa ma yin par 'gyur na zhes pa'i don ni 'jim pa'i gang bu 'jim pa'i rdul phra rab kyi bkod pa ma yin par 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: de dag las brtsams pa ma yin par 'gyur na zhes pa'i don ni 'jim pa'i gang bu 'jim pa'i rdul phra rab kyi bkod pa ma yin par 'gyur ba las /
translated: If they were not based on them, then the clay pot would not be the arrangement of the subtle particles of clay.

original: de'i bkod pa yin pa'i phyir bkod pa dang bkod pa can tha dad par 'gal te /
analyzed: de'i bkod pa yin pa'i phyir bkod pa dang bkod pa can tha dad par 'gal te /
translated: Since it is the arrangement of those, it is contradictory for the arrangement and that which is arranged to be different.

original: ji ltar na ngar ba'i ring po bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar na ngar ba'i ring po bzhin no //
translated: It is like, for example, a long clay pot.

original: de ste gcig pa yin na yang de dag phyogs thams cad nas khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ste gcig pa yin na yang de dag phyogs thams cad nas khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: If they are identical, then because they are not different in any way,

original: 'jim pa'i gong bus bya ba gang byed pa de nyid rdul phra rab so so bas kyang byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i gong bus bya ba gang byed pa de nyid rdul phra rab so so bas kyang byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: whatever function the lump of clay performs, each of the subtle particles would also perform.

original: de bzhin du gser dang gser gyi sde bu yang bdag nyid thams cad nas gcig par gyur na nyes pa 'di nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gser dang gser gyi sde bu yang bdag nyid thams cad nas gcig par gyur na nyes pa 'di nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And likewise, if the gold and the gold ornaments were identical in every way, the same fault would apply.

original: rigs kyi mtshan nyid ces pa ni de rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rjes su mthun pa'i rgyur gyur pa 'am //
analyzed: rigs kyi mtshan nyid ces pa ni de rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rjes su mthun pa'i rgyur gyur pa 'am //
translated: The definition of a class is that it is the cause that is compatible with all the consciousnesses that arise from it.

original: yang na de nyid kyi rgyun la rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na de nyid kyi rgyun la rigs zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, the continuum of that class itself is called a class.

original: de dag tha dad na de'i rgyu las 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes pa'i don ni de kho na nyid du bsams na tha dad dus mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa gnyis ka rgyur mi 'thad ces 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag tha dad na de'i rgyu las 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes pa'i don ni de kho na nyid du bsams na tha dad dus mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa gnyis ka rgyur mi 'thad ces 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If they are different, they would not arise from that cause. The meaning is that if one reflects on reality, it is not tenable that either different or simultaneous causes are real. This will be shown later.

original: de ste tha dad ma yin zhes pa bdag nyid thams @79b cad nas gcig pa nyid yin na zhes pa la sogs pa ste tshig gi don ni phal cher shes par zad do //üîΩrnam par shes pa rnams kyi rang gi rigs kyi mtshan nyid ni de rnams kyi rigs mthun pa'i rgyur gyur pa /
analyzed: de ste tha dad ma yin zhes pa bdag nyid thams @79b cad nas gcig pa nyid yin na zhes pa la sogs pa ste tshig gi don ni phal cher shes par zad do // rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rang gi rigs kyi mtshan nyid ni de rnams kyi rigs mthun pa'i rgyur gyur pa /
translated: If it is not different, that is, if it is identical in all aspects, then the seeds of the uncontaminated dharmas would not be different from the seeds of contaminated dharmas.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The defining characteristics of the consciousnesses are the seeds of their own class, which act as the cause of consciousnesses of the same class.üîΩThe alaya consciousness is the seed of the uncontaminated dharmas that are not different from it, and as previously explained, its continuum is not interrupted.

original: de dang tha mi dad pa zag pa med pa'i chos kyi sa bon ni sngar bstan pa ltar rgyun 'gag par mi 'gyur la las kyi mtshan nyid de 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas bsgos pa'i bag chags zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon ni ci rigs par
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa zag pa med pa'i chos kyi sa bon ni sngar bstan pa ltar rgyun 'gag par mi 'gyur la las kyi mtshan nyid de 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas bsgos pa'i bag chags zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon ni ci rigs par
translated: The seeds of contaminated dharmas, which are the impregnations of the evolving consciousnesses, are eliminated as appropriate.

original: 'gags pa'o // gal te de lta na kun gzhi rnam bar shes pa gnas gyur ba ni me long lta bu'i ye shes so zhes bshad pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: 'gags pa'o // gal te de lta na kun gzhi rnam bar shes pa gnas gyur ba ni me long lta bu'i ye shes so zhes bshad pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, it contradicts the explanation that the transformation of the alaya consciousness is mirrorlike wisdom.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon dang / rnam par smin ba'i cha glo bur gyi dri ma rnams gnas gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon dang / rnam par smin ba'i cha glo bur gyi dri ma rnams gnas gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: The seeds of contaminated states and the aspect of karmic maturation, which are adventitious stains, are transformed.

original: de'i rang bzhin la sogs pa ni snga ma ltar rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin la sogs pa ni snga ma ltar rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: But the nature of the ƒÅlaya and so on are not causes that existed previously, because

original: ji ltar chom rkun gyur par grags pa'i skyes bu sngar gyi nyes par spyod pa dang / khyim pa'i rtags spangs pa na skyes bu de nyid gzhan du 'gyur zhes brjod kyi de'i rang bzhin 'gags pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar chom rkun gyur par grags pa'i skyes bu sngar gyi nyes par spyod pa dang / khyim pa'i rtags spangs pa na skyes bu de nyid gzhan du 'gyur zhes brjod kyi de'i rang bzhin 'gags pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: just as it is said that a person who is known to be a thief will become a different person when he abandons his criminal ways and the signs of a layperson, the nature of that person is not stopped.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rigs kyi mtshan nyid dam rgyun ni 'gal rkyen dang mthun pa'i rkyen rnams kyi nus pa'i bye brag gis skad cig gnyis dang gsum nas lo dang bskal pa la sogs pa'i bar du ci rigs par 'gag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rigs kyi mtshan nyid dam rgyun ni 'gal rkyen dang mthun pa'i rkyen rnams kyi nus pa'i bye brag gis skad cig gnyis dang gsum nas lo dang bskal pa la sogs pa'i bar du ci rigs par 'gag par 'gyur la /
translated: The characteristics or continua of the types of the engaging consciousnesses are stopped for various lengths of time, from two or three moments up to years or eons, due to the specific powers of opposing conditions and conducive conditions.

original: yang rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i skad cig gi dngos po ni rang nyid skye ba'i dus las skad cig gnyis phan chad mi gnas te 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i skad cig gi dngos po ni rang nyid skye ba'i dus las skad cig gnyis phan chad mi gnas te 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the entity of the moment that possesses the characteristics of all consciousnesses does not remain for a second moment beyond the time of its own arising, but ceases.

original: 'gag pa'i tshul bstan pa 'di nyid kyis rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnas pa dang skye ba'i tshul yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i tshul bstan pa 'di nyid kyis rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnas pa dang skye ba'i tshul yang shes par bya ste /
translated: By this very teaching of the mode of cessation, one should understand the mode of abiding and arising of consciousnesses.

original: de la rkyen rnams kyi nus pa'i bye brag gis rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig ni skad cig gcig pa'i ngo bor skye la /
analyzed: de la rkyen rnams kyi nus pa'i bye brag gis rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig ni skad cig gcig pa'i ngo bor skye la /
translated: In this regard, by the specific power of conditions, some consciousnesses arise with the nature of a single moment.

original: 'ga' zhig ni skad cig ma gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa'i rgyun dang ldan par skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni skad cig ma gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa'i rgyun dang ldan par skye ba'o //
translated: Some arise with a continuum of two or three moments, and so on.

original: 'dir thams cad du rkyen bzhi'i bye brag tha dad pa ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams la tshad mas grub pa med pas khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir thams cad du rkyen bzhi'i bye brag tha dad pa ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams la tshad mas grub pa med pas khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Here, since the specific differences of the four conditions are not established by valid cognition for childish beings, they should not be accepted.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rgyun na skad cig las tha dad par rdzas su grub pa med pas skad cig gi mthar thug la /üîΩskad cig kyang thog ma dang dbus la @80a * //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rgyun na skad cig las tha dad par rdzas su grub pa med pas skad cig gi mthar thug la / skad cig kyang thog ma dang dbus la @80a * //
translated: Thus, since there is no substantial establishment of consciousnesses apart from momentariness in the continuum of consciousnesses, the ultimate of momentariness isüîΩmomentariness.

original: sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa ste sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa ste sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: And that is differentiated by distinctions of beginning, middle, and so on, as previously explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin 'dus byas pa'i dngos po ni don dam par stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin 'dus byas pa'i dngos po ni don dam par stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the dependent is called ‚Äúultimate emptiness.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / rten kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig dang tha dad las grol ba nyid kyi phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / rten kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig dang tha dad las grol ba nyid kyi phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the engaged consciousnesses and the foundation consciousness, the support, are free from being identical or different. Therefore, they are ultimately natureless.

original: skabs kyi don 'di rnams kyang /
analyzed: skabs kyi don 'di rnams kyang /
translated: These topics of the present are also applied as answers to the objections,

original: sngar gyi rkyen gyis skye ba ji lta bu //
analyzed: sngar gyi rkyen gyis skye ba ji lta bu //
translated: ‚ÄúHow is it that they arise from previous conditions?

original: 'bras bu ci lags rgyu ni ci lags gang //üîΩzhes rgol ba'i lan du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ci lags rgyu ni ci lags gang //üîΩzhes rgol ba'i lan du sbyar te /
translated: What is the result? What is the cause?‚Äù

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul ji ltar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul ji ltar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as the conventional and ultimate modes are taught.

original: yang 'dir gal te kun gzhi'i rgyun 'gags pa na de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad rgya mtsho dang rlabs bzhin du 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang 'dir gal te kun gzhi'i rgyun 'gags pa na de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad rgya mtsho dang rlabs bzhin du 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the continuum of the foundation consciousness were to cease, then all consciousnesses that are based on it would cease, like the ocean and its waves.

original: de lta na chad par smra ba'i mu stegs rgyang 'phen pa dag sems can gyi lus ni chang dang / chang gi nus pa ltar sems las tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de lta na chad par smra ba'i mu stegs rgyang 'phen pa dag sems can gyi lus ni chang dang / chang gi nus pa ltar sems las tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
translated: In that case, you would be a tƒ´rthika who advocates annihilation, like the CƒÅrvƒÅka, who say that the body of a sentient being is not different from beer and the potency of beer.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mngon par gsal ba'i sems pa can zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mngon par gsal ba'i sems pa can zhes bya ba la /
translated: For that reason, they are called ‚Äúthose who have a manifest mind.‚Äù

original: de yang 'chi ba'i dus byas pa na mngon par mi gsal ba'i sems pa can 'byung ba bzhi'i bag la zha bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang 'chi ba'i dus byas pa na mngon par mi gsal ba'i sems pa can 'byung ba bzhi'i bag la zha bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they die, they say that the mind that has a manifest mind becomes a latent mind in the four elements.

original: de las gzhan 'jig rten snga phyis bsdus pa'i 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba ni med do zhes smra ba dang khyad par med par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan 'jig rten snga phyis bsdus pa'i 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba ni med do zhes smra ba dang khyad par med par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no difference between you and those who say that the world is not included in cyclic existence, that nirvana is not included in cyclic existence, and that there is no relationship between karma and its effects.

original: 'dir yul la 'dzin pa ni mngon par gsal ba'i sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yul la 'dzin pa ni mngon par gsal ba'i sems pa'o //
translated: Here, the grasping of objects is the manifest mind.

original: rgyun chad pas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa des bsdus pa thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa des bsdus pa thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is interrupted, all that is included in the eye consciousness and so on is interrupted.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi rgyun ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi rgyun ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: The continuum of beginningless time is cyclic existence.

original: gnyen po goms pa med par rgyun chad par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po goms pa med par rgyun chad par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Without the cultivation of the antidote, it is interrupted.

original: de la thog ma med pa ni gzhan gyi lugs rjes su brjod ba yin gyi de dag gi lugs kyis ni 'khor ba la thog ma med par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de la thog ma med pa ni gzhan gyi lugs rjes su brjod ba yin gyi de dag gi lugs kyis ni 'khor ba la thog ma med par mi 'dod do //
translated: Here, beginningless time is stated from the perspective of the opponent‚Äôs system, but according to their system, they do not assert that cyclic existence is beginningless.

original: gal te de las gzhan pa'i mu stegs pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba la sogs pa'i tshul ji ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de las gzhan pa'i mu stegs pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba la sogs pa'i tshul ji ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: If that is so, how do tƒ´rthikas other than them assert the mode of arising of consciousness?

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Great Intelligence and so forth.

original: de la gzugs dang snang ba ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs dang snang ba ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: Therein, form and appearance are merely examples.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rkyen rnams las shes pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rkyen rnams las shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness arises from the conditions taught above.

original: de dag gi rgyu ni yon tan gsum cha mnyam pa'i gtso bo mig gi blo la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur @80b ba thams cad kyi byed pa por 'dod pa dang / nang gi skyes bu rig pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yul 'dzin cing longs spyod pa'i byed pa por 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu ni yon tan gsum cha mnyam pa'i gtso bo mig gi blo la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur @80b ba thams cad kyi byed pa por 'dod pa dang / nang gi skyes bu rig pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yul 'dzin cing longs spyod pa'i byed pa por 'dod pa dang /
translated: They assert that the cause of those is the primary nature, the three qualities in equilibrium, which is the agent of all transformations, such as the eye consciousness, and so on. They assert that the inner purusha, which is the nature of consciousness, is the agent that apprehends objects and experiences.

original: yang rig byed kyi mtha' pa dag sna tshogs pa thams cad skyes bu'i rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi rnam par 'phrul pa ste /
analyzed: yang rig byed kyi mtha' pa dag sna tshogs pa thams cad skyes bu'i rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi rnam par 'phrul pa ste /
translated: The VedƒÅntins assert that all variety is the manifestation of mere consciousness of the purusha.

original: de nyid kyi rgyu las byung bar 'dod pa dang / gzhan yang rig pa can dang bye brag pa rnams dbang phyug gi byin gyi rlabs kyis bdag dang yid kun du sbyor ba las shes pa skye bar 'dod pa dang / 'ga' zhig gnas dang lus dang longs spyod du snang ba rnams khyad par du 'phags pa'i blo dbang phyug sngon du song bar 'dod pa dang /üîΩdngos po thams cad dus kyi dbang gis 'byung bar 'dod pa dang / rigs mthun pas rdul phan tshun sbyor ba las rags pa yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom par 'dod cing /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyu las byung bar 'dod pa dang / gzhan yang rig pa can dang bye brag pa rnams dbang phyug gi byin gyi rlabs kyis bdag dang yid kun du sbyor ba las shes pa skye bar 'dod pa dang / 'ga' zhig gnas dang lus dang longs spyod du snang ba rnams khyad par du 'phags pa'i blo dbang phyug sngon du song bar 'dod pa dang / dngos po thams cad dus kyi dbang gis 'byung bar 'dod pa dang / rigs mthun pas rdul phan tshun sbyor ba las rags pa yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom par 'dod cing /
translated: The LokƒÅyatas assert that it arises from the four elements. The followers of Kapila assert that it arises from the transformation of the three gu·πáas. The followers of Ka·πáƒÅda assert that it arises from the conjunction of self and mind. The followers of ƒ™≈õvara assert that it arises from the blessing of ƒ™≈õvara. The followers of ƒ™≈õvara assert that it arises from the conjunction of self and mind. Some assert that it arises from the prior existence of a supreme intellect that is the cause of the appearance of the world, the body, and enjoyments.üîΩüîΩSome assert that all things arise through the power of time. Some assert that coarse things with parts are formed from the conjunction of atoms of a similar type.üîΩ
