original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi rkyen gyis skye ba'i khyad par sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi rkyen gyis skye ba'i khyad par sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa /
translated: Moreover, the phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root verse refers to the twelve factors of dependent arising, which are subsumed within the two truths of suffering and the origin of suffering.

original: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshul mdor bsdus te bstan pa 'am /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshul mdor bsdus te bstan pa 'am /
translated: This is a brief presentation of the twelve factors of existence.üîΩOr, the phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root verse can be understood as a summary of the following lines:

original: yang / sems can dngos po'i rnam grangs dang / mngon par brjod pa su yis bskyed //üîΩces pa'i lan bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang / sems can dngos po'i rnam grangs dang / mngon par brjod pa su yis bskyed // ces pa'i lan bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: Who creates sentient beings, things, and expressions?

original: de las 'du ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin ni rgyu kun 'byung gi bden pa ste /
analyzed: de las 'du ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin ni rgyu kun 'byung gi bden pa ste /
translated: The nature of the things that gather refers to the truth of the origin of suffering, which is the cause.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu rkyen phan tshun 'du zhing sbyor ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu rkyen phan tshun 'du zhing sbyor ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: It is the gathering and combination of causes and conditions, such as karma and mental afflictions.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni de las da ltar gyi ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po mngon par 'grub pa sdug bsngal gyi bden par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni de las da ltar gyi ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po mngon par 'grub pa sdug bsngal gyi bden par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the things that exist refers to the truth of suffering, which is the present actualization of the aggregates of name and form and so forth.

original: mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ni da ltar gyi phung pos bsdus pa'i tshor ba 'am tshor ba'i rgyu la mngon par chags pa'i sred pa dang / len pa dang / de dag gis ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'grub par byed pa'i 'du byed kyi sa bon mthu dang ldan par byas pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ni da ltar gyi phung pos bsdus pa'i tshor ba 'am tshor ba'i rgyu la mngon par chags pa'i sred pa dang / len pa dang / de dag gis ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'grub par byed pa'i 'du byed kyi sa bon mthu dang ldan par byas pa ste /
translated: grasping, and the potentiality of the seeds of the formative forces that cause the future aggregates to be produced.

original: srid pa zhes grags pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa zhes grags pa'o //
translated: These are known as existence.

original: de rnams kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa ste /
translated: They are included in both the truth of suffering and the truth of origin.

original: sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i @81a * //üîΩphung po 'grub par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i @81a * // phung po 'grub par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: They are the result of former karma and affliction and are the cause that produces the future contaminated aggregates.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas mtshan nyid kyi dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas mtshan nyid kyi dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the reality of the characteristic because it is the characteristic of affliction.

original: 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni de dag gis bsdus pa phyi dang nang gi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni de dag gis bsdus pa phyi dang nang gi 'byung ba ste /
translated: The things that are the nature of the great elements are the internal and external elements that comprise them.

original: sems can gyi skye ba'i gnas kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi skye ba'i gnas kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: They are included in the abodes of sentient beings.

original: de yang sems kyi snang ba las ma gtogs pa bems po'i ngo bo ni grub pa med ces bstan to //
analyzed: de yang sems kyi snang ba las ma gtogs pa bems po'i ngo bo ni grub pa med ces bstan to //
translated: Moreover, it is taught that apart from the appearances of mind, there is no established nature of inanimate things.

original: rgyu'i dngos po ni 'du byed kyi sa bon dang ldan pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po ni 'du byed kyi sa bon dang ldan pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The causal thing is the foundation consciousness, which possesses the seeds of compositional activity.

original: ma rtogs na 'khor ba'i nye bar len pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs na 'khor ba'i nye bar len pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it is not realized, it becomes the cause for appropriating samsara.

original: rkyen gyi dngos bo ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed dang sred pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen gyi dngos bo ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed dang sred pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The conditional thing is ignorance, compositional activity, craving, and so on.

original: sngar gyi 'du ba'i don nyid kyang gsal bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sngar gyi 'du ba'i don nyid kyang gsal bar bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcoming together‚Äù is also clearly taught above.

original: 'on kyang da ltar gyi gnas skabs las ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'grub par byed pa'i rgyu dang rkyen la sbyor bas zlos pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang da ltar gyi gnas skabs las ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'grub par byed pa'i rgyu dang rkyen la sbyor bas zlos pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not the case that there is the fault of repetition because it is applied to the causes and conditions that establish the future aggregates from the present state.

original: 'grub pa'i dngos po ni rgyu rkyen de dag la brten nas skye ba dang rga shis bsdus pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'grub pa'i dngos po ni rgyu rkyen de dag la brten nas skye ba dang rga shis bsdus pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'grub pa ste /
translated: The things that are accomplished are those that arise in dependence on those causes and conditions, and are included in birth and aging and death, and the accomplishment of the future aggregates.

original: de ltar na sred pa'i yan lag rnams kyang tshe gsum gyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na sred pa'i yan lag rnams kyang tshe gsum gyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: Thus, the links of craving are also included in three lifetimes.

original: zhib tu ni 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu ni 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained in detail below.

original: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni rten 'brel de rnams kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid don dam pa'i bden pa ston te /
analyzed: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni rten 'brel de rnams kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid don dam pa'i bden pa ston te /
translated: Moreover, beginning with ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, those dependent originations,‚Äù it teaches the emptiness that is the nature of those dependent originations, which is ultimate truth.

original: sngar gyi de bzhin nyid ni rnam pa du zhes pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi de bzhin nyid ni rnam pa du zhes pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúHow many kinds of suchness are there?‚Äù

original: de la sems kyi spyod yul ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i thos pa dang bsam pa las byung ba'i shes rab spros pa gcod byed kyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lo //
analyzed: de la sems kyi spyod yul ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i thos pa dang bsam pa las byung ba'i shes rab spros pa gcod byed kyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lo //
translated: Therein, the domain of mind is the object of suchness, the wisdom arisen from hearing and contemplation that cuts through elaborations, and the object of inferential valid knowledge.

original: de yang slu ba med pas rigs pa ni //
analyzed: de yang slu ba med pas rigs pa ni //
translated: Moreover, since it is undeceiving, it is reasoning.

original: don dam yin te zhes pa dang / des gtan la phab pa'i don dam pa ste zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩye shes kyi spyod yul ni 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa las byung ba'i shes rab drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa cung zad rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / de'i yul du gyur ba'i de bzhin nyid de /üîΩde skad du yang ye shes kyi tshogs ni drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs yan chad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las bshad pas so //
analyzed: don dam yin te zhes pa dang / des gtan la phab pa'i don dam pa ste zhes gsungs pa'o // ye shes kyi spyod yul ni 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa las byung ba'i shes rab drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa cung zad rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / de'i yul du gyur ba'i de bzhin nyid de / de skad du yang ye shes kyi tshogs ni drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs yan chad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las bshad pas so //

original: gang zag dang chos kyi bdag la kun du rmongs pas sa dang po la sgrib po zhes sngar bstan pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang bzod pa dang 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos kyi bdag la kun du rmongs pas sa dang po la sgrib po zhes sngar bstan pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang bzod pa dang 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na go rims bzhin du /
translated: It was previously taught that the delusion of the self of persons and of phenomena is an obstruction to the first stage, and also the Perfection of Wisdom says that in the situation of the supreme mundane right view and patience,

original: gang zag rdzas la brten pa dang / skyes bu btags pa la brten pa'i 'dzin pa'i rtog pa gnyis dang ldan no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag rdzas la brten pa dang / skyes bu btags pa la brten pa'i 'dzin pa'i rtog pa gnyis dang ldan no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one has the two kinds of grasping, one based on the substantial person and one based on the nominal person.

original: lta ba gnyis las 'das pa'i spyod yul ni de 'dra ba'i rnam rtog rags pa spangs pa mthong lam yan chod kyi ye shes dang / de'i yul du gyur ba'i de bzhin nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //üîΩde skad du yang /
analyzed: lta ba gnyis las 'das pa'i spyod yul ni de 'dra ba'i rnam rtog rags pa spangs pa mthong lam yan chod kyi ye shes dang / de'i yul du gyur ba'i de bzhin nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //üîΩde skad du yang /
translated: The domain beyond the two views is the wisdom of the path of seeing and beyond, which is the abandonment of such coarse conceptualization, and the suchness which is the object of that wisdom is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: sngar gyi lta ba gnyis la sogs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba nyid du gsungs pa dang de 'dra ba'i rmongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas sa dang po thob pa nyid du gsungs pas so //
analyzed: sngar gyi lta ba gnyis la sogs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba nyid du gsungs pa dang de 'dra ba'i rmongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas sa dang po thob pa nyid du gsungs pas so //
translated: The former two views, etc. are said to be objects of abandonment by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation, and it is said that one attains the first stage by abandoning the obscuration of delusion of that kind.

original: snang ba med pa'i spyod yul ni mdo sde 'di nyid las //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i spyod yul ni mdo sde 'di nyid las //
translated: The domain of non-appearance is the wisdom and its object of the eighth stage and above, as this very scripture says:

original: snang ba med pa brgyad pa ste //üîΩzhes gsungs pas khyad par du sa brgyad pa yan chad kyi ye shes dang de'i yul lo //üîΩsras kyi sa las 'da' ba'i spyod yul ni sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug pa dpa' bar 'gro ba 'am /
analyzed: snang ba med pa brgyad pa ste // zhes gsungs pas khyad par du sa brgyad pa yan chad kyi ye shes dang de'i yul lo // sras kyi sa las 'da' ba'i spyod yul ni sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug pa dpa' bar 'gro ba 'am /
translated: The eighth is non-appearance.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs kyi ye shes dang de'i yul lo //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs kyi ye shes dang de'i yul lo //
translated: The domain of transcending the stage of the son is the wisdom and its object of the stage of the Buddha, the stage of the Heroic Walk, or the stage of the vajra-like samadhi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul ni sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus pa chos kyi sku'i ye shes mnyam par gzhag pa dang rjes kyi gnas skabs dang de'i yul du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul ni sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus pa chos kyi sku'i ye shes mnyam par gzhag pa dang rjes kyi gnas skabs dang de'i yul du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The domain of the individual self-cognizance of the Tathagatas is the wisdom of the Dharmakaya, which is included in the stage of Buddhahood, and it is the state of meditative equipoise and its aftermath, and the object that is to be known.

original: 'dir thams cad du yang yul dang yul can tha dad pa ni min te /
analyzed: 'dir thams cad du yang yul dang yul can tha dad pa ni min te /
translated: Here, in all cases, there is no difference between the object and the subject.

original: 'on kyang so so rang rig pa'i tshul du rang rang gi chos nyid la sgro 'dogs gcod pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang so so rang rig pa'i tshul du rang rang gi chos nyid la sgro 'dogs gcod pa'o //
translated: However, in the manner of individual self-cognizance, the superimpositions are eliminated with regard to their respective natures.

original: gal te de lta na thog mar bstan pa rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma rtog med du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na thog mar bstan pa rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma rtog med du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then at the outset, the inference of the teaching would be non-conceptual.

original: rang gi rang bzhin du gyur ba'i snang ba la phyin ci log gi sgro 'dogs gcod pa'i cha nas rtog pa med cing ma 'khrul ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin du gyur ba'i snang ba la phyin ci log gi sgro 'dogs gcod pa'i cha nas rtog pa med cing ma 'khrul ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: From the point of view of eliminating the superimpositions of error with regard to the appearances that are one's own nature, it is accepted that it is non-conceptual and non-erroneous.

original: 'on kyang rang gi snang ba don ma yin pa la don du mngon par zhen cing spyi'i rnam pa sgro btags la 'dzin pa'i cha nas rtog pa dang @82a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi snang ba don ma yin pa la don du mngon par zhen cing spyi'i rnam pa sgro btags la 'dzin pa'i cha nas rtog pa dang @82a * //
translated: Nevertheless, in terms of the aspect of apprehending the non-entity of one's own appearances as an entity and the aspect of apprehending the superimposed general aspect, it is a conception.üîΩ

original: bcas shing 'khrul ba nyid yin pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mi 'dra bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bcas shing 'khrul ba nyid yin pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mi 'dra bar bstan pa'o //
translated: However, it is taught that it is not like nonconceptual wisdom, because it is conceptual and mistaken in terms of the aspect of apprehending the superimposition of a general aspect onto what is not an object of one‚Äôs own appearance as an object.

original: de yang ji ltar tha mal ba rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa rang gi rang bzhin la ltos te rang rig pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin kyang sgra don spyi'i rnam pa tha dad pa lta bur snang zhing zhen pa pas de nyid rtog pa'i bdag nyid
analyzed: de yang ji ltar tha mal ba rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa rang gi rang bzhin la ltos te rang rig pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin kyang sgra don spyi'i rnam pa tha dad pa lta bur snang zhing zhen pa pas de nyid rtog pa'i bdag nyid
translated: Moreover, just as the conceptions of ordinary beings are a valid cognition of reflexive awareness in terms of their own nature, they appear and are conceived to be different aspects such as the meaning of a word. Therefore they are the nature of conceptions.

original: yin zhing / de nyid kyi phyir de 'dra ba'i gang zag rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o zhes mi brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yin zhing / de nyid kyi phyir de 'dra ba'i gang zag rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o zhes mi brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: For that reason, it is said that such persons are not endowed with nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: shes gang gang la sgra don 'dzin //
analyzed: shes gang gang la sgra don 'dzin //
translated: Any consciousness that apprehends the meaning of a word

original: de ni de la rtog par 'dod //
analyzed: de ni de la rtog par 'dod //
translated: Is asserted to be a conception of that.

original: rang gi ngo bo'i sgra don min //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i sgra don min //
translated: It is not the meaning of a word that is one‚Äôs own nature.

original: de phyir de la kun mngon sum //
analyzed: de phyir de la kun mngon sum //
translated: Therefore, it is a direct perception of all.

original: zhes tshad ma rnam 'grel las bstan pa dang rjes su mthun par 'dir yang rkang pa gnyis kyi rjes su /
analyzed: zhes tshad ma rnam 'grel las bstan pa dang rjes su mthun par 'dir yang rkang pa gnyis kyi rjes su /
translated: In accordance with the teaching in the Thorough Exposition of Valid Knowledge, why would we not say here, after the two lines,

original: spros bral chos nyid sgra don min //
analyzed: spros bral chos nyid sgra don min //
translated: ‚ÄúFreedom from elaborations is not the meaning of the term ‚ÄòdharmatƒÅ.‚Äô

original: de phyir de la rtog med 'gyur //üîΩzhes ci ste mi brjod //
analyzed: de phyir de la rtog med 'gyur // zhes ci ste mi brjod //
translated: Therefore, it is nonconceptual‚Äù?

original: de lta na yang tha mal ba'i mngon sum de lta bu dang rjes su dpag par grags pa ni phyin ci log gi bdag nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de lta na yang tha mal ba'i mngon sum de lta bu dang rjes su dpag par grags pa ni phyin ci log gi bdag nyid yin pas /
translated: Even so, such a direct perception of ordinary beings and the inference that is renowned are of the nature of error.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes min yang spros pa gcod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni ji snyed pa'i spros pa gcod pa'i cha nas yang dag pa'i tshad ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes min yang spros pa gcod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni ji snyed pa'i spros pa gcod pa'i cha nas yang dag pa'i tshad ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, although they are not authentic wisdom, the inference that eliminates elaborations is authentic valid knowledge from the perspective of eliminating the elaborations of things that exist.

original: des spros pa bkag pa'i don yang don dam pa dang mthun pa'i don dam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des spros pa bkag pa'i don yang don dam pa dang mthun pa'i don dam zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the negation of elaborations by that is called ‚Äúthe ultimate that is concordant with the ultimate.‚Äù

original: de rnams kyis kyang lam dang 'gog pa'i bden pa bsdus te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang lam dang 'gog pa'i bden pa bsdus te /
translated: Those also include the truths of the path and cessation.

original: de ltar na dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam grangs bstan pas ni shes bya bden pa bzhi bstan cing /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam grangs bstan pas ni shes bya bden pa bzhi bstan cing /
translated: Thus, by teaching the nature of things and the synonyms of ultimate truth, the four noble truths are taught.

original: de yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su 'dus la /
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su 'dus la /
translated: Moreover, those are included in the two truths, the conventional and the ultimate.üîΩThus, the perfection of wisdom that includes all aspects subsumed by the two truths is endowed with the wheel of Dharma of the buddhas of the three times.

original: de ltar bden pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yin no zhes de rnams rtogs pa'i phan yon ston pa ni /üîΩ'di dag ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bden pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yin no zhes de rnams rtogs pa'i phan yon ston pa ni / 'di dag ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The benefits of realizing those are taught by ‚Äúthese are the phenomena of the buddhas‚Äù and so on.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa ni de rnams kyi rtogs pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa ni de rnams kyi rtogs pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of things of the buddhas‚Äù and so on refers to the nature of things that are to be realized.

original: de dang ldan zhes pa yang rtogs bya nyid du ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan zhes pa yang rtogs bya nyid du ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with that‚Äù means endowed with the object of realization.

original: 'jig rten ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúWorldly beings‚Äù are childish beings.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'o //
translated: The supramundane is the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa @82b mchog ni yang dag pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa @82b mchog ni yang dag pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas so //
translated: The supreme supramundane is the bodhisattvas and buddhas who abide on the true grounds.

original: de rnams kyis bsdus pa'i chos dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos snga ma ltar bden pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis bsdus pa'i chos dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos snga ma ltar bden pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa ste /
translated: The virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral phenomena subsumed by those are realized as the two truths, as general and specific characteristics, as before.

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas thams cad ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag ces pa 'am /
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas thams cad ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag ces pa 'am /
translated: Among those, the general characteristics are that all conditioned phenomena are produced, abide, and are impermanent,

original: rang rang gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rang rang gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: or their individual characteristics.

original: gzugs ni gzhig cing gzhom du rung //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzhig cing gzhom du rung //
translated: Form is that which can be destroyed and overcome.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: shes rab kyi spyan ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi spyan ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The eye of wisdom is the wisdom of omniscience.

original: rnam par 'god pa ni rigs dang skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du blang bya dang dor bya la sogs pa'i bye brag ma 'dres par ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'god pa ni rigs dang skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du blang bya dang dor bya la sogs pa'i bye brag ma 'dres par ston pa'o //
translated: The arrangement is the teaching of the distinctions of what is to be taken up and what is to be left behind, etc., in accordance with the type and fortune of the disciples.

original: tshul ji ltar 'god ce na /
analyzed: tshul ji ltar 'god ce na /
translated: In what way is it arranged?

original: mu stegs byed kyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The heretics and so forth.

original: de la thog mar dbang po dman pa rnams la ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la thog mar dbang po dman pa rnams la ston pa ni /
translated: Among them, first of all, the teaching for those of inferior faculties is as follows:

original: mu stegs byed kyi smra ba dang lta ba ngan pa ste /üîΩgrub pa'i mtha' yis blo ma bsgyur ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang thun mong du mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyi smra ba dang lta ba ngan pa ste / grub pa'i mtha' yis blo ma bsgyur ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang thun mong du mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The heretics are those with bad speech and views,üîΩ who have not been influenced by the tenets of the Mahayana, and who have the view of the transitory collection, etc. The teaching is not common to them,

original: de dag dang ma 'dres shing de dag gi gnyen po nyid du 'gyur ba'i chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang ma 'dres shing de dag gi gnyen po nyid du 'gyur ba'i chos ston pa'o //
translated: but is not mixed with them, and is the antidote to them.

original: ji ltar na de rnams dang thun mong ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de rnams dang thun mong ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In what way is it not common to them?

original: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is as follows, and so forth.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i yul la tha dad pa bden par rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba khong du ma chud pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i yul la tha dad pa bden par rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba khong du ma chud pa ste /
translated: They have not understood the view that the objects that are the nature of the consciousnesses are truly different.

original: de'i yul yang sems las tha dad med par ma shes shing /
analyzed: de'i yul yang sems las tha dad med par ma shes shing /
translated: They have not understood that the objects of that view are not different from the mind.

original: tha dad du rtogs pa phyin ci log pa nyid du khong du ma chud ces pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad du rtogs pa phyin ci log pa nyid du khong du ma chud ces pa'o //
translated: They have not understood that the conception of difference is a misconception.

original: bdag gi sems snang ba tsam zhes pa ni de ltar snang ba kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin no zhes yongs gcod kyi cha la mi 'jug pa ste blos ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi sems snang ba tsam zhes pa ni de ltar snang ba kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin no zhes yongs gcod kyi cha la mi 'jug pa ste blos ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe appearances are only mind‚Äù means that the appearances in that way are the mind itself conventionally. They do not engage the aspect of determination, that is, the mind does not understand.

original: de'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams las mu stegs pa'i sems tsam smra ba kha cig bdag rig pa gnyis med kyi ngo bo ni dngos por yod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams las mu stegs pa'i sems tsam smra ba kha cig bdag rig pa gnyis med kyi ngo bo ni dngos por yod la /
translated: Therefore, among the childish, ordinary beings, some tƒ´rthikas who propound mind only say that the essence of the nondual cognition is an existent thing.

original: de las gzhan pa thams cad ni dngos por med ces pa dang / de la sogs pa phyi rol ba dang tha mal pa rnams kyis bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba la mi ltos par dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin don dam par lta ba'i lta ba gnyis su ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa thams cad ni dngos por med ces pa dang / de la sogs pa phyi rol ba dang tha mal pa rnams kyis bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba la mi ltos par dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin don dam par lta ba'i lta ba gnyis su ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, non-Buddhists and ordinary people fall into the two views that the nature of things and nonthings is ultimately real, without relying on the division of the two truths.

original: de'i phyir de rnams ni srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis las mi ldog @83a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams ni srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis las mi ldog @83a * //
translated: Therefore, they do not turn away from the twelve branches of existence.

original: cing / gzhan yang phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa srid pa gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba las kyang mi ldog ste /
analyzed: cing / gzhan yang phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa srid pa gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba las kyang mi ldog ste /
translated: Moreover, they do not turn away from the root of the suffering of the three existences, which is the conception of error.

original: des na de dag rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir de rnams kyi lta ba dang ma 'dres par rang gi sems snang ba'i yul sgyu ma ste /
analyzed: des na de dag rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir de rnams kyi lta ba dang ma 'dres par rang gi sems snang ba'i yul sgyu ma ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to reverse that, the illusion of the objects of one‚Äôs mind is not mixed with their views.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbu ma'i tshul rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i thabs gang zag gi bdag gis stong pa phung po la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbu ma'i tshul rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i thabs gang zag gi bdag gis stong pa phung po la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: As was previously explained, the method for seeing the way of the middle that is mere awareness is to explain the emptiness of a self of persons, the general and specific characteristics of the aggregates, and so on.üîΩBy teaching in that way, those whose faculties are slightly purified gradually come to have the good fortune to be taught emptiness.

original: de ltar bstan pas rim gyis dbang po cung zad dag cing stong ba nyid bshad pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la stong ba nyid zab mo dngos su ston pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pas rim gyis dbang po cung zad dag cing stong ba nyid bshad pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la stong ba nyid zab mo dngos su ston pa ste /
translated: The actual teaching of profound emptiness is for those who have the good fortune to be taught emptiness.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas lta ba ngan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas lta ba ngan pa ni /
translated: With respect to that, bad views

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba gzung 'dzin dngos por 'dod pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i rang rig don dam pa'i dngos por smra ba rnams kyang ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba gzung 'dzin dngos por 'dod pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i rang rig don dam pa'i dngos por smra ba rnams kyang ste /
translated: are the hearers and solitary realizers who assert that the apprehended and apprehender are things and those who propound that nondual reflexive awareness is an ultimate thing.

original: 'ching ba'i rgyu nyid du khyad par med cing yul la gnod byed kyi tshad ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ching ba'i rgyu nyid du khyad par med cing yul la gnod byed kyi tshad ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not different in being the cause of bondage because there is a valid knowledge that refutes their objects.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: de nyid tshol la thog mar ni //
analyzed: de nyid tshol la thog mar ni //
translated: For one who is initially seeking reality,

original: thams cad yod ces brjod par bya //
analyzed: thams cad yod ces brjod par bya //
translated: one should say that everything exists.

original: don rnams rtogs shing chags med la //üîΩphyis ni rnam par dben pa nyid //
analyzed: don rnams rtogs shing chags med la // phyis ni rnam par dben pa nyid //
translated: But when one understands the meaning and is free from attachment,

original: ces gsungs so //üîΩyang de ltar stong ba nyid bstan pas stong pa nyid kyi mtshan mar 'dzin cing /
analyzed: ces gsungs so // yang de ltar stong ba nyid bstan pas stong pa nyid kyi mtshan mar 'dzin cing /
translated: then later, one should be free from all conceptual elaborations.üîΩMoreover, some people, when emptiness is taught, grasp at the sign of emptiness and deny the connection between actions and their results and so forth.

original: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba la sogs pa la skur ba nyid du la la dag 'gyur bas de rnam par bzlog pa'i don du rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbu ma mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid zab mo mdo sde 'di nyid dam /üîΩ'di'i rigs can rnams kyis bshad par bya'o zhes ston te /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba la sogs pa la skur ba nyid du la la dag 'gyur bas de rnam par bzlog pa'i don du rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbu ma mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid zab mo mdo sde 'di nyid dam / 'di'i rigs can rnams kyis bshad par bya'o zhes ston te /
translated: In order to reverse that, the profound suchness free from the two extremes of the Middle Way of mere representations should be taught by this sutra itself or by those of its kind.üîΩWith that in mind, the sutra says:

original: de'i dbang du byas nas lta ba ngan pa ni stong ba nyid kyi mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas lta ba ngan pa ni stong ba nyid kyi mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The bad view is grasping at the sign of emptiness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rnam par dben don mi shes par //
analyzed: rnam par dben don mi shes par //
translated: Without understanding the meaning of emptiness,

original: thos pa tsam la 'jug byed cing //
analyzed: thos pa tsam la 'jug byed cing //
translated: one engages in mere study.

original: mi gang bsod nams mi byed pa /
analyzed: mi gang bsod nams mi byed pa /
translated: Those who do not perform merit

original: skyes bu tha shal de dag brlag //
analyzed: skyes bu tha shal de dag brlag //
translated: Those low-class people are lost.

original: ces gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam ni bla'i zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan to //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam ni bla'i zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan to //
translated: And it was also taught above: ‚ÄúBetter is the view of the person, vast as Mount Meru, than the view of emptiness of those who are weak in wisdom.‚Äù

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa srid pa gsum gyi sdug bsngal zhes pa yang gnas skabs gnyis po la yang ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa srid pa gsum gyi sdug bsngal zhes pa yang gnas skabs gnyis po la yang ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And ‚ÄúThe nature of existence and nonexistence‚Äù and so on, and ‚ÄúConceptualization is the suffering of the three worlds,‚Äù should be applied in the appropriate way to both situations.

original: bshad @83b par bya'o zhes pa ni sangs rgyas gzhan dag gis bshad pa ltar da lta ngas kyang bshad par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bshad @83b par bya'o zhes pa ni sangs rgyas gzhan dag gis bshad pa ltar da lta ngas kyang bshad par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI will explain‚Äù means ‚ÄúJust as other Buddhas have explained, I will also explain now.‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po dge sbyong ngam zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po dge sbyong ngam zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid rgyas par ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the ≈õrama·πáa‚Äù and so on extensively teaches the uniqueness of the Buddha.

original: de la dge sbyong ni //
analyzed: de la dge sbyong ni //
translated: Therein, a ≈õrama·πáa is

original: sdig ba ci yang mi bya ste //
analyzed: sdig ba ci yang mi bya ste //
translated: Not to do any evil,

original: dge ba phun sum tshogs par sbyad  //
analyzed: dge ba phun sum tshogs par sbyad  //
translated: To cultivate virtue well,

original: ces pa'i dge sbyong gi tshul lam phyi rol ba'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: ces pa'i dge sbyong gi tshul lam phyi rol ba'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Those who have gone forth in the way of virtuous endeavor or the doctrine of non Buddhists are also like that.

original: de dag gi ltar na dngos po rnams kyi rten 'brel don dam pa'i dngos po nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na dngos po rnams kyi rten 'brel don dam pa'i dngos po nyid du 'dod de /
translated: According to them, the dependent origination of things is asserted to be ultimate reality.

original: de la 'ga' zhig ni 'bras bu rgyu'i dus sam de'i sngon rol na med pa zhig rgyu'i byed pa'i 'og rol du skye bar 'dod la /
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig ni 'bras bu rgyu'i dus sam de'i sngon rol na med pa zhig rgyu'i byed pa'i 'og rol du skye bar 'dod la /
translated: Some assert that an effect that does not exist at the time of its cause or prior to it arises subsequent to the activity of its cause.

original: grangs can pa rnams las mngon par gsal bar smra ba rnams 'bras bu rgyu'i gnas skabs na yang yod mod kyi 'on kyang mngon par mi gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: grangs can pa rnams las mngon par gsal bar smra ba rnams 'bras bu rgyu'i gnas skabs na yang yod mod kyi 'on kyang mngon par mi gsal ba yin la /
translated: SƒÅ·πÉkhyas who propound manifestation assert that although an effect exists at the time of its cause, it is not manifest.

original: de'i rgyu'i byed pa las mngon par gsal bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i rgyu'i byed pa las mngon par gsal bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: It becomes manifest due to the activity of its cause.

original: 'bras bu la yang rgyu nyid rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu la yang rgyu nyid rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: And the cause itself continues in the effect.

original: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu phan tshun bdag nyid du gyur ba skye bar 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu phan tshun bdag nyid du gyur ba skye bar 'dod do //
translated: Thus they assert that cause and effect arise as mutual identities.

original: 'di dag ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi 'thad de /
translated: These are untenable.

original: re zhig 'bras bu med pa skye //
analyzed: re zhig 'bras bu med pa skye //
translated: First, an effect that does not exist arises.

original: zhes pa ni 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: This would be contradictory.üîΩSince arising is the intrinsic reality of things, it would be as though

original: skye ba dngos po'i chos nyid yin pas med pa yod ces par 'gyur na /
analyzed: skye ba dngos po'i chos nyid yin pas med pa yod ces par 'gyur na /
translated: nonexistent things existed.
